reviews.review: Stroll by the Danube.. Margaret Island is a pleasant island in the Danube. One can walk, or ride a bike, beside the river, or walk amongst the trees. The musical fountain is fascinating, as it spurts water jets in time with the music played over the loudspeakers.
Great day out. Try to spend the day here. Get a river boat to it, they run regularly. Recommend walking and taking in the sights. Something for everyone. The gardens are amazing.

nice on a hot day. nice walk on a hot day, big park with cafes and a japanese garden at the end. Horse drawn carriage rides and you can hire trikes for two if you are tired. Bus 26 goes through the island, bus stop at entrance but you need public transport tickets as no machines to buy them.

An Excellent City Park. On this island you can find one of the best city parks in the world. Stayed there for around an hour but it is highly recommended to stay there for not less than 2 hours. Probably best time to visit is before sunset.

Lovely, serene and calm island. if you are tired going places have a break and visit Margaret Island. Pass on Margaret Bridge and in the middle of this bridge you find the way to Margaret island. While passing by you will notice a very tall bronze monument and further down you cannot miss the dancing water fountain which is very similar to Bellagio fountain of Las Vegas but obviously much smaller. At particular times you can watch this water fountain dancing to the synchronized music both in the morning and during the evening. In the evening the water fountain is lit up with numerous lights. Have a stop at the kiosk nearby and order some hot tea (without milk) which is really good and tasty. you can hire a bike or an electric classic car and go around the island. You'll find a nice park, a garden, a mini zoo and other attractive monuments. The area is very quite but at the time we were there some construction work was going on.
Island park in the Danube. Rented bikes and rode around the island. Beautiful gardens, lovely views and the fountain at the entrance to the park provides endless entertainment.

A calmer way to play tourist.. If playing tourist in Budapest is wearing you out, take an afternoon to wander round Margarets Island. It's a really pretty park, with a cool mini zoo and dancing fountains. Chill out, have an ice cream, and recharge before you head back into the city centre.
Nice spot in the mid city. Nice spot for a walk, a talk or a picknick in the mid of the city. Literally between Buda and Peste.

Beautiful huge park in the middle of the city. This park is very beautiful, it is vast and full of interesting places, including the rose garden. It also has the trail for jogging or walking all around the island. During my last visit part of the island had construction sites on it, but if you walk past them, you will find many beautiful areas.

Nice place to spend a Sunday. Margaret Island is easy to reach by trams 4 and 6. We visited on a Sunday lunch time and most of Budapest were there. Everyone seemed to be strolling round the Island and there were a range of activities. You could also hire electric cars or bikes and there was a land train going round the island. My favourite was the fountain where music was played through loud speakers and the fountain was synchronised to the music, brilliant old fashioned entertainment.

My lovely island!. I have lived in Budapest for a year and this was the place were I used to go walking, have picnics and relaxing without having thoughts in my mind! It's full of nature and perfect for a break with friends and family.

Must-see in Budapest. This island is a gem in the middle of the city. It is an athlete's dream, with a ~5km track surface loop, swimming pool, cycling path, and more. In the middle of it even lay old ruins and a petting zoo! All this for free can't get any better.

Lovely. This island is like a big park with dancing fountains, small zoo, Chinese garden, a track for jogging, swimming pool, play grounds & much more for the people to have fun, we went there as a part of a Segway tour & we enjoyed walking around so much with the lovely views, really worth the visit.
Brilliant fountains. Brilliant to walk in. Dancing water fountains timed to music superb!!! Unfortunately a lot of work going on as late in season. Has to be done sometime!

refreshing walk through greenery. excellent way to spend a sunny day .spread over 2.5km by 1,5km the island is like a park replete with musical fountains , joggers track , mini zoo , zen garden .you can laze the day watching the cruise and boats on Danube taking in the fresh breeze .ideal on sunny days
Lovely. The most visited place for us in Budapest .. every time we are in Hungary we must visit.. it's a piece of heaven

worth a look. more of a chill out but still worth a wander round. We hired a double bike and this gave a respite from walking which you can do a lot of in Budapest. Undergoing a lot of reconstruction at the moment.

While away a sunny afternoon. The island is beautiful but there is definitely a slightly shabby air to the place. I suspect this is to do with the ongoing building & renovation works going on but nevertheless, it is a lovely place to while away a sunny afternoon. You can hire bikes, tandems, pedal carriages (seating up to 5) & segways. There is 1 casino, 2 hotels, 2 cafes & an outdoor street food vendor (try the Langos and fresh lemonade, they're divine). The water fountain plays on the hour for approx 10mins to music. The running track is approx 5k and always packed with runners, day and night. You can visit the island either by walking along the bridges, or via the river cruises which drop you off & collect you at different times throughout the day.
Relaxing . The Island is very relaxing and peaceful. My family and I enjoyed watching the fountain dance along to different songs!

Haven in the bustle. Margaret Island is a lovely peaceful place to spend an afternoon, even when it's busy. Gently stroll round the grounds, stop for a beer, or eat in the circular restaurant. The musical water fountain adds to the ambience.

Oasis in the middle of the city. We happened to cruise around Margaret Island during our stay in Budapest. The island which located in the middle of River Danube was covered with trees and looked to be quiet and peaceful from our cruise boat although there were few bulldozers and workers at work near the river side. Learnt that the music fountain and abbey were famous on the island and hoped to step on the island next time when we visit Budapest.

beautiful island. I am very happy that we decided to go here on our last day in Budapest! everything about it is just lovely. It is in a very interesting location (right smack in the middle of the Danube river!), it has a great trail for runners, really lovely gardens, and an amazing beer garden! It is so beautiful!

Worth a visit . We spent like 2hours on the island rented an electric car which was at a very good price. We went out the island which took an hour you can drive around in this car and get to see nature , the river etc.

Quiet spot umongst the city. We visited the Island and took in the musical fountain, the abbey, and some additional sites. Much like the island in Vienna, it is a quiet break from the city. Easy to get to, and a welcome break from the city. We enjoyed just walking the paths and admiring the horticulture.

Bulldozers seen everywhere. Pity that the place is being revamped during the tourist season. We went on a train guided tour which was very bumpy. The best time to visit this place is in the summer months.
Bike ride in a park. When we visited the musical fountain we decided to hire a bike and ride around the island. Too much construction to fully appreciate the beauty of the place but worth a visit

Marvellous visit - must see musical fountain!. The island is best visited near sundown, I'll explain why. When we were there unfortunately there were large parts of the main road under construction / being renovated, but even the construction's dust and noise couldn't hide the beauty of the island. It's small, but feels like it envelopes you with trees, grass, and quiet. The fountain deserves its own paragraph; we had just missed the musical show (happens once on a round hour), and decided to take a seat and have a picnic while we wait for the next show. Even though it was literally an hour's wait sitting and doing nothing, the musical routine at the end was completely worth it. My tip : watch it after dark. Very romantic.

Nice island especially for kids. When we were in Margaret Island it was a very nice warm, sunny day. It was just a beautiful island to enjoy walks around, enjoy the music fountain, enjoy the foods and drinks. I think it is really favorite place for kids and families. You can easily spend a whole day in the island.
Take the Segway tour there. This island is to beautiful and full of recreational activities.We were taken ther on a Segway tour.It has a beautiful Fountain and many parks surrounding it.

Amazing !!. Just at the beginning of the island is a singing Fontaine where you can sit , listen music and watch a beautiful colorful show . Been there twice because it was just awesome highly recommend

Not so good. We made a special trip to see the Margaret island. do not go out of your way if you have no important reason to visit the island. The island and attractions are out dated and a mess. There is not much to do on the Island.

Finally made it to the island. managed to get too visit the island this time, went by boat but it easy to get to by tram (no 2) or bus. Entrance halfway across bridge no charge. make sure you sit and watch the fountain display with music , lit up at night. Hired a bike to go round inland which was fun

Wonderful recreation. This is a beautiful island to enjoy. It's 3 miles around the island. They have a beautiful running track to run/walk around. At the far end of the island they have a fountain that go on every hour. (We miss that) they have a beautiful (huge) water park. We went in the end of Sept and it was drained. They were doing construction. I don't know if it was because of the end of summer or what they were doing. Hopefully people can enjoy it during the summer. They also have beautiful play areas and a water well for diving, polo and synchronized swimming. It was in the mid 70's sunny and a beautiful day for a walk

Disappointed . We hadn't had chance to visit on our last trip so put it on the list this time. I can see why people like it but it didn't seem anything special. Nice retreat from busy city but I definitely wouldn't visit if you're only in the city for a few days. Currently a lot of construction work going on too. We felt disappointed

Great for all ages, but especially for kids!!!. That was the favorite place for my kids (7 and 10). There is a beautiful foundain that the water "dances" along with the music coming out from large speakers. You can rent a bicycle, two or four riders bicycles, electronic cars etc and even cruise around the island. You can easily spend a whole day in the island. You can visit the Japanese garden, the small zoo, or just walk in the nice trails under the large trees.

Not recommended for tourists. As it was recommended as Budapest Top 10 attractions in the official Budapest Guide, we went there. This place is not recommended for tourists who are visiting Budapest for 2 or 3 days. We were disappointed as both the Open Air Stage and Water Tower are not operational in October. The only consolation is we get to visit the Music fountain.
Lovely island!. Great for a romantic stroll, also I'd strongly recommend hiring the peddle car for 2 hours! Great fun!

Great family realxing location. A lovely place to spend the day walking around, having some lunch and visiting the zoo. Great place for families to relax and spend the day together. Great views of the city.

Nice for a romantic stroll. We were dropped off on this island by our river cruise, it is a little gem. You can reach the island by cruise ship or walk over the Margaret Bridge, but make sure you wear your walking shoes if you want to see the whole island. There are options to hire modes of transport to get around the island, but ti is quite nice just for a romantic stroll. There is a musical water fountain that you must see, a really nice touch to the island.

Little oasis. We visited this island/park on a Saturday afternoon after a week of intensive sightseeing. The weather was perfect and we stayed a lot longer than we had planned. The music fountain is very watchable, not quite Vegas but well worth the trip. We than walked around the island, with the obligatory ( for us ) stop for a beer. The Japanese garden is pretty and peaceful.Very impressed with the rubberised running track, well he is (I'm more a treadmill person) In fact my husband came over the next two mornings for a run, the track is kind on you knees :-)A lovely little park, and definitely reminiscent of Central Park ( a bit ) and a great relaxation during a hectic schedule.
Delightful parkland. Beautiful island 2.5km long and 0.5km wide easily accessible by bridge. Extensive grassed areas and gardens, a small zoo and the wonderful fountain. Not to be missed.

A little heaven in the middle of the capital. There is a lot to see in Margaret Island from the medieval ruins to the japanese garden as well as a thermal hotel and a swimming poo.. The island is quite big and can be reached by a bridge on both sides. A must see when visiting Budapest.

A tranquil place to visit at some stage in your busy visit. Margaret island is about 3kms long by 0.5kms wide, and consists of many acres of lawns,trees and gardens. I understand this originally the exclusive hunting ground for royalty. The trees are in many cases many hundreds of years old. There are two hotels and at the northern end, there is an old chapel, and the ruins of a nunnery; for the rest it is pretty much untouched. Apart from the lawns, one can easily imagine that the trees etc must be what the vegetation would be like in the absence of man. A tranquil peaceful place just a short distance away from this bustling city
Holiday. We rent bikes and I visit the island with my friends for picnic.The island is full of trees, birds and friendly people .I relax a whole day there.
Beautiful, peaceful setting. Beautiful, peaceful, car free island - a nice contrast to the hurly burly of the city and easy to get to.

Cool with kids. Enjoy the escape from the city crowd and spend several hours in the green. Music fountain, Palatinus bath, little zoo (for free), Japanese Garden are absolute must to visit if your head is full with noise and especially if you are with children. Rent a bringo hintó and explore the island, it is really worth to visit to get your peace in the middle of the city. No matter if you are from budapest or abroad.
Nice place for a stroll. The island is Budapest's main downtown green space. The park looked a little worn and wasn't immaculately manicured, but was a pleasant place for a stroll.

What a lovely island!. We stayed in Budapest for a week and we visited Margaret Island twice in that time. We arrived onto Margaret Island the first time to be greeted by the Musical Fountain just starting up which was nice. The definite highlight of the island for us though has to be the Palatinus Bath, it's fantastic! If you're planning a trip to the baths, be sure to look out for the free mini shuttle bus that goes to and from the baths. It is situated near the entrance to Margaret Island. It goes every 30 mins and is driven by a lovely local man. We timed it perfectly on both visits and managed to get the shuttle to and from without any waiting around. It was so helpful as the walk to the baths would be around 25 mins probably. The baths themselves have a great mix of pools including a wave pool, lazy river, thermal pools, serious swimming pools and there are also some slides which are a lot of fun. We spent hours here relaxing and dotting between the different areas. We favoured the Palatinus Bath over any of the other baths in Budapest and we made the right decision. On both occasions the baths were not too busy and you never had to queue for anything, including the slides. Would thoroughly recommend visiting Margaret Island and the Palatinus Bath! You could spend a morning or afternoon here quite easily or even a whole day.

A relaxing afternoon!. If seeking a relaxing spot in a busy city, I would suggest Margaret Island. There is an hourly musical water fountain which children would love very much especially if it is Disney music such as 'Frozen' as we have watched. While there, you can also go cycling with all the family. However 30 minutes are enough to go cycling round the island and seeing animals like deer on your as 1 hour is a bit long enough to get tired and bored.

Amazing space. We got off the hop on off cruise here and spent a lovely hour cycling around very reasonably priced hired bikes. We got off in front of the dancing fountains which were superb. The Japenese garden at the far end is also well worth a look.

Great way to get a flavor for local activity. We walked to this amazing park ( think Central Park but in Budapest) and spent about two hours. Walking, eating, watching their fountain move to music, riding bicycle carriages, watching water polo...there is something for everyone! Watch the locals or jump right in. We were so glad to have visited.

Very relaxing!!. We visited the fountain on the Southern tip of the Island while walking across the Margaret Bridge today. It was very nice. At 2 pm, several popular songs were played on the speakers as the fountain was choreographed to the music. It was very pleasant to enjoy on a nice day. There were many families in the park enjoying the fountain and the day. There was a very clean public WC available.
Beautiful :). Great place for hiking, bicycle trips etc. very clean, nice small zoo. Good for children and family's.
well worth a visit. really well worth visiting . . ferry stops at the Island . . bikes, electric vehicles, family size pedal cycles, noddy train . .all available.
Relaxing in the city. This island is the playground of the city. Consider taking the public ferry back to where you want to go. Plenty of stops on both sides of the river

Just OK but worth the Visit. I expected more from the island , but it was still worth the visit . You can arrive by the hop on hop off boat cruise if you purchase the bus tour . The fountain was somewhat impressive and the garden areas somewhat pleasant , but not a lot else really .

Fab . Nice place really enjoy walk , it was quite interesting lot of people from different part of world visiting kind multicultural place love for date too , nice corn around to eat also place to chill out

well worth a visit. Beautiful place, much bigger than we anticipated, we hired bicycles for an hour and has a great time viewing the gardens and small animal enclosure. lovely for a picnic or just to chill and take in the sights alongside the river.

Not as expected. Was really excited to visit the island and had heard nice things about it, but it was full of construction and the pool on it appeared to be closed for construction or maintenance which was a shame. Although its pretty, a nice place to have a sit down and the musical fountain is cool.

Idyllic island but not quiet enough for contemplation. I usually write very positive reviews, so perhaps we were very tired after a long day traveling around Buda, but when we got off the tram and wandered into Margitsziget (Margaret's Island) we had hoped for some peaceful areas where we could take a break from the hustle of the big city and enjoy nature. What we found were an amazing amount of joggers constantly doing a round-the-island jogg. Now this is hardly a bad thing in itself, but it seemed overwhelming when we made our first visit on the island. It was difficult to walk around the island and hardly accepatable to walk on the jogger's soft surface path that dominates the coastal walk area. So, somehow this became a less pleasant experience. As I said, perhaps it's my own fault - I was tired and had dreamed of a place for contemplation - a peaceful sanctuary. In fact, perhaps there are such places on the island... we did not stay long enough to find out, but there needs to be a balance between the sports people who enjoy this island and those who wish to enjoy nature - at least in my estimation!

An oasis in Budapest. Whenever we are in Budapest and we get a nice day, we take one of the yellow trams to the last stop on the Pest side then walk half way across the Margeret Bridge and walk to the right along the entrance to the island. Just inside the park is the singing fountain which performs (I think) on the hour so try to time your entrance.We usually take advantage of a nice day to shop for a picnic at the Central Market before going to the island. There's a tram stop just outside the main entrance of the market to the left. Then, on the island, we walk most of the way along the river, counter clockwise along the path, then cut into the park and walk about half way back to find a bench to sit and have our picnic, but there are several small cafes within the park, and a bathroom which has a small fee.You can also rent bicycles or an electric or peddle cart, but walking is nicer.

Oáza oddychu / Oasis of relaxation. Margarétin ostrov je ideálnym miestom oddychu pri spoznávaní Budapešte. Relaxujte pri spievajúcej fontáne, rozkvitnutých záhonoch, v kúpeľoch, na bicykli, ... Možností je oveľa viac. Margaret Island is an ideal resting place for those who are exploring Budapest. You can relax by the singing fountain, blooming flower beds, baths, on the bicycle ... the possibilities are much more.
Lovely peaceful island. We visited this island at the weekend and it was nice to see plenty of families out enjoying themselves, whether it be cycling , jogging etc. Fountains were spectacular
Nice!. Liked it. Nice, silence green island. Beautiful island. You can rent byececle and drive around. Enjoy!

Very pretty spot in the middle of the Danube. You can take one of the many river boats or tour boats to this idyllic spot on the river frequented by locals and tourists alike. It is mainly a large park with very beautiful trees and gardens.

Beautiful park for an afternoon stroll.. I spend a very relaxing afternoon here during my last stay in Budapest. I walked to this island as it was not too far from where I was staying and I enjoy walking. You have an option of taking a ferry as well. its a great place to have a fun afternoon if you are traveling with family. You can walk around or get a golf cart, or a bike (tandems including 4 people bikes). There is a small zoo, beautiful dancing fountain. I spent about 4 hours walking around and enjoyed every minute of it. Kind of reminded me of Central Park, only it was in Budapest. Although there are not too many options you can have lunch there. I got a sandwich and set on a bench near the fountain. Definitely worth visiting.
Ideal for an easy stroll. Ideal for an easy walk on a nice day. Do not miss the musical fountain:a 30 minute of a spectacular show.

Large park . This is a very beautiful large park on an island accessible by boat or a foot bridge. Many people walk or run the 2 km stretch and you can see a lot of people exercising. There is a convent and accommodation available if you wish to stay on the island. Nice to get away from the hustle of the city

The 'Central Park' of Budapest. We visited for a few spare hours after checking out from our hotel.We took the public ferry over to the island from the Pest side and then walked back over the bridge and caught the number 2 tram back.If you only have two to three days in Budapest, I wouldn't really say this was a not to be missed attraction, however, if you do have time or just want a couple of hours relaxing in lovely parkland, then this is where to go. We went on a beautifully sunny, very warm September Sunday. It was very busy with locals, chilling, walking their dogs, cycling, going to the swimming pool etc. During the week I assume would be quieter.It is a real family friendly place. As well as plenty of bicycles, including tandems and what I believe are called four people Surrey bikes, there are smaller versions of the same for quite young children. Plenty of means to get around. Of course you can walk, but as we were short of time, and it was very warm, we walked only a little and then hired an electric golf buggy for an hour. This allowed us to get all around the island. Ok it wasn't cheap at about 16GBP, but it was a means to an end for us with limited time. The bikes etc would be much cheaper.We enjoyed the dancing fountains, which are straight ahead of you when you get off the ferry or if you use the bridge to walk over, they would be within a very short walk in front of you, at the Southern end of the island. The fountains dance to music every hour on the hour. We caught two performances whilst there.A pleasant place to visit either as a couple or as a family. If you use the pool and visit the little zoo, I guess you could spend a good deal of the day there, but for a quick look around, have lunch/ afternoon snack and watch the fountains, I would say 3- 4 hours. We only had two and half hours, so the golf buggy was helpful and we didn't sit down for a snack, we just picked up a drink from one of the mobile carts.
Margaret island. I do not recommend! Not much to do the park looks abandoned and there is a lot of homeless people lying around the place... sometimes without clothes on!

Something to do but perhaps not the best in Budapest. The island is nice and easy to get to. It is quite large so there are options to get around including bicycles and small electric cards. My favourite part was the dancing fountains near the front of the island
Good stop for the cruise. Enjoy this green spot in the middle of the Danau. Rent a cuistax and go for a tour. This is the place where people go to relax and practice sport.

Island in the city. There was a lot of construction and maintenance happening on the island so the beauty was obstructed during my visit. The best part was the musical fountain which played music for about 10 minutes at the o'clock to "dancing" fountains.The Japanese gardens are pleasant but the ruins were insignificant. An island in the middle of a city is novel to visit but an hour or so to enjoy a picnic lunch before moving on.
Relaxing. Was great to walk through the park and sit and relax after a couple of days pounding the pavements of Budapest. Helps when the weather is nice.

a day in the park. lovely island, pack a picnic lunch and sit on the grass, do visit Palatinus Strand beautiful pools, adventure, wading, and swimming, IF you are swimming, bring a swim cap (obligatory for swimmers) goggles, sunscreen, and a towel, nice facilities, currently 2016 being reconstructed and expanded. interesting ruins on the island, japanese garden, easy to spend the day there,

Shame about the building work. Lovely island in the middle of the river. Very popular with joggers & dog walkers! Has a mini zoo, swimming pool & spa area as well as restaurants/snack bars. The water fountains are worth sitting by - they do a display to music also these change colour on a night

Great ride with bicycles!. An amazing place, full of grass you can lay down and enjoy the sun! We rent bikes and went around the island, it was an amazing expirience and definitely deserve the money.! You feel refreshing after your visiting to this island. Its ideal for reading a book, relaxing etc. Just be careful of the bicycles! definitely recomended!
A huge natural park. We traveled with a boat from the Pest side to the island. It was a very short trip. There we rented bicycles and rode along the island.

A Green Oasis in Budapest. We visited Margarit Island on a very hot day ( 30+) and it was wonderful. It is the "urban lungs" of Budapest and caters for all ages. "Noddy" trains, golf carts, tandem bikes, segways, jogging paths. All the Hungarian wives and their childreen were theer but there is always room to feel alone! Magnificent trees, shades and formal gardens with plenty of food, ice cream and beer caravans. At 12 noon we had a real treat at the central fountains. A synchronised water show accompanied with classical music was a real crowd drawer. A perfect recluse( Margaret, the daughter of an Hungarian King, spent her life on the island in a nunnery because her father wanted to thank God that the Hungarian Empire had been won back!!) on a very hot day. Beats Hyde Park any day!!
A little bit of tranquility. A lovely place to go for walks, take some exercise, visit the Platinus baths, the Grand Hotel or just chill. Worth a visit

Nice park. It is a nice park that can be accessed through the bridge. there are plenty of opportunities to navigate inside the island though various type of rentals of bicycles or others. There is a nice park with a fountain and a coffee place. you can sip your coffee or have a drink, walk around and come back. if you are on a short busy schedule, it is not a must to see.
Just boated around. This was an interesting island to see from the water. Lots of activities appeared to be going on on the island. Running, biking,and lets not forget to include nude sunbathing
Day trip. Margaret island has a music fountain and a water park as well as a wooded area for cycling and picnics. Places to eat and drink and to sit and watch the world go by.

Nice place for a stroll with people watching. . Pedestrian and cyclist only park, accessible from the bridge just north of the parliament. Good way to work off some of those vacation calories. There are paved walking paths through highly treed areas. A cushioned surface running path is on the perimeter. Beautiful central fountain with periodic shows with music, kind of like the Bellagio in Vegas. Food and drink vendors available.

2016 Summer Vacation. You need to plan a picnic and a half day to spent to Margaret island. Very relaxing, touch with natour, there is a zoo, the musical fountain, the Japanese garden. Have a ice cream from the parlors there.

Surprising. A wonderfully peaceful oasis in such a busy city. We visited on a Sunday so it was fairly busy, but such a lovely place. So much to do if you wish but also perfect to just rest from the city pace and people watch. Loved it.

Beautiful. A city park on an island in the middle of the Danube and full of surprises. The park is meticulously groomed and spotlessly clean with something unexpected seemingly around every turn. There are large open fields of grass, beautiful flowers all over, a children's zoo, ruins of a crusader church, a Japanese garden with a waterfall and koi pond, ruins of an old convent, thermal baths, fountains, etc. I was there on a summer Sunday and it wasn't crowded. I should have gone on a weekday when presumably there would be even fewer people.

RELAX!. A very large island accessible from Margit hid (the Margaret Bridge) with lots of green spaces that is popular with local people. There’s multi-seater bikes for hire and some bars with a strong local flavour. You can reach it by the waterbus: the usual bus/tram/Metro tickets are not valid and you will need to buy one on board. Don’t miss the Music Fountain.

A big piece of nature in the heart of Budapest. I love this island in every season! Thanks to its size you can find a calm place even in the high season when crowd is swarming to it. Water springs, running track, lots of green with almost no traffic, while restaurants, bars, theater, hotels satisfy the needs of consumers, too.

Rent a bicycle. My husband, daughter and son in law visited the island. We rented a 4 person bicycle and rode around the island. It was hysterical fun. They have a lovely pool with a fountain that is fun to watch. My daughter had to stop to get cotton candy from a vendor. This is just a great park to explore and to watch Hungarian's enjoy their day.

Nice place for relaxation. Margaret Island is a must see!We visited the island through the Red Hop on Hop Bus that offered a free boat ride to Margaret Island. It is worthwhile going.Actually,There is not a lot of green space to relax in Budapest so Margaret island is a must stop for the outdoor lovers.

One hotel, mudbaths, exercise area; be carefully at night. Island in the middle of the Danube is something of an athletes paradise. There is one hotel that has violin players in the dining room at night. During the day there is a spa with mud baths. Lots of joggers, exercisers sand bicycles. Only by taxi at night please!

Beautiful large public park. Margaret Island is actually a large public park situated on the island. I think the most well-known attraction is the magic fountain right at the tip, but it is well worth it to take an afternoon and explore the center of this island as well. It had some really beautiful flower beds, a nice restaurant located at the top of an old water tower, and a couple of intersting and picturesque ruins that are very photo-worthy!
Nice place to have picnic and relax. Many locals like to enjoy nice weather here. Place has nice parks, restaurants and lots of space. Really lovely island.

Great for a hot day . Hired the mini electric old style cars to look around for an hour which was great. The water fountain is fantastic for kids & adults on the hour it dances in time to the music. No shops or touristy stuff but assume the locals like this. A few bars, food outlets & icecream & was pretty busy on a hot 34 degree day but plenty of spaces to lay on the grass & avoid the crowds. Had a really lovely day here & would definitely recommend for families & couples.
An escape from the bustling city!. Great nature walks. Be sure to bring water. Lots of stalls with ice cream, candy floss, langos! Lots of fun!

Beautiful! . We walked to Margaret Island on a bright sunny day. It is beautiful gardens, a lovely fountain and looks like all the locals take their wee babies there to play. Beautiful but I encountered quite a few homeless people.

Fell in love with Margaret Island - visited with 2 kids. Loved this park.. we had a great time at the waterpark and loved that you could get a golf buggy to venture around. The waterpark also had great food and drink options for good value of money.

Mingle with the locals. Nice park within walking distance of both Buda and Pest main districts. Lots of walking paths, zoo, water park, water falls, flower gardens, and sporting fields. something to do for everyone.

Walking tours, sport, culture and peace. During a long walk you come across historic cloisters, two swimming pools, an outdoor theatre, a marvelous garden, two hotels and some typical Hungarian style inexpensive eateries. In one of them you should definitely try a lángos (scone), a Hungarian specialty. There are wide open places where small groups are seen in circles, or exercising martial arts, or playing football. You pass by (on the Eastern side) some sections, that should be developed. The present digging will be finished by March 2017. Nothing can be compared to the Northern section of the island with a Japanese garden and the eco-park, a gift by Sweden. The island is an inexhaustible source of joy, enlarged by the music fountain at the entrance to the island. The zoo is for the small ones, you find it on the Eastern side near the rose garden.

Nice place for a wander. Lovely park to walk round. It is a lot larger than it looks. Plenty of bikes, scooters and other things to hire to get around on if you don't want to walk. Lovely dancing water fountain just inside the entrance. Worth sitting back for 10 mins to watch the show which is set to music. There are places dotted around the park to buy food and drink. Enjoyed our visit.

Nice Cheap place for Pizza Lunch. The Champs Beer Garden on Margaret Island in Budapest is a must for lunch by the Danube RiverWe had vegetarian thin slice pizza - lots of veges and very cheapThe Island has many activities including 4 person cycle with which you can discover the Island The Island has running and walking tracks Very easy on foot !
Fantastic fountain. Called in here for a pitstop and the fountain was wonderful on its own and with music - would be nice if they put it on more though, it was quite a wait between 'performances'

Beautiful walk. Spent an afternoon or evening walking on the Margaret Island located in the middle of the Danube river. Very easy to reach by tram. You can have a pick nick there or go to the swim bath or just go for a walk.There are also ruins of an old monastery there and 2 beautiful fountains, a Japanese garden and a restaurant. Worth a visit while in Budapest. The

Short and wonderful visit. We took a boat ride tour to the island, which left us with only an hour and a half to explore. Took the tandem bike and went riding. Got through the beautiful gardens, the great musical fountain and back along the Denube shore. Simply marvelous!
excellent park. If you need to relax and get a way for a few hours, this is the place to go. Large green areas, some theme areas (Japanese garden, rosegarden etc) and some Churchruins.

Great break from the city. Imagine a gigantic park with walking paths, gardens, a mini-zoo (free), a concert amphi, fountains, and two spa hotels. Green, fresh, lovely. Makes for a nice break from walking around in the city.

Relaxing and beautiful. We spent half a day on the island and walked around it (about 6km). It is a beautiful oasis providing relaxed atmosphere and a lot of activities. Nice parks, lots of flowers, mini Zoo, restaurants and much more! The musical fountain is definitely the most interesting attraction on the island. I was sorry I was not prepared to jogg a round on the beautiful jogging track.

An oasis amidst a concrete jungle. This place offers something for everyone. Whether you're into sports, taking a walk, cycling, relaxing among trees and exotic plants in the Japanese garden, this is the place for you.

Very dutiful place.. Very dutiful place. Great bicycle tours on that island. Good pool for afternoon visit. With children. Nicest singing fountain! very colorful. One of the best days i spend in Budapest.

Unexpectedly fun stop from hop off boat. We made a last second decision to hop off from the boat, and ended up spending a nice few hours here on a hot day. We rented a 4-person and a 2-person "bike" and meandered around after watching the fountain display set to classical music, then had lunch. Could have spent a whole day had we been in the city longer.

Lovely. The island is a large, beautiful park. There is one bus route, but otherwise no motorised vehicles (plenty of non-motorised vehicles!). Tram stop at one end.Open air theatre. Musical water fountain display.Two open air swimming pools. One is for serious swimmers and one is a family fun swimming complex, including water slides.No admission charge to the island, but as expected you would pay for extras like swimming, etc.

Beautiful place to walk. Cross the whole Island from Margaret Bridge to Arpad Bridge. You will find a lot of nice places to visit, have a brake and relax. Don't miss the Water tower and the ruins, and the little botanic garden close to Arpad Bridge.

Lots of Green in the Center of the City. This isn't a must-to-see but a pleasant place that is great for a run or walk, right in the middle of the Danube. City dwellers were enjoying the rubber running track next to the unpaved track, all the options for preferred surface. It has a nice rose garden and a nice Japanese garden. There are interesting ruins from the 1500s of a convent built as part of a pledge by the king. He promised to build a convent and send his daughter Margaret there if the Huns left Budapest. The Huns were forced out and there's no information on how 11-year old Margaret felt about her part of the deal. Like many public parks there are pedal cars and little golf carts, several refreshment sites. It might be a good spot to let kids run off energy with no traffic danger.

Ok. Not too bad. Good stroll away from the noisy city centre with swimming pools, bars and a running track for those fitness fanatics. A lot of building work going on now so a lot of places where closed. Still enjoyed it for a couple of hours.

Refuge from the heat of the city. What a beautiful little island in the middle of the river... I could easily sit and relax for a couple of hours at the fountain area just after the entrance from the southern bridge.The gardens are truly pleasing to see and wonder around. You can rent small 4 wheel family bikes and electric cars but I found them to be a bit pricey, so I took the train ride for around 3 euros, which also came with a guide explaining the history of the island.

A different experience of Budapest in the best possible way!. I would say a visit to Budapest isn't complete without getting across to Margaret Island and using one of the various modes of cycle-transport available on the island for a fun way of seeing about.We hired bicycles (free as part of the city sight seeing tour 72hr ticket) which was a really fun way of seeing about the island..especially on a sunny, warm day! As well as getting some exercise.The island is like an oasis from the city and has plenty of different things to look around.You can access the island from the Margaret Bridge - we got a taxi to beneath the bridge and then walked across it to access the island.

Oasis of calm away from the city. This place is great. It's what I imagine central park feels like in New York. My advice, rent one of the bikes/buggies to aid getting around a bit easier. If like us you have already walked miles around the city I imagine it would make getting round the island a lot easier on the feet! Lots of things to discover.

Very nice break from the city. A lovely break from city life and you can go and just do nothing all day except relax. We went to the water park and this was good fun. Lovely place to visit. The musical water fountains are so interesting.

not my kind of thing, good for kids if you have them.... it was packed on a Sunday and not great for strolling since there are all manor of vehicles around from electric carts to bicycles.Had to be done but not so high on my list....

This island is a must!. Such a hidden gem with a Japanese garden, mini zoo, rose garden, park and restaurant under the water tower and so much more The island comes alive afternoons when people are getting off of work. Jogging is popular.

Well worth a visit.. My friend and I spent a lovely afternoon on Margaret island. We travelled there on the hop on hop off boat, part of the Giraffe bus tour! The weather was good and it is a lovely park, with plenty of space and things to look at. There is the dancing fountain, a mini zoo, food and drink stalls, swimming pools, flower gardens and large play areas. A variety of vehicles, motorised and non-motorized can be hired to tour the island, they can be driven by kids or adults. There is a running track around the island! We had a pizza lunch in a restaurant over looking the river, reasonable prices. There was so much to see, we could have made a return visit.

When Complete, It Will Be Perfect. There were a few too many building works going on on the island, so there were large lorries driving about, but when they are gone it will be perfection. A real gem of a place. Wandering from the pools in the north of the island to the grassy and tree lined middle area to the flower beds and finally the fountain in the south. You need to see it all. Probably best to walk south to north to be able to photograph, where we walked north to south and had to keep turning around to photograph (with the strong sun on our backs).

Amazing location to spend a sunny day. Wow....this island is amazing. It has everything. It is full of runners and families enjoying time together. There are also some pools there but I was not expecting it so I had no gear to go. The most amazing feature is the singing fountains. You can also rent bikes to move faster around the island. It is really relaxing and fun to stay there.

Great park. We walked up to Margaret bridge and then made our way to the Island and we came across the musical fountains which were great attraction. Plenty of benches to sit down. Lots of things available to hire and plenty of green. A must visit when in Budapest.

Great island for a day trip!. I visited the island and there is a fun looking water park, next time I will take my swimming gear. Best bit for me was the musical fountain! If you visit budapest, promise me that you will go look at that fountain!

Amazing park for sports and recreation. Went there on a sunday afternoon/evening and were delighte by the parks and car-free gardens. The Japanese garden as well as the theatre are definitely worth a visit and the comparably cheap bikes for rent are also reccommendable! Also great to use the running track all around the island, although it might be quite crowded during peak-times.
The best nature Park in crowded Budapest . Margaret island is the best nature Park in crowded Budapest, you can relax,enjoy the mini Zoo, train or jog on one of the running tracks around the island.

Would recommend the Palatinus water park!. A wonderful, well kept huge park on a island in the middle of the Danube.Used by locals for jogging, dog walks and picnics. It has options for bike hire and there's little food and drink stalls dotted around.Most noteworthy though is we were warned against going to the Szechenyi Baths as it can be really crowded and a little run down. However, on the island we stumbled across the Palatinus, an outdoor water park that wasn't over-crowded even on a hot day, clean and well accommodating. The water is somewhere between 30-32 degrees, there's free lockers - will let you figure them out ;). There's several 'pools' including a kids area, jacuzzi type area and water slides.Excellent for families with kids or those who wana hang out in/by water on a hot day!

Afternoon visit. A really lovely place to visit to get away from the city. It's basically a large park on an island in the Danube. Locals use it for jogging, cycling and other sports . There are no cars allowed , but you can hire bikes, small electric carts or just walk and enjoy the paths. One highlight is the fountain near the entrance , which on the hour does a display set to music - very entertaining. Also this attraction is free !!

Huge and fascinating. Margrit island is a huge and fascinating park which is almost 2.4 km long with nice attractions. most famous are musical fountain, palatinus water park,Japanrde garden and water tower..This is the Best place for relaxing,recreation, pass time and for picnic.You can explore the park by walk, bicycles or four-person cycle cars or small electric cars can be rented for use on the area of the islands. Plz do carry passports if you want to rent the bicycles in margrit island as They will keep our passports with them until we return their rented bicycles or cars.There is even a running track for fitness lovers....and few restaurants and food shops are also. But if going with small children do keep snacks for them to be on the safer side.

Beautiful park to relax and walk around. We spent a nice afternoon there walking around the Island. Sit near the fountain and enjoy the music and water show! You can even go to the water park on a hot day!! :)

Wow...... So much to see!!! 🌳🌲🐾🌻🌺🌾🍺🍴. We came here for a few hours on the boat tour and could not believe how beautiful this island was. So much to see and a lovely feel to the place. You can hire bikes and there is a small train to take you around if you wish. Some places to eat also..... Overall a great place to visit we really enjoyed it!!!

A beautiful park with so much to see and do. Visited this beautiful park twice. Free entry to park. You can watch the musical fountain display each hour. There are plenty of walks, plants and numerous transport you can hire. Can also get a free shuttle train down to Platinus pool. We opted to walk and sit and enjoy a large space in peace and beauty.

great sunny day activity. its where the locals come to get away from the city . Great running track . you must hire one of the bike tandems as they are hilarious to ride around on . Best £9 for 2 hours i ever spent .

Relaxing and Fun. There is quite a variety of activities available on this island, which is a short walk from the Margaret Bridge; accessible by public transit. We didn't spend a lot of time here, but thoroughly enjoyed the "Singing Waters Fountain" and ice cream from a vendor. A delightful place to spend a summer evening.
A healthy park to escape to relax. A beautiful park in the middle of the city. Excellent running facilities and well kept gardens... the dancing fountain is worth to see
Great place to picnic with the family. Street # 2 takes you there from Margit Hid (bridge) There is a 5 start hotel on the island and worth the trip.

The Singing Fountain was Amazing!. We spend an evening here on our visit to Budapest and were amazed by how much there was to see and do on the island. We ate Langos and watched the singing fountain before exploring the island a bit more. It has lots of gardens, a zoo, a hostel, lots of places to hire bikes and two fountains (that we are aware of). We could have spent a whole day here. There were lots of toilets too, though charged about 150HUF.

Just relax. A perfect place to spend a quiet, relaxing day away from the noisy city. You can get there with a public water transport, where you can get a beer or a coffee. On the island there are many pathways to walk. You can seat in the fountain listening to music - even on a hot hungarian day it is very refreshing.

Amazing!. Very pleasant trip! You will need a full day for this attraction. We took a river boat to the island, tickets were very cheap, 24 euro for the family of 4 adults. On the island itself there is so much to do! However we went straight to the Water park and pools by free shuttle. The sheer size of the area! There is changing area, showers, you can hire sunbeds, only 2 euro. There are plenty places to eat, do try famous Hungarian Langos - deep fried pastry topped with sour cream, cheese or anything you want for only 2-3 euros.After the pool, there is shuttle bus which will take you to the main area and then you can sit by the amazing dancing fountain, take a bike, or electric car, or segway! Then take the boat back to the main land. The whole experience is great especially if you have children. The only thing to bear in mind the timing when boat is going back otherwise you have to take bus or tram. Overall super super fun! And while on boat you can see Budapest from the two sides.
A good place for a quiet walk away from the traffic.. We caught the ferry boat to the island and spent most of a hot sunny day there. The gardens and flowers are very beautiful.

Relaxing Place next to the City. We visited the island through the Red Hop on Hop Bus that offered a free boat ride to Margit Island. It is worthwhile going. It is mostly covered with grass, lovely trees and flowers. There are swimming pools and a big hotel.There is a beautiful fountain with dancing waters. Lovely to sit and watch. There are comfortable armchairs to sit and relax in front of the fountain. There are paths to walk and ride bicycles, too.

Many things to do and see. We walked to Margaret Island but you can also get there by bus or boat. We only spent a couple of hours there but you could easily spend a whole day in the summer. There is a lovely musical fountain, all kinds of bikes to hire (for 1, 2 or more people). There are things to do and see: sporting grounds, outdoor swimming pool, running track, Japanese Garden, just to name a few. The area is very large with plenty of shaded parkland to relax in for the whole family.

A must see!. Margaret Island is a must see! Explore the island by renting some bikes or if you have the hop on hop off bus tickets you get them free, that's what we did. The music fountain puts on a amazing show, don't miss that also they have a small zoo and nice gardens and parkland.

A cheap day. Unless you hire a motorised car 40 euro or bike 6euro for 30mins-this should cost nothing, A fountain to siit & watch, a monastry ruins, a very small zoo, with fluffy chickens and a stroll in the park

Great range of activities. Island is two miles long. Great selection of walks and the thermal dos us very family friendly with a wide range of pools from wave pools to relaxing thermal baths. Margaret Island is busy in terms of tourists and locals taking walks or engaging in sports but is not as noisy as the main shopping areas. If you have walking problems then there us a bus that travels through the Island so you can see the main sights.

Sunny day fun. There is not a lot of green space to relax in Budapest so Margaret island is a must stop for the outdoor lovers. The island offers a large variety of activities to chose from so you will have something to do no matter what you like. There are lots of walking and running paths around the island so it is a good place to come for a run. There are also spots to get in the water and swim. Great open green areas to just sit and hang out with friends away from the busy city. One of the big draws is the large fountain that has musical shows through out the day with is actually pretty entertaining. Although there are shows through out the day the time to see it is later when there are lights added into the mix. There are some snacks to be had on the island but it would probably be best to pack a picnic if you plan on spending alot of time here.

Great escape in the city. The Margitsziget is a treasure in Budapest. It's a wonderful escape from the city noise and heat in the summer. The running track around the island is 5.3 km of soft track surface, and it's perfect for a place to run without having to travel out of the city! The green areas are well kept, and there are two places to go swimming and relax by water (Hajos Alfred is great for lap swimming, and the Palatinus strand is great for lounging in the sun all day!)

Nice island in the Danube, but nothing special. We spent several hours on the island, which is in the middle of the Danube. It has a nice Japanese garden, and numerous places for entertainment-- water park, restaurant, tennis, jogging and bike riding. The restaurant was pretty good, with excellent and pleasant service.

Large, diverse public park. This large park had a fountain that spouted in time with the music played as well as nice walking paths and flower gardens. It was a lovely peaceful place to spend an afternoon.

Outdoor fun. Essentially, Margit sziget is to Budapest what Central Park is to NYC. Much like the city, the island has a rich history as well. Besides the endless maze of walking trails, and the great views of the city on either side, there are several small little destinations within the park: a small Japanese garden, a tiny zoo (inhabited by rescued animals), musical fountains, old ruins.The island is home to several athletic buildings as well: the Palatinus water park, the Hajos Alfred athletic pool, tennis facilities etc.

Perfect for promenading. Glorious park that can be reached by boat, tran, bus, taxi or foot. We went over on a boat & took the tram back. Very pretty park with dancing fountains, food stalls, cafe, bikes & other vehicles to hire. Lovely place to chill.
Great running track. Was staying reasonably close to the Park and ran their cushioned track around the island. Good views of Budapest along the Danube , nice spot for a run.

Great for an entire day walk!. Margaret Island is a wonderful island that can be walked to quite easily. A tour of the island can take a few hours up to the entire day. Other than a large amount of people renting carts and bikes and taking over the pathways, an otherwise pleasant day with lots to see. From japanese gardens to 12th century ruins, the island has a lot to offer. Bring money for the washrooms!

Great Attraction to visit.. I went to Budapest a couple of times now and this island is one attraction not to miss. I was there in the summer and in the winter and both times was memorable. In the winter you can have a glass of hot wine to warm you up. And in the summer a Ice cold local beer. Summer time would be the best time to visit because everything is green and there is a lot of space to have a private pick-nick just pack a basket and you're all set just get a nice spot on the grass under a tree.If you are a sports fan you can run on the track that surrounds the park with a lot of points of interest along the way.You can get there by Bus also.

Nice place to walk around. Really good for a relaxing stroll during the day. Nice entrance with a 'musical' fountain and areas to sit at one end, and a thermal baths at the other end. Seems to be well used by locals too, with a jogging track round the outside. Some food stalls selling local specialities, such as Langos which is a deep fried flatbread finished off with various toppings

pretty but crowded. looked forward to seeing this, fountains are pretty, the planting is also pretty, found frogs and turtles in the Japanese garden, always good. BUT there are too many cycles, little motorised cars and wheeled vehicles

A peace of heaven!. In the middle of the city, between Buda & Pest this small Island is like walking in to a magical world. Everything is green and quiet and you can hear the birds singing.There are golf carts that you can rent by the hour(About 15$ per hour) and explore the island.There are lots of restaurants along the island and public transportation can get you there but when we were there a week ago the South entrance was under construction so we got there by ferry.A true gem in the middle of the city.
Place where you can relax:). Island accessible by public transportation. It looks like a park. You can visit aquapark or you can walk up to the water tower.

Great place to get away from the city and take a peaceful walk in a huge park. We love walking and we spent an afternoon walking up and down this entire island (located in the middle of the Danube River), which is really one big park with two resort hotels at the end of it. Has a few ruins, a lovely Japanese garden, a great musical fountain, water parks and a lot of greenery. While we walked the entire length and back you can also rent bikes, bike carts, or small motorized vehicles to get around. Can reach the park by public transportation or by just walking across Margaret Bridge to the side bridge that takes you down to the park.

Very nice Island. We had a tour on the Margaret Island. We took a tour by a train with a guide, and it was lovely.The Island is very nice and calm, the green color is addictive, and all the other attractions are great.

Fab little island. We really enjoyed our visit to this island. We ended up getting a taxi from Nygati train station as we couldn't find the bus stop for Bus 26. We spent one afternoon there wondering around the sights and we visited the waterpark on the island which you pay a small entrance fee to get into. It well worth it for a different temperature thermal pools, swimming pool, water slides, food stands and loungers. Great afternoon for a sunny day!
That's where my hotel is. Beautiful Danube, a long running path through parks and wildlife. Looking for something natural in Budapest? This is the place.

Great on a nice day. We came here for a picnic on a nice sunny day, a lot of people had the same idea. It is very chilled. The water fountain show was good. They played 'George Ezra - Budapest' whilst the fountain show was on, very cliche but a great moment none the less
Fun Summer Days running around Margaret Island. On a summer day it is a fun to run around the Island and sit by the magic fountains at night. I will remember Budapest

Excellent place to visit . The island is a great park to go with family or solo. There are many activities around, bicycles, yoga, electric cars, musical fountain etc. Great to spend the day, exercise etc. recommended to rent a bike if you want to see the different areas.

Come at sundown!. You absolutely must see the dancing water fountain show!This activity was a great end to a long day, we relaxed next to the water and then sat on the grass enjoying a bit of a drink. Many were having a couple of beers at the end of the day (it's probably illegal but I noticed no one in Budapest actually cares, not even Police).Great for families with young kids, as I've never seen a child who doesn't love music, light and water!
Charming little island. We rented a bisycle and did the whole tour. They have playgrounds, huge fountains, a mini zoo and old ruins. Worth a visit :-)

Fell in love! . Our hotel was situated on Margitsziget and we absolutely fell in love with the island! Central to Buda and Pest, easily walking distance to most tourist attractions. The musical fountain is definitely worth a visit!
Rent a fourwheel bike carriage. For only about 12 Euro you can rent a little carriage to pedal around the island. This allows you to see the whole island in an hour and is great fun!

Thank you, Margaret!. We spent almost half a day on the island but it wasn't enough... Just sit down (really down, on earth!) and watch the fountain. Every hour and for about 15 mins, it dances to the rhythm of the music playing! It is a very large park where you can rent bikes and ride along the river. It can by reached also by the river, using the public water transportation or hop on-hop off boats.
Nice place to relax. Nice place to relax, A pastorally corner in Budapest. Rent a pair of Bick and spend an afternoon here

Dont leave from Budapest without a visit to Margaret island. I go their by boat. Remember your driving license if you want to rent a motorbike or a battery car. Else (like me, i forgot) you rent a bike and take a tour in the beautiful island. Nothing to worry their.

Best of the Best. This is one of the most brilliant ideas someone could think of. Having no mechanised transport on the island allows for the jogger, walker, cycler and just picknicking to do so in peace and calm in an environment that is conducive to relaxation
Hire the bike and explore. Well worth hopping off from the boat trip, great fountain, lovely well kept gardens. Hire the bikes and have a look round at the Japanese gardens.
The Margaret iland is in the hart of Buda and pest. The Margaret iland is an Oasis in the center of the Hungarian capital, it is a beautiful park with a nice restaurang, all with a lot of history.

A Peaceful Park on the banks of the Danube. We arrived by boat, although the park can be reached via the Margaret Bridge. The fountains are musical at the entrance and the free show is well worth a viewing . We hired bikes - to sit two , although there are ones for larger groups of people available. The park is a green oasis with beautiful gardens, an open air theatre and a small zoo. There are toilets and reasonably priced refreshments . Don't leave Budapest without visiting this park.
Relaxing. This is an amazing place to visit. Easily forget you're in a city. Beautiful gardens to visit. The musical fountain was lovely to watch. Public toilets a bit dirty but useable.

Nice way to spend a day. We rented bikes from the island and it was a great way to quickly see what's there. On a hot day walking would have been impossible. The music fountain was fun and the water tower restaurant was a great place to cool down.

Lovely . We spent a good few hours on the island and thoroughly enjoyed walking around it. The highlight was definitely the fountain where if you go at the right time, 4pm I believe, it will play a musical show which was fantastic to witness. There is also a small petting zoo hidden away and plenty of places to buy ice creams and drinks!
Lovely walk . Thoroughly enjoyed this island. Lovely walk and nice way to escape the hustle and bustle of downtown Budapest. Great for cycling and running

Really enjoyed the musical fountain show!. Myself and my boyfriend visited Margaret Island in the evening to rent a bike to tour this island, have a couple of drinks and watch the musical fountain show. We were unable to rent the bikes as the rental service finished at 19:30 (our fault for not looking this up before). Therefore, we decided to scan the island for a nice bar / restaurant to get some refreshments. We found a spacious beer garden called "Champions" which was very pleasant as we were able to chill out on some bean bags, with a cocktail and pizza and watch the Olympics on a large projector. After a relaxing time at the beer garden we walked back to the South of the island to watch the musical fountain show which was very enjoyable and uplifiting.

Busy place!. Don't think it is normally as busy, but we visited in the afternoon prior to the Euros Final. Fanzone set up in part of park. However we decided to go pack to it at night and sample the atmosphere. Happy we did as it was well organised and excellent location for that. The Island itself is bigger than you think and has a nice feel to it.
Cute. Have been here before and stayed in the hotel. Cute island that looks nice at night. Walking track all around, tiny zoo, music venue , Roman ruins and spa facilities. Great place.

Beautiful Park. We took the short walk around. Saw the ruined churches and the still standing ones. The park was amazing and loads of locals use the park as well. The japanese garden was nice.Beware of tourists whom have rented the "Bike cars". They dont really grasp the concept of road or sidewalk.

Such a charming island!. This island was like taken right out of a Movie. The small cars and Bicycles, the fountain, the parks and the monuments. I loved every inch of this island and this is probably the main reason I want to og back to Budapest one day.

A scenic place to visit by a cruise on Danube. An excellent place with scenic beauty. A great place to walk and cycle and also enjoy natural beauty across the Danube river. An excellent place for picnic and merry making. Bicycles are also available for cycling.

Don't miss this when you visit Budapest!. A beautiful place to spend the day... wonderful trees and flowers, the most gorgeous fountains at entrance to park - you could stand for hours watching the changing designs! Very peaceful place...
A huge park. Me and my fiance rented one of those bicycles and we went around it. Definitely recommend it for relaxation.
Lovely quiet place in a busy city. Island in the Danube with wide open spaces, gardens, music, swimming pool you could spend a whole day here bikes and golf buggies to hire

outdoor pools. went with my teen at beginning of June. Looks like building work but dont let that put you off. changing facility clean and have lockers.
Can rent sun bed for small price. Several different kinds of pools, some slides also.
Little Island. Beautiful little island in the middle of the Danube. Relaxation, recreation and sports. Afternoon more peoples.
Margaret Island. Margaret Island is full of activities, simple and good restaurants. Very nice people and great fontein show every hour. easy to reach by public transportation.

Afternoon to relax in the nature. Nice place to spend an afternoon, if you've seen everything else. Maybe have a picnic. 1 hour to go around the island. At specific times the fountain at the entrance has a nice mini-show with music.

A great day out ..gardens.. waterparks ...live music...bars ..musical fountains. Go to Margaret Island ...just to sit and watch the water fountains is a holiday for your soul..stroll randomly through this island park..and find the japanese garden where more often than not a quintet of talented musicians may be playing classical tunes..hire a bike or an electric car or just walk for the pleasure and be sure to stop for the most delightful drink on a warm summers day..idyllic

A look back in history. We walked the entire coast of Magarets Island. It was very interesting: we arrived to see a fountain display with accompanying music. Quite mesmerising.The further we walked though it did seem that we were stepping back into a more austere time in Budapests history. The outdoor swimming pool looked straight out of a 1950's soviet text book..really interesting to see.The island could do with a bit of investment in certain parts but well worth a trip if you like walking.

Music & water. On entering the island from Margaret Bridge you found a fountain where music and water plays are performed more or less at each hour. There is some place to sit around the pool (and some is also in a good shadow). We walked around the park, attention to bikes and small cars because there no only pedestrian streets.
Surprising. One hour walk from the center but worth it. I liked sziget a lot, and the fountain with water games is uncomparable.

Oasis in the city. A MUST DO!. We walked to Margaret Island from the Pesh side. It was a really pleasant surprise. A huge recreational park frequented by the locals, it was so relaxing to stroll through the natural beauty, sit and relax at the musical fountain, watch families picnicking and playing together, stroll along the Danube banks and watch the different vessels traversing the river. It would be a great place to ride a bike around to cover more ground. A delightful way to spend an afternoon.

A must to visit.. A pleasant place to just relax or just walk, there are bikes for hire and electric carts. the pathway around the island is approximately 2.5 km if you feel like a pleasant walk away from the city. the only traffic allowed on the island are public transport buses. The fountain is a must see as the water jets are in sync will amplified music especially at night as the jets are combined with a wonderful light show, giving the impression of a firework display.

Margaret Island. Green Island in the middle of the river With sports and games for children. Just after the entrance there is a fountain, and Every hour there is Water games and music.There are no restaurants only Fast food stalls.You can rent a bike or have a nice walk in the small island.

Great place. The music fontaine is beautiful, colourful at night. It's a great place for walks and also for running. I was surprised how many people runs there. I definitely didn't feel like in the middle of a big city.. almost no traffic and lot of green :)

A fun experience !. This is a must visit for all garden lovers. I loved this beautiful island not very far from the main city and easily accessible. I would highly recommend to hire the pedal bikes for two and just roam around watching the dancing fountain, animal zoo and the rose garden. There is a beautiful running track along Danube and outdoor swimming pool in case you want some more activity. Loads of ice cream and eating option and not to miss the candy floss.

Wonderful. Peace and quiet is combined with the party on Friday ,Sunday. Rest days you can walk to see the old buildings of famous people turn bars in front of the Island at night you can dance until down party. The Danube is beautiful and close. I love this town.

An Outdoor Delight. This is where the locals come to play. If you have ever been there, it has the feeling of New York's Central Park--joggers, cyclists, kids' playgrounds, food vendors--you name it. The only difference is that it is on an island in the middle of the Danube. We spent a couple of hours sitting on a bench, drinking soda and watching the world go by. Loved it.

Take time to relax for a while!. Loved it on Margaret Island. While on holiday you try to do as mush as possible so I decided to take my family here just to slow down for a while. There are lots of things to see here including the lovely fountain, gardens, I think that there is a small zoo here too. We hired a four seat bike for an hour! My sons aged 16 and 21 thought it was great and took it in turns to do the steering, while my husband and I were on the back - which worked out well because we took the opportunity to stop peddling when we could so our sons did all the work!

Forest and flower beds everywere. The people of Budapest are very lucky to have this island to walk, bike and relax. There are flower gardens and trees everywhere. Don't miss the dancing water fountains. There is a big fountain at the entrance of the Margitsziget where waters from the pumps "dance" according to music.

Margaret Island. One of the favorite places for the locals to go for a walk or do some jogging. There are some bars and nice gardens to spend your time. There's also a small zoo, so it's worth spending an afternoon there with your family.

Lovely place for a stroll. Walked over to it from Castle Hill, enjoying the views along the way. Lovely park setting to spend some time, with plenty of seating for a rest en route. The running track around the island was very popular at 4PM on a Monday. Also spotted a family of deer in what could have been a small zoo or animal sanctuary. There are bridge links with trams running by at both ends of the island, so it's easy to reach without too much walking.

A relaxing day out. A small island in the middle the Danube reachable by boat or road bridge. Well worth devoting a day to visit, this little island has a dedicated running track round it's perimeter (which gets quite busy), a hotel and health spa, gardens, a concert venue and restaurant, historical buildings and a small water park, which is centered around the natural spa - so take your cossie! You can hire cycles or pedal driven buggies to get round the island or just take a nice stroll and relax for the day. We traveled there by sightseeing boat which gave us the opportunity to see the main sights of the city from the river and runs at 90 minute intervals throughout the day, so once you are on the island you can stay as long as you like. If you have a transport pass for BKK you can use it on their water taxis or buses to the island too. Nothing seemed to be violently expensive, though on a nice day I would consider taking a picnic as there are plenty of areas that would make a nice venue for one on the island.

Gorgeous Spot. Spent a few hours walking around the island and enjoying the sunshine. The water melon and orange drinks served at the central cafe were amazing and really well priced. The highlight was the fountain display, which took place mid afternoon with the fountains dancing to Coldplay and Guns and Roses tunes amongst others. Great fun. Recommended to everyone as a lovely place to visit and enjoy.

Perfect city escape. Came here on a gorgeous sunny August day (32 degrees). We didn't do much to be honest but soaked up the sun, bought pizza and beer from a kiosk, took a noddy train (1000 huf each) around the island, went on the swings and dipped our feet in the musical fountain. It was too much for much else! With a city full of flats/apartments, like other large European cities, the public outdoor spaces are excellent. There were lots of tourists here, but equal numbers of locals off to the pools, riding bikes, waking and picnicking. If we'd had longer (and the temperature been a little lower!) I'd have loved to do them all! I can't review this without talking about the musical fountain. Located by the Magrit bridge entrance it plays a choreographed fountain routine (to music) on the hour every hour. The music varies each hour and crowds gather to watch. On a hot day, sit by it and dangle your feet in as you watch. Bliss.

Awesome. A real must do in Budapest.Relaxing fun and a great place to people watch enjoy a beer and listen to the music while the fountains squirts in time..Stay till 9pm the hear and see it at its best
A great day out for families. This is effectively a huge park, with lovely fountain and gardens. Additionally there is a HUGE outdoor swimming pool complex, with something for everybody.

Dancing fountains. A real family hangout Lots to do.Electric cars Fun bikesEntertainment from street artistThe dancing fountains set to classical music is so awesome.Liquid fireworksThere are bars and foody places.It is all good.

Great water park . Lovely park and water park. You can get the water bus straight to the island and you can use your normal travel pass on it too.The water park is about a 15 minute walk away. 7,100 huf for a family pass, 2 adults & 2 kids. There are 4 slides and a lot of different types of pools. Lots of shade for lounging around and quite a few bars and cafes that charge reasonable prices. A locker is also included in the entrance price.

Go if you're a nature lover. Margaret Island is a green island with most of it covered with well-maintained parks and greenery. There are direct buses to the island. Well, there is not much sight-seeing there except a couple of architectures but if you want to relax amidst nature, Margaret Island is THE place to go in Budapest.

A stroll in Margaret Island. In a warm day it was vary nice! Dancing fountain, wild animal zoo, terrace and cold drink, flowers. Really relaxing place where you might spend your day and maybe have picnic! Easy to get to with tram or bus or boat.

Lots of activities for all the family !. A fun place in the middle of the Danube ! With 'synchronised' fountains, all sots of transport available to ride yourself around. Swimming pool, water park, childrens zoo, Often their are free concerts there. Or just relax and boat watch - plemnty of room for all although the Lido did seem crowded.

Relaxing. After a couple of days of visiting basilicas and museums, Margaret Island provides a welcome change of scene with its gardens, fountains and footpaths. Good to spend a couple of hours by the Danube. Rented a 2 person cycle (there are plenty of options) to ride along at a leisurely pace, stopping for pictures and ice cream.From what we could see only tram 6 stops right at the centre of the bridge to walk down to the island. Other trams 2 and busses stop at either end of the bridge, so it's a 10 minute walk.

Calm oasis in a busy city . We visited after a long day walking around the sights - it was nice to escape the busy city for the calm of the park.The area is pretty, there is a swimming baths you can pay entrance into, places to eat, drink or take drinks away with you, also plenty of ice cream sellers.You can hire peddle cars, bikes to go around the island,though it is fine to walk about - and there was plenty of shade.The fountain near the entrance is great - the shoots of water are in time to music! Worth watching!

Good outdoor activity. If you are after an outdoor activity there is a lot to do here. There is a water park for the children, historical ruins and various gardens. There are also wide open green spaces just to sit and relax.

Beautiful!. The island was so much bigger than I expected! My sister walked around for awhile, and then settled down at a flower garden to read our books until the water show. The water show was lovely, and lasted a whole hour. We ended up leaving early as to avoid traffic, but it was a great time!

An island park. On the other side of Parliament from Chain Bridge there’s another bridge, the second to cross the Danube, which opened in 1876: Margaret Bridge. It has an intersection in the middle of the bridge leading to Margaret Island surrounded by the Danube. The island is a popular recreation area. This is like NY’s Central Park, only surrounded by the Danube. There are sporting events, carriage rides, green space galore—all surrounded by the Blue Danube.
