The only way to access this island park is by Margaret Bridge—unless you swim there or take a boat.

Beautiful. Amazing place for relaxation, some 20 minutes walking from the city centre.Beautiful nature and park areas.Great little island with numerous activities, the most tourist one being the musical fountain.
nice place to see. enjoy the dancing fountain and many rides like bikes, scooters and electric cars. nice restaurant on the beach

Calm place in the city. This is a great place to visit when you need to relax and have some calm time. No cars to deal with. Nice place to walk or just sit around and enjoy the trees and people watching.

A Place to relax. A small island on the Danube. Just stroll around, hire a bike, or just sit and relax. There are a couple of ancient ruins on the island plus a church and a couple of hotels. Perhaps the focal point for many is the musical fountain which performs about every 15 mins I believe. Interesting to watch with an array of different music including 'Let it be'from Frozen

Wonderful oasis of calm and beauty. Do take a walk across the Margit Hid to this lovely island in the middle of the Danube. There are ruined churches, an open-air theatre, large swimming pool, a huge water tower and a restaurant. But above all there are gardens and woods and at the far end a pretty Japanese Garden. You can easily spend a couple of hours just wandering around and there are plenty of food and drink stalls for refreshments. Plus of course great views back down to the Buda and Pest waterfronts. In the evening there is a great illuminated musical display at the fountain.

Must visit. Beautiful quiet oasis On the Danube. We had hired electric scooters so got round the whole island in no time. Didn't get a chance to try the swimming pool but it looked good. Fountain show was good. Bars and coffee shops and ice cream sellers. Plenty of shade if you need it. Waterfall and duck pond with a turtle

A beautiful island in the middle of the Danube. We stayed on the island for several days and it was a beautiful, quiet location. Although it is close to most of the cities main attractions, it was like being in the countryside. The island has a few bars/ restaurants, a couple of hotels, a running track and a great fountain display at 6pm and 9pm each day! Worth a visit!
peaceful. you can reach this island by two bridges there are open air swimming baths and waterpark,the grounds or parkland are amazing so peaceful,don`t miss it

I was expecting more. If you are on trip in Budapest and you want to swim and cool yourself then this is place for you. If you want to have fun and experience new thing you can avoid visiting this place.

Great day out. This is a beautiful park with lots of activities for families. You can hire bikes to cycle round the island and there are lots of places to sit, walk or run.The dancing water show must be one of the best free attractions in Budapest.
More for family and kids . I come here on Monday because many museums or attraction place are close on Monday in Budapest. It's more family and children park. Not quite special for me.
The perfect retreat for the traveler sports man. The go to place for fellow athletes, the perfect place for running, cycling, and all kind of sport activities.
Very beautiful and entertaining. It has watershows, beautiful surroundings and bicycles for several people which you can rent. The service here was better than in Budapest itself

This Place has Everything. You would need a whole day on the island, there is so much to see. Ruins are interesting to look at. Japanese garden very pretty and is quiet so provides a great place on the island to take time out. Cafes, outdoor swimming pool, also a variety of rentable transport to get around the island.

A beautiful park . Nice park with many activities for both adults and children. Remember to take a trip when you are in Budapest! Remting a bicycles which has place for the whole family will have a lot of fun.

Best place in Budapest . We went here on our last day. We planned to just go to the pool/baths but as we arrived on the bus, it looked beautiful. We spent ages in the Palatinus Baths. It was so clean, very good price and was a lovely place to spend the afternoon! We walked a little across the island. We did try to find the musical fountain but the sign post disappeared. Only took about 20 minutes to walk to the closest metro station as the bus back was quite busy. Definitely worth going. A beautiful place!

We had so much fun at Margaret Island!. Me and my boyfriend had a few hours before dinner so we decided to walk to Margaret Island. We hadn't made any specific plans so when we arrived we decided to rent a 2 person bike and see the island by bike. We had such a laugh doing this together and it was a really fun way to see everything. Afterwards we went to an outdoor bar in the Island - I'm not sure of the name - and had some beers while chilling out on beanbags. Margaret Island is relaxed and fun (much like the rest of Budapest) and we enjoyed each others company and soaking up the atmosphere here.

I had a very pleasant stay with my parents staff very helpful but you need a car or a taxi to go to the town .. You can be busy hole day at the spa which are very good and in the afternoon or evening go for nice walks around the park .,but you defiantly need to see the town it is worth it !

A beautiful island. It's such a pleasure to go away from the build up of buildings and be greeted by the beauty of nature. Myself and two friends spent the majority of the day there sitting by the fountains walking around the island and then visiting the water park. This place is a must if you visit Budapest.

Great oasis in Budapest . We had a fantastic afternoon on Margaret island. We traveled easily from our hotel to the island bridge by the tram system using our budacard which was best investment on the holiday. Anyway we walked to the musical fountain which was mesmerising. Then got a peddle car to travel around the island ( you pay in return for time spent). We stopped for some lunch and beer on way, visited nuns ruins, Japanese garden and the water tower which is worth a walk up for some great views of the gardens and Budapest. I thought the Island was tranquil, fun and had lots to do if you wanted to take up a whole day. Well worth visiting while in Budapest. Also can get there by hop on and off boat trip.

Mixed feelings about this spot. It's a nice spot for a long stroll. But its really big, so you either have to take a bike, jog, ride the bus, or spend hours to see it all. The swimming pools/baths looked fun, but we didn't have swim trunks with us. The japanese garden is REALLY small. Not worth the effort to find it.The island is a great place to jog, bike, or visit the pools/baths. Otherwise, I'd skip it.
green place in the center of Budapest. There are lots of activities on the island, walking, running, renting bikes and so on. There is a nice fountain at the entrance which has a light/music show.

Missed potential with suprises!. The island is worth a visit for the gardens and especially the dancing fountains, a lovely spectacle, but parts of the island are tatty, messy and have been allowed to deteriorate, shame as this could be there jewel in the crown!

Nice place for rest. Margaret Island is very nice especially in the spring and summer days. You can walk, run or bike on the beautiful park of Budapest. You can find here a nice musical fountain, places for sports and fun.
2016 European vacation. Margrit Island was wonderful. This was our 1sr visit there. Many interesting photo opportunities. The visit was enjoyed by all.

The best run I have done!. Running track going around this small island on the Danube, the whole island is a park, with swimming pools, etc.
Beautiful!

Peaceful walks in the city, plenty of shade. We discovered Margaret Island early on after reading some reviews, and ended up going there three or four times in a week. During the day time is a lovely quiet park with some reasonable food and drink stalls, and some beautiful gardens to wander around or just sit and watch the world wander by. The musical fountains by the entrance are great to spend an hour (displays start on the hour, every hour).We also found out that the musical fountain has great lights, so returned one evening. The display is great with the lights. One thing to watch out for is that the public toilets close relatively early so watch out if you are staying for the 9pm fountain display!

A charm !! . a beautiful and peaceful little island in the middle of the river and the Busapest center. an immense green park for walking and relaxing with friends and pets .... trekking and picnics, a real beautiful place in nature, clean and very well looked after !! a charm ...

Beautiful park. Spend a full day here, go to the swimming pool the bus stop is out side. You can get cafe meals inside or out across the quiet road. Then walk up to the hotel and see the gardens. Hen walk back down through the middle seeing the bedding plants, the mini zoo and then the amazing musical dancing fountain. I loved the island .

LOOKS PRETTY. This is a rather large island in the middle of the Danube just north of Parliament and Margaret Bridge. It is easily accessible via either this bridge or as a stop off point with one of the many tourist boats that cruise this stretch of the Danube. Island has many bicycle/walking/jogging paths, sport facilities, gardens, green space and places for locals/tourists to sunbath. It is frequently used for music events/festivals. We viewed the island as part of our tour on the Danube Legend (Duna Bella) boat that departs from dock 7 near the Marriott Hotel.

Confusing oasis. While a great place to escape central city Budapest, we found the island quite confusing as it was difficult to orientate and there weren't many eating and drinking options. We couldn't even find somewhere to hire bikes! So if you're looking to go as a group of friends to chill or relax in the woods then would 100% recommend, otherwise maybe give this island a miss.
Quiet and peaceful. Nice quiet park accessible from centre of bridge. The musical fountain is well worth seeing and the Island is delightful on a fine day

Bring a picnic and a book!!. The island is accessible via the 4 or 6 tram line so don't bother with a ferry. We bought sandwiches and drinks before going over and found a great spot to have a picnic near the fountain. There are so many beautiful spots to choose from. The fountain plays music every hour timed with the water. There is a swimming pool for kids and a small zoo that is free. There were lots of sunbathers, families, and joggers. You don't feel like you're in the city and can rent all kinds of bikes, scooters, etc if you don't want to walk. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED for at least half of the day to chill and relax.
Peaceful. Hard to believe this magnificent place in the middle of a city. Great place to unwind or have a picnic.
Water ,show is amazing. If you go here in the afternoon you will catch the water show at the fountain in the early evening, this is a must, great atmosphere, the kids would love it also.

Fun few hours on the island. We stopped on Margaret Island as part of the Danube River Cruise on Legenda. We rented a pedal bike for two and worked our way around this beautiful little oasis in the middle of the Danube. It's a fun place where families gather and a nice respite from the city.

Nice for a bit of a break. It's a nice place to go if you want time out from doing city stuff. If you have children it is a great place to take them to let off steam and just have fun. There is a lot on the small island. The water fountain, whilst quite small and simple, seems to attract quite the crowd! The running track hat goes around the outside is rubber covered - making it nice to run on. There are a few places to buy drinks/snacks etc from. A nice place to spend some time, to rest, chill out, or let your kids just do kid stuff

Lovely green cover midst of city. It's a wonderful place to visit which can be easily reached even by foot from chain bridge between Buda and Pest. All age group will love this place, specially kids as there are so many variety of bikes, Segway , electric car to rent out at reasonable price and explore the park which is about 2.5 km. central area of park has nice musical fountain which is like any other normal musical fountain, nothing very spectacular, however generally overall a must visit place if you are in Budapest. A great picnic spot as well with the pets for the locals and tourists alike.

Avarage park visit. It is a nice place and which is attractive because of it is an island. You can walk, have a picnic or rent a golf-car... But I don't suggest to go there if you don't have extra time in Budapest.

Can easily spend the day!. A 2.5km island in the middle of the Danube. We reached it easily by foot, over the bridge. We spent a couple of hours strolling around in the glorious sunshine and it was such a nice way to spend an afternoon.As soon as we walked onto the island we were greeted by the musical fountain. Chances are high for you catching a performance as they play on the hour and each performance seems to last about 15 minutes. We caught performances on both our way on and off the island. We arrived and watched the performance, along with lots of adorable toddlers who were visiting with their nearby playschool.The island also has a tiny zoo you can look around where there were some deer and horses. We were also lucky enough to catch a bird feeding her young, which was pretty adorable.The islands water tower is a point of attraction on the island. It was built in 1911, in a very funky art nouveau style. We stopped at the base, where there is a bar, and had a break with some well earned beers.Around the park were dotted various stands selling ice creams and various food items and we ended up stopping for some pretty amazing burgers and hot dogs.
for your day off. a tired traveller wants a day off to relax, hire a bicycle .. relax . its an excellent place and an island in the river. Please enter at arpad hid entrance if u have a car.

What a great place for the whole family. We stayed on the island at a hotel which is the subject of a separate review. The island itself is fantastic and caters for all tastes ranging from the super fit (running track right round the island) through the to the slightly less energetic (quad/side by side cycles) through to us (electric car). Lots to see for kids with a small petting zoo & beautiful musical fountain. There is a wonderful open air water park and for around £20 for a family of 2+2 seems pretty good value. There is a bus service that runs 26 (226) from just outside the hotels and is pretty easy to use. The initial trip will cost you 450 HFT (price of a single journey) but as soon as you can go to a main train station and but a book of tickets 10 for 3000 HFT or even a travel card. To link in with the hop on hop off buses take the bus Nyugati Railway Terminal (last stop) stand with the main end entrance to your back and the buses are on the other side of the road. If you want to link into the metro then go in opposite direction to Árpád had and link in there (it's quicker from the hotel stop). Some of the hop on hop off buses stop at the island so you can join/leave from there but they do get busy.There is a sightseeing river bus from the island as well as a river bus that costs 750 HFT per trip (I am guessing you could buy block tickets if thats your thing).Do try to watch for the floating bus (assuming you don't use it) as it's quite a sight watching it drive into the river and then float happily down river towards the house of parliment.
Great park!. If you like to walk, drink beer, watch fountains, drink beer, rent a bike, drink beer, and just be in the beautiful outdoors it's a fun way to pass time!

Lovely place to spend the day!. We only spent the morning here but had a great time! As soon as you arrive there are plenty of bikes/cars to rent to get around. There are also some food kiosks/stalls to get ice creams and drinks and there looked like there is a hotel. On bikes you can see the whole island and it is a nice break from the city. The only thing I would like to point out is that the sign posts to the musical fountain are quite confusing so it may be better to ask someone!

Park with recreational facilities. From Nyugati station bus 26 goes right to the heart of the island. The bus is even accessible with a wheelchair. Alternatively you could easily walk to the island from the city center. There is an outdoor swimming pool, a trail to jog goes around the island. To get around by bike is another option. Margaret island is a park. Of the original natural environment nothing is left. Personally I liked the Japanese garden most. The water tower (admission 600 Forint) offers a limited view as the island is a lowland. It took me one hour to walk around the island's periphery (5.6 km).

Well worth the walk. This is a beautiful walk in the centre of The Danube, but the island appears to be in the midst of the regeneration process of the City. Currently, you do get a good feel of how it might have been during the communist years of Soviet occupation, but work is ongoing to improve the facilities on the island. It was a great way to escape the traffic and fumes of the city.

Lovely place with lots of trees and shade!. We visited the island on a hot sunny afternoon and cooled down at the water feature near the entrance! Pure delight! It's a large place that you can go around in a small train, hire electric cars or ride around on a bike! Need a few hours to enjoy it fully!

Lots of hidden stuff here!. If you are 'seeker' type of tourist, this place is definitely for you. I recommend old water tower (great photos from the top of it!) and its surroundings (in the middle/northern part of the island). Good idea is to take free bike (for 2, 3 or even 4 people).

Best of Budapest. Margaret island offers everything you need to get relaxed during the sightseeing in Budapest. Theres stunning japanese garden, animals and beautiful view. Excellent place for a peaceful morning walk in the city.

Beautiful oasis in the city . We loved margaret island. So beautiful and relaxing with lots to do. Would recommend hiring a bike or something to get around as it gets very busy. The water park on the island was great fun with a few slides, wave machines and lots of pools. A lovely summer visit.
My favorite place in Budapest!. Margaret Island is my favorite place in Budapest. I love walking there in the morning, when it's empty and very calm. The Aqua Park (Strand) is a cool place to visit.

A mini Central Park. Great relaxing space! You can bring a picnic or enjoy the food stands .rent a bike, funny small car ( golf cart) or have a nice stroll or run. Need a green fix ,head on over, and wear your comfy shoes !!!

Cute little island. Spent a couple of hours on the island. Took tram #2 from outside Marriott Hotel and in 5 minutes we were on the bridge leading to the island. We walked around the island, takes about 1-1,5 hours. There is a small water park if you want to spend some time there, we didn't. Overall it was a nice walk around the island, if you have some spare time, go visit.

Island with history. We went there in a sunny morning. We used the electric vehicle and performed the full tour of the island. There you can see the ruins of the monastery where Margaret lived. Nowdays it's a green oasis with many activities (swimming pools, relaxing music fountain), ideal for families with children.

Lots of open space. A nice area for families, lots of open space to relax and availability to hire bikes etc. Lovely on a summers day but take your own food and drink as the bar options are pretty disgraceful in terms of service.

Relaxing oasis. Nice green area in the hart of the city.just like you can find yourself in another world.
even thay have a mini zoo.

Relaxing and great to people watch. If you are visiting Budapest and want some down time away from shopping, come here. We biked through the island and it was beautiful. They have petal bikes, little electric cars, bikes to rent and of course you can walk. There are a lot of shady areas to sit, picinic and do some people watching. Bring a snack or bring a picnic lunch, sit back and relax. It was a nice place to visit to take a break from touring.
Relaxing. The island can be accessed through the tram or on foot through the bridge. There's a big park surrounded by a jogging path. It's perfect for a morning run.

Great place!. We came here on our way back from the beach further up river. The musical fountain was a hoot! We then strolled to the other end with its small zoo which was very nicely laid out. Caught the bus back into town - very practical.

Ideal to run. I only get on the island to run, almost every day of my stay. This is really great. The parc is beautiful, calm and the runners path are perfect. You'll even find many refreshing fountains and toilets.You also can't miss the water park and it's many pools and the petting zoo.

A lovely walk around and the musical fountain!. We walked from our hotel (over a mile!) and then walked around the island which is also called Rabbit Island. There is a tram which will take you around the island. Restaurants and walking trail too.

Budapest anniversary visit. Visited the Island on a Sunday and had a great day exploring. Electric vehicles and various forms of pedal cycles are available to hire if you are not exploring on foot. There are places to visit and restaurants available on the Island and do not miss the musical 'dancing fountains' near the entrance

Relaxing place to spend a few hours. A lovely tranquil leafy island in the middle of the Danube. Lots of open grassy areas, and plenty of shade to sit and relax. Dancing fountains at the Magrit Bid end perform to music on the hour - well worth a watch. It's possible to hire bikes, including 4+ seaters for all the family to cycle round the roads and paths. Because there are no cars allowed, it feels very safe for the kids. Plenty of ice cream stalls, snack bars, etc. Only wish we had realised there was a large open air pool complex, including several slides, which kids were desperate to go on. Next time!
Family day. Very nice destination for families with children. Lot of trees - shadow, fountains, river view...For geocatchers : few interesting treasures as well.

So much to do! Run, cycle, swim, relax, eat, picnic. This is a lovely relaxing park pretty close to the city centre. There is a great running track about 5.5km in length around the island. You can hire a cycle and ride around the island or you can visit the swimming pools. If you feel more like relaxing you can just chill with a great view.

Stunning place to visit. We spent the day walking around this beautiful Island park. Beautifully maintained with lots to do for children and also a swimming pool (payable). Several paces to eat and drink with reasonable prices. In fact everywhere in Budapest seemed reasonable to eat and drink especially alcohol.Try the home-made lemonade served in most of the places on the Island, it is gorgeous and refreshing

Tranquil. I love Margaret Island, there is so much to do here and you can find some really quite relaxing spots.The fountain does have a laser show at 9pm to music which is worth going to see, although there isn't much seating so if you need to sit (approximately 55 minutes )..There are various modes of transport you can hire to get you around the island (2km long) from hire bikes to golf carts and a bus runs every 10 minutes.There is an amazing public baths at reasonable prices and a great way to relax with plenty to keep your kids occupied all day.The open air concert hall should you be lucky enough to see concert there is fantastic. If you're into jogging the track goes right round the island. I could go on but Google would probably tell you in more detail. Just make sure you put at least half a day out of your time to visit this little piece of paradise in a city.
Nice park. It's a nice place (in the city center) to take a break from the noise and traffic in Budapest.It's a pretty island to walk/cycle around on. Visited in January

Great Saturday activity for the family. We spent a few hours here on a Saturday morning. We rented a bike for the family and biked around the island in about 1-1/2 hours, with stops to look at the ruined convent (St. Margaret) and the animals. We also bought some of the nice chimney cakes to eat. The children really enjoyed the fountain with the water and sound show (at noon, when we went).

Evita. I've spent last night on Margaret Island to see Evita at the open-air stage. The stroll to and fro was a delight, the air was cool and breezy. Casting was average with one exception: Peter Sandor was brilliant in the role of Che. An extremely talented young man, whose presence dominates the stage.
Relaxing. Nice to walk around and relax while you enjoy the huge number of things that can be done there, at walking distance from the city center
Perfect day trip. This island is small but has so much to offer- highly recommend! We hired a bike and rode around then visited the waterpark and got ssome food- lovely day for friends or families.

Fun times. We ended up taking a boat tour and spent 1 1/2 hour on the island. We got a discount (from boat tour) for renting bikes and saw the whole island. If it is hot then you could spend the day at the large pool and park.

Great place. A really good place to spend the day. A group of 11 of us caught taxis to the island from the Main Street in Budapest - Andrassy Avenue.When we arrived we walked alongside the running track on the edge of the island, before passing through the monastery to the water park.The water park entry was 3800 HUF per adult. There are various pools, including a thermal pool, wave pool, children's pool and an area of slides, amongst other pools.There are plenty of places to eat or drink, and lots of areas to sit or lay down. You can hire sunbeds at a cost of 600 HUF each, although we just settled for a lovely grass patch. A great day out for all ages

Not really that much to do. We took a boat here and had to stay there for at least two hours. These were a very long two hours. It's a pretty island and nice to walk/cycle around on. But we got bored rather quickly and wished we hadn't gotten off the boat.

Great park. Had a nice morning run around the dedicated running track in the morning....nicely cushioned with km distances on the floor. The views out over the danube while running were amazing. Visited again in afternoon and soaked up some rays while chilling at the pool. Was awesome!!

WOW!. Beautiful place and peaceful! Perfect for families and kids. Its huge!
Make sure you dont miss the 9pm fountain show! The best attraction of the place. Note that the fountain only works from May - October

Island in Paradise. If you want a break from the noise and traffic in Budapest, you definately has to visit Margit sziget/island, in the city center. On an area of ​​225 acres preserved as a park island on the Danube river is surrounded by a jogging track with a special coating. Inside of the island if you feel really hot there are two aquatic complex, vast meadows and forests in the shadows to which you can relax. Athletes can benefit from professional tennis and swimming facilities, and music lovers can spend there all summer festivals and outdoor concerts. Tranquility is inviolable and the Danube, with the possibility of a boat trip is at your fingertips. So you can sit on the lawn in the middle of the island, in the middle of the Danube, in the middle of Budapest, and to realize just how you started exploring this city where you feel so good and so at home.

Relax. In the middle of the Danube, you have a place full with gardens, grass and flowers. You will find here a huge swimming pool, a sports complex, an open-air theater, hotels and much more. This is a real gem in the middle of the city.

Enjoyable but not a true Japanese Garden. We decided to explore Margaret Island specifically to see the Japanese Garden. A lovely and enjoyable walk but the Japanese Garden, while very nice, is not very authentic. For many people that won't distract from its beauty and serenity but if you are expecting a formal Japanese garden, you will be disappointed.

More than just a park. We walked down to the island after dark to get some nigh pics from the bridge. This is definitely the best time to wander down to the island to watch the lighted fountain dance to the music. Quite entertaining and totally unexpected. If we had more time, we probably would have looked for bike rentals to explore this big park more thoroughly.

A Place of Serenity in a Busy City. Margaret Island is a gem in busy Budapest. It is easy to reach on public transport but beware that it's one kilometer from the entrance to the main areas. You need to catch the public bus which runs through the island. Margaret Island has many leisure attractions for both locals and visitors. It's a lovely place to spend time, away from the traffic of Budapest.

Great place!. Great way to spend a few hours. The island is beautiful and is highly recommended. Just walk through it and its nice gardens.The fountains show is every hour but the most recommended one that we caught was the 12:00 noon show which also had music.

Oasis in Budapest. This island was a really pleasant surprise, and if you go in the summer months it's quite shaded so does provide a bit of respite.Make sure you visit at a time where you can catch the musical water fountain, which does fantastic displays to the music whilst you can dip your toes in the edges.There's also a variety of touristy tools to navigate around the island. We chose the bicycle. It takes a good hour to cycle round and properly see everything, and probably a couple hours to walk. The zoo isn't really worth seeing, although would probably be nice to take small children.

Beautiful and green, walk it or cycle it. A nice green super green place with lots of hidden gems around, I think the best way of doing it would be cycling since it is quite big and if you walk it you might take longer than wanted (that's if you're in the city for a short stay) but it is a must-go place. Go early, have some food, enjoy!

Margaret Island on Danube River, in the heart of Budapest. Saturday 4 June 2016We met Zoltan in the Corinthian Hotel Lobby. We caught a tram to Margaret Island located in the middle of the Danube River in Budapest. No cars are allowed on the island which is mostly level. The island is a sanctuary with beautiful trees and bird life. We decided to catch the train on wheels around the island for our sightseeing tour. We then walked on the paths through the park to the Danubius Grand Hotel where we had a relaxed lunch on the veranda of the hotel. Zoltan had purchased bus tickets which took us back to the main entrance of the island and into Budapest. We connected with a tram for two stops to return to the hotel. We highly recommend this tour as it is a very nice way of taking in Margaret Island and at the same time not too far from the city hotel.

Great for couples and families. Carousel ride and fountain on south end of island, cotton candy and ice cream as well as beer/wine for adults, and beautiful parks all over the island. A wonderful place to visit in summer.

Relaxing island . Lovely peaceful island in the middle of the Danube river. Bring some drinks and snacks and enjoy the grass near the fountain, or walk or bike all around the island! Very nice place to get away from the centre. Worth the visit!

Amazing place, leave a few hours to visit. This place is incredible! There is a singing fountain with a few songs every hours and a full blown 1.5 hour concert and light show at 9pm every night. There is a Japanese garden which is beautiful, a water tower, various mini "bike-cars" to rent to get around, a mini zoo, an amphitheatre and various other things I have probably forgotten about. The whole island itself is a massive park which is very pleasant to walk around and it is much bigger than it looks (it took us about 2 hours to walk from one end to the other, with a few short stops along the way). Definitely recommend if the weather is good! It is very special and very romantic.

Go bike riding on Margaret!. We visited Margaret Island recently because we bought a bus ticket which had a free boat trip and cycling tour of the Island, so we figured that we would give it a go! We were really pleasantly surprised, Margaret is beautiful! It's a real haven in the middle of the Danube, with a running track that goes around the edge and plenty of places to hire a bike, we had a lovely time touring the island on our bicycles, had an ice cream and just generally really enjoyed sitting by the fountain. Would definitely recommend.
attend a performance at the open air theatre. it can be a long walk, so catch tram 4 or 6. Then bus 26 on the island. The gardens are lovely to walk through.

Something for everyone. When I visited Budapest, my favourite memories were made on Margaret Island. The musical fountains are a particular highlight, and paddling on a sunny day. It makes for a beautiful walk or cycle. There is a small zoo, rose garden and japanese garden.

This is an ISLAND. When some of us think of island we may think of it as just a bit of mound in the middle of a lake. This is not as big a town but not quite island, it's just amazing! Running tracks, fountain display, huge BUDAPEST sign, bikes, tuk-tuk style vehicle. If your on the plane in check out this beauty. It's green and luscious and perfect for everyone.
nice. basically nice , the musical fountain is great and there is bicycle tours.the view and gardens are lovely .

Worth a visit. This island was larger than I expected. We took the little train around it as my daughters feet were hurting and were given some interesting facts.I would have liked to use the bikes or little electric cars which enable you to stop and explore.

Fantastic use of green space. Margaret Island, like a leisure resort in the middle of the Danube. Used by everyone for so many things, jogging, running, walking, dog walking, organised sports, cycling, swimming plus spa, Japanese Garden, dancing/singing fountains the list is endless. Always full of people but never crowded

Awesome. This was a great place to visit. We were amazed by the fountain and the music. Great atmosphere. What a great way to let your feet rest after a long of walking...
Highly recommended.
Stay till you hear the music and watch the fountain follow..
Fantastic. A wonderfully island in the middle of the Danube, plenty to see and do. Make sure you get to see the musician water fountain!

The fountain is great. We dropped off here when we were on the boat trip and we are glad we did. It was a beautiful day and we watched the fountain that was "dancing" in time with the music. Its a lively place and we had a very enjoyable lunch at one of the cafes

Beautiful on a summers day.. We really enjoyed our morning on the Island. The fountain that plays classical music on the hour is beautiful. We hired a pedal car for 4 people and enjoyed cycling around the Island.

Lovely . What a lovely place to visit. Only downside was the extremely rude and intimidating staff in the bar area which was set up for the euro football championship. My wife went in to use the facilities but was approached by staff who refused to let her leave until she payed for using the facilities, despite no signs displayed to indicate that this was the case! The only sign was to welcome us in. My wife,who is 5 feet tall was approached by a male staff member who was over 6 feet tall and told she could not leave as she was a customer and therefore was not entitled to use the facilities. She felt extremely intimidated and when I intervened the staff member became extremely rude. All in all it ruined our visit to a beautiful area of Budapest.

Away from the heat. Well obviously it was really hot in Margaret Island too, but there were lots of trees so it was much easier to bare with it in the shade. There is also a public swimming place and bigger baths too. I also really liked the music fountain.

Lovely area for a walk. We took the river bus up from Pest one morning and had a lovely walk from one end of the island and back. There are musical fountains, a children's petting zoo, Japanese gardens etc to see and the promenade runs along the edge of the river under trees.A really beautiful place to get away from the rush of the city for an hour or two.

Well worth the trek. Situated between the two cities floating in the Danube. This island is amazing. I would definitely recommend hiring a segway to get around. For 3000 ft. Or about £8 you can get around the island at the speed of light. Visit the tranquil Japanese gardens and the many cafes littered around the park.

For long walks. The island is ideal for long walks or for riding a bicycle. Is has lots of trees and it's quite perfect for hot summer days, it has quiet and relaxing parts. The japaneese garden is nice, with ponds and water lillies.

A beautiful and fun oasis in the middle of the Danube. With easy access by bus, tram and ferry boat, Margaret Island is a popular destination for locals and tourists alike. It's gorgeous and a must-do.Most people walk throughout the island but there are a number of options to cater to those who can't or don't wish to stroll. It's easily enjoyed by those with mobility issues or young kids. I rented an electric golf cart and they also have pedal-power options including bikes and carts. There are so many things to see here! The dancing fountains, coordinated to music, go off every hour and are a delight. There is a large sports field and a wonderful swimming pool with slides, etc. The rose garden is stunning and a great place to have a picnic. There are numerous places to sit down and order drinks and food. There are even ruins on the island that you can explore!This is a special place in a special city and no visit can be called complete without experiencing it.

Hyde Park but better in Hungary. This island used apparently to house the Sultans harem. It is a beautiful island full of history with a lot to see and do. If you have kids or even if you do not it is well worth a visit. It has a running track made of astro-turf all the way round it, It has hotels with access to thermal waters, Japanese gardens, terrapin pools, musical clocks, musical fountains, a tower to climb to get good views for a nominal fee, swimming pools, small children's visiting zoo, cafes, restaurants, it is the place to go on a Sunday when the weather is good, or a holiday day off.. The musical fountan is a must, as is the ice cream made by the vendor close to the musical fountains. It looks like an ordinary ice cream stall, it is though spotlessly clean and the ice cream is the best you will taste in the world. I aleays have reservations about buying ice cream from a stall, is it shilled enough, is it stored correctly, beleive me you will have no worries. We oreered two scoops and when we had finished we ordered two more, (and we are not ice cream fans as a rule) You can get a ferry from here up and own the Danube, hire electric buggies, pedal bikes, pedal powered carts to hold a whole family, go on a land train, or just meander around the park to your hearts content. Cars are not allowed to drive around the park unless they are going to a shop or restaurant. You can though drive to the island and park. This is great relaxing day out.

Great place to relax or enjoy sports activities. A haven from the heat of the city and easy to get too. Is situated in the Danube river between Buda and Pest. Lots of sports activities, music concerts in the Summer months and an electric hop on/off train to take you round to all the spots. Well worth a visit or take a picnic.
Fantastic. Fantastic outdoor pool , beautiful gardens , musical fountains outstanding , a perfect day out such a beautiful place to spend summer days with family and friends

it is more of a local's hangout than a tourist destination. We walked over to the island to see what was there. There is a great fountain, lots of sports activities, and many different types of vehicles to rent and drive around the island in. I don't recommend it if you are short for time.

we dubbed it "health island". its about a 20 minute boat ride away and is worth a visit, but i wouldn't stay for longer than an hour or two. We dubbed it the "health island" because the whole thing is very clean and green and pedestrian only, you can hire bikes, there's a small outdoor gym, there's a running track, a spa and some other fitness type bits. There's a lovely fountain (do check the times its on as its only around 6 times a day) that dances to music for around 15 minutes which is quaint and interesting. There's also ruins of a nunnery and lovely rose gardens. Great for a little bit of oasis from the city for a while but you can walk around and through the whole thing in a little over an hour.

Tranquil . Beautiful quite island with many that's to do. There is a Japanese garden, swimming pool, and many quiet areas to sit. There is also a water fountain show. You can rent bikes or a golf cart to drive around the island which is to big to walk the entire thing in foot.

Very green and quiet island,. Perfect fro those wanting peace in the big city, the cars are not allowed on this island so you will have fresh air. I have stayed in one of the islands hotels and could not be happier with the place

A nice green getaway from the city!. This island was a nice green getaway from the city for a half of a day. My husband and I walked there. We rented one of the small golf looking cars around the island and took everything in that way. This island is luxurious. If you plan you could even have a picnic there and chill. There is a zoo and a water park. ANother MUST visit I think.

Oasis of Calm in the City. We were not going to bother to visit the Island but the Boat trip allowed you hop on and off and stay for the next hourly boat. A fountain spouting in time to pop classics greeted you as you stepped off the boat, a good place to sit around and enjoy the atmosphere. The island is a long finger shaped park, taking some 2 hours to walk around leisurely. Old ruins of a nunnery, the famous Grand Hotel Budapest and formal flower gardens are just a few of the attractions. You can hire a variety of bikes and pedal carts to get around, There are a number of Cafes to watch the world go by from. A great place to relax, I even saw a man sling a hammock between two tree's.

Margaret Island with a musical fountain and other attractions - Margitsziget, zenélő szökőkúttal és más látványossággal. We spent a few hours in Margaret with two kids aged 6 and 8. They really liked the whole place. The musical fountain close the island entrance of Margit bridge is a great thing. It palys music every hour and different patterns are made by the water sprinkels with the rhythm of music. There are hundreds of sprinkles so the sight with music is special. In front of the fountain there is a guy making large colorful water bubbles that kids liked so much and jumped around the boy bursting the dog sized bubbles.The "bingobikes" are also kid magnets. These vehicles are for two/four people and you can pedal them like a bycicle. It is great fun worth trying as you can bike the whole island around in 40-50 mins. There are some cafeterias and buffets where you can buy soft drinks, hot dogs, fried doughs (lángos) and other stuff so if you need some rest you can spend the whole day in a peaceful area in the heart of the city.A családdal a hétvégén a Margitszigeten voltunk. A gyerekek imádták a zenélő szökőkutat a Margit híd felőli sziget bejáratnál, aminek jó pár szórófeje volt és a zene ütemére váltakozott a vízsugár mintája. A szökőkút előtt egy fiú óriás buborékokat fújt, amiket a kicsik imádtak, visongva ugrálták őt körbe és a pukkasztgatták a kutya, néha őzike méretű színes buborékokat. Továbbá nagyon tetszett nekik a lábbal hajtható bingobringa, ami lábbal hajtható autóra hasonlító 2/4 személyes jármű és 40-50 perc alatt körbe lehet velük bringázni a szigetet.A szigeten több helyen van büfé, ahol lángos, üdítő, hot-dog vásárolható, tehát ha valaki egy békés nyugodt napra vágyik a város szívében, akkor azt a szigeten megtalálja.

lots to do. a very nice park on island in the Danube right in the city center. I took a run around the perimeter and saw many activities and sights. Better in summer i am sure - lot of warm weather activities that were not open in April.

Lovely, shady place . I was out walking and saw a bridge leading to this island, so headed that direction. What a fun surprise to find walking trails, fragrant rose gardens, playgrounds, fountains, historical churches on this little island! It was a HOT day so after a bit of exploring, I enjoyed just sitting on a park bench in the shade and watching the boats pass by on the Danube.

Fabulous fountains. The island is a lovely tranquil location with lovely walks amidst pretty floral displays. The highlight for us was the superb fountain display which is set to music on the hour and illuminated in the evening. The perfect antidote to the hustle and bustle of (wonderful) Budapest.

Take a Vacation from Your Vacation. Margaret Island is one of the most tranquil places I have ever been to and it sits between two distinct urban areas. It is easily reached by bridge from either Buda or Pest. In our case it was part of our E- bike tour and we are so glad we got to experience it. It seems to encompass all the best elements of great parks and gardens thru out the world. Think of Monet's water lilies, Kyoto Koi ponds, Paris Luxembourg gardens, Central Park sheep meadow.It seems to be a world to it's own.

Green lung in the middle of the river. We only visited a very small portion of the island, but as it was a sunny and warm day, we got a pretty good idea of how lovely this is as an escape from the city. The musical fountain is fun to do and there are lots of pools and outdoor activities to enjoy!

Beautiful park. A beautiful park, very easy to get to either by foot, tram or bus. There is so much to do for people of all ages especially families. The highlight of or visit was the dancing fountain and the petting zoo. Well worth a visit

easily spend a whole day here. if you have children, then you will need to spend a day here. Lots to explore. Playgrounds. Ruins. Animals. Great big open space. Escape the city sounds and hang out here.

A lovely retreat from the city. We hired a 4 wheel bike with a canopy to get around as it was such a hot day & the shade was vital! This meant we could go all over the island easily. You need to leave some ID with the rental person so take a driving license or something less vital than your passport!The fountain is good to sit and watch & on the hour they play some music (e.g. Cecilia by Simon and Garfunkel) to which the fountain 'dances'.

Beautiful and relaxing. Citizens of Budapest are too lucky to have this small paradise...A place where you can relax, have a picnic, run, bicycle, swim (at Palatinus) or view the beautiful gardens. One can rent a bike or a small car.

Beautiful island. This is a very beautiful island, and a good place for recreation. A lot of people come there to play football, jog etc. or just relax. It is a good place for picnic. It is also a mini zoo for kids at the island. I really liked the island.

Various to do on the Island or just a chill - its good. This was an after thought on our last day to kill time to the flight. A fantastic choice. You can access the Island from the bridge. It was a beautiful day when we went, which helped! We saw the fountains first, great, we saw the Water Tower, the Japenese Gardens, the Musical Fountains. The Island has lots of greenery and is treated very much as (because it probably is) a Park by Tourists & Islanders alone. It's very beautiful. There are are lots of kiosks/cafes to get a beer and some street food. Theres an athletic stadium and swimming pools. There is public transport on the island, buses, or you can hire cycles, peddle cars or engine "cabbies" (a bit like the electric caddies they use on golf courses. All we did (apart from eat & drink) was free. Obviously there is a charge for bike etc hire but we didn't check.
Cool park/island.. It was raining heavily when we went, but we still really enjoyed it. We peddled around the island in a peddle car which was great fun. Lots to see, and well worth a visit.

Brilliant afternoon. This was a fantastic place for a relaxed afternoon.We were particularly impressed by the range of things available such as the mini zoo, musical fountain and Japanese garden.We had planned to stay later for something to eat in the evening but we weren't too keen on the restaurant.

Escape from the city. We have had three trips to Budapest, but had never ventured to Margaret Island. The island is situated in the middle of the Danube and is about 15 minutes walk from the Parliament Building, so not far from the main sights.A stunning park area that is a great way to escape the hustle and bustle of Budapest. The day we visited it is 84 degrees, there was a lovely breeze across the island so it was brilliant just to stroll and relax. The island has a 5k track around its edge that is popular with runners, this gives you an indication that the island is large.At both ends of the island there are dancing fountains that perform every hours to a wide variety of music. The free shows are around 20 - 30 minutes are are well worth seeing, there are lots of chairs nearby. Would be well worth seeing at night when the fountains are lit.Outside of this there are rose gardens, park areas and tree lined areas to wander and relax. Well worth a visit to chill out.
Beautiful park. Beautiful park, especially recommended to visit at 21:00, to watch the fountain in the entrance of the park, where it display a show of colors and music.

Water Fountain. I can only recommend coming to the island at 9 to see the water fountain show!! Free entry to the fountain which performs along to lights and music, if you do choose to visit you'll be so pleasantly surprised at how good something as simple as a fountain playing a long to music can make you feel.

Lovely way to spend a day. We went to Margaret Island with a cruise and we only had a couple of hours to spend here and unfortunately on a rainy day. But we still had a nice time. The island is very pretty and it was worth the trip. There are a lot of great things to see and do here and we weren't able to see it entirely in just the two hours we had. We walked around it, but I do regret a bit not taking those tandem bicycles.

Margaret Island is a must see!. Margaret Island is one of the most idyllic places I have had the pleasure of visiting. Accessed from the Margaret Bridge it boasts plenty of greenery and activities surrounded by stunning view of the riversides of both Pest and Buda. We particularly enjoyed the musical fountain show and the TukTuk that we rented to take in the scenery.

Which we had more time. We visited the island by boat and due to our busy schedule we only had 90 mins, coming across the musical fountain and the running track that circles the island. It was a busy place maybe as it was a sunny day and Sunday ? We missed the opportunity to hire some bikes as there were 9 of us would like to return and see some more

Take a bike ride!. This is a mellow way to spend a few hours in beautiful surroundings. Take a leisurely bike ride around the island, check out the small zoo and observe the musical fountain! The island is quiet and easy to reach off the Margaret Bridge. It's also a nice place for a run.
BIG ISLAND. You can gain access from Margit Bridge. Lots of activities go on during the summer months. Ideal for walkers and cyclists.

Bicycle tour. Margaret Island is one of the most wonderful green places that I' ve ever been. If it is not a rainy day you must be there. You can either rent a bike in order to have a tour around the island or just relax watching the musical shows of the fountain
Beautiful oasis in the city. Very beautiful island. A lot of Fauna and Flora in this island. You can reach by boat, by foot or by tram. Easy to get there. Splendid place for picnic,
beautifully arranged promenade. We walked and rode a bus to the water polo match and visit the water fountain with music which was very interesting

Pleasure, leisure ...... About half way between Buda and Pest is the city`s green lung, an area for pleasure, Relaxing. and recreation but here you can also find Sports grounds, pools, spa hotels national swimming stadium oand last not least remains of the former Dominican Convent where it said Saint Margaret had prayed.Stretching between Margaret and Arpad bridges the Island remains car free but you can hire a bicycle. Sports, early morning joggers, tennins, yoga are exercised all the year round.For families the Island offers areas for pckinking nearby Japanese gardens and HotelMargitsziget, the later inviting you lunch, dinner, or refreshment.Margiot Island can be accessed by public bus Transport via Margaret or Arpad bridge and even by sightseeing boats departing from the Center of town.During summer time the Island is given preference by sun-bathers and fishermen whilst wedding parties are most popular there during spring time; a concert stage is giving hoste to summer concerts and open-air Performances.Really nice for Relaxing.
A great afternoon. We had a great afternoon exploring the island. There is plenty to see and do.Enjoy this piece of calm and relaxation in the bustling metropolis that is Budapest.
Fountain Show . Walked to the Island via the Y bridge Popular with tourists and locals Jogging track goes round the Island offering great views Fountain shows are well worth viewing

Margaret Island. The perfect place to visit on a hot day. Lots of shady trees and places to sit. There is a bridge at both ends of the island making it easy to access. There are a couple of restaurants and several stalls selling food and drink.

Pretty ordinary.... I heard great things about Margaret Island but to be honest I didn't think it was worth a visit. The views of the river are just as good from either the Buda or Pest side, the fountain show was average and the most interesting attraction was a dedicated running track made of an athletics track material that runs around the island, that's it. If you have a day to spare by all means have a nice stroll but if you want to hit the top attractions, I would say this was it.

A delightful Park in the City Centre. Margaret island lies on the Danube in the heart of the city, lying between Buda and Pest. This green lung is covered in trees and gardens, sport facilities and a swimming pool. It is great for a stroll, a jog or even a ride on a tandem. It is a beautiful and relaxing area.

For a lovely afternoon. The park is easy to get to, there is a structure at the begining which is to symbolise the unity of Buda + Pest , which seems a bit heavy and clunkly placed next to the vibriant springing fountains. The fountains are fun to watch + surrounded by seats and the water dances to recorded music that is played. There are snack stands around too, but they are not value for money. There is a mini train you can take to get an overview (with recorded commentry) but you can also take regular bus through the park. The open air theatre and japanese gardens are highly recommendable, there is also some ruins from a closter - unforntaely riddled with graffiti and a rose garden.

Lovely tranquil oasis, with somethng for everyone. This has something for everyone, from swimming pools, to beer gardens, to ruins, to zoo. A great haven to wonder around. The jogging track with softer 'pavement' is genius
REally nice. I didn't have enough time to see everything, I'm sure I will return, I just have to :) If you catch the singing fountain, it's something you don't see everywhere

Brilliant little island. This is a lovely island with a lot to do. Perfect for a sunny/warm afternoon. There is a musical fountain that plays every hour on the hour and is well worth a watch. The island is swarming with bicycle and golf cart rentals and is a nice way to get around the island without waking the 5km round trip.
Perfect for running. The 5 km tartan track around the island offers a run while enjoying a beautiful view. The beergarden that I popped into was also a lovely place with reasonable prices.
bike riding. we have 1 hour free bike riding over there as Hop on Hop off bus offer. it has playground for kids and garden for adults.The island has musical fountain too.

Just a park. A big park on an island...not for tourists except if you have a lot of time to spend in Budapest and you want to relax for a couple of hours. Close to the entrance on the island is a dancing water fountain (we caught the program at 5 pm)

Make time for the dancing fountain. You cannot miss taking a stroll through Margaret Island and then sitting and watching the dancing fountain whilst music plays; my favourite was when a ballet melody started playing and the fountain danced along to it. Fabulous!

Lovely park for some quite time. We visited the park twice on our break in Budapest. One when on an 'I like Ebike' tour and once after being dropped off for a couple of hours by a river boat.The park is a great place to visit with a variety of things to do.There is a 5K running track around the outside and some stunning open parkland in the middle. There are many other things to see and do including the musical fountain that puts on a display on the hour, every hour.We hired some bike for one and a half hours and this gave us time to stop at several places to have a good look around.

Relaxing park, a nice break from the city.. We went here on a sunny day and had a very relaxing time, it was a very nice break from all the traffic and all the other stuff we did during our week in Budapest.I recommend not to rent a bike, if you're able to walk. It takes about 30 minutes to get to the other end of the island (might have been 40, i don't remember) - and it's a beautiful walk through the park.We took the tram here, very easy, you seriously can't end up in the wrong place. We didn't really cared about the spa or restautants, we had brought our own picnic and had already enjoyed the Lukacs baths.

What A Delight!. Great place to enjoy flowers, trees, greenscapes and trails. Rent a bike for two people or more and ride around the island. You must see the water fountain synchronized to music played around the area. Plenty of places to eat that are inexpensive.

An absolute gem!. This is such a gem - a island on the Danube - in a walking distance from the Parliament. Much variety in the attractions - plenty of trees and grass to rest, benches to sit and read, a jogging track around the whole island, ruins of a convent, tiny chapel, cricket court, rose garden, dancing fountain which was my absolute favourite. And a mini zoo, water park, hotel and much more. You can also hire bikes and cycle around. Great for families as there is so many things to do.The cafes only serve drinks and snacks so don't go on an empty stomach or bring some food with you.We spent around 3 hours there, walking around, sitting in a cafe and watching the dancing fountain and loved it.

Perfect for runnig. I did a early morning tun arround this Island, and it is almost perfect if you do not want any hills. It hav 5-6 k tartan track all arround the iland dedicated to runners that I can highly recomend.

Make it to Margaret Island. This was the highlight of our trip to Budapest. We took the day cruise and got off here for an hour and a half. My daughter and I rented bicycles and toured the island. It seems all the locals come here to run fast. There were lots of families, too. We had an inexpensive, casual lunch. The weather was perfect. This is the reason to do the day boat cruise.

Leisure and relaxation. we came here almost by chance as we had heard there was an Island between Buda and Pest. We ended up spending three hours here and would have spent longer except we had a plane to catch. There is something for everyone, fountains that play music on the hour and display shapes of all kinds in time to the music, a road train that takes you round the island, sportsfields , a vast swimming pool, a petting zoo, a ruined monastery, places to eat, a theatre and concerts and other live music in the open air, you can rent electric bikes and carriages and even a vintage car

A large park. We had a lovely boat ride to the Island. It is basically a large park !. We hired an electric car for 1 hour ( you need your passport), this was brilliant and enabled us to drive right around the Island. Watch where you walk, the local joggers will run into you if you accidentally step in their way !, I had bruises to prove it !. We did see a couple of newly weds having photo's taken, which was lovely to see.

bike ride fun. We loved our day on Margaret Island. We rented a 4 person bike and toured the entire island 1x to get a feel for what there is to see....there is LOADS to see!! Our favorites were the gardens and the musical water fountain!

Don't miss the fountain shows. Great park to walk around in and to relax. Don't miss the fountain shows every whole hour. Plenty of bikes and golfcarts available for rent, the island is pretty big if you're not a walker.

Beautiful park, plenty to do, well worth the visit. This island is in the middle of the Danube. There are plenty of things to do. Gardens, Thermal baths, Fountains, dancing waters, mini zoo. There is even a running track around the island. We hired a Rickshaw type bike, was so much fun. Remember to take an ID for this. Well worth the visit if you have half a day free.

The highlight of my time in Budapest... I'm a walker..and this Island in the middle of the Danube was perfect for a warm verging on hot day..especially the japanese gardens and the Thermal baths..floating on this delightful water and gazing at the blue sky with a smattering of fluffy clouds is my idea of heaven!
Beautiful park. Worth a visit. Sat down with an ice cream by a small lake and suddenly there was music and dancing waters, lovely. No time to explore much but would have liked to.

Lots of things to see. The Margaret island is great, and well worth a visit. We took a lot of time to explore the park and there were even some animals you could see which was a bonus. Would be a great place to go if you can have kids!

Don't miss the fountain. Nice for a stroll. If you are a runner, there is a great running track with lots of joggers. Bike paths too. There is no entrance fee and you can take a local bus or a boat to and from the island. The bus is nice because it stops along various spots on the island and you get to see more of the place. The fountain show to music is worth sitting and enjoying.

Everything for a Relaxing Time. Whether you are young or old this is a good place to relax. The park is good to walk through or cycle, you can hire bicycles for four. There is good shade or walk by the river. There is a running/jogging track round the outside. There is a very large swimming pool and other sports facilities. There are many cafes and snack stalls. For more formal eating you can go to the Danubius hotel. A 26 or 226 bus goes on to the island or get off the 4 or 6 tram which has a stop at the end of the island.
So beautiful and peaceful. Stacked with history. We had a great time riding around in the electric cars.A great way to see everything on the island
Lovely park. We visited the park on a weekend. There was music playing and families out enjoying themselves. It is a lovely park a very peaceful after he bustle of the city

The Green Budapest. This is the greenest part of Budapest. This very large river island is maintained as a big park. This contains swimming pools, restaurants, romantic pathways, medieval ruins, etc. This can be reached by walking from the Parliament building. This is also well connected by other means of public transport.Worth spending a whole day, if you have time to spare.

A jewel in the crown in budapest. A real gem of a place, couldnt praise it enough and im usually a moaner. Discovered this fabulous place whilst passing on a river danube boat tour the day previously.Great quiet place to relax and enjoy for all the family. Amazing lido and water park, pools and spas are crystal clear water. Building work going on in far background. All new locker rooms when we visited. Great quick food available from the cafe outlets at platinus water park.2800 huf each to get in which is great value for money in a relatively cheap resort.A must visit if visiting Budapest in the sunny season

Running in Budapest. Don't forget to bring your running gear next time you go to Budapest. The Margaret Island in the "center" of the City, or should I say middle of Donau, offer a great 5 km track. The track offer you a nice round or two with a lot to look at and a number of people like you, that enjoy a nice run. This is the best and nicest facilities for this type of exercise I have seen in any European capital.Enjoy it!

Peacefully Serene Park. I needed a restful day last Monday in Budapest and took the tram and bus to get onto Margit sziget, walked the many paths and read in the shade before continuing on to discover the little zoo where I was completely overjoyed to find not only storks (feher golyas), but baby storks! There were 9 or so adult storks wandering about, doing stork things (including an interesting mating thing where they clack their beaks rapidly), and in the center area 3 nest boxes where I watched 2 chicks being fed by their mother. I love storks (can you tell?!) so this was actually very exciting and a highlight of my trip to Budapest. There are gardens, a church and monastery ruins as well, plenty of paths for walking, bike riding or jogging, and pay toilets here and there.

Beautiful and restful!. If you visit Budapest in nice weather, definitely check out Margaret Island!! It has lovely bike/walk paths, gorgeous fountains and gardens, and various attractions (including the ruins of an old cloister). There are many stands for food and drink and the prices were reasonable. A lovely escape from the city!

Lovely Park. This island park has lots of walks, a little zoo with cranes and chickens and ponies (the cranes had nests with fledglings when we visited), a musical fountain and a really nice Japanese themed garden, with terrapins swimming in the pond and a lovely waterfall.  It'd be perfect for a day of walking and chilling out, or for jogging/running if you are so inclined.  We spent a couple of hours wandering about. There were toilets frequently dotted about but you had to pay to access, and there were not many cafes so bring a bottle of water, but it was very relaxed and peaceful, and not too crowded.
Too limited dining options. Good nature to see, fresh air but too limited options for eating. One restaurant at a hotel and few buffet things. You should go there with full stomach.

Good old days in the middle of the Danube. You have to take a walk to Margaret Island from the Pest side. The island is a paradise for families with small kids. It is a good choice to finish off your busy days after exploring the city even if you are a lonely tourist. Nice walks, beautiful meadows and a music fountain are the main feautures of Margaret Island.

Amazing park and island. A great place to visit and unwind after a long day trekking round Budapest. THere's loads to see or just laze around on the grass by the fountain. I'd recommend the 5km job round the island. Best way to see the place in half an hour.

Beautiful. A beautiful, tranquil island. Lots of long walks through the park with things to discover along the way or you can hire various forms of bicycle or electric buggy style cars. There is a dedicated jogging track around the park. Do take time to visit the musical fountain, we found a pleasant shaded spot and sat and watched several of the shows. The park is huge and very clean and it appears that locals and visitors alike, both young and old respect the stunning scenery as there was very little litter.
The Hungarians at leisure. The island park in the middle of the Danube is a charming space to spend a lazy afternoon, sampling pop-up food stalls and watching the Budapestians at play.

Break from the city. Margaret island offers a nice little rest from the busy city feel, and allows you to spend a few hours exploring a quieter section of Budapest with plenty on offer to satisfy a range of ages. Recommended for a visit as it is worthwhile.

Amazing little park. We nearly missed this attraction out, but so glad we didnt. An amazing park, with a jogging lane and many joggers following the path round the riverside. We stopped at a sports bar an had a drink in the beer gardens. The dancing fountains were very good,all set to music. We didnt do the whole island, visited the small free zoo and walked round the lovely flower gardens and park land. There is a bis 26 that does run down the middle of it. We got to it on the no. 4 Tram. An enjoyable day it was too. Need to go back and try the spa and pools out someday.
2 hours is sufficient to visit. We hired an electric car so it was fun but there are no restaurants etc.. so you can only enjoy a couple of hours

Greatly impressed us. We had not expected the versatility of the numerous attractions, eateries and plain entertainment we found there. By sheer luck we took one of the bikes from the onset, otherwise we wouldn't have had time to make the full round seeing all that the island has to offer.

Magic island close to the city center . Margaret Island is a great biiiiig park with lots of activities for every age!!!
A kid can enjoy bubble show, a teenager can listen to a live music show, an adult can drink a beer and enjoy the place!
Try riding a bike!!! It's worth it!!!

My Favourite place in Budapest. This is a beautiful island that you should definitely visit if you are in Budapest, accessible from the tram stations on the bridges, I have been many times and it's a great walk with beautiful gardens, activities such as cycling paths, segways, pedal carts you can rent to get around the island, a small zoo, food outlets and a cafe, a beautiful fountain that has background classical music synchronised with the fountain, the thermal baths are one of the best I have visited in Budapest also and worth a trip in themselves, at night the cafe turns into a casino, nightclub which I visited before which was also well worth the trip, a must if you are In Budapest , 5 star attraction
Incredible place. Wonderful green island in the middle of danubio river.It is very big... i suggest to rent a bike.Wonderful green , animals and swimming thermal pools.You must visit

a green zone in a capital. My girlfriend and I decided to spend one morning on the island. We made use of bus 26, which covers the whole island (about 5-6 stops). We decide to get off the bus at the last stop before Arpad Bridge and walked back to the other bridge. The Japanese garden is a quiet oasis, well laid out. There are 2 hotels on this island which are very popular by tourists. The park is used for jogging, cycling, sunbathing, walking and is kept in a good condition. You will find a ruin of an old church and there is a small zoo, with mainly all kinds of birds. Towards the other end there is a fountain display on music. It's loud but funny.

A huge activity island with no entry fee.. This island in River Danube is easily accessible by walk through Margarita Bridge or by bus or boat. The island is an excellent place to bask in the sun or relax in the shade. The whole island can be explored by the different types of cycles and rikshaws on hire.

Perfect Inexpensive Daytime Attraction. My family, boyfriend, and I had a wonderful day here. It is so beautiful with so many things to see and do that include nature. You can visit the beautiful Japanese garden, eat, drink (if you please), go swimming, play sports, and even rent a bike or battery powered car to ride around in for cheap! We had an absolute blast. If you come to Budapest and don't come here, you are missing out. I just wish I had brought a blanket and book to sit in the grass and read.
Great place for jogging. If you want to jogg in Budapest, then this is the place to do it! Ca. 5 km to jogg around the island and have splendid views while doing it.

Perfect for relaxing Sunday. What a perfect spot for a relaxing Sunday! We went here originally to visit Palatinus spa; however this island has so much more to offer. I loved the musical fountain!! There are many activities to do or you can just walk around and enjoy the beautiful nature.

Budapest's Hidden Gem. I feel that not a lot of people think to go here. But this place is the most beautiful in all of budapest. The beautiful gardens are wonderful to walk through and it even has a 5 kilometer track around it for sports! Great place to workout or just to chill! There are also great ice cream stands and places to eat as well as old Roman ruins which are not protected that you can climb all over! Simply amazing.

Interesting park. Margaret Island has some interesting things to see. We started by a tip around the island on a little train. You can also hire a golf buggy and drive yourself! There are dancing fountains, a Japanese garden, various ruins and walks under the trees.

Relaxed. A wonderful chilled out feel to the beautiful parks on Margaret Island. We went on a sunny sunday and people watched both locals and tourists relaxing in the picturesque surroundings. Sharing a dual cycle bike was especially fun.

A Fabulous Park to Enjoy on a Sunny Say. In the middle of the Danube, Margaret Island is clearly a magnet for families, joggers, and tourists on sunny days. We walked the peaceful tree-lined paths for 3 hours on our first full day in Budapest and loved every moment. Bridges link the Island to the shore on both Buda and Pest sides, but transport on the Island is limited to the 26 bus and rentable electric or foot powered mini-carriages. A map is handy - there are ruins and special features you might otherwise miss on your ramble (our guidebook had one, but there is also one you can photo with your phone and carry with you. We had a lovely lunch at the end of the island at the Grand Hotel - outside on the porch accompanied by a musician plucking familiar tunes on an antique instrument.

Beautiful walking park. While staying in Budapest a recommendation was to visit Margaret Island. I decided to walk there from the Lion bridge around the Parliament buildings and over the bridge. It is a long walk but ohhh so worth the trip. The island has a small zoo on it and ruins of the old convent that St. Margaret stay at are still visible. There is a lot to do and see.

Green Haven. Caught a boat up to the Island and did a self guided walk around it from our guide book. It is a peaceful haven full of beautiful trees and birdsong. There is a long artificial surface jogging track around it which was very busy. A route map was available from our hotel. There is a large musical fountain with the jets playing in time to music and also s musical well! A young princess was confined in a convent on the island aged 9 until her early death after her father promised he would give her to the church if the Mongol hordes left Budapest. In the summer there is outdoor opera and theatre and there are lots of bike carriages etc for hire. It was chilly when we were here but it would be a great escape on a hot summers day. The main swimming strand was closed for renovation.

A lovely place to stay.. We stayed at an hotel on the island, it was really convenient to get into the city using the number 26 bus that runs every 20 mins. The island itself is lovely, there is a beautiful Japanese Garden there, cafes, running track, swimming pool, fountain,plenty of open space and seats were you can sit and take in the view.

Lovely park. lovely park with running track, play park for kids, adult outdoor gym equipment, swimming pools (several), Japanese flower garden...Lovely way to spend the afternoonThe park is free to access and has public toilets and food/drinks for sale
Wonderful big park. We were there on sunday, together with a lot of Budapest people. In the middle of the Danube, no cars, you even don't here the traffic there. Enjoy and relax!

My favourite! . This little island is a piece of treasure! We loved cycling around in the little car/bike around the island, the gelato was amazing and beautiful gardens and scenery! Great place - excellent for exercise and relaxation

Good for rest, for meditation, for sports. We were really surprised about the calm and zen atmosphere. You can escape the buzzy-bee atmosphere of the city. Just take the tram: it pops you off just in the beginning of the Island. What a fantastic idea to create a jogging lane: hundreds of joggers have their fun, measure their performance, evacuate their stress. We were so surprised to see so many Hungarians taking care of their body and health. I felt like starting jogging again. Next time we will definitely bring our sports shoes and join the crowd.

Peaceful retreat in the centre of Budapest. Stopped off on the Island as part of a river trip for 3 hours. Pleasant to walk around and see the ruins of the Monastery and the Musical well. Nice coffee shop at the Hotel.

A great change from the busy city!. Went here on our last day just for a change of scenery. So glad we did.Being here is like being out of the city. The parks on the island are beautiful. There is a mini zoo which we didn't go to but probably good for kids. There are some old ruins to see a restaurant and Japanese gardens which are also very beautiful. At one end of the island is also a musical fountain which plays music on the hour along with a fountain display which is great.Prepare to do lots of walking or pay to hire an electric buggy or pedal buggy to go round the island.
nice day away from the crowds. Get a picnic and take a trip wonderful day away from the crowds. Pick a sport and a book and say all day. very relaxing and quite

Relaxing place to visit. Walked there over Margaret bridge with great views of Parliament. Hired a 2 sear peddle "bike" two seats next to each other with canopy. Cost about 3800 HUF it was very hard to peddle and we wished we'd got a bike each, I'm 5 foot 5 inches, but seemed peddles were too far away from seat, kept sliding off seat!! Never mind had some excersise. Island beautiful peaceful, pretty, great little animal park for children, was some red squirrels. Walked round ruined church, great water fountain, nice morning relaxing

You almost forget you are in the city. Its a park on a island that can be accessed from Margaret Bridge, the musical fountain wasn't working while I was there, there was lots of ruins of old churches and convents on the island
lots of fun. a nice get a way in the middle if the city. we rented one of those small elexcric cars and had so muc fun!

Hire a buggy!. As long as it's not raining this place is perfect to kill some time in the city.You have to hire one of the electric cars, or if you want to work a little harder one of the peddle cars. Lovely maintained parks with interesting ruins inside them.
