A walk in the park. A large island in the Danube which we entered from the Margaret bridge.First thing you come to is the wonderful fountain, with seating area and small food and drink stops. We had really come to see the Japanese gardens which are at the other end so we had a pleasant stroll along the bank path..It was worth the effort as it is probably the best maintained piece of the island. It had many of the features of Japanese gardens but lacked in Maples but overall was very good.

Relaxing oasis in the middle of Budapest. Margaret Island is a green oasis where one can unwind and relax after a busy day sightseeing. We got there by using the tram which goes over Margaret Bridge and then opted to walk around the island, which is around 2.5km long. If you don't feel like walking, there are a large number of operators renting bicycles, and other types of golf buggies etc. There is also a bus running the length of the island. The food outlets on the island were surprisingly reasonably priced. There's a lot to see on the island and one can easily spend a whole afternoon exploring or just relaxing. There's a small zoo (mostly for children), interesting ruins, a Japanese garden etc. The magic fountain was not operational when we visited on Easter Sunday, which is a shame.

Relaxing. A very nice place to visit in Budapest. You must rent a bike to have a tour of the island for sure! half an hour is not enough. Picnic could be an option as well. There's also a small zoo for children mainly.

Wonderful park. We biked this lovely island and found hotels, gardens and peace and quiet. Mostly vehicle free, the island is easy to reach and an excellent place to walk. jog or bike. Hard to imagine how this much green space survived in such and old city.

Beautiful island with a variety to offer. I have gone here the last three times I have visited Budapest. Each time, I find something new I hadn't known about the island before. This island has so many activities to do. First off, if you like to run like I do, you can use the soft track that cirlces the island to jog on. There are many other things to do like ride bikes or other various vehicles. When we visited last summer, I went with my extended family. We rented a thing called a bringo cart. They are fun and moderately paced bike like vehicle to pedal around the island. We went and visited everything on the island during our 2-3 hour stay there. The things we enjoyed the most-the Japanese Garden, the the water tower, the mini-zoo with unique animals, the rose garden, and the dominican ruins/old church. There is also a musical fountain that has a show every hour that plays different songs. You can find the website and they will detail which songs will be performed every hour. The food on the island is good too. We got a massive stick of cotton candy (twice the size of my wifes head) for the equivalent of $1.25 american. I also had a langos which is basically an elephant ear. I had mine with nutella and it was amazing. Really love the island and the variety of picturesque things to do there. A must see on your trip to Budapest.

A Nice Oasis in the Middle of the Budapest. Between Buda and Pest, after a short walk on the beautiful Margaret Bridge, you get to this island, which is so big that it has it's own bus line going around it. It's basically a recreational park. A very nice place to read, jog, ride or just chill and watch the musical fountain. You can also rent pedal bicycles for multiple riders.

A really interesting place to visit. Arrived via the hop on hop off boat trip from the city. Was a Sunday and also a sunny day, lots to see, musical fountains, children's animal rescue centre, very interesting water tower, Japanese gardens with turtles, food outlets very reasonably priced.Well worth the visit, allow half to one day .

Relax. Margaret Island is a wonderful oasis of peace and greenery situated in the middle of the Danube. It is ideal for outdoor reading and listening to headphones, but also for jogging. Access is very easy and is done by the Margaret Bridge. The island is served by bus line 29 (before ending the island) and tram lines 4 to 6 that the station Margaret Bridge, near the island.

Jog around Budapest and visit this scenic island. During a business trip I decided to jog around the centre of Budapest and this was the best part of that exercise. The route took around the island and gave me a good view of both city and the island itself. It was also a nice break from the hectic city life.

Nice park for a stroll or jog. Lovely area to take a walk and take in parklife. The island has a number of beer gardens, small farm area for kids which has horses, ducks, rabbits, storks, etc. You can hire a bike, golf buggy etc if you prefer not to walk.

Lovely little green escape! . Visited here on a sunny day, was a really lovely break from the busy city of Budapest, while still being in Budapest! Visited the mini zoo which was super cute and lovely, we loved the peacocks! Then we had a nice snack at one of then little cafe bars, and some delicious freshly made candyfloss in every flavour imaginable! We watched the singing fountain which was really great and entertaining! It was very easy to lose good few hours here and we didn't do half the stuff on the island!

Good break from the city. The city is beautiful, but if your eyes want a break from endless rows of architectural wonders and enjoy some greenery and space, Margaret Island is the place to go. It is accessible by foot over the bridge or by boat. I'll recommend the bridge as it is a good walk that offers a great view of the river and both banks of the city. There's a musical fountain that's great to relax and enjoy, and nice shaded paths right by the river where you'll see lots of joggers running past.

Beautiful trip, the fountain is amazing.. Margaret island is superb, we've arrived there by foot which is nice but you can also travel there by the city train.The fountain with colors that is playing by the music is just beautiful, i loved it! It provides a 30 minutes or more of relaxation, they have sits.It is only operated at night.Otherwise, it is lovely to walk around and relax, the gardens are really beautiful.Trip time would be minimum 3 hours :) Enjoy!

Worth a visit!. The Margaret Island in Budapest is worth a visit mostly because it gives you a feeling of "escaping the city"! The lush green island is a treat to the senses and you can walk (or cycle) around to enjoy its beauty. Although, remember to check the weather forecast before visiting! When we visited the musical fountain wasn't working and that was a let down.
Margaret island . I liked the place, very chilled and relaxing. A picnic there would be amazing it's also suitable for couples and families

A great place for a walk. Margaret island is like an oasis in the midst of Budapest . Located in Dunabe river you should visit it to enjoy the nature and chill from the historic centre of the city . It's a great place to admire the view of the palaces and the parliament. If you want to see the whole island prefer to rent a bike.

A must see place. You must take a trip to this island if you are in Budapest. You can choose to catch a boat trip there or you can reach it on foot via a bridge. The island is broken up into different sections and you could easily spend half a day wondering around it lazily. I would highly recommend renting one of the amusing bikes that you can hire. for £8 per hour you can peddle around the island and see the whole thing. This attraction is good for everyone. Families can visit the little zoo and couples can peddle around in a little car bikeand friends can zoom around in a 4 or 6 seater bike and there is loads of grass spaces where you can sit to relax or enjoy a picnic in the sun.

Beautiful place. We rent a bike and spent one great hour on Margaret island.Beautiful nature and some nice spots to visit.There are also places to eat or drink something.Great for children and people that love nature.

Nice park in the middle of the city. Very nice place in the heart of the city. Small zoo for children. We stayed there for several times (they have two hotels in there) and enjoyed our stay at the island

Really nice stroll on an island. Margitsziget is a really nice island to stroll around, there is a huge park, memorial places and just a great atmosphere. Grab some food and have a picknick or play some frisbee. Great for families and friends.

Biking on Margaret Island. This is a beautiful spot to visit while you're in Budapest. You can easily walk around the island but it's fun to hire bikes or another type of transport with pedals (there is a range!) and the prices are pretty cheap.There are places to eat on the island (and again, the food is cheap) or you could pack a picnic lunch as there is plenty of grassy areas to sit and eat.
Good place for running/biking. It is a good place for a walk, run or bike. Its a good place for families to spend time, lots of things for kids. But its just like any other park!
Margaret Island. We hopped off our bus tour and hired bikes to see this beautiful island. The weather was glorious and it is a lovely oasis. Lots of modes of transport to hire.

Relaxing and peaceful. We walked to Margaret Island from our hotel near the chain bridge. The first thing you come to on the island are some fountains. They are amazing and worth watching for 15-30 minutes whilst eating an ice cream. We then toured the island on the land train which has a commentary in English. The island is very large so it should be easy to find a quite spot. Would have gone back if we were staying in Budapest for more than 2 days.

One of my favourite running place in Budapest. This is one of the best place in Budapest if you want a romantic walk, if you want to run, if you've got kids since everything is there in a small place. Even a little zoo that you can explore. Also some fountains playing music, restaurants, playing grounds not only for kids, running track, gardens, even night clubs. Must visit if you're staying in Budapest!!
nice square. this is a pretty nice square which attracts lots of tourists if you visit it look behind it there is a nice boating lake a park plus the zoo.
Very big. Right in the middle of the Danube rive you can find this island that is basically a huge park. Accessible from the Margaret bridge by tram or by foot.
Pretty but............ .....little or nothing to do unless you go for a swim (costume needed) or a long walk( good shoes). Nothing really for children. A nice stroll and not much else

Something Different. Took the option to step off the cruise boat at Margaret Island. It's in the middle of the Danube and is also accessible from the Margaret Bridge. Mainly used for leisure activities with opportunities for jogging, cycling, tennis, swimming and other sports. Popular for locals to walk or run in the evenings and weekends. Offers good views of the city.
an escape from the city. This offers a serene parkland with bicycle hire and a lovely relaxing space on a pleasant day. Easily accessible with a short walk from the Hop On Hop Off bus stop

Beautiful!! Don't miss.... This place is defiantly a must while in Budapest. You can rent bicycle at the enterence or just walk around. It is really beautiful and if you're into sports you can find good running trail here. Tip: if possible plan to visit this place on a nice sunny day...
Must see place. Went for a stroll and used the location for morning run while staying in a near by hotel. Great place to take a walk, enjoy the time with all features it offers.
Great place. Took the Danube cruise and spent the whole day at the island...great place to take pictures and have food and drink...enjoyed...

Wonderful..A must see. I walked to the island from my hotel which took around 3hrs..its a beautiful space like the tranquil garden of eden..lots to see and do..take your camera and surprise the children by hiring bikes or little cab cycles ..everyone I saw that day were uber happy..a joy to behold, take some bread for the pigeons and not forgetting some loose change and a sandwhich for the homeless gentle men who turn in around 6pm under their blanket beneath the busy road at the far end of the island.

Thin recreation island in the danube. I have been jogging in the Margaret island several times when in Budapest. It offers a 5 km track round the island. In the island there are many other attractions such as outside pools (entrance needed) sports area, restaurants and bars.

Fun, run, nature, yoga.. Margaret Island is the place where you can go anytime. There are many places to see and to visit. You can run, or you can hide in the parks. You can see animals in the zoo and have some hotdog with beer, go with a guitar and play some Nirvana song while having good time with your loved one.
Idyllic. We hired a a kart things to cycle round the island on, it was lovely and kept the burning sun off you and we stopped half way round and had a picnic etc. Stunning island.
A bit boring. The fountain is not much, and if you like, you can rent a bike or a paddeling cart.There isn't much going on there
Great island with a lot to see. I walked from one end to the other. There are interesting things to see and it is very peaceful. Highly recommend.

A beautiful gem in the middle of a busy and big city. Margaret Island is probably my favorite place in Budapest. I enjoy the quiet and beauty, the trees, the availability to get out and walk and the beautiful gardens. If you are looking for a place to just get outside, relax and enjoy the beauty, this is it!
Relaxation . Must go there 3 hours, must first have an electric car for 1 h and must go on the all ways ... After must hire a bike and visit again , very much enjoyed... Hope to do again soon

Beautifully tranquil. We only spent a short time here but such a gorgeous park. Easy to get to by foot or bus. It's great to spend time walking around or people watching. Runners come here as there is a great dedicated running path which is less impactful than regular concrete paths. There is a small zoo, a few small eating places and a couple of hotels. But it's a great chill out place too.Lovely!!!!
special birthday. need a good 2 hours to walk stroll or hire a three wheeler trike and cy let for a few quid and a good giggle on the clapped out contraptions

Disappointing,. We walked quite a distance to visit the island and somehow expected more. Although the gardens are pretty and we could imagine going there for a picnic in the summer everything else seemed very run down. There was a lot of building work going on so we imagine that they are busy renovating most of the buildings and hopefully will provide some nice cafes, restaurants and attractions in the future,

Long Walks. It is a perfect place to take a walk to or go jogging. Very calm and relaxing. You can walk hours and enjoy yourself. I found that it is a great place to take photos as well or do your own photoshoot. Very beautiful. You can always see people jogging, or having a picnic. What I like the most is that it is usually quiet there and you can enjoy your book or be in your thoughts. It is totally worth of visiting and seeing the beauty.

cut off, relax and rest.. after long day take Your book, magazine, music or just yourself and go the to take a breath. place is green and relaxing close fontes center and silent at once. "Must do" in Budapest in spring/summer.

Great for a walk or a run. This is a great park in the middle of the Danube in the heart of Budapest. It's a busy park with many attractions, popular with locals and a perfect escape from the hustle of the city.

Breathe of fresh air in the summer. Visiting the Margitsziget in summer is like taking a beach holiday in the city. Its got something for everyone - gardens, cafes, swimming pools etc. Two things in particular worth doing; hire a bicycle (the ones for two or four people with a canopy are great fun) and cycle around and watch the musical fountain.
Wish I had more time. this was a lovely 'find' as one of the stops on the river cruise. Lovely part with delicious ice cream
Tranquil Haven. This is a beautiful spot to get away fro the hustle and bustle of the city and just enjoy the peace and quiet.

Relaxing place. Peaceful and relaxing place. Many paths for walking and biking. It is possible to hire electric cars and different bikes for many persons too. Trams and busses drive near island. Little animal park was very nice and Japanese garden beautiful. Nice place for picnic too.

A Beautiful Retreat. We had a fantastic tour around this island on a warm afternoon. We rented a 4 person peddle car that zipped us around. It was a perfect retreat from a bustling city environment. The cafes, ruins, and flowers in bloom….a perfect afternoon!

Lovely walks on the island also beautiful park and wildlife sanctuary. Great for walking and also there's a jogging track round the island which many people use and there's a bike track it's very cultural and there are ancient ruins from the 1200s really interesting place

A great casual park to walk, ride or run around. This is an island in the Danube that you can get to by bus tram walk or cycle. Once you are there you can ride run or walk around. There are a number of bike rental options such as the normal bike hire or you can get 4 wheeled bikes and segway type machines. There are many flat paths you can meander on which will lead you to old ruins, small churches, parks, fountains and well kept gardens. There are toilets and eateries throughout the island so you can keep refreshed with water ice cream drinks and food. I nice place to have a picnic as well. Many places to rest and settle under trees or in the open spaces. Well worth the visit of you are not in a rush. Many locals here as well.
Just a park. When we visited it in early March not much doing looked a bit jaded and in need of a tidy up and vey quiet.

Oasis in Budapest. A short walk from the city along the bank of the Danube, stroll halfway across a bridge and you are there ! Free access to a wonderful park. Great for kids of all ages. Bike hiring is simple and cheap, we took a bike cart for 4 and it made the day. Cafe and restaurants and a few sites to look at are on the island. Water park was closed, but looked good (for the location). If you have kids, are in Budapest and have time to chill, recommend taking the 3-4 hours to visit and enjoy.

geocaching at Margaret's. together with my 3 best friends we are walking and geocaching in Budapest. the island is quiet and less cars. the sun was shining so we all were happy while walking and searcing for the stash.
Great morning out. The island itself is strangely deserted, spooky empty boat clubs and so on. Hire bicycles and explore, we had a great time! Best for sunny days though.
Interesting for a short visit. The visit was easy for us as it was part of the itinerary of the boat trip we took. Certainly well worth seeing if the weather is kind.

Good break from the city hubub. As with almost everything in Budapest, you can get here by tram or bus. Its an island park a bit north of Parliament. Bikes, segways and golf carts to rent to make the 2 mile trip around the island. A couple of bars. Not a ton to see here, but it is a quiet place to relax on a nice day.
Relaxing walk. Really peacefull island, we stay in Budapest for 3 days and we visit this island on last day. The Japanese garden is really beautifully done, all island is a one big Park.

Very peaceful and relaxing park!. We spent there few hours of our last day in Budapest- it was just what we needed. great place to read a book or have a picnic.The park ia absolutely beautiful and has a lot to offer.

Lovely escape. Unusual little island but full of interesting things to see and do. We got a river cruise to it which was lovely and gave the history of the whole city, stopped at the island for a few hours. A welcome escape to the bustle

Fun and relaxation in the city. Great place to unwind, in the centre of the city. Do take one of the bikes, or mini motorised vehicles, remember your driving license. It is a fun place to go, with spaces for picnics, and for chilling. Saw a red squirrel as well, do take the time to visit.

Island of mystery.. You can access this via blue bus, yellow metro or walking (No cars are allowed on the island).The island is a large park. 2.5km stretch, 500m across.Within the park you can; rent bike carts and electric carts; go running on the track (5.3km total); walk the numerous paths; go swimming at the pool; visit the rose garden or Japanese garden; visit the free petting zoo (ponies, rabbits, peacocks...); have lunch; visit the thermal spa; see the musical fountain...If you want a break from city life, this is an ideal getaway with so much to do.
Love this place!. Absolutely love this place! If the weather is good, go! It's peaceful, beautiful and the perfect place for a break and to chill.

Lovely day out in the sunshine. We took a river cruise and got off at the island for two hours, it was really lovely and a nice place for a walk and or cycle on a nice day. There were a few food stalls, swimming pool, jogging track and countryside to walk in. Very well worth going to visit.
An amazing park in the middle of Budapest. We rented bikes and rode to the island and took a picnic there. An amazing serene place where you can escape the busyness of the city.

Definitely worth a wander. A lovely couple of hours spent exploring in a pedal car. The sun was shining and the atmosphere was friendly. It's hard to believe you're smack bang between Buda and Pest when you're cycling amongst the blossom trees.

the Central Park of Budapest.. There are a few cruise ship docks along the river, just pass the Margaret bridge where we first boarded our cruise ship. I Could see it from our ship and was told it is their Central Park. Could see joggers, walkers, dog walkers. Was not able to take a visit. Maybe on my next visit to Budapest.

Fascinating place. Went on a gorgeous 24degree c sunny day, plentynof benches where we had our picnic, didnt have one we were walking but loads of pedal buggies to hire and even some interesting electric buggies. Plenty of very reasonably priced ice cream vendors, dotted about.

we just could not believe that this was in the middle of the city. Like everything else in Budapest you just cant believe what you find by just taking a small detour from your walking directions. we visited this island for two hours and we left with a huge smile and pain on our legs from the cycling. a must visit especially if you have kids

Fun with bicycles. we hired a bike on the island - travelling with my daughter. we had so much fun and it was harder than it looked. a nice local pushed us up a hill. Some bits of the island were a wee bit run down but the whole feel of the island was lovely. we tried to get a coffee in the hotel but they said it was not possible which we thought was rather odd! we went in March and it was quite busy. I don't think I would want to do the bike ride when really busy as they are quite hard to stop quickly and we had one near miss with a toddler!

Gateway in the 'middle' of budapest. If you are tired of all the traffic and all the noise from the city heading to Margit Island is a good option. peaceful with plenty of space, is the perfect spot for a picnic, some walk, some jogging.

Feels run down and in need of maintenance. Fountains were not working and fenced off. Lots of graffiti and buildings in need of a wrecking ball. Park is huge and pleasant to walk. Not a lot of places to eat. Playgrounds are good for little ones to burn off steam. Bicycles for hire - brakes not working!!! Electric golf buggy requires a drivers licence! Best be prepared.

relaxation spot. this island is a blissful place! A huge park, where people come to do sports, have picnics or simply relax. There is enough space to go jogging and local rowing clubs have their training sessions here too. The park is very shady, so you can hide from the sun and chill under one of the numerous trees. It gives you an opportunity to enjoy the nature while being in one of the most beautiful capitals in Europe.

Island in the middle of budapesr. In march it was not crovded, but that was nice. Very easy to reach, walking in greenery, and watching parliament building was relaxing. Sport complex, bicycling and some other entertaining facilities was available.

Don't come during the winter. The island looked lovely on the map and we wanted to see the musical fountain. The fountain wasn't working (March 2016), it wasn't even filled with water. The island doesn't include significant attractions - the small church there is closed and the Japanese Garden isn't very Japanese-looking and also doesn't look good during the winter. It might be a great place to visit during the summer, but it was pretty much a waste of time when we went there.

Lovely but a bit dirty.. We (a couple) like to visit Margaret Island in autumnal period of a year to enjoy golden colors of leaves on trees and ground. It is usually very peacefull and you can easily walk for an hour without meeting a soul.On the territory of the park, you can find singing fountain, Palatinus Strand with baths and mini-aquapark, small zoo full of chickens with pants and a lot of archaeological sites. There are also several stands with food and bike rentals. However, it still doesn't make the park to be full of things to do.The big disappointment of this park is that it gets clean only by rare natural floods than by people. Almost everywhere you can find disgusting cigarette butts. Before you will sit on the ground, you will need to clean it.All in all, Margaret Island could be a great place if people would take care of it more.

Most beautiful park in Budapest. Rent a car for an hour and drive all along the island...you will love the greenery, the flowers, the sun and the petting zoo...you could also walk and enjoy the sunshine or the fresh air..the choice is yours and in my opinion this is another highlight if you visit Budapest..You could combine with tram no.2 and the parliament! Try also the langos yummies and the Kurtoscalacs...bread baked with sugar!!!

Great for a walk outsude the city. Had a really nice morning exploring the island. Would recommend hiring the two-person bikes as they were lots of fun. Probably best to visit in summer - we went in March so the musical fountain was not on, the cafes were shut and plants were not fully grown. It was still very pleaseant, but would love to go back in summer. The island can be accessed by a footbridge and there is no charge to visit it.

Green space perfect for a bike ride. We rode through Margaret Island as part of a bike tour out of the city and it was a breath of fresh air, lovely shade and a refreshing drink by the water for a rest stop. I can imagine if I lived in Budapest I would love to spend many a weekend in the summer here. It has its own history and historic buildings, a beautiful musical fountain and quaint cafes housed in colourful caravans.

A Unique Haven away from the city (with city views). Margaret Island-set on the Danube, is walking distance from the main city areas of Budapest. The park has a a new rubber running track thats 5.35 kilometers (3.33 miles), that wraps around the park. I initially visited the park to use the running track but to my delight I found other interesting features in the park that I enjoyed and I'm sure you will too.There is a well-manicured Japanese Garden and old ruins in the park that were nice, I will go back with my 'real' camera to photograph these.Oddly, there is also a backpackers in the park, I could imagine that this place is fun at night for the backpackers staying there! There is a free Zoo that I wandered through, there a very large bunnies (maybe hares) that are cage-free, which is nice, however there is a large Eagle, which was kind of sad to see, as such a large bird with large out-spanding wings seemed out of place in a small enclosure :( There are ponies and deer that are very healthy and seem happy, one cute pony had it tongue out and was very friendly so I stopped for a quick pat and a selfie.Perhaps one of the best things in the park is the Lokshe (large traditional Donut with sour cream and cheese or nutella). I stopped at the cafe as I noticed people eating these. I ordered the traditional donut with sour cream, garlic and cheese. I suggest sharing one as they are HUGE!! Next time I'll get the Nutella. This was a really nice surprise as I'de been looking to try this large traditional donut but had not come across one yet.The view of Parliament and Pest is quite nice from the park as well. Pack your walking shoes (sneakers) and a camera. The islands and park is dog-friendly which is great for me as my dogs come to Budapest from Los Angeles next week.Happy walking- don't miss the huge donuts! PS. The park is free so a great way to spend an afternoon for those on a budget.
Great place to relax. Great place to relax, walk around, bike or swim in a pool. A heaven on a hot day...you can spend a day there easily!
We enjoyed a stroll. We walked around and through the island. There are bird feeders, ruins, and we even saw rescued storks building a nest.
Amazing park. This is an amazing park on a half-island. Great for sunny afternoons or long runs as it has a proper running track on both sides. I come here a lot when I'm in the city!

Relaxing break from the city. A lovely area to walk or cycle in, accessible from the Margaret Bridge. Would recommend taking a picnic, although there are cafes there too. There's even a running track if you are feeling energetic - there are carriages to rent if you are feeling less so!

Nice and relaxing. A nice breath of fresh air from the city, a lot of locals were enjoying picnics, afternoon walks and just relaxing- we hired a little buggy to have a drive around which was fun, you can also get bikes-I think this would be a great way to spend the day in the summer

Visit if you have time. We had 2 hours to kill while waiting to catch flight home, so decided to visit the Island. It was nice and surprisingly large but to be honest nothing spectacular, we visited in March and most things were closed and fountains etc not working, i guess it maybe better during summer months.
Great park-island. I have been many times on the island, it is one of my favourite places to go out with my friends for a walk or to do a piknik.
A pleasant stroll with many things to see.. The best way to see it is to walk to the end of the island and take the bus back.It also has a running track which my husband took advantage of

A lovely Island in the Danube. We had a leisurely walk around this beautiful island in the middle of the River Danube in Budapest. There are running and walking tracks around the outskirts of the island, with different friendly modes of transport you can hire. It is very peaceful with a restriction of motor vehicles and very child friendly. On Sunday there are many joggers. There are a few run down areas on the island which is a shame as it could be a wonderful haven in a capital city.

Great to clear your head.. A nice stroll on this beautiful island on the River Danube was alway's a nice start to our day to clear our head's after having enjoyed the many pub's & bar's the night before.A mecca for jogger's and tourist's there is just so much to see here and the view's are awesome .Looking up onto the very impressive Margaret Bridge is outstanding and looking at the boat's along the Danube is very relaxing.A great place to visit and one i highly recommend to anyone when visiting this most beautiful of cities.

pedal it around. so practically in all seasons you can rent different kids of vehicles at the entrance which can be found in the middle of the Margit-bridge. So if you wish you can rent a bike, too, but it is better to pedal in strange shaped cars with your friends i think. you can get anywhere, you can see the zoo in the middle of the island, stop for a coffee, see the water tower, see the gardens, etc. there are some good quality restaurants there, but if u only fancy a hamburger, hotdog, or a Hungarian garlic-bread-like speciality, called LÁNGOS for about 2 euros, you can try them!

Vast island - see it by bike!. Margaret Island was much larger than I expected - we saw it by bike, these can be hired at the entrance to the island for a relatively low price. There's plenty to see on an hours cycle around the island; the old water tower, church ruins, and a small zoo.The island is well worth seeing if you have a spare hour or two in Budapest.

Fine walk on a dry day.. We walked round the whole island in around two hours. Plenty of green space, a mini zoo, Japanese garden and recreational areas. A welcome break on a dry day from the hustle and bustle of the busy city.

It would be better to go in summer. It is a park which is located in the middle of the Danube river with a mini zoo, a couple of 12th, 13th century ruins, a thermal bath, a theater, and a closed water park. There is also one or two closed restaurants. People come here to bike, to jogger, to walk their dogs or do some other exercise. I would say this park would be more attractive in the summer. We rent a golf car to circle around the island for 2900 fl/30 minutes. If the weather is warmer, it would be peasant to stay here longer.

best seen in the summer. We walked around some of the 'track' around the island being overtaken by plenty of joggers . Only a small island and not a lot to see in March but we were told it is beautiful once the spring arrives and trees and plants blossom

Great park area during hot summer. Margaret Island is great park in the River Donau. There was some restaurants and kiosks to buy food and ice cream. It was quite popular during weekend also by locals.

For any occasion any season. Offers exercise activities, zoo, theatre, sport facilities, pools, spa, restaurants, and so on and on. Still it is a park that is roomy and almost never too crowded, in the middle of one of the most beautiful cities, on an island. Do I need to say more?If so, consider that this place is home to runners and lovers, cyclists and psychics, tourists and florists, children and ... well, go and check it out.

Wow! A Treasure of an Island!. With a brand new sprung running track, cycle paths, green open spaces, swimming pools, coffee stops, a Japanese Garden, an open air theatre and lots more - what a place to spend some leisure time. Used by lots of locals and their families, this really is a treasure of an Island in the middle of the Danube!
lovely park. A lovely place to spend a few hours (or more) on a sunny day. Well worth the travel away from the centre. Found it easy to get to.

You just HAVE to see the fountain!. We cycled to the island on a Mol Bubi bike (like our Boris bikes). Just as we arrived the large fountain sprung into action. It was literally dancing to 'Feeling Good' and a couple of other popular songs. I've seen fountains work in time to music before, but nothing as mesmerising as this. We were glued to the spot (even though the time was running out on our bikes). There are seats all around - a bit like the Place de la Concorde in Paris, and it was a lovely atmosphere. Everyone was enjoying the music and show. I THINK it plays on the hour, probably at peak times (we were there in October). A must, even if you don't bother with the rest of the island...

Quick visit. Really nice park, we hired a bike and attempted to pedal round in the heat! Ended up just chilling out on the grass watching the musical fountain, definitely worth a visit if you have a spare hour or so.

Island of Biking. What a great place to go to get away from the city and yet it is still in the city. We took 7 kids (5-16) and 4 adults to the island and rode those red bike car things. One person steers and another 3 peddle the bikes. It was a great way to get some excersize and have fun. The weather was decent. There is a small zoo on the island that is pleasant to look at for a few mins. A big playground and a fountain make the island a great place to spend time outside. We also picked up some mulled wine while the kids played. Very tasty.!!

Interesting, took longer to walk than we thought!. We walked down from the northern bridge to the southern end to go to Lucakz baths. You see some of the normal Budapest life, e.g. people jogging and walking their dogs, and you can follow signs to see a few things of interest, like a church, a fountain, rose garden, and the little zoo (an aviary with Hungarian birds including storks, ravens and owls, plus some deer and ponies). It looked like you could hire two-man pedal-powered sheltered buggy vehicles to go around in. All a gentle stroll suitable for prams. It took a lot longer than we thought to walk the length of it at nearly an hour and we got a bit bored. I wouldn't recommend trying to fit this in a busy day. There are a couple of cafes.

Peace. Me and my friend went there by walk and we were impressed by the silence and peace that there is on this island. In fact, we have took the opportunity to sit down on a bench and admire a huge fountain which one finds on this island and even took a snack from there.

One of the best park in Budapest. Walking through on the Margaret bridge, but around in the middle stop a couple of hours, and visit this special place. Walk under the huge trees, sit on the nice green grass and eat a ood place with kids, without kids, with dog or without dog, with friends, or alone, for couples, for youg or old people, for runners or just walkers.

Oasis of calm. We visited the island on a bright, cold morning in February when few of the attractions were open. It was however beautiful. There are numerous paths and we followed what appeared to be a new running track down the Pest side and returning to Margaret bridge down the Buda side. We saw various birds and some red squirrels. There are many pools, leisure facilities and play areas which I assume are popular in the summer. In the winter/spring the island had a very calming effect!

Great area for exploring!. There were a ton of activities happening on the island and the gardens were spectacular! We rented a peddle bike cart and rode it around the entire island. There was an outdoor concert happening, food vendors, people jogging on the paved track on the perimeter. Very busy place for locals and tourists wanting to get a taste of the local flavor of Budapest!

Island on Danube river. This 5km length island is really worth to see. You will enjoy the beautiful forest and the view of Danube River. Old church and St. Margaret's graveyard are there. you can also visit a small Zoo o an island

Wet but lovely. A beautiful escape from the hustle and bustle of the city. Unfortunately for us it was raining, and it was raining hard, but this did not stop us walking from North to South, visiting the monastery, water tower, gardens and ruins among other aspects. Lovely tranquil place that I can imagine being beautiful in the warmer months!

Not if it's raining, but well worth a visit.. A park in the middle of the river. There are hundreds of joggers and a wealth of birds. Lots of great places to eat and have coffee and a nice respite from the city. It definitely needs a couple of hours to visit and the thermal baths are amazing.

Lovely Spring walk. There's so much on this tiny island, even off season where most of the cafes etc are closed, we still got to see the mini zoo, Japanese gardens and have a coffee at the hotel. Pleasant walk and I like that you can measure your walk or run with the track if you were there for fitness reasons.
Good for a walk. Perfect place in a sunny day for a walk and for rest. You can meet a lot jogging, walking and resting people.

A paradise away from the city in the city. Seriously I cannot express how much fun this island is, it has so many great aspects. Firstly there is a running track that goes around the whole island which is 5.5km long and many people use it, and its not hard to see why you get a great panorama of the Danube line of houses and buildings here of both sides of the Danube, its great for peaceful walks of all ages. There are large green areas, flowery gardens, old trees, and lots of entertainment and of course food and drinks. The island’s include a number of walking paths, medieval ruins, a small zoo, musical fountain (cant miss it, very popular), a water tower, swimming pools, a water park an open air theater and cinema. So there is certainly no shortage of things to do here.I do recommend to rent a bike everyone does and just ride around the island for an hour or so and take in the beauty of it, there are group bikes as well that can seat multiple people, its great fun, and certainly my favorite thing to do.FYI: The best way to get to the island is by tram 4 or tram 6 and get off at the Margit híd Budai hídfő stop

Wrong time of the year. Since we visited Budapest in December, there was no real reason to visit Margaret Island. I would recommend it on summer days, for long walks and a picnic. Great also for families.

Relaxing and training in the heart of Budapest. The island is absolutely perfect for familys to let the children bicycle free on the ways. Many Sport possibilities on the island like Track and field, swimming, long distance running, football, soccer, frisbee, streetworkout etc... The islend is full green with big fields on it where picknik is awesome. the little zoo is very good family program. You can finde bath and swimming pool on the island as well. The music fountain is very funny.

A calm oasis in the middle of Danube - excellent for families and strollers. The Margaret Island is big enough for long walks, or for jogging around on the running track. In summer time the island is relatively cool, there is an excellent swim and waterpark (Palatines) in the middle of the island. Easy to reach by walk (can be a little bit far som some), by bus or city-bicycle. No private cars are allowed otherwise. Especially nice is the fountain at the downstream end which works / "dances" with music in the summer time. There are several places to buy drinks, food, snacks and ice-cream. Electric cars and family bicycles can be rented for a reasonable price. It is very possible to just stay at the island with a book and a big towel and just chill out under a tree on the lawn - totally free.

Worth a look. We wandered around here one afternoon. Would love something like this where I live, they have running tracks that tell you how far you have gone. Was good to see loads of people using it. Nice place for a wander.
good little walk around. came here for a bike ride but due to time of year the hire place was closed so we walked round loads of nice little things to see defo recommend it if your in budapest

Green and Serene. While returning from the Danube Cruise we were recommended by the cruise staff to get down at Margaret Island. That was a good advice for us. Located in the middle of the Danube this island is connected to Budapest by the Yellow Bridge or Margaret Bridge. It's named after Margaret, the Hungarian princess, who lived here as a nun in a Dominican convent. The ruins of the church and the convent render a desolate appearance. St. Margaret's shrine is a much visited site here. The Island can be explored by hiring battery driven cars or by a train carriage type ride. There are large gardens all so green and serene. We passed by the luxurious Grand Hotel. There are athletic centres and a well maintained jogger's track. This track runs parallel to the Danube and to walk down the track is a very pleasant and refreshing experience. We took the bus service to get back to Margaret Bridge and returned to Pest by a tram.
Great spa beautiful island. Loved it! The spa is amazing, the island is so beautiful and the food was unforgettable! Big thank you to all the helpful staff.
paradise. walking in this place is like living in fairytale. there is a nice Japanese garden worth seeing and take photos.

nice island for jogging in winter time. We been there on winter, so all attractions where closed.
It is more recommended for summer time.
can spend a few hours there walking around, enjoy forest and open area.

Pleasant mid morning stroll.. Visited Margaret Island in January on a pleasant day. It was a pleasant walk however many of the amenities were shut due to the winter season.Was very popular for runners and a had brilliant marked five km running trail around the island. Would recommend any tourists in training for races to bring their trainers!Park a quiet oasis for families with young children.....also many outdoor play equipment areas for young children 10yrs and below.Make sure to wear decent footwear if you are intending to do lots of walking.

A great day out and an amazing spa!. We had a wonderful day at Margaret Island (me, husband and two daughters aged 13 & 18). There is a lovely fountain near the entrance, which has 'dancing waters' every hour (recorded music with coloured water etc). We hired bikes karts (two in each) to see more of the park, and then went to the amazing pool - which actually has 10 pools inside, or differing shapes, sizes and temperatures. Tasty street food on offer by the poolside, too. There is loads more on the island (theatre, cinema, clubs etc) which we didn't get a chance to sample - but a visit here is an absolute must during a summer visit to Budapest.

Exqusitic Island. Yes worth a visit some of the views are stunning, interesting to walk around a break from city life. Gives the impression that with some redevelopment could be another tourist attraction.On a cold winters day possibly not the best time to visit

Great for walks. We've been to the outdoor swimming pool on 4 or 5 occasions on Margaret Island. Great to spend a lot of time with the locals in the thermal baths there or in the lazy river. Food and drink at extremely reasonable prices, but don't expect anything that isn't fried!Lovely walks and you can avoid the sun with the woods. Also bike hire and special jogging surface.Gets really busy at weekends

Wonderful Budapest. Budapest – I’ve nothing but love for this beautiful destination and awesome people! A city once split into two different towns by the Danube river and named Buda and Pest, each complete with its own distinct personality. You'll find rolling hills, historic Ottoman relics and the famous Castle District in Buda, whereas flat Pest is marked by wide, tree-lined boulevards, crumbling apartment blocks and trendy ruin-style bars. It’s a city that merits a longer visit, but if you're just there for a short visit, a must see places are Margit Hind, Castle Hill, Chain Bridge (Szechenyi lanchid), Heroes' Square, Gellert Hill and Statue, Parliament (Orszaghaz) , 300-foot dome of St. Stephen's Basilica. The nightlife is vibrant, with a wide variety of venues to choose from that it gets confusing! I really can’t wait to return again this year!

Island Surprise. Walked a long way to access Margaret Island and was then shocked to learn it is at least 5 km long. Numerous means of hire transport available on site fortunately. I settled for a push bike and thoroughly enjoyed the Japanese Gardens and the chapel in which Margaret was virtually a prisoner. The viewing tower central on the Island, 'guarded' by 2 huge metalic dogs, was closed when there unfortunately.

Great place for a break from the City. After a few days trawling through museums and churches a trip to Margaret Island was just what we needed. At its best in summer it is also busy so you have to decide. We went in autumn and enjoyed our walk.

Fun Day Out!. I didn't know what to expect when my partner and I took a boat trip over to Margaret Island as we hadnt read up about it beforehand but what a delight it was, made even better by the fantastic weather. There is so much to do and see so make sure you leave plenty of time to explore the island.
Beautiful Park. Margaret Island is absolutely beautiful. It's maintained incredibly well. Make sure to check out the dancing fountain while you are there are just stroll around!
Margaret Island. It splits the Danube in two and has a great running track all the way round. ( 5km) other than that there isn't much else to it in winter other than a hotel/ spa at the top end.

Tranquil in the midle of the city. The island is a great place for a walk (or a run for the energetic). Access direct from the Margaret Bridge and in the winter you go straight from the bustle of a capital city to a quiet and tranquil place in the middle of the Danube. You can walk right round the island in just over an hour (about 6km) and its worth the effort. A lot livelier in the summer I would guess, but would then be a great place for a swim

Gorgeous Place to visit. Had a great day out on Margaret Island. Walking distance from the main town. The whole island has a running track round it which was popular so we sat at a café and watched the runners for the afternoon. Lovely fountains danced to the music, nice seating areas, grass and even a small 'zoo' - it was more like a wildlife section with birds, pigs, horses and donkeys. Lots of cafes and bars. There were food/drink vendors and you could also hire bikes or 4 person cart. Had a lovely day and would recommend taking a picnic on a nice day. Also there's a massive 'Budapest' sign that's a great for a photo opportunity!

Good Walking and pleasant surroundings. Walked here from the Parliament buildings, down by the waterfront. Margaret Island is well worth a visit to blow the cobwebs away and watch the local keep fit runners doing the circuit of the island denoted by a purpose made pathway marked out in kilometres. You can also hire covered bicycles for two to four people. We opted for a sedate walk by the riverside to the end of the island and coming back down the centre parkland.There are a lot of run down buildings on the island screaming out to be restored to their former glory. Their are Japanese gardens, children's player's, beautiful water tower, petting zoo, and just so much space enjoyed by visitors and locals alike.We did find a hut selling food and snacks by a completely miserable and totally disinterested young woman. Hence my Hungarian hotdog was cold as was my latte. So disappointing!However that did not diminish a lovely walk in beautiful grounds.I should love to see this in the summer when there would be more to see and do - more cafes and restaurants open. Lovely for families.
Relax and rest in summer. Place for relax all family. There are Kinder playgrounds. People practice Yoga. Many floweres and green trees. Beutiful fountain.

Probably better in spring and summer. We were there in January and Fountain was closed and Japaneses garden was just green European plants. It is big park, so we advise renting a bike.Pity that you cannot see Outdoor theater / Water tower from inside.

Fun, relaxation and friends. You have to visit this small island! You will meet a lot of happy people with big hearts and a lot of good stories. Ride a bike, a horse, visit the music water and the great theatre. You won't regret anything.

Not a winter destination. Very disappointed to see everything closed, and the whole island looking very run down. I am sure it is a lovely spot in the summer, but when I visited in mid January, it was miserable.

Snowy day walk, nice landscape. . The trees and path were interesting, would have been good to hire a bike, but was too complicated and expensive. I think this would be great in summer, but it did have a nice relaxed atmosphere in winter.

Spend some time here walking or jogging. A nice island in the middle of the city to spend a day more close to the nature. There is a fine road going around the island which is a really popular route among the joggers. There is also an outdoor water park, spa, hotel and a free petting zoo.

WINTER VISIT. I think this place would be wonderful in the summer!However we went in January and there was very little to do. Lovely for a walk (dog owners and joggers seem to love it) and nice to see some ruins and the old church. But very little was open. I'm sure if I went in the summer I would think very differently - but if you're going in the winter I wouldn't allocate a large amount to time to spend.

Austere in the winter, otherwise a nice walk getting there!. We walked to Margaret Island all the way from Chain Bridge.. takes about 30 minutes to reach it. But it was so nice doing so, as you pass the Parliament building on the way. We walked towards it through the Danube Promenade, so the view of the river was constant. It was also done during the evening, so very relaxing indeed. The Island itself is a park, and during winter kind of has this bleak austere sense to it. Not sure how it is during summer, maybe greener? All in all though I would recommend this to explorers at heart as well as whoever likes to jog during vacations. It is indeed a PERFECT jogging spot.

Visit in the Spring. We visited this island on a cold dull day when it was growing dark and so didn't see it at its best I'm sure but there appeared little to do but see old derelict bars and buildings. Perhaps this is a little unfair as it was at the end of December , I will visit again but next time in the warmer months.

only alternative energes on the island. I have been on this island in a beautiful day. I arrived there with the tramway and left with the same mean. After a moment of difficulties as to reach the island , i end there with my daughter, following the directions of a nice couple of young Italians we met at the beginning of the island. We arrived immediately where the visitors have to choose how they want to visit the island, They can chose among vehicles like a bicycle for two people, who pedal next to each other, an electrical bus, and a sort of electrical bicycle. We choose the first option. There were many places where you could loan them, but to pedal with it wasn't so easy and after an hour we didn't travel very much. After this with sat near a very large fountain with very beautiful water plays that followed the music. The seats were nailed to the earth (probably in order not to make them stolen). therefore you couldn't move them, but after a while you became used to it and didn't care much. We went also to eat something in a sandwich. We had a good time there and the island is a beautiful place.

A few hours spent walking in beautiful Grn Space in the middle of the city. We spent a lovely few hours wandering this green park-like island in the middle of Budapest and the Danube. We got there by taking the metro to level with the top of the island and walking over the bridge. We then walked down the park, looking at the Japanese Garden, the water tower, and various other buildings and attractions. It was mid December so was fairly closed down, but we had plenty of piece and quiet to enjoy the city on the opposite banks. We also found a place where you could rent cycle buggy's by the half hour or hour and tried one out for half an hour - that was fun but exhausting unless you are quite fit. We ended up at the other end of the island and walked over the bridge that end and back to our apartment.
......peaceful. We hired a pedal car for two and enjoyed a couple of hours cruising (well pedalling!) around the island on the traffic-free roads and paths......peaceful.

Favourite part of Budapest. We got the bus over to Margaret Island using our Budapest cards. We had so much fun here, after having a drink at the ruin bar on the Island, we hired out a bike to drive around on. There was a candy floss stand at the far end of the island, the candy was huge, at least the size of out torso. We brought the bike back and charged less than we expected. It was great fun driving around and spotting the ruins.
Great place. Great place to have a walk, lots of lovely locals and tourists from all over the world. Lots of opportunities to take great pictures

A sports facility. We had a quiet walk around the island, but is not very special unless you are visiting for sport. The hop on hop off bus ticket also alows boat trips that do stop at the island. The island is easily walked to by crossing halfway over the road bridge.

Huge spa. Margaret Island has a thermal spring-fed medicinal spa named Palatinus Baths which cover over 17 acres, Rose Garden, Union Monument which is a metal sculpture of a flower, a water tower and an open-air theatre.
Nice and quiet. Great place to run away from center of the city. Good and fresh air on this spot. You can watch athletes running there all day.

great place for a relaxing afternoon or picnic. the island is bigger than i though. It has huge gardens and so historic buildings.The is a range of coffee shops and restaurants, a little bit pricey.You can rent a bike or one of those pedal cars and go around the all island very quickly, its a nice experience. My favourite thing to do there is sit in the gardens with a bottle of wine and enjoy the biodiversity of the place.
Vast island in centre of River Danube. This has a little zoo on it where you can walk around and feed the animals , there are bikes available to get around we didn't walk very far

A great park for a walk and relaxing. Margaret Island was a nice contrast to some of the other attractions that Budapest has to offer. Nice to have a walk through the gardens and enjoy the piece and tranquility. Easily accessable and there are cafes for refreshments. Worth a visit
Must do!. Well, its a touristic thing, as some people may say, but it's a must! Its interesting to see how local people enjoy time on this island.

Nice place to visit. This is a really nice place to visit if you like walking. This place is about 35 mins from the shopping area. It has a track if you want to run, a small zoo free of charge, an open theatre, a casino, a small stadium, an old church to see, some ruins. I took lots of nice photos and I found a nice place to eat with a warm mulled wine back on Pest.

FRESH BREATH, OLD TREES, NCIE WALK. While most cities lack a green lung, Budapest has it. An ancient park situating two swimming pools, two hotels, an ecopark donated by Sweden, long walking tracks, enchanting music (only duriing the summer), special ruins, cloisters. This island has everything to offer to both tourists and locals.

Beautiful, peaceful island in the heart of the city. It's an absolute must when visiting Budapest. Take the tram (2) to the edge of Margit Bridge and walk across to where it intersects with the Island in the middle of the Danube. On a sunny autumn day it was a delight to walk the 5k running track around the outside of the island well used by the runners and cyclists of Budapest. There are no cars which adds to the peaceful and relaxed atmosphere. In the centre of the island there are plenty of things to see and do (huge fountains, a musical well, a small petting zoo, ruined churches, a stunning Japanese garden, a water park/lido etc). There is a feeling of 'faded glamour' to some of the buildings which were closed in the autumn but this added to the atmosphere. Take a picnic and make it a priority!

One of My Favorite Places in Budapest. This place is really nice. There is a small zoo, thermal baths, gardens, snack bars, and more. The island has an interesting history and you will even see the ruins of a centuries-old convent where Szent Margit lived.

Truly a hidden gem, worth spending more time. Its a 25 minute walk from the Andrassy Av. A quiet, peaceful little island with NO cars, just pedal power cycles you can hire, and acres of solitude. I used this place to get rid of the Pub-crawl hangovers. Bring your own lunch and beer, and you'll have a great afternoon picnic. Lots of small snack places with burgers and Wursts, running tracks, musical fountain etc. All accessible from a tram stop.
Beautiful on a sunny day. We had to come back as a storm stopped us to enjoy the island. We came back on a nicer day, and even in cold, but sunny weather, this is a beautiful park-island to visit

musical fountain!. We walked to the island from the city center, its a good distance but we enjoy walking so it was fine.The island itself is worth a vist, it has a large garden with beautiful specimen plants well worth a look. The highlight for me was the fountain which seems to dance to the music played loudly while the fountain is on. I could have happily sat and watched it all day. The island is free to enter, and there are bikes of all shapes and sizes to hire if you are not up to walking all day, which ever you decide to do, walk or ride, do make sure and vist Margaret Island.

A magnificent little Island on the Danube. This paradise on the danube is very close to my heart. The national swimming pool, the Palatinusz, with the Grand Hotel and the outdoor theatre with its beautiful gardens and the dancing fountain is a real gem. Don't miss this island when in Budapest.

Here's a Tip: Know Why You're There. The island is not near the city centre so it's best to plan your activities on Margaret Island. We went there via a boat cruise for a concert under the stars during summer. It was amazing.We saw people walking their dogs, running, chatting with their friends, old couples holding hands, and picnics by the river. They looked happy on that island. So if you have a plan (just like them) and have nothing to do for an hour or two, then go.Ps: Meandering is a (planned) activity too ;)
Definitely visit on the night time too!. Something free to do in Budapest, something I would recommend to anyone. Sat on the island for hours, and enjoyed the scenery and the fountain concert
Beatiful place to walk or ride a bicicle. Its an historical and beatiful place of Budapest. You can walk o ride a bicicle into the island in a suny day.

Lovely park, nice walk. An island in the river and now a public park. It used to be, apparently, the site of a nunnery and also a hareem when the Turks occupied Budapest.There's a musical fountain that seems a big favourite with kids and teenagers. Lots of sports facilities and good walking/riding/cycling paths around the edge of the island. At the far end there's an upmarket hotel where we stopped off for coffee and cake.

Skip it. There is nothing of any interest here, except tennis courts and a swimming pool and other sports venus, so it would be great if you need to play tennis or swim... Otherwise not for the tourist, nothing to see.
Best desicion. The hotel I stayed at was on the island, it was quiet and away from the crowds. There are many walking paths, historic sites and a musical fountain. Amazing must see!!!!

Fabulous running track. Had a great run around the island on a cold winter morning. The views are great and having a proper running track is fairly exceptional for this sort of historic area in Europe.
Shame that the island does seem to be quite shut down during the winter.

Basically just a park... but oh so much fine on the bikes!. We got off here on the tour bus and was a 5/10minutee walk there from the stop but was a nice day so we did not mindOnce there we saw you could hire out bikes to go around the island and so we did and it was DEFINITELY the right choice!For starters I looked AMAZING on the bike. It was GREAT FUN. ASERIOUS workout. And the island was quite large so it was definitely needed lolThe island had toilets all over which most of did NOT work, there was a small zoo and sone restaurantsThis isnt a place you would go out of your way to visit but if near by, definietly visit

Check out the fountain!. When we visited it was boiling hot weather, we went for a walk in the island and sat by the fountain. We were sat around the side dipping our feet in the cooling water. There were many other people around doing the same. We got up to walk off and some music started - and then the fountain did a dance in time! It was really fun to see.

Not for the traveller. This is an amazing place for residents but it is just a park, the novelty is that it is on an island. It is not a place to visit on a city break as it wasted time. (it did not stop raining during my visit, so not a good time to play any sports) If you get the cruise which included in the hop on, hop off coach tour, it is worth going, just to go down the Danube. I walked back towards the bridge and got a bus back to my hotel.

Not great on a rainy November afternoon. Visited here on a rainy November afternoon with most of the attractions closed. If you are there in the summer I think it would be great but not a winter activity. Although the walk up along the Danube from the Jewish Quarter was nice with some good sites on route

A pretty little island.. Not too far of a walk from central Budapest this island houses many things, from magical fountains to a fully operational sports complex and extensive Japanese gardens. You have to visit even if for a short period of time. You can access the island at either side as its connected by bridges by I recommend using the V-Shaped Margit bridge. You can get a tram that stops directly in the middle of Margit bridge.

Not as good in the winter. I think this would be a wonderful place in the summer season, but in the low season it looks drab and tired. There were still quite a few people out walking and jogging but it was obviously a time for repairs so the fountain was closed and some paths dug up. We found one brave stall open selling hot food, coffee and mulled wine where we sat wrapped in the provided rugs trying to stay warm. It is worth a visit, but if you have a chance go in the warmer months.

a lovely walk!. We visited Margaret Island in the afternoon and we loved it! The sunset was amazing from the Margaret Bridge, pure pink clouds. We enjoyed a ride with a bicycle that we rented from there. The gardens are stunning!

Pleasant and peaceful haven. As I understand it, further development on the island is restricted. There is a sports facility, a couple of bars and restaurants a cinema and the 2 hotels at the northern end. Given that the island is about 2.5km long, this leaves a lot of open space, even allowing for the road connecting the Margit and Arpad bridges (at the south and north ends of the island (respectively). Note that the island is served by the 26 bus (Nyugati station to Arpad metro).My visit was on a morning in November. There were people around, but mainly joggers and dog walkers with a few bike riders (I understand that the island is a favourite place for local joggers). There is a good path running on the eastern side of the island used by the runners, but there are numerous others meandering through the park-like surroundings. There is a small mini-zoo, rather limited, but may be sufficient to keep young children diverted for a while. Also present on the island are the ruins of a convent. You can't miss the water tower, which is rather more attractive than the usual. At the northern end is a small chapel and a small Japanese style garden. There is a musical fountain, but there did not seem to be much action. Perhaps its still being restored.

Fantastic!. The island is very beautiful with ZOO in the middle .
It is favorite place for children and for people who like sport.
Local people adore this island and visit it every day and for weekends.

interesting. It is located at the middle of budda and pesti opposite to the parliament.it is a piece of land in the middle of dunavis river and it is connected to the land with a kindof bridge.you can get there with the bus,or the boat.the margaret island,is a very big park in reality,where you can take a lot of walks.by foot,or by bicycle!you can also work out,have pic nic ,or eat in a restaurant.At the winter restaurants are closed and you can find only cantines for drinking a coffee or eat fast food.

Great place to walk or bike. The Park has special walk ways, and is great to relax and watch life go by , great and safe place to bike or just sit at a bench and read. Saw many young lovers , it was nice.
Favorit place. If you are looking to spend a bit of time to relax from your daily rotine it is the best place to go,

Summer lovin.. Midnight in Paris was playing in an open air cinema set up on the island the past summer. A well stocked bar and Owen Wilson, far from home and nostaligic as always, I shed a little tear.And the little kebab on the walk back. It was so good that when I finished I ran back and got another.Sure beats walking around exercising like the locals. And don't start me on paddle boats and little electric buggies. It's not on.

cute and green. great place for spending several hours enjoying greens and fresh air.small place-1 hour by pedal car-2 600 hu,2 hours by foot,lots of trees,flowers,old church,ruins,many statues. japanise garden with lake .very relaxing and beautiful.amazing autumn day

Beautiful park to relax. Margaret Island is simply beautiful which is no surprise because Budapest itself is just so beautiful. A perfect place to spend your afternoon and relax. I went there by myself and I enjoyed the scenery and atmosphere so much, but I do think it's best visited with your family or loved one. :)

A nice place to relax. I visited the island on a sunny and warm day with my work mates. Had a lot of fun since we rented a pedaling car and we went around the island with that. There are some nice places were you can grab a drink or eat something. You shouldn't expect a whole lot from these places, but they are alright.

Highly recommended quiet place in town. take some time to enjoy the beautiful fountain, have a walk or ride with an electric golf car. Escape the noises of the city and enjoy the Danube on both sides!

A relaxing afternoon.... We hadn't planned on going to Margaret Island, but we found ourselves walking aimlessly by the Danube on a Saturday and strolled across the bridge on to the island and had a great afternoon. We sat and had some hot wine outside, then rented a pedal car (I think it worked out around £7-9 for an hour). There are a couple of little cafes around for some food and drink, but not too many.It's basically a really nice, relaxing park with some cool stuff to see. Definitely worth spending an afternoon if you have the time!

A liitle piece of history. If you are in Budapest and have some spare time on your hands take a trip to the island, have a relaxing amble around and take in the history and sights, you will find it very erlaxing

in the heart of Budapest, for leisure and pleisure :). It is a green island located in the center of Budapest, easily accesible by trams 4-6.
You can jog around (there is a track), you can rent bikes, or you can just enjoy the sunshine in one of the many relaxing bars around.
Even Hungarians recommend it! :)

Beautiful location for a relaxed and fun filled family time !. Island has a large beautiful park with river view, musical fountain, shows, lush greenery, ice crea, shops, vendors selling beer etc. Park has something for everyone. Families with kids, couples. youngsters, grown ups can all equally enjoy lovely breeze, good views and be entertained with shows, people dancing to the tunes played in the musical fountain. One can use Segway,Golf cars etc if you find walking to be hard work. It was a great day out, very relaxing and refreshing. It is walk able distance from tram line.This island comes with high recommendations to all. Don't forget to take our picnic basket !!

Beautiful walk. If you fancy a good walk this is the place to do it. There's not much to see on the island bar some old ruins but it is very beautiful and quiet. The Japanese garden is charming although very small and perhaps in need of a bit of care. A beautiful refreshing walk however.
Lovely place to visit. We visited here after out cruise down the Danube.Hired a bike and explored the island, definitely a good idea as there is a lot to get round
Fantastic. We spent most of our 1 week stay here. The musical water fountains especially at night are not to be missed. Lots of history can be found here, unforgettable
Great escape form the city. Easily accessible from the city is this nice island retreat. Kids loved the playground and the peaceful atmosphere amongst the fall leaves was beautiful.
Good to walk around. We went late Autumn/early Winter so it was full of interesting colour but a tad cold. Lots to photograph and even just sit for a while.

Stayed here, several times. Particularly in the summer, when Budapest is humid, this place is cooler. I like the Belle Epoque period hotel, although I do not patronise the baths. The island is a little way from the city centre, so be prepared to use taxis. The extra expense is well-justified, in my view
lovely place. We really enjoyed riding the bicycle through the park, great way to see some parks, and do some workout.

A great activity. We were staying close by and walked here on the afternoon of our arrival. It was raining the day we visited but we could imagine that in summer it would be a welcome respite from the busy city. We walked most of the island and enjoyed the tranquility. There appears that there is a lot on offer during peak season, we would love to visit then.

Peaceful and interesting retreat from the city.. Margaret island is well worth a visit. It is easy to access by foot or by car and is a good day out for families, couples or individuals. Lots of people use the track for jogging, there are lots of play areas and sport facilities. The Japanese Garden is lovely to walk around. We visited in early November, so it was quiet, but I would imagine that it is very popular in the summer.

Great day out. It's a lovely place to go, and a great history. Get a bicycle car and explore.The jogging bath along the Duna is worth a go, and the little roads are lovely with the bicycles.The old convent and church must be seen.Do not miss!

Lovely place!. Ideal place for physical activity, hold a picnic, photograph or just enjoy the landscape. I followed the tip of the people of Budapest and was a very pleasant afternoon on the Danube River.

Huge park within the city - not to be missed. Reminiscent to the large parks in London, Margaret Island is a must see. Not only a park, but also houses hotels and concert arenas, etc. Mostly a pedestrian zone.

A lovely autumn morning walk on Margaret Island. We started our walk at the top of Margaret Island and set off on our walk. The first interesting place we came to was the Japanese Garden. That was beautiful and we enjoyed spotting and watching the fish and the turtles swimming in the ponds. The trees were beautiful as the leaves changed colour and fell. There were little children having fun collecting leaves. The mini zoo on the island is also good for kids (of all ages). They have a few animals (deer etc) and quite a few birds. One enclosure holds a flock of silky chickens - about half black and half white. You can't help smiling watching them. A little further down the island I was pleased to see a small flock of nuthatches (one of my favourite birds) high up in the trees. I don't think I've seen so many at one time before. There were other interesting sights, leaving us to marvel at God's wonderful creation, and it seemed no time before we reached the bottom of the Island (even though it had probably been a couple of hours). The highlight of our walk though wa sthe musical fountain. We thought it was kids singing as we approached but it was music from speakers and the fountain was performing in time to the music. It really was impressive and my wife filled up her phone memory videoing it!

Margaret Island. Decided to visit Margaret island situated in the midst of the Danube river and approachable by the Margaret bridge built across the Danube connecting Pest to the Buda side embankments.Boarded a 6 Nos tram in Pest and alighted mid-way on the bridge tram stop and walked into the garden World of Margaret Island.St Margaret Island is 2.5 Kms long and 500 meters wide situated in the middle of the river Danube in Central Budapest.This island was dominated by nunneries,churches and cloisters until the 16 the Century when the Ottoman wars forced the monks to flee and the buildings were destroyed.In the 18th century it was made into a resort for the Palatines.It was declared a public park in 1908 and during the "Siege of Budapest" in World War II bore the brunt of war destruction and massacres.There were numerous young tourists and cycling was the craze in this unique natural island park of Budapest. Cycle hire charges were 1400 Ft for a hour and i was charged 1000 Ft for half an hour between 1300-1330 hrs. Explored this small cute island with the cycle as this was the safest place to cycle having negligible vehicular traffic .Didn't Irish Rock star Bono of "U2" get seriously hospitalized while cycling in Central Park in New York ? I was careful in my cycling speed as there were numerous cyclists as well as pedestrians with a occasional bus or vehicle making its appearance on the narrow park roads.Cycled around the small island and came across the beautiful crafted "Japanese Garden" which had a small pond with Koi and carp fish.The island has the Palatinus water park which is the largest open air swimming complex in Budapest.There was also a jogging track along the boundary of the river island having a foam rubber track.Cycling around discovered the landmark "Water Tower" built in art Noveau style in 1911 and today functioning as a look-out tower and a exhibition hall.There were statues of two huge dogs at the entrance of the Water tower.A real cute Island in the midst of the Danube river.

Such an interesting island a must. We spent a onderfulfew hors walking on this lovely island all the trees were Autumn colours ,free mini zoo Japanese Garden waterfall ,remains of a Convent plenty of history and in the hig season so much to see and do .alsoif you feel energetic there's a 5km running track all around with plenty of energetic people using it.

The island in a golden autumn day. To go to Margaret Island today, was a very lucky decision .Probably this was one of the very last golden days of the fall, whose colorful robes made of autumn leaves were still in full glory, but the sunshine was a bit hazy already and the shivering pansies pulled themselves together in the flower beds. My steps were cushioned by fallen leaves, and the statue of the girl with the flute in front of the l ruins played the „Autumn leaves”. The Palatinus water park, that is so busy during the summer, now is abandoned, only a few people are waiting for the No26 bus what runs along the island in every 15 minutes. It starts at Nyugati railway station and goes through Margit bridge until Árpád bridge.Margaret Island is a popular recreational area and being in the middle of the city it is easily approachable. In addition to the aforementioned Palatinus “Pala” as the Hungarians are calling it, there is the Hajós Alfréd sports pool for the serious swimmers and a tennis court as well.During the summer evenings is a wonderful entertainment to go to the open-air-theatre. Most of these features are closed already (in November) together with the famous “Music Fountain”. The landmark Water Tower is still open, only doesn’t function as a water tower anymore, but as a lookout and an exhibition hall.If you’re rich enough there are two hotels as well, but as you can guess, they aren’t budget ones.Walking around I thinking about poor St Margaret after the island was named, and who lived most of her short 28 years life here. After the Mongol invasion her parents offered her to the God to save Hungary.
