At the age of three she went to the Dominican nuns and later was transferred to the convent on the Island of Rabbits, - currently Margaret island - built by her father. Margaret’s vows took place here in 1254. Can you imagine? She was born in 1242, so took the vows when she was 12 year old. Not an enviable life for a princess.Admiring an old oak tree I think that perhaps it is one of whom Arany János the famous Hungarian poet wrote about. “I like to relax under the oak trees” (sorry for the awful word to word translation)This island isn’t only beautiful in every season, but full of history as well. If you want to rejuvenate your body and soul, visit Margaret Island.

Perfect spot for a sunny sunday picnic. If the weather is good, I recommend you buy some food and go on the island (you can easily walk from tram 2 last stop, near the parlament) for a picnic. After you can take a walk around the island. Or even rent some transportation (bicicles, etc)
Last Day. Beautiful place, looking forward to returning next year to complete our visit. Just perfect. Could easily have spent hours here but sadly our flight was calling .
A wonderful stroll on a sunny day.. You can reach the island by boat, which we did, or by bus or on foot. Walking the full length with lunch only took 2 hours.

all year round. cross the island from Arpad bridge till Margaret bridge, check out the renovated Japanese garden, climb up the water tower, visit the church ruins, pass by the small animal park, finish at the musical fountain
Great for a long walk / day trip. Amazing place! Definitely go to the music fountain and the japanese garden. Great for walking, running or cycling.

beautiful Island. A beautiful, nice, relaxing place to visit. A walk, a run, cycling, across the island is possible.
A tip; visit the open air theatre, the fountain, church on the island.

Escaping the city. Very huge area. We decided to take a small train guided tour. And we made the right choice cause the island is big. We didnt have so much time but we wanted to see it . We passed by all the island, discovered all the attractions. Great place to spend the day. Reachable by public transportation. Not to be missed.

Magical Musical Fountains. Margaret Island bisects the Danube and can easily be accessed on foot or via tram 4 or 6
If you visit in the evening then the fountain sound and light show is something to definitely sit and watch

Good cheap day activity for summer. I went with 3 other girls this summer. It was a really hot day, we rented a golf buggy for a hour which was really cheap, a good laugh and a nice break from walking in the heat. The island is very pretty but there's only a couple of café type things to eat, we were expecting to have lunch there but maybe take something with you.
Margaret Island. Very enjoyable boat trip round the island; stopped for an hour but very little to do there, everything closed and run down, maybe because it was October

Beautiful Island. We visited on a Saturday and it was such a lovely trip. The musical fountain was magical and the Japanese garden was stunning, peaceful and tranquil. We hired an electric car which was great fun. Without a doubt this was one of the favourite attractions of my trip and I would recommend it to everyone.

Dancing Fountains and good beer.. Loads to do here...walking, bike rides etc. Spectacular fountain and very attractive Japanese Gardens. A quiet spot away from all the bustle and traffic. Good bus service!

green island. We visited this green island in a sunny day after many rainy days. We stopped there for an hour during a hap-on hop-off boat tour on Danube.You can rent electric cars, funny bicycles or walking in the beautiful park. In the north of the Island there is a musical fountain and a lot of chairs fixed there and you can see the dancing fountains and took a sun bath. As we have not enough tine, we couldn't visit all the Island.

Beautiful place to relax. Hard to believe this is right in the middle of a bustling city ! We walked to Margaret Island from out Hotel and spent half a day here , we hired one of bikes and explored the Island , had a Langos for lunch and watched the world go by sitting by the fountain, a quiet oasis when you need a break from all the tourist attractions , lovely ! :)
So pretty in Autumn. Calm oasis, beautiful park, fountain to music was awesome. The views are good. Take time to walk to this park.

Beautiful!. Margaret Island is a beautiful island situated on the Buda side of Budapest. It is very easy to get to by crossing over the Margaret Bridge. We spent about 2 hours there, but can easily see how people could spend all day there. Great place for kids and families and the fall foliage is beautiful. Can only imagine what it is like in the spring. Highly suggest exploring the island. You can also rent bikes to explore. If you are in Budapest for a long duration and like to run, Margaret Island also has a running track.

Good for a sunny day. We Visited on a sunny day - Rode a train for 950 which showed us all the landmarks on the island..It would have been one massive walk if not. Fountain was very pretty. We took a packed lunch which was very nice touch

Nice island. A pleasant park for spending an afternoon seeing. Bikes and pedal buggies are available for hire which can be taken around the island. Lots of pretty gardens and a few ancient ruins / monasteries to see. Very little transport using the island too so very safe with kids.

The music fountain.. Thanks to the very good weather we could walk a lot during our journey so we visited an island in the middle of the city which is very quiet and beautiful, especially the music fountain.

Little piece of heaven!. Could spend a whole day here, only wish I had more time on the island. Filled with trees, play parks for children, restaurants and a water slide park this is a perfect place to be. With the relaxing atmosphere and The River Danube flowing either side makes this picturesque and peaceful island the perfect spot for those special travel/holiday photos.

It's a nice place. We visited here as it was about the only touristy thing we hadn't done yet in Budapest. We got a pedal trolley and got a hell of a workout getting it round the island. Our advice would be to walk out get a golf buggy. It is a lovely little island with a few things to do and see

Leafy park. Good place to escape from the city. Jogging track around the island. The musical fountains were good. Poor catering.
Other than that just a leafy area with no traffic.
very nice peace of nature in the city. nice visit at the Mragaret Island. highly recommended. you can rent a bike, nice walking a lot of green trees and flowers
Intersting Island. We viewed this island from the boat on the river Danube. It has lots of things to fill a summer day - beaches, bykes and no cars.

Little gem. The dancing illuminated fountains were a brilliant find, our apartment owner told us to go there and we were not disappointed. The danube on both sides and plenty of people there keeping fit. Well woth the stroll

Beautiful place to visit, rest. Fantastic running spot. If you like to run outside and in Budapest, go to Margaret island to run. It has a running track along the island, nice sightseeing and nice places to rest. You can take your family and during your run they have several things to do. It has also a nice hotel if you want to stay in the island.

A Relaxing Outing. Take the tram and get off either at its last stop or just before the bridge. Then change trams or cross over on foot. The island is a virtual peace haven. Lots of locals just come here to relax. There are a few eating places but nothing much to praised. Lots of options to take pedal cars, mini vans, trains etc to drive round this beautiful park. The flowers were not very exciting, but then winter was soon to arrive. But do not give this a miss.

Nice and tranquil. If you want a break from the hustle and bustle of central Budapest then Margaret Island is a great place to go.It is a lovely tranquil walk around the island with lots of nice things to see such as the musical fountain, open air theatre and remains of an ancient nunnery. There are also things for the kids such as play parks and a petting zoo.There are various famous hotels and thermal spas on the island you can go to.Definitely worth a visit if you want some down time whilst in Budapest.

A beautifull place in the heart of Budapest. Margaret Island is a beautifull place in the heart of Budapest. You can walk around beautifull nature (trees, flowers) by the river. Highly recomended for families, baby walks but you can also have fun at the fanous baths.

Worth a trip. We visited here for an afternoon and it was a fleeting visit as it was pouring down but this would be a lovely day out if the weather was nice!You can hire cycle cars or motor cars (small ones) to get around the island and there are various things to see as you can go around such as musical well, chapel, ruins and singing fountain... there are plenty of small coffee and burger places too so you can easily stop and have something to eat :-)Well worth a trip!

Unbelievable holiday. Once you arrive at the Danubius Health & Spa Hotel on Margaret Islandyou are switched off from the city noise and feel as though you are on a different planet.Check in at Reception Desk - very polite and efficient. Rooms -excellent. Cleanliness - very good. Employees are very polite and helpful. Food - very good. Medical Treatments - very good.. Hotel surroundings - lovely garden, water park, zoo, and fantastic "walking" facilities. Close to City and there is a bus stop not far from the Hotel which brings you into town - last stop - West EndOverall rating should be VERY GOOD

Very pretty park. It was a little cold and and rainy when we visited so we hired a little car to drive around the park. Very pretty in autumn with all the trees in colour and the fountains were lovely. I imagine it's a great spot to spend a day in the summer
Don't miss. It's a landmark that can't be missed. Take your picture from afar or somewhat nearer. A tourist local guide can find a good spot for that great picture.

A nice quiet place better in warmer weather. When weather allows, there is a water park on the north side and in summer the fountain offers a music & light show. There is also a small zoo in the middle and pedal car rentals. I really like the jogging carpet which allows for lower impact - Pest side.

Wonderful respite. Get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and visit tranquil Margaret Island. It is easy to get to. We loved the island. Very relaxing. The island has a musical fountain, bike paths, walking paths, gardens, a small zoo and many other activities. There are also numerous snack bars. Bikes in many forms are available for rent at reasonable rates. The island is small and it is easy to get around. Very good place to take the family.
Nice to See. If you take a cruise with your hop on hop off bus you get this free and you can get off the cruise and walk around this Island in the middle of the Danube
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. Great place. Really nice, has a lot of activities in the park. Great to go with bicycle or to go to jog. The Japanese garden is unbelievable!

NATURAL. Margaret Island is a lovely natural preserve oasis located in the middle of the Danube in the beautiful city of Budapest, Hungary. Private cars are not allowed to drive on the island making it a great place to stroll or picnic on a lovely day. You will enjoy the views of Buda on the West side and Pest on the East side. Taxis can take you to the restaurant on the island for good Hungarian food. Well worth a day to take it all in.

Romantic Margaret Island. The Island is a sanctuary of peace in a frantic,fast city. The groomed gardens,fountain, ancient ruins are a fine way to spend a few hours. There are variable food outlets, as well as electric car rental,bike rental and many attractions for the kids. Should be part of your experience of Budapest.

top class avon. Really wanted to go to Margaret Island while in budapest, really glad I did with the danube on either side it is a special place from watching the birds and a red squirrel to watching and listening to the musical fountain , a bigger place than I thought it would be easy to get to from margit hid [margarets bridge] ps don't forget to feed the fish -terrapin -etc in the pond nice thing to do , loved this place a big a+++++++

A little paradise in the city centre. Walking onto the island was like visiting another world. It's gorgeous, huge, and the perfect place to unwind. The gigantic lido in the middle of the island is also AMAZING with the best waterslides I've ever experienced.Come at the right times, and you'll also find the big fountain by the bridge onto the island playing music with the water flying around in time. You can also take off your shoes and soak your (probably aching) feet in the fountain's perimeter, which is a must on a hot day. I'd spend a week here if I could.
Great day trip. It is nice for 2-3 hours. Pay attention when using the 4-wheels bicycles that it is forbidden to enter the japanese garden and ride on the red lanes for runners

THE place to exercise in Budapest!. We rented bikes on Margaret Island and rode around the island and also over to Budapest and around. When we came back, we had coffee in the grand hotel there. The island is full of trees and flowers with lots of people running, playing soccer, and riding bikes.

Fantastic. I went for a visit to the island on a Tuesday. There were visitors but not too many. We rented a cart to drive around the island to see all the sites. It was a great idea. We rented the cart for an hour, which was enough time to see the entire island. After returning the cart, we sat by the fountain. The fountain is great, but it is probably best at night. The music selection at the fountain is varied. A must see in Budapest!

Lovely for a stroll. Margaret's island is a lovely quiet oasis. Beautiful walks and a fabulous fountain that spouts in time to music....Lovely. There are stalls selling food and drink if you get hungry/thirsty - great place for some relaxation!
The ambient is unbeliveable. After a good dinner, one must do a walk here, it is so nice, the gardens, the flowers, the river and the people.
Nice . The park is very nice and big, it's fun that you are in a big city and yet you can sit and relax in a park ob an island

Best place for romantic couples and for runners. This is one of the best place for runners. There is a running track around the island. There are two good hotel on island. Both have spa. You can find a small zoo and concert hall also. There are beautiful flowers and gardens. Most of it car free.

Well worth a visit. We were not too sure about visiting Margaret Island during our short stay in Budapest, but were very pleased that we did. We got a water taxi (Big Bus) from just after Liberty Bridge which took us to the Island and back for approx 4000huf each. The island itself has so much to offer everyone from a simple walk, a visit to the baths, rose gardens, musical fountain, small zoo and you can even stay in the hotel on the island. Allow for a full morning or afternoon at least as it's bigger than you think!
What a wonderful facility. We found this park to be both beautiful and relaxing. A great facility right in the middle of Budapest. The fountains which 'dance' to music are amazing.
A very public open space. The island is fairly large, one can jog around the special path, cycle and the public busses also run onto the island. It is beautiful and definitely worth a visit.
BEAUTIFUL AND CALM PARK. Margaret Island is a beautiful and calm park plenty of trees,there's a japanese garden with a waterfall and a tiny zoo.

lovely relaxing park. really lovely park on an island in the middle of the Danube (you reach it via a bridge) You can hire push bikes, electric buggys, or Segways to explore the island. The dancing fountain is also a nice attraction and there are nice coffee/food stalls to sit and have a beer/coffee and watch the world go by
Lush and Green. Really worth a visit, it is very green and lush. There is a bus which takes you from one side of the Island to the other.

The Musical Fountains are Fantastic. We visited Margaret Island at night to view the Musical Fountain. It was fantastic. The key is to get there at the exact time of the music. This appears to be one of the best kept secrets in town as there were few others present on a beautiful evening.

Nice place to walk. We enjoyed walking through the park. It is very big!
Bigger than you would think. The restaurant/café are a bit rundown unfortunately.

has everything!. can spend at least half a day walking the circumfrence of the island. there is food and drinks, dancing fountains, sports, even a mini zoo! In the summer many people read books and sunbathe in the park. the trees are glorious...its a wonderful place to visit.

Must go on summer time!. If you are viaiting budapest in the summer or had the luck of a sunny day in another season dont miss the margit island. You will find a huge island which is all a big park. The park is divided to few parks, japaneese park, a fountains area, waterpool center. There is an option to rent a bicycles or a family bicycles. If you like you can stay at the island using one of its few hotels.
A lovely way to relax.. A beautiful park offering lots of activity for those who wish to run, swim or walk - or peddle the many 'golf buggies'.

Surprising Island. There is so much to see and do on this surprising little island in the middle of the Danube. We enjoyed a stroll around the perimeter path but there is a swimming pool, water park, water tower, kids play area, zoo, the ruins of an ancient convent, and musical fountains. The perfect place to spend a day while visiting this beautiful city.

Buda - Pest island.... The island was wonderful. We were there in september and the atmosphere with all of the flowers and parks was amazing. We had good opportunity to have quality time with my friends. The island has several hotels, restaurants, different sights and even a zoo. There are great possibilites to do some sports inside like jogging, or running, right next to the beautiful Danube. We had a really great time. We’ll definitely come to visit again.
Simply beautiful. A place to escape the city and enjoy flowers and open areas. Perfect place to run or bike. Accessible by boat or car. Very historic island and not to be missed.

Super morning fun. We used the hop on hop off boat to get to the island. As we left the dock we could here music so we went to have a look. It was a fantastic fountain show in time to the music. So we stopped and took a seat. The music was classical and modern but we thought that the classical was more effective with the music. Then we noticed the pedal cars! So the four of us set off to explore the island pedalling and laughing alway! We stopped at a cafe for some of the famous lemonade and something to eat. Then it was time to go back for the boat.

Unexpected splash of music!. We arrived just as the musical fountain began its routine. We had not heard about this in advance and it was a very pleasant surprise. It's worth visiting the island just for this. Also, the Japanese garden is very well presented and maintained. Although the rest of the island is peaceful and worth having a stroll through, as other reviewers have found, many of the facilities seem to be closed or in need of renovation. Still, do visit if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city!

Margaret Island, Budapest. The Japanese Garden was beautiful. We stayed for an hour and walked around part of the manmade island. It was worth a visit. Might be better to in the spring/summer when the flowers are in abundance.

Fun day out. Really good fun!! Rented a pedal car to have a look round and was great fun, lots of people doing the same. The musical fountain was amazing, was really surprised!! Went from Verdi to Dire Straits!! Had food from one of the snack bars and some mulled wine which came in practically a pint glass, fab!! Not everything was own because it was October but still easily worth a trip.

Pretty island to ride around. Pretty island with dancing fountains to music. We rode around the island as is it quite a long walk round. We had free bike hire for an hour which came with our hop on hop off bus tour and is recommended. There are other options to get around the island.

A great chance to have a break from sight-seeing. After several days of doing all the sights we needed a break.Margaret Island was a solution - a lovely green area easily reached by the tram (number 2 or 4 I think) that runs across the Margit bridge with a stop in the middle by the road / path that runs down from the bridge onto the island.At the bottom of the slope down there are a number of options to see around the island - a mini-train that does a 45 minute tour, bicycles to rent, shared bicycles and electric golf carts. We did a mini train trip, then had a bite to eat at a nearby snackbar, then rented a golf cart for an hour for about 3,900 HUF (with a cash deposit required of 10,000 HUF)..The hghlight for us, after the trip around the island, was discovering the musical dancing fountain which provided great entertainment on the hour every hour,Overall, this was a wonderful, relaxing afternoon.

Well worth the visit. A local popular attraction.. A Beautiful Park, full of family attractions in an amazing setting!. Restaurants and cafes, electric cars to hire, bicyles to hear. Run or stroll, Relax away from the city. Park set in the fork of the River, access from one of the main bridges, set down from the City Bus Tours. Make sure you give this attraction some time to enjoy all the park has to offer.
worth a visit!. we liked this island a lot and went there a couple of times. to hang out on the grass, to watch the fountain and just to chill.
great park. Wonderful place to visit - a big park with a running route and lots of lawns, flowers and benches to sit and read.

Maybe we walked the wrong way!. We had high expectations and were left very disappointed, we arrived by boat and having walked for almost an hour and only come across a not so good fountain, a jogging track all the way round the island with joggers who take no prisoners and push you to get by- there is no other path in certain areas, lots of buildings that looked like they had been evacuated and abandoned a few food stalls and people cycling we decided to move on. Maybe we missed something however on a short City Break it was not worth stopping off here.

Another must see Budapest attraction. This is a large park on an island betwen Buda and Pest . a well maintained and lush park , has a small animal "reserve" for kids (and a pony ride too) . The not so long ago renovated musical fountain is also worth seeing. i would definitely recommend a leasurely stroll throught the length of the park or hire a bicycle or one of those golf cart types.

Hire a bike and ride around. Lovely to see such a beautifulPark with so many facilities. Formal & informal gardens, sports facilties, theatre, spas, restaurants kids playgrounds.....plenty of transport available from bikes, to golf carts to help you get around.
Peace & Quiet. Wonderful for relaxation , I went there 2 executive days demanding quietens & peace. It has a place for those who needs natural mineral waters.

An Oasis in the middle of the Danube. Budapest is a beautiful, historic city, but sometimes one wants to escape the crowds, pavement and cathedrals. In August, the gardens of Margaret Island bloom brilliantly, and the fountains are resplendent. In fact, the one near the entrance off the bridge is a musical fountain, with water sprays complementing tunes composed by Strauss, the Beatles and other popular artists. What a treat, to just relax, watch and listen to the half-hour show. Margaret Island is about three miles long and also features a small zoo (mainly a deer and bird rescue sanctuary), a Japanese garden and monastic ruins. As well, there’s a sports park, restaurant and large children’s playground. Oh…and there’s no entrance fee…what a wonderful way to spend a pleasant afternoon in the middle of the day in the middle of the Danube.

A Green paradise in the middle of the city. IF You are a little tired of the noise and crowds of the city Margaret island is a welcome change. Cars can only go from the northern end Arpad Bridge, and have to park at the Grand hotel. It is easily approachable from the southern end Margaret bridge. By streetcar Nr 6 stops at the entrance. You have to go by foot from then on. One of the first things You will see is the large fountain, playing by the music.From there lovely old trees and beautifully maintained walkways, until You arrive at a gigantic garden full of flowers and comfortable benches. Around the water tower there is a fairly good restaurant, and the view from the top of the tower is very nice. There also is a small petting zoo for children, The ruins of the monastery where Princess Margaret daughter of the king lived her life..at about the 12th century. If You prefer a little more formal meal the Grand Hotel restaurant is a 5 star restaurant.

Walks or bike rides in a green scenery. Take Margit híd (Margaret Bridge) and go down to Margit-sziget (Margaret Island) for a good long walk (or bike trip) along the many parks and attractions on the island (thermal spa, restaurants, aqua park,..). The island is over 2.5 km long!Bus 26 runs the length of the island, and can bring you to Árpád híd metro station (we found it rater harder to get to the metro station on foot than it looked on the map).
boat trip. we went on a boat trip here, had an hour and a half so hired bikes to see the island. lovely food stalls and paths to walk round but not much else to see.
Romantic island walk. See the singing fountain in the evening, visit old ruines or the Palatinus bath, watertower or japanese garden, or just walk along the most beautiful sycamore alley in Europe.

Island tour. We took the Danube river trip during which we had an option to get off the Margaret Island.You can spend a couple of hours here to see the thermal spas and lovely gardens. There are different modes of transport to look around this Island. Cycles, Self pedalling rickshaws, Electric buggies or a public bus. It was a good experience.

On an Island although in center of the town. a wonderful experience being in the Center of a City with no traffic except one bus-line, you can rent a bike and discover this Little Island. as there is a bus Station you are very fast at any place in the town

UNWIND ON THE ISLAND. A lovely island to stroll around but better to rent a bike, novelty electirc car or pedal car as it's 2.5km long by 500m wide so not small. Plan your visit to coincide with the musical fountain which is brilliant, we arrived at 1155, the display started at 1200 and lasted about 15 minutes with an impressive fountain display accompanied by 4 very different songs playing, it was great fun and impressive, aqua/ musical fireworks. Face away from the sun to see better. Renting a good quality bike rental cost 690 HUF each for 30 minutes which was just enough time to cycle sedately to the end and back but allow more time for stopping (other transport cost more). The island also had a small zoo, swimming pool (not open all year), coffee shops, hotel and gardens and quiet spaces to admire the city and Danube from.

Nice park but a bit boring . Went to this park as soon as we got to Budapest. We knew it was the last sunny afternoon for a while so got in here quick! However, it was a disappointment. Although the island is undoubtably a nice park, I wouldn't call it a tourist attraction. It's just a park. With a couple of churches in it. We went to the hotel and it was a poor standard. Wouldn't recommend if you don't have much time in Budapest.

Self Guided Biking Tour. Very flat with lots of bike friendly terrain. We did a complete loop with 2 stops one for cold draft beer and another where they choreographed a fountain to music was beautiful!

Spectacular park in the city. An amazing place nestled in the heart of the city. Connected by bridge one can just find his way across the island very easily either by vehicle or a bicycle. Within the park lies a zoo and a joggers track lying parrellely to the Danube river. A very huge park where an entire day can be spent roaming and just relaxing.

Nice relaxing scenery. Nice place, stayed there a day doing various acticvities, not many peaople there in the middle of the week, but plenty to see or just a great place to sit down on the lawn and relax.
A place to dream on. So romantic, so suitable for sports and walks and kids' activities, so quiet in "the woods" that you can hear your own heat beating. And the singing and dancing fountain is wow!
Beautiful and relaxing part of the city. Beautiful island and easy to get to, not a vast amount of choice for eating but really nice place to walk or cycle around! Very relaxing and pretty scenery.
Nice place for relax time on a sunny day. Great place for a walk, a run, a pic nic and just generally relax on a sunny day in Budapest. many bike rentals if you prefer to explore this way.

My perfect saturday morning. It was the second half of a weirdly warm september when I chose to visit Margaret Island. I went there by foot (but there is also the tram line no. 4 and 6 for the laziest) and the place is a sort of green area where you can forget about buildings and their concrete, forget about cars and forget about stress. A natural place with some amusements, like the Music Fountain which perform a game of water together with music each hour. There it is possible to find also a small farm with some animals (even if they call it zoo, but the animals are not those you'd find during a safari though) or just jogging around and exercise in a big area full of trees and grass. The climate was perfect so I more than enjoyed it and I recommend the place to all those who are looking for relaxation or a natural place where to spend few hours of their time.
Boat Trip. lovely, tranquil and calm place - away from the bustle of the city. Spent a couple of pleasant hours walking around before catching the boat back to the city

Don't Miss This Part of Budapest. One of the airline staff on Etihad recommended that we visit Margaret Island as part of our 4 days in Budapest. She was absolutely right it is not to be missed.Margaret Island is in the middle of the Danube and you can walk the in 30 min from The Parliament building or you can get the 2 tram.Once on the island, there are very few cars only bikes and little golf buggies and 4 wheel peddle bike (which we selected).You can ride around in about 90 minutes allowing for stops to see the sights. The main sites are displayed on the peddle bike so you don't miss anything.The Japanese garden at the end of the island is simply superb.It is such a peaceful part of Budapest with beautiful botanical type gardens and plenty of small food outlets. Lots of local grandparents with the grandchildren enjoying the serenity of the place.There is lots of history to the island with ruins and a wonderful legend about Princess Margit and her father King Bela 1V.As I said it should be on your must do things in Budapest.
Curio. September seems to be too late for visiting this island. Weather was most beautiful but all the facilities were closed. Overhauling is definitely needed.

A must!!. We discovered this place on our last day & we absolutely loved it...spent hours there!The musical water tower is fanstic...& the japense garden is a must too! As well as other little treasures on the island too! We also found a good bar/restaurant too...champs...burgers to die for & by the river with great views! It's our favourite city to date....Only complaint the Hungarians are very rude & not very helpful! & their customer service is very poor!
The island. Here you find the dancing fountains, you can walk around or rent a bicycle car, you can eat and drink. It is peaceful and nice.

Spend some time in this park. Great for kids and couples. If the weather is comfortable and you have extra time after seeing the sites, this is a park area. Pack a lunch, relax and people watch. If you can learn about the history of this island it makes the stay more appreciative too

An oasis of calm in the city.. A tranquil getaway located in the middle of town. The island can be accessed by bus from the bridge or boat but no cars are allowed on the island. There is a little road train to take you a tour around the island or you can hire bikes or a golf buggy that looks like a small car. The musical fountain is impressive and worth waiting the half hour for if necessary. There are some small cafes and apparently a good restaurant but we didn't try it. Wrong time of day for us to eat.

Oasis of calm. Sometimes you just need to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and this place is ideal.We walked from the city centre via Margaret Bridge and at the end of the link road onto the island are the fountains. Rest you feet for a while and take in the fountains dancing to music on the hour, every hour......magical.From here you can hire bikes or like us just take a stroll round the 5.5km outer path. Ideal on a nice sunny day.

Relaxing Evening. Walking towards Margaret Island was an experience in itself. Crossing the Parliament along the Dunabe alone seemed good enough, but meeting up with friends behind the island's fountains was magical. I recognized American songs and felt at home seeing families and couples enjoy the night. Definitely a must see while spending time in Budapest
A must. Don't miss Margaret Island and its many attractions.You can spand a whole day there, especially if you go to the water park.

A haven of peace and quiet. want a short break from all the hustle and bustle ? Margaret Island is it. Place to see and be seen, huge public park. Plenty of sporting activity and work-out opportunites or just simply chill out with the squirrels

Wonderful,peaceful!. A wonderful place to relax and have a picnic!!
The fountain is great to watch like a ballet performance!!

loved it. such a loverly place - we were there in august 2015 -it was so hot. spending the day on Margaret island was like a little get away - quiet peaceful. We went to the pool complexe on the island . I loved it . I would even consider getting a n hotel on the island.

Nice island!. Choose a sunny afternoon in Budapest,
and visit this island! We got there by boat but there are also buses.
The island is beautiful! If you get there,
a bike ride is really recommended.

A great escape from the city rush. A lovely little island, a cute music fountain with cute songs.
If you end up there you should rent a bike and take a tour around the island. They have there a few cafes and one of them serves langos which is quite good for my taste (it could be sweet or salty) it is an Hungarian food :)

Beautiful island!. We were staying only 5 minutes away from the island so visited frequently during our stay. The gardens are beautiful and the musical fountain is very entertaining throughout the day. We spent a very hot day sunbathing on one of the many grass areas and there was lots of space to do so. There are a couple of restaurants/food stalls to get both lunch and dinner from and also just enjoy a drink in the evening - however these are at the Margaret bridge side of the island as there is not much to do on the far side. Lots of bikes/buggies to rent to allow you to make the most of viewing the island which is definitely a must as the walk is quite far!
Peaceful!. We spent a few hours on the island, rented a self-peddled bike for two and had a great time. Definitely a great place to chill out!
Relaxing. Great place for walking, running, picnicking, taking pictures of the Parliament building at sunset, walking dogs and kids.
Dynamic Fountain Display. It was easy to reach the fountains with their continually changing display, which was great fun to watch.

Good day out for the family . We visited the island on two separate occasions and enjoyed both days. When the weather is nice it is lovely as is a nice walk around. You can hire the little bikes or family ones which we did, they were quite cheap, we were gonna book for an hour but, only managed half as our legs were hurting. There are the little motorised carts that u can drive instead however, if you have a license. They have a mini zoo, the rose gardens, and musical fountains. We watched a lovely musical show at the fountains and really enjoyed it. I would recommend for anybody as it can be a lovely day out

Lovely change-up to cultural Budapest. This island park is well worth visiting for a bit of down time while in Budapest. The highlight for me was the orchestrated "dancing" fountain near the park entrance. My favourite tune was -- what else -- the Blue Danube Waltz. I found myself laughing aloud at the synchronized display. This is also a great place for people watching, although they are probably watching you as well, ha ha. Plenty of places to walk, a huge expanse of grass lawn in the middle for picnicking. Quite an unexpected surprise to have such a space in the middle of all of the history and culture. The locals clearly appreciate it.

Am I missing something here?. We were using up all the options on our Hop On Hop Off bus offer, which included a boat cruise up and down the Danube. It was a very hot day in Budapest so we chose to get off on Margaret Island to enjoy the trees and get a bit of shade.This is an odd place. The setting is beautiful. The trees and gardens are a welcome relief in the middle of a busy, dusty city. But, there is a depressing air of neglect and better days past across the Island. Facilities are boarded up, tennis courts are overgrown with weeds and it looks like it needs a good spruce up.There were plenty of people jogging around the perimeter or sunbathing. It was a pleasant place to stroll and sit and watch the river. But there is something kind of sad about it all as well.
Something different to do in Budapest. We rented a two person bicycle cart which was great fun. We rode through out the island stopping at the Center for ice cream.

Just rest and unwind. Take it easy and stroll down the 5 km walk in the huge park or by the danube river,watch people do sports, hire an electric mini car or a bike for 4 to 6 people for an hour or half an hour and take it easy,watch the fountain,watch the old nunnery ruins from 1200 year or so, and RELAX.Take bus 26 when you get to the end of the park to get back to the main street with trams.

Well worth a visit. This island is a large park with some gardens, sports facilities and some food outlets. The park is easily reached by crossing the nearby bridge over the Danube. The area is flat and suitable for people with limited mobility.
Good place for a walk and to relax. This is a good place to come down and walk and the sit and watch the Danube. I can't say about the food but we did grab a coffee here while we chilled for awhile.

Great way to lose an afternoon. The island is a 10 minute walk from the parliament building and can be reached on foot via a road bridge. There is a swimming park for kids, lots of grass and a good walking or running track encircling the entire island.At the bottom end nearest the access bridge there is a musical fountain, great to drink and lose an afternoon there.
Gorgeous and relaxing day out, must see. We had a lot of fun navigating the island on a 4 pedal bicycle. Beautiful parks and buildings. Musical fountains a highlight. Must do
Nice place to spend some relaxed time. A lovely place to spend a few hours. Relaxed pace, places to get an ice cream / beer / coffee. Nice fountains.
Great watermark is my highlight. Family friendly with food and drink options for everyone. Good for adults - especially the watersides and the wave pool
Beautiful island. A green oasis, perfect for walking, running or swimming in the sports centre olympic pool. A small zoo with deer, ponies, storks, and other local animals. Perfect for kids!

Beauty. I think this is an excellent place to spend a day with family or friends, or even to go for a run. This was one my favorite places in Budapest. Ideal for picnics ! You can enjoy the fountain show in the evening and I also liked the small zoo on the island. The running track on the island is the best you can ask for !

A lovely walk and lots to see. Spent half a day on Margaret Island, walking amongst the gardens, shaded pathways, and many sites, and watching the runners on the loop pass by. The musical fountain was a nice stop. A lovely walk!
Lovely tranquil place to walk. A car-free island. lots of sports facilities and a lovely fountain (more a water show with jets of water in time to tasteful music) - we loved it.
Excellent place to relax. I have visited this superb place and I admired the beautiful japanese garden and all the surroundings.

Green space between cities.. Pleasant pedestrian green space on small island on Danube River between Bude and Pest. Featuring large fountain with dancing waters to music. Very entertaining and relaxing. Motorized golf carts, electric Segway type things, bikes and peddle cars available to rent by the 1 & half hour. Kinda of expensive. Paths for these vehicles through tree lined paths. Some nice gardens. A cafe though didn't go to it.

Amazing. The most beatifull park we saw in budapest and let me say not just there!!!Maybe one of the best in europe!!! Very romantic enviroment with a lot of flowers with many colours and excursions such as biking or kayaking or having fun in the pools or drive an electrik golf car!!! Must see it!!!!

Well worth a visit. Well worth a visit. We caught the No 2 tram to the Margaret Bridge and then walked along the bridge to the road leading on to the island. However you can get get onto another tram which runs across the bridge and stops by the road onto the island. We took the little train tour round the island which was very good and the dancing fountains are not to be missed.

Lots of fun. If you find yourself nearby on a sunny day, stop by this lovely island. We walked there via the bridge, strolled down the entrance road, and rented a two person bicycle cart, with which we pedaled all over. The island features medieval ruins, lovely formal flower gardens, and a theatre, plus lots of ice cream and snack carts and at least one larger sit down place. There is a nice running path along the Danube too.

Many different things to do. Margaret (Margit) Island is largely a park in the middle of the Danube. There are hotels with thermal baths as well as a number of restaurants. Mostly, it is a place to relax for a few hours. There are many things to do including a water park, a (newly refurbished) running track on the perimeter (5 k/ 3.3 mi), a musical fountain (think of the Bellagio in L.V.), gardens, music venues, ruins, and a small zoo (not so impressive). Auto access is quite limited, but you can rent a variety of vehicles (bicycles, multi-person cycle carts, and electric golf-carts). Our kids loved the 6 person bike-carts.

Stroll and enjoy!. We his our on the island on a day in August when the temperature was nudging 40c. Plenty of shade, lots of playgrounds and refreshment stalls. Our kids enjoyed the musical fountains and in all it was a great place to find some respite from the sun!
Bicycling Fun. We rented a bike and rode along the Danube River and through Margaret’s Island. Very enjoyable and a nice break from traditional sightseeing!

Nice change of scenery. We took the City Sightseeing hop on hop off bus to Margaret Island on a Sunday morning. Needless to say it was getting crowded by the time we left around noon. Our hop on hop off gave us one hour of free bikes. So we toured around the island and saw their water park, music venue, along with the Grand Hotel. To walk around the park maybe too much. The bikes were perfect as we saw the entire island within the hour. If you need a break from the cathedrals and castles I recommend stopping by Margaret Island. Bikes are a must.

recreational place to relax from the visit. A great place to relax and rest from the hard work of walking the city streets. The beautiful musical fountain, the bycicles and the walks are just perfect.

Worth a visit. Worth a visit. You can access his island by the 29 bus which has several stops on the island or you can go by boat and stay for a few hours. There is plenty to see and do on the island,

Nice place for walking. If you have much time,good weather or you like sport thats the place where yoh can go to go jogging or running. If the weather is nasty it is anyway good place to go. Take some gluhwein and go on exploring.

Great place. Really great place to take some rest, very green with nice fountain. There is also a very nice mini zoo within the park with free admission. I would recommend to take some veacihle (you can rent them in the island) if you want to see the whole island, because it is pretty long walk from one side of the island to other.

An oasis in the city. I found this island fascinating. It is the river between Budapest and Pest. It has a running track going right round its perimeter. Ther is a sports centre and also an outdoor bathing centre (which was unfortunately closed as it was March) there is also a hotel and a theatre on the island and a children's farm. You can hire bikes or pedal carts to travel round or just enjoy the stroll. A real oasis

Jewel on the Danube. This is a wonderful attraction on the Danube in the centre of Budapest. It was very tranquil but has a happy buzz with people from all over the world savouring its beauty and cafes. We did not use the cafes as we had eaten earlier. Truly a little gem not to be missed when in this fantastic city

So much to see and do. If my daughter had been in a better mood this would have been the perfect place for her! We walked over the bridge into the island and rented one of the buggy's to tour round the island. There are plenty of places to rent these and they also have bikes and motorised vehicles to take you around. After we had dropped it back off we decided to walk the whole island to see what it had to offer. There is a small petting zoo where they house and rehabilitate animals and birds that are sick or injured. One of the prettiest areas was a huge garden surrounded by lovely bright flowers, this then leads on to the rose garden which wasn't in full bloom but still pretty. The Japanese garden was very tranquil and the fish pleased our daughter. There were a few play parks for children too. There are plenty of places to buy food and drinks on the island and you can spend a leisurely 3 hours enjoying the surroundings
Quaint!. Beautiful island based in the middle of the Danube in between Buda and Pest. We cycled around the island and took a picnic. well worth a visit.

Delightful change from pavement pounding. When the heat and sightseeing get too much, go to Margaret Island and enjoy the shade of the trees, the musical fountain (on the hour), the Japanese garden and so much more. There are plenty of bikes, buggies, etc to hire, or simply walk. Plenty of refreshment stalls for drinks, ice creams, and loads of seats dotted about everywhere. Became busy after the children had finished school for the day.
Peace and tranquility. After hectic touring around Budapest and its many places of interest it was great to unwind in the peaceful gardens after a pleasant river cruise to the island

musical water fountain. We got to the island on the hop on/off boat which was included if you bought a ticket for the bus tour. We walked up to the water fountains and took a seat just as the music started playing and the water fountains sprang into action. Spurts of water danced around to the time of around 5 different pieces of music which was played. It was really magical, not to be missed!
Kid's paradise. Basically you must be more interest in this island if you travel with children as long as this is a kids paradise at all.

Great spot for relaxation. Travelled to Margaret's Island by boat. The island is very peaceful and a great place for relaxing amongst the beautiful gardens. We also thought the musical fountain (near the Buda-side docking platform) was spectacular. The fountain pulses and dances to music on the hour from 12 noon. The island is small so it is easy to wander around all of it, but there are also lots of opportunities to hire, bikes, electric buggies, skegways etc etc there are also several swimming pools and and outdoor theatre to enjoy. Definitely worth a trip to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

Good place to spend day. Get aRiver cruise upthe danube drops you off for a couple hours.If its hot stick your feet into the jetted pool and be bathed in the mist of pulsing jets to the music.It was 30 deg when we were there and this was bliss.

Good way to spend a few hours. Spent half a day on island. 'Dancing water' fountains, sometimes with music are entertaining and relaxing. Doesn't take too long to walk around. Particularly enjoyed Japanese garden.Best when weather good,

great place for a walk. We spent 2 hours walking around the island and seeing the lovely gardens, the abbey ruins and watched the musical fountain. There are lots of options to hire bikes and a variety of other things to get you around the island. Its a 15 minute walk via the bridge from tram 2 at the southern end of the island. It took 20 minutes to walk to the metro station from the northern end of the island.

Fantastic park. The island is an incredible parkland. Full of magnificent old trees alongside new growth. A great place for all ages. Bikes to rent if you want or just stroll through the gardens. Well with a visit

Great place to spent some time. The Margaret Island is a Recreational park in the center of the Danube River. The Island is a fantastic escape from the city. the Church is situated among beautiful green trees. You can spend a few minutes in the church there.You can get bycycles for rent. You can run, swim and walk around the beautiful trees and is one of the best time to rejuvanate youreself. This attraction is part of the boat trip in the Danube river we need not have to pay seperately

Definitely recommend a visit to Margaret Island. We found this to be a great place away from the traffic of the main city. It was peaceful with plenty to see, including a lovely sanctuary for injured birds of prey.

More than a big park with babies, animals and bicycles. -You can reach margaret island from a point on Margaret bridge where the island and the bridge are linked-As a teenager, before visiting Margaret Island, all i thought of it to be was just a huge park full of children, bicycles, etc. - nothing out of the ordinary. Having explored most of it, i realized it's more than that. It's a break from the city madness, a place you can go to relax- to read a book, to go with children and both have fun, to walk your dog, to people watch. I could definitely spend 3 hours there, even doing nothing since sitting underneath a thick canopy of trees is more relaxing than I thought it would be.Check out the Japanese garden- very pretty! Rose enthusiasts, you might want to check out the rose garden, on the way to Japanese garden.There are maps and signs throughout the island to help you navigate, and if everything fails ask the people selling food, etc.- they are very willing to help out. Also, you might want to rent a bicycle or a golf cart thingy (they work like bicycles) available at the entrance if you don't have much time yet want to explore the whole island because walking around when you don't have much time in your hands can be tiring and make you miss out on the relaxing vibes of the island. I wish to come back one day, especially for sziget festival since that must be even more awesome and you can realize it the moment you step on Margaret Island since the vibes are great.

Margaret Island. Margaret Island is a very peaceful island in the Danube between Buda and Pest not far from Parliament. Cars are prohibited. There you can participate in many sports or merely stroll the island taking in the many wonderful views and sights?

Beautiful Island in the heart of City. This large island offers great walks, small zoo, beautiful flowers and plans, fountains, lakes, swimming in pools, biking, riding buggies - there is something for everybody.

Cool, shady park areas with a fountain not to be missed!. A great stop to get away from the heat and noise of the city. Bikes to rent for kids,adults, families. The fountain can't be missed--they have space for you to soak your feet in the water at the edge of the fountain as you watch the show that's set to music. We sat at the fountain with a four-year-old for over a half hour. Park area, lots of trees, we enjoyed the shade, water and breeze after August sight-seeing in the city. Hop On Hop Off and Big Bus both drop you off close by.

Fantastic afternoon out. We took one of the boat trips and headed down to Margaret island, lovely place with an amazing fountain which literally dances to the music, fairly spectacular. Plenty of places for food and drinks and you can lounge about and soak up the sun or go for a walk, there always the outdoor pools as well should the mood take you.
Retreat from the city. takes 30 minutes to walk quickly frpom end to end or a leisurely 3 hours. water fountain to music on the hour was good, 4 tunes, pop and classics.

Sunday morning on a windy island. Sunday morning adventure onto Margaret island .if you don't enjoy walking much ,you won't see much ! Use a bike or scooter or the pedallo type bikes .you are literally in the middle of the Danube ,it's rather windy. The fountain was lovely well worth a visit for that but the rest wasn't up to much .good place for all the joggers and runners !

Beautiful park and a must visit. The weather was extremely hot whilst we were there but you could get shelter in the park. It is about a 30 minute walk from Chain Bridge but it can be reached by the red metro line.Beautiful park where you can hire bicycles or electric cars by the hour. You could easily spend a day here with the family.

Musical Fountain - a must visit. The island is the only one in the Danube in Budapest so you can't miss it. Accessed via a spur from the Margaret Bridge. not far from the Parliament building. The spur leads you directly to the fountain, which on the hour from 1200 to 2100 I believe, is choreographed to music for 15 minutes. Sounds simple but it really is wonderful to see. Music played ranges from classical to pop/rock including The Beatles, Simon & Garfunkel and Dire Straits. There is a rotation of 4 set lists and at 2100 the fountain plays for an hour, all 4 set lists being run back to back, combined with a light show. This really is something everyone visiting Budapest should see Did not visit the rest of the island but it looks to be a pleasant green oasis, various cycles and 4/5 seaters available for hire beside the fountain.

Offers something different. Even though Margaret Island isn't one of the most common attractions amongst tourists its definitely somewhere worth the visit. There are some nice cafes situated on the island and it is easily accessible by bus with a short walk over the bridge from the bus stop. On our visit we hired a five person bike for one hour which made for some of the funniest moments of our trip to Budapest, its a great place to cycle round and there are lots of motorised or pedal power vehicles to hire at different points around the island. If you are in a larger group and want a bike that offers more than 3 seats you may find yourselves waiting as it can get quite busy but it is definitely worth the wait to do something different on your visit!

Green heart of Budapest. Cool place for chill out especially in hot summer days. You can either walk around, rent a bike or use the bus no.26 which will take you through the island. There are lots of restaurants, hotels and swimming pools here, so basically possible to hang around the whole day. Place is also great for jogging. Must visit if you in Budapest.

Too much to do. We went to the Baths. They had several huge pools of all different temps from 28 to 38 degrees. Lots of people but plenty of space, it did not feel crowded (on one of the busiest days of the year) just big. Slides, wave pool, excellent fresh waffles, and more. You don't need a cabin just a locker. The Island is a nice park and biking around it was perfect.
Good evening walk. It's a fantastic place to relax and have an evening walk. If you take the boat ride on the Danube, they will stop here and you may take a walk around the island

Peaceful oasis during 38 degrees. Can walk there, but if hot totally recommend taking public transit tram which will drop you off right at the entrance.Lovely fountain, restaurants, musical fountain, shades and trees.Walk north to the Japanese Garden, rent a pedal bike. Caution: bikes are not comfortable, but silly and fun, and inexpensive. Recommend half hour rental only.

Relaxing on a hot day. Wide island with a lot of attractions. In the middle, there's a big fountain, with an interesting water show. Perfect for relaxing on a hot day. (You can cool your feet down there)

Musical Fountain. Despite not being the most obvious tourist attraction to leap out when one thinks of Budapest, the island in the Danube is certainly not something to miss. My partner and I visited the island three times for the musical fountain, and the gardens immediately adjacent. Having looked at the map here on TripAdvisor afterwards, I am left wishing that we had decided to explore the entire island, rather than just the southern tip!We actually discovered the island completely by accident whilst walking over the yellow bridge looking for something to do for an hour before we ate dinner. We wandered over to the fountain, wondering what the crowd was there for. At about 18:10 nothing was happening, so we decided to leave it and move on. No sooner had we stood up, than the previously off fountain suddenly burst into life to the theme of "Pretty Woman". It begins with a 30 minute setlist at 11:00, with a further 20 minutes on the hour every hour until 21:00, where it plays the four 20 minute setlists consecutively as a lit-up show in the dark. After dinner, we came back for the lit-up show, and it was definitely worth the walk. The highlight for the both of us was Vivaldi's "Four Seasons", though Dire Straits' "Money for Nothing" was also definitely a memorable one. Like I said, it's not an attraction that immediately springs to mind, but you will not regret it if you decide to go - and you should.
A lovely day out. We hired bikes and cycled around the island, then sat back and enjoyed the dancing fountain. You could easily fill a day here.

Loved it . We loved it here. While we were in Budapest it was 36 everyday. We took a walk down the the park. And came across this huge fountain that we were able to dip our feet in. We also timed it so well as when we arrived music started to play & they did a show with the fountain to the music it was amazing

Visit the fountain for a music and light show!. I'd definitely recommend a visit to the fountain light and music show in Margaret Island as it's amazing and full of people around. It's at 6pm and 9pm every evening - get there a little earlier to get a good seating spot. The music is an eclectic mix of classical and pop but it really is a lot of fun.

A Pearl In The Danube. This island located in in the middle of the Danube river is a peaceful hideaway from the hectic downtown of Budapest city.During my stay in the city i spent an hour every evening strolling its large green areas,flowery gardens,old trees with lots of entertainment, if you care for a diversion.It has attractions for every one from romantic walks,medieval ruins,a rather smallish zoo,a lovely melodious fountain,water tower & park,clubs & open air theater.Enjoy its peace & serenity in an old historical city with its turbulent past !
Beautiful. Just beautiful to walk around on a lazy afternoon. Must visit the fountains as on the hour fountains are set to music. Well worth a visit
Great fun. Worth going just to see the dancing fountain display but we really enjoyed haring about on the pedal cars you can hire to tour the island
The island. Fabulous visit. Walk across the Margaret bridge to the island. Hire a little buggy for an hr and enjoy visiting the sites. Really fun day

Nice and peaceful place to spend a day. The island is really nice place to spend a day, to take a picnic, walk around or to rent a bike. There is also a very nice waterpark but if you are travelling with small children they must be atleast 125 cm / shoulder length to get to the slides.

A nice break from the hustle and bustle of Budapest. We love to stroll through Margitsziget [Margaret Island] when we visit Budapest. It’s relaxing and FUN…a nice break from the hustle and bustle of Budapest. This island is in the middle of the Danube River. To get there, we always walk across the Margit Bridge at the south end of the island, and take the walkway down to the island. On the way home, after exploring the island on foot, we go up onto the Arpad Bridge at the north end and walk across to Pest to our apartment. We’ve also rented a bringo cart, which is a fun way to bike through the island.While on the island, we like to visit the zoo, the Japanese Gardens, the Musical Fountain, the swimming pool, the ruins of the Franciscan Priory, the Water Tower, and the various gardens. The old casino is worth a look for a snap-shot in history. My husband is also a regular runner around the island. On summer weekends, residents of Budapest flock here…so go early to avoid the crowds. Or, visit on a Tuesday morning, when crowds are more likely to be thin.

Peace & Relaxation in the city!. A wonderful peaceful place to while away the hours. An almost traffic free island makes this an ideal escape from the bustle of the city. Take the tram to Margaret Bridge then walk down onto the island. Marvel at the musical water fountain then wander around, grab a snack (much cheaper than in tourist locations) and choose a place to relax. If you're feeling energetic hire a bicycle to see the whole island or rent a battery operated golf buggy if you can't pedal for an hour! Don't miss the views from the tower, the ancient ruins or the gorgeous scented rose gardens!

Great for something to do outside.. We didn't really explore too much of the island, however, it was very easy to walk to. There's probably a ton more to do here and when I return to Budapest, I would go back.

Fantastic place away from the hustle and bustle. Absolutely beautiful park with a few cafes and places to eat - really relaxing and it feels like you are miles away from the city even though it's really minutes, very highly recommended.

Great for a bike ride. Visited Margaret Island on a scorcher of a day. Lovely scenery on the island itself as well as fab views over the Buda and Pest sides of the Danube. We hired bikes for a few hours and rode around the island which was a good way to explore for not too much money. Check out the musical fountain!

An afternoon delight. We stayed in an apartment on the river where we could see people enjoying the island. Take a long walk on a sunny day or go there for a run, a picnic, or meditation. The tram stops on the bridge right at the entry to the park. It's free!

Time out from sightseeing. Pleasant afternoon spent on this island - the youngsters cycles round the island while we took the open bus (which was a long time setting out). There's a beautiful fountain that thinks it's a firework display - the various water spouts 'dance' to various pieces of music.
We spent time at the Palatino swimming baths which were fun.

Great Place. The musical fountain is well worth seeing. Lots of ways to get about, even if, like me, you can't walk very well. You can hire an electric car or a push bike. You can also take the mini train.
Oasis minutes from the city. We had a great time cycling around Margaret Island.It is a little oasis away from the busy city. The music fountain and Japanese gardens were delightful.

A lovely place to wander around. We arrived by boat as part of our "Giraffe bus tour." It was great for a wander and we enjoyed the different gardens. We couldn't see any animals at the mini zoo, but could definitely smell them! Make sure you go to the toilet before you go as all the public toilets were charging a fee.

Lovely little island. Came here on our last day and so glad we did. We hired a bicycle which was a great idea as the island is bigger than it looks, was only cheap to hire the bicycle for a couple of hours. they have a little zoo on the island which was nice, and lovely gardens and flowers and then a huge water fountain. Lovely little place to go on our last day :)
Rent the group bicycle!. A pleasant tour around the island allows a couple of hours away from the hustle of Budapest. Walk, jog, bike, picnic, and there is even a waterpark in the warmer months.

A shelter from the summer heat.. There is lost to do on the island. From swimming in the lovely swimming pool with slides for the more adventurous. We sat with our feet in the musical fountain and enjoyed the spray on our faces and watched the world go past on a sweltering August afternoon. The food was good too and available from the verious food stalls. A good day out.

Air in the city. A great place to relax in the hot weather, bus goes directly onto the island but can be crowded or tram will drop you near the main entrance.Whether you relax and watch the fountain show, which is fabulous at night, or ride the cycles that are for hire or just wander round and sunbathe the place will do you good!

Perfect island. Perfect little island in the middle of the danube, its a very popular place to visit, relax, watch the world go by and just stop for a minute, night time musical illuminations / fountains at the weekend.
Good wander. Perfect for a picnic, or filling your time with a lazy stroll through the park. There's a brilliant running track around the whole island as well, which lots of locals use.

A must see in Budapest, beautiful.. We visited the island during our three day visit to the lovely city of Budapest, it a fantastic few hours relaxation a lovely park. The island lies in the middle of the Danube and you walk on to it by a slip road off the bridge. You can hire bikes, electric cars or just stroll about, we walked a bit and hired an electric car, it was great fun and perfect to drive around and see everything, very reasonable too for an hours entertainment. The fountain has a great music show and worth waiting to see, it seems to go every 20 mins or so, there is also a very nice Japanese garden at the end of the island. Set aside a few hours for this perfect distraction of the hustle and bustle of the city.
For a sunny day. Do visit it if the weather is nice.Take a bike and take a tour of the island. Great view, get in touch with nature, while being in town.

great place to spend your day. just great! we hired a little car to get around and take a look at the place. there is a great fountain at the entrance. we also had fun at the water park that there is on the island.

Run Around Like a Local!. On a Sunny Sunday morning, we took off for Margaret Island and ran two laps around on the new spongy trail around the island. In the middle, we stopped at an exercise part and played with the contraptions, then kept on going. At one point, we heard Scottish bagpipes and saw a local gymnastic dance team practicing in the ancient Roman Ruins. Very multicultural! ONE NOTE: Take a few notes for the bathroom, but keep the receipt as it's good for all restrooms on the island and also any member of the family.
Lovely and tranquil. Spent two hours here, you can stay all day, very peaceful, lovely, places to eat, fountains a zoo, Japanese garden, water tower, fabulous!

Must visit this island. A small paradise in the city.Full of trees and flowers. A musical fontain is worth visiting.Since the island is about 2,5 km long, it is better for the first time to see it with a small train which costs 900 Hungarian Fiorints per person and does the round of the island in about 1 hour.

Fun for the entire family. So much to do. We rented a 4 person buggy/bike to travel around the island. There are baths, pools, gardens, cafes, a zoo, roman ruins, a singing fountain..... etc. The day we went, everyone was blowing bubbles! The gardens were in bloom and lovely. What a wonderful place to spend quality family time enjoying each other and nature.

Take the Boat Tour, Get off on the Island. Cheap bike rentals. A quick jaunt around the island via wheels provides you with everything you need to see. Dancing fountains (not Bellagio, but they're trying!), convent ruins, beautiful gardens, tons of statues and a sad zoo full of native Hungarian animals. Grab an ice cream while waiting for the boat to return. Pretty spot with free wifi by the bike rental.

Nice stroll. Take a stroll along this island. It's located in the middle of the Danube. The stroll is approximately 5 km. Many families recreates here. Also the island houses the city's athletic stadium for swimming. Some nice hotels are located here as well and a mini zoo.

Great Place. This is a great place to visit with lovely gardens, an impressive fountain which bursts into life every 30 minutes, a popular water park and also a musical fountain, which was a bit underwhelming, but produces nice cool drinking water. Reached via the Margaret bridge, there is a No 25 bus service which does a loop of the island, which is 2.5 km long and 500m wide. Very nice place for a picnic and enjoying the gardens and greenery.
Nice pool and area. A nice place with the kids as the island is home of a large park and a public pool. In summer it is also where is the largest music festival.

Nothing special. Came here after visiting the Castle District. Nothing too special here, unfortunately. You can probably skip it. I'm quite amazed at how many Hungarians take running very seriously - there were so many of them running on the jogging tracks at 6.20PM!
garden island. Very wide and beautiful park island in the middle of budapest with different gardens flower Japanese and more also food and drinks as well

Well worth a visit. we visited Budapest in 2013 and wanted to go on Margaret Island but so much to do ran out of time, but this time we made time and it was well worth it we walked looking at the sites a distance from the Intercontinental hotel. You descend onto the island and the peace descends on you your 1st view forward is the fountain that dances some of the time to music. We were short on time but wanted to see the island so opted for a 1/2 hour road train tour of the island, there were other ways to go Cycle hire with varying styles of bike from single, tandem, and family style 4 wheel bikes, 4 wheel covered racing looking styles just for the kids, Segways, Motor stand up scooters and Golf buggies that you can hire in the style of an old car. As i said we opted for the road train and saw all the sites, The Monastery, Kids Zoo, Swimming pool outdoor japanese and conventional gardens Yes well worth a visit give it more time and take you swimwear.

For a relaxing day-out. It´s a chilling place for family, frends and couples. cycling is must there .. you can have a picnic in the open fields, enjoy reading or listening to music .. Nice atmosphere for you to have a chilling afternoon

Great island, easy to get too!. The island has everything in a short distance! Water park, restaurants, a zoo, bars, bike rentals, etcThe island is a great visit and I also recommend visiting the BUDAPEST sign on the island To get to the island, we purchased a boat from one of the all day bus tours which take you around Budapest on the bus and then drop you off at the river where you board the boat to Maggie island :)

Place to chill out away from the crowds.. Lovely big Island covered in trees which were a blessing when the hot sun came out,you can hire an electric car to get around the Island on or a peedle car,only a couple of restaurants to choose from. The fountain has intervasl of music which the fountain spurts are in time with the music,excellent display.There also is a huge water park there if you wish to cool down.

Not to be missed.. If not for the fact that we had some time before dinner to spare, I doubt if we would have made a trip to this island in the middle of the Danube, as other 'must-see' sights took higher priority on our list of things to do and see in Budapest! As it turned out, it was one of the highlights of our stay in Budapest! This island is probably the most popular public city park in the city. Once there, you forget that you ARE in a city. It is very picturesque and serene with loads to see and do. It is so easy to spend half a day or more here. We chose to sit for an hour or so dipping our feet in the refreshingly cool water of the fountain with the locals while waiting for the next musical show of the fountain (complete with lights) to start. The show commences at the start of every hour. There are places to eat here ranging from cheap to expensive and free spring water from taps.The island is 2.5 km long and about 0.5 km wide so if you don't feel like exploring it on foot, you can take the frequent Bus 26 (payable or free if you already have a valid public transport pass) and get off at the various stops on the island to do the exploring. We liked it so much that we spent more than 3 hours here (dinner was forgotten!), just getting away from the heat of the day.To get here from the city center, take Trams 4 or 6 and get down at the stop which is on Margaret Bridge itself (there is only one stop on the bridge, roughly in the middle). From here, walk down to the island. The area is popular among sports enthusiasts as well and in the evenings, many locals come here to jog or cycle or swim.
margaret island by pedal buggy. Fun - hired a pedal buggy, which meant we could enjoy the beautiful island more comfortably in the heat.

A piece of Paradise. Margaret Island is a heavenly place. We would visit it over and over again. Large green parks, lots of colourful flowers, a tiny zoo with deers, hens and hawks, street food and coffee, a big fountain whose water dances along with the music and some pool (which I think is public). We rent bikes but there are also electric golf cars.

Awesome. I was in Green Island Hostel wich is in this island and I loved it cause there`s some pubs, there`s a fountain that is syncronised with the music they play in every hour (like, 8, 9, 10, 11 pm). Simply awesome.
beautiful Island. this is beautiful well cared for island that attracts alot of joggers walkers cyclists alike. Pay for parking though is a draw back and lack of decent eateries
Sunny Sunday on Margaret Island. Island was full of all kind happenings. Very comfortable way to spend a sunny Sunday. Location of the Island is very good.

Beautiful green gardens. I visited the island with my boyfriend in a bit of rush so we rented one of those bringo carts to see more of the island. The carts were really fun and you can see most of the island by cycling them. We stopped for a few spots that were inaccessible (like the ruins, or the Japanese garden). We fed the ducks and fish in the Japanese garden (they have a machine that gives you special food for a really cheap price - 100 HUF). The gardens are well tended and the place is beautiful for a walk/ cycling tour. You can also jog here, as they have a special jogging track.We've only spent some time around 2 hours on this island but it would have been nice if we had more time. I would recommend this place if you are a fan of parks, jogging or cycling.

Relaxing place.. Worth a visit especially to see the fountain. This water feature does displays to music. Great to watch. There is also a little dance floor where people where enjoying an afternoon boogie to the music! The island is like a massive park. Cafes and bars. Grass and tree areas to sit and people watch.Was very busy on a Sunday afternoon.

Relaxing, beautiful and fun. We caught a boat to the island from Pest, which was quick and easy to do. Once on the island we had a great time! It has everything you need for a fun day out - we hired bikes to ride around, soaking up the many sights. The food from the kiosks is really tasty and traditional - I can recommend the Hun dog. There's also a hotel, theatre, casino, outdoor swimming pool, convent ruins, a running track.. The list is endless. Something for everyone!

Very relaxing and beautiful scenery. We visited here after seeing the pictures and decided it would be a nice place to spend a hungover afternoon after sampling the wine bars!It was easy to get to - we took the metro and then a bus. We found it a great place to wander around and admire the view but we also had a lot of fun renting a pedal cart and cycling around the roads.If you're after a peaceful afternoon then this place is perfect!

Relaxing. Margitsziget offers so many options for spending a day! From multiple terraces, to lying on the grass, jogging, walking around the park - everything sounds like the beginning of a beautiful day and lots of memories

Relax and enjoy the nature. We took a Hop on Hop off boat tour and made a stop at the Margaret Island. Our visit was in August and therefore it was very hot, but the island is a perfect oasis, a place where you can relax and cool down while enjoying the nature or one of the many attractions (monuments, bars and cafes, sports fields and pools...). We stayed for one hour, but I would recommend spending at least 2-3 hours there. You can get there by boat, but there is also a bridge so it's easy to get to the Island. We walked and it was nice, full of trees, but we didn't manage to see the whole island in an hour (it is 2.5 km long) but there is a possibility to rent a bike and that is something I will definitely do the next time I'm visiting the Margaret Island. If you have time don't miss Margitsziget. Relax, enjoy and recharge your batteries to continue sightseeing.

Relax and cool off in the summer. This island is situated in the center of the river, passing through Budapest. It is in a very central location and can be approached from the bridge after the chain bridge. You can take the tram to reach it as there is a tram stop near the bridge. Once on the bridge, you can walk down to the entrance of the park. once there, you have a choice to walk through, take a bus, which goes through the park and has various stops, or take a cycle on rent to go through the place We decided to take the bus and use it as a hop on-hop off. Just be careful you get off on the last stop, as the bus will go through at the other end. The park has some nice restaurants and snack places, water park, vista points, historic buildings, musical fountain, a mini zoo, japanese garden etc. Primarily look at it as a place to relax. On the way back you can take the bus going out again in either direction.

Church review. The tour guide was a bit rushed but it was hot and I think the heat got to everyone. The amount of people visiting didn't ruin our time there and would if been good to have time for cold drinks or ices.

Heaven in the city.
