Al beautiful 2.5 km long park with a wonderful vegetation thoroughly enjoyable in a hot summer day.Perfectly kept even on a Sunday not crowded with lovely fountainwith jumping water that send the spray 20 meters high.Small zoo gombe seen from outside,ruins going back to the13 century where princess Margaret was educated and died....A water complex that can be enjoyed with more than six enormous pools, toilets at reasonable walking distances ( cost 0,70 euros butsimple and very clean)Take the round tour with the trailer from the end where the hotels are,after walking the 2.5 kms from the Margit BridgeYou will appreciate thing you did not see for the island is 400 mtrswide.Visited the island 55 years ago. There was one hotel only.They have 2 now.Stay on the Pest side and if you stay more than 3 or 4 daysIn Budspest give yourself a treat Enjoy as we did

Next time we will visit. We didn't have time to wisit the island, but we saw it from the boat and I looked very nice. You can rent a bycicle or just take a walk. You can enter from the bridge or from the boat.

A Must-Do ,Free-Fun Interlude, When In Budapest. I've been a local for over a decade and never tire of a trip here. You can stroll the attractive park for free and enjoy the fountain, flora and fauna. Or take a tram-ride thru it, or enjoy a soak or swim. You can spend two hours or the better part of the day depending on your pleasure. The far end ( past the medieval convent ruins, the zoo and the famous water tower) is usually less crowded.

Stay on the boat unless you want to enjoy the park!. This was our only little disappointment out of a 5* Budapest experience. It's pretty, but the hotels were a little aloof (we really wanted to lunch at the lovely Grand hotel! But they didn't acknowledge us so we moved on!)

Escape the heat. It was a very hot day in BudaPest when we decided to take a boat to the island. It was at least ten degrees cooler here.Fountains, old churches, ruins and a water park will keep your attention. There are a couple of nice restauants as well.We spent three hours walking around the island and felt like w had played hooky on the heat.
Nice place to relax and spend an hour or two.. Favorite spot in Budapest for the locals and the tourist alike. Weekends are too crowded. Better during the week.
Relaxing. Take a nice stroll in the shades of the trees and don't forget to put your feet in the musical fountain!

Fountain of Fantasy a delight.. We walked across to the Island -although you can take a tram. There is a little train/bus which can drive you around the perimeter (takes 25 mins) . The musical fountain near the entrance plays different tunes and the many water spouts throw up the water in time to the music.We stayed to watch it far longer than we intended. If you are a walker this is the most delightful parkland to stroll through. There is also a natural heated baths (almost like a water theme park) - very enticing.

Fun Half Day in the Park!. Take a break from sightseeing and head over to Margaret Island. We spent a fun afternoon on the island renting a pedal car, listening to the dancing water fountain and having lunch and a beer. This was a nice way to relax and recharge with the locals.

Lets go !. So we walked onto the island having caught the tram from fovam ter. We sat by the fountains for a while and then decided to rent some electric scooters. It was great. 400HUF for 30 mins of family fun zooming Round the island keeping cool and seeing the sights. I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to see the sights but doesn't want to spend hours walking in the very hot sun. Great value and great fun for all the family.
Oasis of shade and tranquillity. A nice way to escape the heat. Get some ice cream, sit in the grass or on a bench and enjoy the fountain that gives a free show with supporting music every hour.

Relaxing day.. Margaret Island is wonderful to travel around either by bike or by golf buggy. It is like a large park with a lot to take in, with the highlight being the fountain which is choreographed to music.

Chilled out. If you are visiting Budapest for a week I advise you to visit Margaret island as it is an amazing place to go and chill out, hire bikes cycle around the island or even go for a swim! It is a lovely island with a running track around it

plenty to do. We thought the island was like a very attractive park. Gardens (there was a zoo but we didn't visit it) bike hire - the large ones that take about 6 people- lovely dancing fountains good places to eat. We visited by boat as part of the Hop on Hop Off Bus Tour which was excellent value for money

A whole day out!. We couldn't believe how much there was to see and do on this beautiful island. The highlights for us were the Japanese gardens, the zoo and cycling around on fun bikes. The water park looked amazing.We got there by boat on the Danube.

Fabulous. We spent 1 and 1/2 days here in the week we were in Budapest. The fountain which displays to music is good to watch. The pedal cars are worth hiring but a bit hard on the leg muscles. Very pretty gardens to walk around while having a cool drink. The water park is well worth a visit also and very cheap.
Perfect running spot in the city. I'm training for a marathon and ran 7 miles here. Beautiful island and perfect getaway from the crowds. A nice oasis in the city.

Take time to chill from sightseeing.. Take the number 4 tram or a short walk from the Parliament.It is worth hiring a pedelo or electric car first to get a feel of the space and history.What a surprise to find this haven of green quiet on the Danube and so near to the city bustle.Then enjoy the spa, swimming pools and aqua park....beautiful.They even hire kit and towels if you have forgotten yours.

nature in the middle of a city. The island is a great idea whether you want to take a walk in a green area or a park, sit down, relax, sunbathe, swim, run, see a mini-zoo, or even if you want to go to a party in an open-air place.I personally prefer it for romantic dates and hours-long friendly chats too. :) Bars and restaurants will provide you with food and drinks if you're in need, but if you decide to just walk around it's fine too. Be sure to check out the ruins of a church and monastery, the music-playing fountain, and the pond at the northern end of the island. Or, if you're up to it, play some ball game on the fields, it's very popular. The other funny possibility is to rent a bike-car (or whatever its name is) or a golf-car and drive around in those.

Nice recreational spot filled with life. We actually lived at one of the two hotels located on the Island and we had quite a few walks on the Island. It was a very hot august, so we probably would have enjoyed walking on the parks even more, if it wasn't so hot! But I'd say it's worth a visit, especially if you live on a bustling street and need to get a breather and relax in some green environment.

Don't miss it!. I cannot say enough about this gem of an island. It is absolutely gorgeous and is so big that even during peak tourist season you'll have peace and quiet. There are shade trees which kept he temperature down. You can rent bikes, scooters, and electric cars to tour the island. We went to the kids' pool, which cost 7100 HUF for a family of 4. It was a great afternoon.
wedding party. Lovely place, thunder , lightning , torrential rain did not mpen the spirits.goodbars, good food . At night the fountain was lit music played in sync . Good finale to a good day .
Great place to walk. The Island worth a half day walk, visit all the beauty of the place. You can visit nice ruins, great fountain or you can just simply jog there
Amazing!. Fantastic place for nature lovers and people who want to get away from the city. A lot of places to sit and enjoy the area. Many "food trucks" with different types of food.
must go!!. Wonderful place to spend the whole afternoon! we rented a bike and had a lot of fun around the island!! this is a must go!

An Oasis of Calm !. There is a great and very popular running trail around Margit Park and it was my intention to run it. Due to a nasty lurgy, I was unable to run - but thoroughly enjoyed walking around the island and getting away from the bustle of Budapest for a morning.

Nice break. Stayed 4 days in Pest and 4 in Buda. The shade, water features and park were a nice respite from the 90-plus degree heat and a good place for those who, like my wife and me, enjoy hiking. We strolled the length of the island. Just watch out for bicyclists and joggers who share the paths and walkways. BTW, the island is accessible directly from the Margrit bridge (side opposite the Parliment building).

Gorgeous fountain!. Music plays, and the fountains dance! Lovely to take time to just chill & watch in the shade out of the heat. Not a lot to do but very relaxing & if you like walking in a park with pretty flower beds to see then spend an hour or 2 here

Not really for tourists. We really didn't enjoy this park. It's great the city has a great big park for the locals to jog around etc, but I really wouldn't waste my time visiting this park as a tourist.

😍😀😀. Spent a very hot day here as it was too hot in city centre. The park is lovely with plenty of shady trees and an impressive fountain, where you can dip your feet in to cool off, and which plays music on the hour, and lights too. There is a sports centre, bike hire, a huge outdoor swimming pool and mini zoo where children can have horse rides. The outdoor theatre has a varied programme of shows which look good ( we didn't have time to go to that). It was so good we returned on our last day for another walk round the island and cool our feet in the fountain.

Cool off on a Hot Day. We headed over here on a scorching hot day. The fountain show was in full swing and very entertaining. We had hot dogs and fries at a sensible price. We then went to the nearby swimming pools which were fantastic. Could have spent much more time here.

Awesome. I am from Prague and Budapest look simular but i still love Prague more but this Island envy from deep of my heart. It is totaly island of relax and freedom. You can walk in park, swim (in pool or Dunaj if you want to) or just sit and put your legs into fontane and be impress of fontane. It is goooooooooooood

A lovely afternoon in the park.. We went to the island on a warm afternoon. We stopped by the big fountain where lots of people were sitting round. We were there for around 5 minutes when suddenly the fountain began a choreographed routine to a mix of classical and modern songs that was truly spectacular! What a lovely surprise! The island itself was massive with loads of places to sit. It had a number of water fountains as well as stalls/cafes to buy food/drink. Really enjoyed our chilled afternoon here.

The island that everyone wants!. This is a fabulous place, where nature is respected and and cured sovereign. Admire beautiful parks that inspire relaxation and sports: running and cycling all. Truly a place that you would like in every city!

9 p.m. show. Went to check out the island with my girlfriend at 8.30 p.m. Sat down next to the big fountain. Suddenly, at 9pm sharp classical music started blasting from the speakers around the park and the fountain started to operate in sync with the music. It was magical and went on for a full hour alternating with classical music and contemporary pop, all the while putting on a spectacular water/light show.

😍😍😍. Spent an entire day here with my partner on an extremely warm day. Ot has everything! Lots of sport facilities, water park, japanese garden, space to lay on grass and an amazing fountain where you can dip your feet and watch the show unfold! If your wanting a relaxing day out in Budapest... Head here!

Stunning Budapest. This was great. We had a free cruise as part of our Vienna Pass. It was a very hot day so we cooled our feet in the fountain. We also hired a pedal car/bike and had a good look around the island. A pleasant botanical sanctuary.

Take a break in Margaret Island. The island is huge and accessible by foot or by bus. The gardens are beautiful, full of flowers, fountains and paths. When you enter the island, you'll find a lot of nice bars and restaurant, with prices that are not high.

Unwind. A nice place for relaxing, wondering around the park.. reading a book, stretching under the sun, renting a bike.
You can easily spend hours here doing nothing surrounded by tranquility.
Could watch the water fountains all day.. Pleasant boat trip to island though a bit frantic to get on and get seats. Lovely contrast to city bustle and lots of magical fountains to see.

If you run, you need to run here!!. We were looking for a place to run while in Budapest. Hearing about Margaret Island, we decided to check it out. There is an amazing rubber track that goes around the entire island. 5.5km of perfect running. Great views, water fountains, lots of other runners each morning. This was such a great experience. I am very jealous and don't know why more cities don't do something like this!
Relax in the sun. If your in Budapest with your kids and long for some fun and a time out from the city then you should visit Palatinus bath.

Lovely green space close to the city centre. Margaret Island can be reached on foot or by tram - not by boat! Very pretty park with plenty of seating, fountains, places to eat etc. There is a little road train (5€) or you can hire bikes to get around if you don't fancy walking. Definitely worth a couple of hours quiet r and r.

The Fountain. Don't miss the fountain as you come onto the island to the right of the road. Obviously computer operated the jets create the most complex of patterns, I visited in during the day and sat happily for a long time watching it. Probably even more exciting at night when it is lit.

BRILLIANT PLACE TO VISIT. We walked to Margaret Island so by the time we got there we were hot and sweaty. But what a lovely place to relax and cool down. We wandered for hours enjoying all the gardens etc., There is so much to see here, definately worth a visit.

Great park!. Great activity for a nice day. Luckily the musical fountain was playing when we arrived as we did not hear it again - check times if you really want to see this. Rented w 4-person bike although we did see 4 people on the 2-people bike as there is a front seat. You can easily walk around the island too, rent a golf cart or rent motorized scooters. There are some restaurants and also a water park

Margaret Island. A lovely oasis in the middle of the Danube River. Lovely Japanese Garden for taking a break on your walk around the island. Rent a tandem bike and have some fun exploring. Grab a gelato and sit on a bench overlooking the Danube River as the boats pass by.

Beautiful, relaxing place. It's an island on the Danube, it has parks and a lot of activities to do, electric bikes to rent and a great musical fountain with a great coregraphy!A place of relax in the busy city.

A quiet little haven in the bustle of Budapest. . Spent an afternoon here. It's a lovely place. A little run down but well worth visiting. The spa pools and swimming facilities are lovely and extensive. You can walk the little island in a couple of hours or you can hire a large range of bikes, trikes and golf buggies. (MAKE SURE YOU HAVE DRIVING LICENCE FOR BUGGIES!)Lovely fountains and a lot of places to eat. A train ride around the island is a great way to learn about the island. All in all a good day/afternoon out. Interesting history. GO. ENJOY

Holiday Oasis in the City. Margitsziget (Margaret Island) is a fantastic island oasis in the middle of Budapest. There is something here for everyone. Relaxing spa hotels, running track around the island, electric cars and pedal bikes to rent, lots of green open spaces, restaurant, concert venue and the swimming pool complex.

Nice park. Access through the bridge or by boat. Enjoy this little park out of the city - yet within the city. A great place to relax and enjoy the beautiful garden and park. We didn't really spend much time here but notice that lots of recreational activities and would be a great place for picnic.

One of the jewels of Budapest!. Absolutely, positively my favorite place in Hungary! It has several hotels and two premier swimming/bathing places. (One is for serious swimmers, the other, called Palatinus, is for families and it is a super place. Many other attractions on the Island!
Relaxing place. Really peaceful place, totally worth it if you want to enjoy some nature. We went by bike, fun to ride the bike around the island!

Nice Park. Easy to access from the bridge over the Danube and you immediately notice the reduction in noises. There is a running track that goes around the island that seems very safe and is made to absorb some of the impact as your feet hit the floor. There are a variety of activities - very small zoo, play area, swimming pool, musical fountain (on the hour) and various modes of transport that you can hire to travel around this small island. There is also an area of flower beds which was very colourful and well tended. Greta place to picnic with children or just to go for a couple of hours walk.

Enjoyed. This was a fun last day of our trip. A great way to unwind at the end of five full and busy days. We rented a four person pedal bike for an hour and sat by the musical fountain. The kids were happy!

Margaret Island. We used a boat to get to the island, we had 2 hours for exploring until the boat came back, but you can stay for 4 hours if you like. The island is a huge park with lots of beautiful flower beds and trees, if you are not full of energy you can rent a bicycle and cycle around. There is a mini zoo in it with beautiful animals and the entry is free, you also can have a drink there and rest for a while and then carry on exploring the island.We had a great time!!!

Beautiful, quiet place.. The best way to get into Margaret Island is by taking bus 26 to the center of the park and then taking about an hour to wander through the park. It is quiet, serene and safe. We did have a hard time finding restrooms ... and the restaurant was closed in December.

A small paradise in Budapest. Margaret Island is like a huge park in the centre of a big city.Visited the place and we were very happy for our choice.Entering the Island from the bridge you can see in your left side a sporting club/activities that you can do any sport you like.Then you will find a roundabout that close by you can rent a bicycle or a small battery car in order to explore the island.For sure you need to spend few minutes in the fountain across the roundabout. Many people siting/relaxing watching the water of the fountain that dancing with the music.Recommended to rent a bicycle and go in the island and discover the beauties of it. Full of green and tries. You can relax and clean your mind. In the Island you can also enjoy the Palatinus water park.

Nice park . A lovely place to spend a few hours relaxing. There were places to get food and snacks, a very small zoo area, lots of green areas to sunbathe or relax. We hired an electric car for an hour which was fun or you could hire peddle ones. Only downside there seemed to be a lack of toilets as the only public ones we came across were closed so we went in a hotel to use them but there may have been more that we didn't come across. Take a towel to lie on and go for a relaxed and cheap/free afternoon.
Wonderful. It's a miracle, there is an island in the middle of the city. There is even musical fountation too, which is an unforgettable experience.
Weist of time. Just don't go if you are staying for a few days in Budapest, because this Island don't have anything but trainers.

Lovely place to visit. We visited the island twice during our stay as it was lovely. There is a flower garden, fountains, ruins, a mini zoo, spa and cafes among other things there really is a lot to see and do there.You can rent a bike which we did to get around the island this makes it much easier as it is much bigger than expected.The downside is all the toilets we went to were dirty or you had to pay 180ft to get into the cleaner ones.

A nice green spot inthe city. We spent some hours walking on this small island in the Danube river, which was nice because the temperature was 35+ and the trees provided a lot of shade. You see a lot of families and the island has various opportunities to go for a ( paid) swim. You can walk around, hire a bike, electric car etc. Food and drinks are available everwhere
Great place to visit. A beautiful, quiet island which feels much further from the city. It was bigger than we expected but a lovely walk and accessible by bus

Great spot to people watch. On a very hot day in July hordes of locals were on Margaret Island for the day. Sure its a bit cheesy with fountains and pedal cars and tired looking bars, but if you want to see what the locals do on the weekend, this is it. There are plenty of quiet and peaceful spots to sit and have a picnic under the trees with a view of the Danube. The fountain is a sideshow in itself.

Music and thrills. The first time we came across this wonderful musical fountain we thought it was Wonderful and each time we have returned it gets better. Apart from the wonderful music and magical jets of water soaring into the sky, the audience breathes life into the whole occasion. We even saw a couple walz to the Strauss music

Wish I Could have stayed longer. We entered the island near the fountains and watched as the water bounced to the music. We then walked further to the zoo and saw all the different animals. Unfortunately we ran out of time,we made our way back through some beautiful flower gardens. If you really want to enjoy the island you need to arrive early in the morning and leave late at night.

A Night at the Opera. We had the pleasure of seeing the Hungarian State Opera perform in its summer outdoors venue on Margaret Island. It is easily accessible by public transportation. I wish we had had more time to explore more of the island. It was a beautiful park.

A wonderful memory.. My partner (Margaret) and I decided to cross Margit Hid, to this strange little island on the river. We had a wonderful day there, the trees and green spaces looked quite English in places. We visited the open air pools to swim and bathe in the sun. I had good from one of the stalls there, delicious. When we had crossed Margit hid (Margaret Bridge) to return to our apartment, I stopped to take a photograph of 'our' bridge which looked beautiful in the fading light. The couple in my photograph weren't aware of me taking the photo, I hope they read this review and see what a beautiful shot they inadvertently helped to create...I would advise everyone to visit this island whilst in Budapest, we will never forget it's warmth and charm.

Visited the pools . It was great to cool down in the swimming pools on the island. The thermal pool was 36 degrees and there was plenty of room. Cocktails were very cheap as were the ice creams which appeared cheaper than on the main shops outside. The slides were great and respect to anyone brave enough to go down the orange one. The rest of the island is peaceful and a great place to walk. The musical fountain at the start of the island is great and the perfect place to soak you feet.

Something for everyone. An old convent in ruins, a sports park, a trail around the entire island + a series of them on the interior, a concert venue, food vendors. This is a lovely place to take a break from the city and enjoy some nature or go for a swim.

Perfect Park. Margaret Island has just about everything for everyone--right in the heart of the city of Budapest. For starters, it's easy to get to by public transportation. You can rent a mini auto for a half hour or an hour at a very reasonable price, or you can rent a bike or pedal-car too. There are lovely gardens and a Japanese garden with ponds and turtles. There is a small (very small) petting zoo and you can feed the animals there, and the kids can ride on a horse too. There are ruins of medieval buildings, and there is a water park and a pool complex for serious swimmers / divers. In addition, there is a running / jogging track around the entire perimeter of the island. One of the most popular attractions there is the musical fountain. They play music while the fountain spouts water to the beat. There are also food stands at the various venues on the island. And there's more, too...a great place to spend several hours during the Summer in a veritable mid-city oasis of nature. We'd definitely go back again.

a lovely island with plenty to offer. After spending a few hours in the very nice Palatinus water park, we hired one of the little electric cars to tour round the island. for the hire of the electric cars you must have your driving license with you, well worth it though as we had lots of fun on this, if your tastes are more in the way of pedal power then you can hire many different kinds of transport for the whole family to go in. all in all a lovely place to spend an afternoon or day depending on your program. the fountains as you enter the island from the Margaret bridge side are very entertaining to just relax and watch for a while.

Delightful. On the recommendation of a hop on hop off staff member we visited Margaret Island. What a treat. The fountain was playing to the music. The trees, flowers just magnificent. All alongside the beautiful Danube. So much to see and do at this little gem of a place. Nice cafes to have a cuppa too. Don't miss it. We only had a couple of hours, not long enough.

Walking in Margaret Island. A visit to Margaret Island is lovely. Nice playgrounds, restaurants, swimming pools as well as good walking paths and lovely trees. You can walk from one end of the island to the other and use public transport to come and go.

Stunning fountain. Visited the island just to see the fountain display at night and was not disappointed. From 6pm and 9pm during summer there is a special musical display which goes on for just under an hour and is well worth a visit. Even if you can't make it for the musical displays, the colourful lights and artistry of the water during the other periods is well worth a visit.

The best place to rest in Budapest.. I was there for celebrate my name-day. Peaceful, green, interesting, relaxing island. Old and great trees in the park, soft grass, where you wants to walk barefoot or just to repose there, beautiful gardens, river-views and so on. At the first day I feels, like time was stopped, so deep peace fallen over me. Next day I enjoyed musical fountains. The best show starts at 9pm and lasts one hour. The beautiful dance of water and colours. The water tower is interesting too, but it's not very high. By the way, you can find there to do many things - cycling alone or with family, visit concerts or performances in the Open-air Theater, enjoy one of the best spas in Europe or have fun in the swimming pool or just jogging around the island.

Great place to relax. Visited here during our recent city break in Budapest. The park is set on an island in the middle of the Danube and as there are no cars allowed its really peaceful. One of the main attractions is the musical fountain, which I was surprised to find really enjoyable. The park itself has several little areas, glades, where you can relax and and enjoy a picnic. There's an extensive network of footpaths through the mature trees to enjoy. There is also a small zoo, although we didn't enter it. There's a small stall selling light refreshments, hot and cold drinks. A great place to relax, take some time out, enjoy the music and the Dancing Fountain. Recommend

A different experience from touring the city. This is a great place to come for a 'rest' from the city sights/museums/galleries/buildings etc. There is a lot of green space to enjoy with a fab water music display at the end of the day. No cars allowed!Go to the water park where you can easily spend the day-loads of pools with a massive hot water 'thermal pool'. Space to sunbathe and relax under trees if you like.Take your own towels - the ones you can hire here are really cotton tablecloths. You can hire a sunbed for a comfortable experience. The food is fast, but not bad, but if you can take a picnic, that's allowed.People of all ages here, so if you like water and sunbathing, it's a good bet.
Nature in the city. A perfect retreat from the city, a quiet escape where you can relax beneath centuries old plane trees or picnic in meadows and soak in the sun.
Green and nice. in the middle of Donau insel, green also there is hotel possible to drive with car, no need to pay to drive,tours need to pay but not expensive

A walk in the park, then a concert in the auditorium.. The island is first and foremost the main park area in Budapest, accessible by the No. 26 bus which traverses the full one and a half mile length of the island. We enjoyed a quiet walk through the gardens late in the afternoon. But as others have said, not many toilet facilities, and in the Southern part of the island not much in the way of refreshment facilities either. Attractive gardens. But we visited the island also to see a concert in the amazing outdoor auditorium, which appears to seat well over 2,000 people. Budapest has a summer music festival through the summer and we booked the concert we wanted to see online via the Jegymester website - very easy and tickets not expensive. We saw a huge symphony orchestra and a big choir of 150 singers with ballet for two works by Carl Orff, including the famous Carmina Burana. Fantastic production. We were a bit concerned that we might have to walk the couple of miles back to our hotel after the concert (10.30 pm), but there was a fleet of public buses available at the end of the evening to get everyone off the island, specially organised. Very efficient!

Musical Fountains. Hopped off the trolley to see Margaret Island and was surprised to catch the musical fountains in action. Great entertainment especially since its free. Looks like a great place for adults and kids alike.

Nature in the middle of the town. We visited Margret Island on a very-very hot Saturday afternoon. We rented the 2 place-bicycles and drovee around the island. I love the fact that they kept the nature, and did not distroy it in order to build some nasty building, only for profit.The island is huge, it is very well maintained and it is an ideal place for relaxation.You can relax on the grass and read a book, ride the bicycle through the park, do you morning exercise routine, whatever you have in mind for ralaxing yourself, you can do it here.Wonderful place.

A really lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. We visited Margaret Island on a burning hot day and had a really nice time just trotting round, lazing on the grass, etc. There were a lot of people hanging out by the fountain, eating ice-creams, sunbathing, reading, and you can rent bikes and little cars. There's a pretty little Japanese garden at the tip of the island and some interesting medieval ruins. You can take the metro and it's about a ten/fifteen minute walk from there to the entrance to the island, or you can take the tram. We could see that the buses, which actually take you on to the island were absolutely packed though, so you might want to avoid those.

City park on an island. We went during a very warm day and found that there were no water fountains (despite the city being full of water baths) and inadequate bathrooms. Instead of the idyllic garden island we had believed we were visiting it was the same as any other city park, over run in places and covered in graffiti in parts. It's a good place to have a good view of Pest without going over to Buda and would be lovely to have a picnic in if we were locals but would rather have visited somewhere else on our last day of a three day trip.

Margaret visits Margaret Island. We went to Budapest to catch our Viking river boat tour and we went a couple of days early so that we could visit Margaret Island located between Buda and Pest. Our son had gone there on R&R when he was stationed in Bosnia. So, he told us to visit and we are glad that we did. It was mid November and rather crisp and being from Florida we appreciated seeing the colors on the trees. Lovely hotel...Danubius Grand Hotel Margitsziget. Very quaint and absolutely European. The other hotel on Margaret Island is modern in appearance and is the one my son stayed at. We did not visit that hotel as the Grand Hotel, with its traditional ambience, was more of what we were looking for. Absolutely wonderful walking around the island and watching Xmas decor being set up. Highly recommend the island for a day tour or to stay.
I loved it.. Love is everywhere. We walked there with aother couples. It's ideal for sport and walk around. I loved the fountain too.

A Peaceful Stroll on a Friday Afternoon. Very calm, many people jog and bike.
You can rent a bike or just walk on the few pathways, get an ice-cream and even take a bus back if you're exhausted.

Lovely. Lovely island park that is very popular for the open air restaurants & for picnics.
Lots of activities especially jogging. Lots of attractive young girls jogging along.
Great place for people watching.
Easy to get to.

Lovely park, and much to do. Margaret Island is a beautiful park in the middle of the Danube and stretching from the Margit Bridge to the Arpad Bridge and providing a, mainly vehicle free, variety of walkways, cycle ways, and tracks through the trees and around the gardens.Plenty to see, including regular performances of the 'dancing fountains' and the various speciality gardens, and plenty to do, travelling either either on foot, by hiring a bicycle or, for the really 'laid back', have someone else pedal whilst sitting at leisure in the back!.Give plenty of time as, weather permitting, there is enough to keep the family occupied for at least half a day,

A surprise. Some of the reviews of this island make it sound as if there is not much to do. That is not the case! There were street performers, a musical fountain and lots of things going on when we were there.

One of my favorite places in all of Budapest- plan plenty of time and don't miss the fountain at night!. Wear comfortable shoes and take it all in! Do not miss the large BUDAPEST sign. It's perfect for vacation photos! I was extremely impressed with the landscaping and beautiful pathways throughout the island. It's a great place to exercise, picnic, and play. There were groups playing frisbee, children running around on the playground overlooking the Danube, and restaurants, and places to buy ice cream. There was also a theater that included a bar and restaurant and a historical site. My favorite attraction was the colorful and musical fountain. It was captivating!

The River Runs. Between the towering hills of Buda and the flat bustle of Pest, Magareth Island is a sanctuary in the middle of the Danube with breathtaking views of both. Though there is public transportation to the island, cars are not allowed to participate in this diverse playground. (Your car must stay in the lot while you take a bus or tram, or just walk across the bridge.) But the best way to get to the island is on one of the tourboats that travel the river. Even if you are so enchanted you miss the last boat, you can take public transit off the the island. While you are on the island, there are attractions for all ages, interests, and abilities. There are jogging trails, bike paths, waterparks, and even a small zoo. Centuries old ruins harken back to the time when religious orders sought solitude for prayer and contemplation. Even earlier, the Island of Lepers provided solice to the afflected. The arts are well represented with performances and festivals. There is food for every taste or you can bring a picnic. A walk around the island gives you a wonderful leisurely view of the amazing riverfront sites of Budapest. You can spend as much or as little as you wish. No matter how you get there, or what you elect to do, you will enjoy whatever time you devote to this gem of the Danube

Not much to do here . It's nice because it's green and in the river.But there aren't any beaches or many places to hang out at, like you would imagine on an island in a city like Budapest. I would have expected more cafes, bars and riverside entertainment. Instead, most of the riverside is concrete / stone and cannot really be used for leisure time stuff.
Lots to see!. A beautiful island with a musical fountain, japanese garden, outdoor theater, rose garden, mini zoo... the list goes on! A spectacular place to spend a sunny day!

Pleasant afternoon.. We arrived just as the display started at the musical fountain. It was lovely to sit and enjoy the music and to watch children playing at the water's edge. We hired an electric cart for an hour which was plenty of time to drive around the island and check out the different areas. A very pleasant afternoon.

Lovely little island in the middle of the city. We came here at night after admiring the Parliament buildings across the bridge and they had the fountain lit up in different colours with music and food stalls galore..it's beautiful at this time of the day. Lovely, relaxing evening spent strolling around.

beautiful green area in the middle. we took the hop on hop off bus and walked in, we took a ride tour of the island due to lack of time, this is a great getaway, special gardens, huge spa with water slides and pools for kids, large areas with people on picnics, yoga, tai chi, just a very peaceful zone with jogging trails around, highly recommend!

great running park. Went there for a works event and am so glad i went, firstly the Island is a stunning park in a stunning city on the Danube, there are several hotels to stay at and can be used as a romantic weekend, a joggers dream or a family vacation.The running track around the island is in a pretty good condition and is very popular ALL day and the scenery is gorgeous, you can spend several hours just walking around the park then sit and enjoy a family picnic

Great spot to relax. I'd planned a lazy day and fancied an hour or two relaxing on the island. I stayed all day... There's parks, lawns and wooded areas. Dotted amongst them are medieval churches and ruins and the famous water tower. There are leisure facilities and a running/jogging track if you're feeling active. Bikes, buggies and similar contraptions are available for hire. There are a couple of bar/restaurants and ice cream vendors if you need refreshment. The wooded areas are a great spot to watch wildlife. There's plenty of woodpeckers and nutchatches. I got a good view of a pair of Hobbies and red squirrels scampered about too.

Danube Island. The Island in the middle of the Danube is one of those places almost forgotten in the Beautiful city of Budapest. It's just North of the Parliament. It's the home of the Hungarian (Magyar) Olympic Training Grounds for swimming and Water Polo. The Spa is fabulous.We rented a little Golf Cart like vehicle. It looks silly but it's a fairly long Island. The ruins of an old Monastary are interesting. Margaret was a daughter of a Hungarian King, she became a Nun and spent her days at the Monastery.On the Southern part of the Island (towards the Parliament) is a Fountain, as the water dances from the fountain the accompanying music is played in the background.

Nice big island park so stroll.. I love this place. Been here more than 10 times with my husband and daughter. We love the strolling around the park and just enjoying the green view.. If you want to take a stroll and just relax, this place is my bet to go.
Stunning park. Stunning park, great place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. Loads to do for all ages- baths, sports club, bike hire, boat hire etc.

Just go and See. Margit Sziget is the place where you can find yourself in the nature. Too many trees and social fecilities inside. The end of Island there is ancient ruins. Maybe Roman Empire. Duna river seems very nice. I love this Island.

Big park, great for running, biking or walking.. Nice running path (with a few patchy spots), old ruins of a church, whole place is a huge park. One loop of the running path is 9 kilometers. Accessible via public transport. Great place to run in Budapest on warm days. You can drive there but parking is expensive by Hungarian standards.
Visit the Fontaine in the evening!!. You have to see the musical Fontaine show on the island. When it's dark it's also lights ofcourse. This is a must do when visiting Budapest!!
twixt Buda and Pest. Amazing fountains to music. A great place to wander, and so many activities for families if they want some time out.

A Must-see!. On my last day in Budapest we got up early and walked from downtown to Margaret Island. It is not far from the city and is accessibly via bridge across the river. The island is relatively small, but has lots of activities. We walked around the island, but you can rent scooters or golf carts, etc. for relatively cheap. The mini zoo is worth seeing, as well as the gardens. The baths get crowded early, but would be a great place to bring children as there are waterslides. The island also has places for food, which smell amazing and are not very expensive. I recommend the Gelato by the fountain!

Lots to Do - Great for Runners.. We did the island as part of a run around the city.Was surprised to find a running track on the island. A one-lane, all-weather running track which gives you approximately 5km of newly rubberised track to run on. The island itself also contains some old medieval ruins to look around, a small zoo, swimming pools and water park, a fountain, and lots of parkland to walk around too.If you're in the city make sure you allow 3 hours to mooch around here.

Margaret island -amazing get away. Margaret island -amazing get away. It's got enough for you to spend a full day. Located in between Buda and Pest and accessible by road, it's a place loved by kids, youngsters and seniors. It's got an amazing atmosphere about it. U get a small lake to swim, u can connect to the Danube by boat, u rent bikes of different styles and sizes, rent buggy rides and segways, take walks, have ice cream parlours, water fountain, street artists for entertainment. And all this with loads of greenery, clean surroundings and fresh air.

Alright, would be better for kids.. Caught the boat out here, as part of a hop on bus ticket. About 20 minutes to get there, nice ride. The island is... ok. It is basically a giant park. There are formal areas, lawns, playgrounds, a swimming pool, cafes, a couple of hotels, a little zoo, and so on. It wasn't really my thing, as it all found a bit touristy, though there did appear to be a number of locals enjoying it as well. I think that kids would have a fantastic time though.

My favourite place of the city!!. Margaret Island it an amazing place where you can really spend an entire day! Take your friends, food and drinks and go for a day trip in the middle of city!! The environment is amazing, there are bars, fountains and a big place to run! Definetely must see!

a little haven. We walked the length of Margaret Island one day and while we didn't spend much time there we wished we could have spent more! It is a great public place, with kids play areas, quiet natural spots, running and walking routes, and even ruins of an old church which we stumbled upon and were delighted to explore. Wish we had made more time for this island, definitely could spend a day there and will next time we go back!

Amazing place can spend an entire day here. Beautiful place, boat ride from the City within 10/15 mins. Great place to relax, animal farm including deers and also various types of birds. Picnic areas, pools etcDef a place for children too.
Relaxing visit. Enjoyed this visit too. We hired an electric car for an hour and we went around the island. It was very relaxing.

Great day. We took a boat ride to the island and 'discovered' fountains that rhythmically shoot water. At the top of the hour, this occurs to music. Wonderful synchronization of the music, which is varied, and the fountains! It must be lovely in the evenings. We also rented bicycles and toured the island. They are creating a new soft running track around the perimeter which should be nice when finished. Quite the retreat.

Not the best time to visit this venue.. A good walk from where our ship docked, the park had a lot of reconstruction of walk ways and jogging paths going on. It was a about 7 kms around. Childrens Playgrounds and a musical fountain. There is a bus #86 that is free for all passengers over 65 with proof of age, which we did not take but should have!.

Nice walk - in summer. The island is beautiful in summer, with gardens, a huge swimming centre with pool and other water attractions. The walkways are shaded by trees, so you can sunbathe on the lawns or wander in the shade. There are cafes and hotels on the island.Come autumn, though, everything closes, the gardens adopt their winter look and the whole place is a bit bleak.

a not so hidden Gem. A nice place to spend the afternoon. This Island is surprisingly big. It has two swimming pools,,a play park, a theater and a casino. We just went here to enjoy a nice walk in the park. You can hire bikes and electric cars if you want to and there is even a bus that goes around the Island. There are pleanty of places to grab something to eat and drink. Make sure you take some time to watch the fountain. The tram number 4 and 6 stop on the bridge so you can get there easily. There are a number of other attractions near by, including the Parliment and a little bit further is the shoe memorial.

Beautiful And Relaxing Park. We spent a lovely morning in the park which is clearly a family gathering place in Budapest. The park is quite large with tree- shaded walkways, flower gardens, and tracks for bikes and joggers. On the hour the musical fountain features a 20 minute display of waterworks set to music. There are many amenities, including food and beverage stands and a beer gardens on the banks of the Danube.

So much to do!. It is surprising how much there is to do on the island. You can make a day of it visiting ruins, sometimes there is live music at the outdoor theatre or cycling or renting a buggy of some kind to take round the island. Lots of places to eat and take a load off as well. Highly recommended!
Well worth the visit. The main fountain set to music is fabulous. It reminded me of Las Vegas' Hotel Bellagio. The street trams are very effective and can take you to the Margaret Island

Relaxing day. This is the most relaxing of days when the temperature soars. Beautigful water displays to music. Could have watched all day. Nice walk back along the river and had cafe which serves home made lemonade and chimney cake.

Take a half a day and visit for easy relaxing day. If you feel you need a time out, get to Margaret Island. I would recommend taking the no. 2 tram from as south as possible and enjoying one of the most scenic tram rides in Europe. Get off at the last stop and go down to the island in the middle of the bridge. Rent a bike or just walk. You can buy a picnic meal or eat at a number of places. Really relaxing and beautiful with the trees and nature doing what it does best.

Loved it!. This island was so wonderful and peaceful. I spent hours strolling through the beautiful park, under the trees and enjoying the all blossoming for spring. But perhaps my favorite part was all of the history and ruins here. Being able to actually walk through ruins from 13th-16th centuries was amazing!

Take a deep breath in open air. Relax, jogging, take some time, wandering around... Just near the city, but sorrounded by nature and its peacefulness! There are some spots that need rehabilitation, but in the overall it's a very good experience to take a walk in this Island!

Beautiful haven. We got off here as part of a boat cruise. Wow - what a stunning escape within the city. This is a huge island with no traffic allowed - only the occasional bus. When the weather is good it is glorious. We hired bikes and cycled around the island - bliss!! I just wish that I had more time to go back before we had to leave Budapest. There are plenty of eating places, ice cream stalls etc too.
Ride a bike - any bike . A great place to escape the city in the middle of the city. Go enjoy a fountain - game of futbol or a tree? Nice place to dance in the fountain

an unexpected surprise. We had no knowledge of what was on the island so went to explore and were delighted with what we found, an lovely "dancing waters" fountain greeted us and we went on to discover the Musical Fountain and Japanese garden

Great for Runners - Rubber Track around Margitsziget. Margitsziget (Margaret Island) is a picturesque 5km (3.1miles) park route on a rubberized track route that traces the perimeter of the island. It's beautiful, flat and a popular spot for runners all obeying running rules and sharing the track (run on the right, pass on the left - easy to figure out and follow) so even at it's busiest times it is not hectic. The track is made of the same material as a stadium track, which is easy on the joints. Margaret Bridge is the main foot traffic and tourist access to the island. It is easy to find from both Buda and Pest sides, and has pedestrian and bike lanes so you can enjoy the scenic crossing of the Danube too.And if you need water, a WC or decide beer is more fun than running (no judgement here!), then you can stop at the several places within the park that offer food and beverage. In addition to Margitsziget, Budapest, is a beautiful city to run and/or bike. It's mostly flat and small enough that you can quickly become familiar with which city routes to take (and avoid) in order to have a great run or ride while enjoying the history and sites of the city.

Beautiful Park. A huge pleasure Island in the Danube river. Access from a boat trip or from the bridge connecting it. A road train laps the Island to see the sights or you can hire bikes, golf carts, pedal carts of various kinds. Also has a large swimming complex there, with pools and slides. A musical fountain which spouts jets of water in time with the music is a draw. There are cafes and gardens and a small petting zoo. Worth a day visit if you have children or time to spare.

Family fun. Margaret Island is a wonderful place to visit with the family whilst staying in Budapest. Beautiful parklands and magical fountain for all ages to enjoy. Ideal family picnic location and easy access by foot or public transport.

The best way to spend a day ( or night ) in Budapest... I had read something about this park right in the middle of the Danube and was fascinated to see it. I came here on the last day of my holiday, luckily on a scorching hot day and instantly loved this place. There's nothing nicer than seeing friends, families or couples just out enjoying themselves, be that with a Frisbee, playing football, enjoying a drink or just catching some sum. The tourist parts are of course the busiest, but have a walk around and you'll soon find lots of little spots that are a lot more private where you'll barely hear anyone for hours. There's lots to see and do in the park, from a zoo, a theatre, a casino and more than enough places to eat and drink. However the best part for me was the beautiful fountain at the entrance to the park. Every hour in the hour it has a synchronised fountain display to music, both popular tunes and classical. It's even lit up by a spectacular light show, but you can't see it in the day. Therefore after going back to the hotel and freshen up, we even came back here for 8.00pm to have dinner and watch the extended ( hour long ) fountain water and light display........so impressive was it, I'd say it was possibly the highlight of my trip to Budapest.

Worth a visit. We came while waiting to visit The Parliament. Unfortunately the weather was not very good but we found the visit really interesting.first there was a amazing amusing fountain. When we first saw it it was performing well shooting plumes high in the air then as we were walking away operatic music began and it performed to it,then to the Beatles,Simon and Garfunkel and the four Seasons. It was very impressive and amusing there were several small children watching bouncing up and down with glee. This was at 12 noon so I assume it may perform on the hour there is also a small zoo and St Margaret's tomb in the ruins of a convent.there is also an outdoor theatre and several swimming pools and lidos with slide set which looked interesting but very sad the day we visited as it was raining!

Lose yourself. What an amazing place My son and I took three hours to walk around the island in the early evening arriving back at the fountains just in time for the 9pm spectacular. We saw locals RunningCycling Football Tennis Family picnics Mathis is like a peaceful island version of Hyde Park sounded by water, it even has peacocks !!Could have spent a whole day here and even better is it's totally free
Great. Beautiful island full of recreation facilities. Picnics, bike riding, swimming etc. And right between the 2 cities.

Wish I'd brought my running shoes. . We spent about an hour in the island on our last day in Budapest, and I would say that the musical fountain at the beginning (south side) of the island was the highlight. Although the music was cheesy, watching the water dance in time to the music was fantastic. We then did the walk along the island to find the Garden of Rose and the Japanese Garden. Neither of these were really worth the walk to be honest. The lake in the Japanese garden was dried up and part of it was inaccessible due to construction work. If you have the time, the island would be perfect for a picnic, there are food stalls and resturants that look really nice. If you like running there is a rubber track that runs close to the water's edge.

Hire a bike to see this small island.. Hire a bike and see this small island. There are plenty of bike hire stands scatted around the boat port to the island. I don't remember it being overly expensive, but this sort of touristy things tends to be overpriced anyway.We took a hop on hop off tour here that included the boat. Not much really to do here but we enjoyed our time here.

Lazing about.. Margaret island is great,and its free to everybody.Spend time wandering about or theres ruins of a church in the park. My best advice, get the bus from the city and get off at the water park on the island.You are more or less in the middle then. Spent a most enjoyable morning there.It was very hot, but there are benches in the shade.
Love the running track. If you into running, the island is perfect for you. They just re-did a rubber running track around the island and it is just super. Try it

visit to margaret island. beautiful oasis of calm,20 minutes from the city centre,the perfect place to escape the heat!lovely gardens,water tower with amazing views of the city,musical fountain and a very nice hotel.whats not to like!we wlked from the parliament building but you can go by boat or bus.you can hire pedal bikes.a must when in budapest if you have seen everything else.

Sunday leasure time. If you spend more time in Budapest, Margaret Island is a good place to go to Sundays. Is has lots of alleys, running lanes, fountains, etc. You can go to the Palatinus Strand for a bath during a hot day, and you must vist the Japanese Gardens.

A nice place to relax overall. . It's a nice island to walk around in the summer despite building work at the end. We stopped for lunch at the hotel on the island which was alright. Couldn't find a toilet that didn't cost money and it does seem a bit outdated (deserted buildings frequent) however you can rent bikes and golf carts to get around quicker which might be recommended if you don't want to stay here for a whole day.

A place to see the people of the city relax.. I loved it here. It was calm, quiet, green and beautiful. It was wonderful to see the kids having fun, the locals jogging, to smell the flowers and sit for a beer in a cafe. It was so green and cool, and was just what we needed in the heat. Easy to get to and free to get in.

Lazy Sunday afternoon in park. Worth a visit if had enough of sighting. Spacious park with plenty of snack bars and restaurants. Lazier around the fountain watching display and cooling off tired feet in the fountain.

You'll love it!. The first place where I want to go when I have a time in Budapest and I want to enjoy the nature, sitting in peace and just looking at the Danube is Margaret Island. Very peaceful, you can see how the people change when they're there, everybody so relaxed and happy, nice to be there, in this fantastic place. There're a lot of fun to enjoy, rent a bike and cycle around the Island, see the Musical Waterworks and the Wildlife Park (it's just few from those many things what you can see or do there). Great for anybody!

Nice place to visit. After a bus and boat tour to the island we spent a few hours there. Nice place to see but a few hours for us was plenty. We rented a little golf buggy and drove round, not that big of an island, few nice spots to sit with an ice cream. Lovely probably for a run of you like.. Few spots of history if your interested.
lovely place. beautiful park very peaceful , go there wiht you running shoes , there is a super running pat around the island

Fun day. Go and rent a bike, take the train that will take you around, enjoy the beautiful gardens, don't miss thefountain music show very relaxing to see the water dance with the music.Great place for a romantic picnic and pictures.

Tiring because we are not used to riding bikes. We went on hop on hop off bus which included a cruise on river. Riding the bike around the island was very good its a lot bigger than you would imagine. So all in all a good visit.

Pleasant parkland and a green lung for Budapest. Our visit to Margaret Island was almost an afterthought on the last full day in Budapest but I'm glad we got to go there. It's easy to get to the island, whether on foot from either side of the River Danube or taking a tram that stops in the middle of Margaret Bridge. At just over two and a half kilometres long, and after a 5- to 10-minute walk from either end of the island, it's possible to escape the crowds that arrived with you. Lots of folks come here to ride bikes, listen to a free concert, admire the fountains and flowers, or just use the swimming pools. But with plenty of flowering plants around, I was more than happy to just laze around and pretend that my cares were far, far away.

Don't miss this.. Margaret Island is an island in the middle of the Danube easily reachable by bus 4 or 6, or tram 2 along the Pest side boulevard. You could also splash out arriving by boat.Wonderfully green and peaceful with lots of attractions.We arrived during one of the music with fountains sessions. Absolutely magical. They occur every 30 minutes or so and the fountain is, so we're told, the largest in Budapest.You can hire a bicyle here, well worth it as the island is pretty big. There are lots of places to eat, drink or snack. We finally got to eat a lanos here, a sort of fried dough pizza topped with sour cream and cheese. Wonderful, but more than 1 in a week and you'd end up waddling rather than walking around the city.The island is a super place with something for everybody and the perfect place to unwind. That's what the locals do, and if it's good enough for them it's definitely good enough for us.

A pleasant excursion- despite the weather. Visit this lovely island when the weather is fine. It's a place to escape from the hustle and bustle. Beautiful walks and parkland. We ate in a cafe/ terrace by the tower. Truly awful food. Should have splurged on one of the restaurants at the two hotels on the island, or taken a picnic. Too cold to go swimming.

Great open space. We took a boat trip over to the island on Bank Holiday Monday. The sun was shining, the fountain display with music was playing. A really nice afternoon in the sun with an ice cream. A well kept island area with plenty of green space. The island was clean with no rubbish lying around. There were several places to get refreshments, play areas for children and the opportunity to hire bikes and pedal cars to explore the island. Be aware the toilets (not very clearly signed) are few and porta cabins which you need to pay to use.

Beautiful park. The fountains were the highlight for me. They danced. My friend really enjoyed the rose garden. The ruins were also interesting to check out. Thank goodness though for the bus, because it was a lot of walking.

Fascinating place. We had time to kill after arriving on the overnight train from Bucharest and our room being ready so we had an early morning tour in one of those motor trains and found the place really interesting. An old convent where Margaret was a nun, a seven storey water tower, a lovely small zoo with well looked after animals and birds. Easy to reach by bus or tram.

A welcome green space. We visited the island by boat, and spent a couple of hours wandering around. The atmosphere is pleasant, and it was good to relax there for an hour or two in between sight seeing and eating.

Tranquility in the heart of a busy city!. We spent a full day on Margret Island, named after the King's daughter who spent all her life on the island and died (probably of boredom!) in her early 20s. Now the island is well developed with plenty to do. Swimming park, walks, running tracks, a sports field, restaurant, gardens, fountains, bike hire and motorised caddy car hire. You can just sit on the bank of the Danube and watch the cruisers, barges and boats glide by. It can be really serene.

A place of tranquility. This island is the perfect place to go for a wander away from the hustle and bustle of the city and main tourist sites. Find out when the music is played at the fountains near the Margaret Bridge entrance, sit down and enjoy the water show.

Family fun. We walked to the Island you can rent all types of bikes on the Island to pedal around. It was busy it looks like this is a very popular area for fitness people lots of runners Clean lots of families were here. Pleasant day away from the hustle and bustle of Budapest.

Very nice Island.. Beautiful place. Here you can relax and find some shade from the sun. The musical fountain with the lightshow during evenings is amazing. Perfect located in the middle of the river Danube. A place you must visit when beeing in Budapest.

Lovely place. It is a great place to spend your time in nature. We enjoyed a lot the landscape and the central park. There is a parking place at the entrance of the island, fees are affordable. Strongly recommend it.

The place for enjoying yourself. We visited this island in a nice sunny day and it was wonderful. We rented a kind of vehicle that is run not with the machine but something like bicycle. Using it we wandered around the island. Many people, including us, enjoyed the weather and the sun. Some also came with their children. Recommended for a visit!

Brilliant day out in the middle of the Danube.. Took the tram to the Margaret Island, got off near the Parliament and walked across the bridge and onto the island. First place we came to was a musical fountain, musically dancing to Strauss, Simon & Garfunkel, etc. We stayed and watched for a while, totally enthralled by this free exhibition.We then hired a two-man bike for a trip around the island, only took us 30 minutes to go from one end to the other. We then walked the island stopping at the ruins of the Franciscan Church, the musical Bodor Well, the Japanese Garden, and enjoying lunch at the Water Tower.We had a lovely day, sun was shining and the living was easy.Highly recommended.

top place for outdoor activities. Best place for:-running on a special cover around the island-enjoy walking among the trees, gardens-do any kind of outdoor activities on the fields: yoga, badminton, etc-enjoy the fountain show by music-take your kinds to the playground-take a bath/swim at the public pool

Worth the trip!. The Margaret Island is a green lung in the Danube. We took a ferry to get there (recommended!), but you can also get there via the bridges.The island is huge and green with forrests and parks. Even a mini zoo and bathing facilities! You can rent golf cars and bicycles to get around, or just take a stroll. There are also good opportunitues for jogging.The only downside is the lack of proper restaurants. You can get sodas, icecream and hot dogs, but not much more.
Lovely island. Well worth a visit either by walking across bridge, bus or boat. Lovely to relax, cycle, picnic, walking/running on jogging path, see the incredible water fountain.

Spectacular. A small island between Buda and Pest, accesible by bus or foot through a bridge. Very large parks, fountains and too much grass. Ideal for a walk, for friends, for couples. You can take bicycles for one, two or more people. Small shops sell traditional food and sweet and ice creams. GREAT!

Good for a relaxing day in Budapest. Lovely park with things to do and see - and ideal for couples, seniors and families. We started off by renting a vehicle to check out the island with some stops along the way. We didn't take advantage of all there is to do there e.g., swimming pool, but we enjoyed the scenery, drive and stop at the old convent and mini zoo.

Sunday morning jogging. There is a jogging trail around this island in the Danube, with lots of locals taking a pleasant run on Sunday morning. It goes through a lovely park with great views across the river. There are children's play areas, and a big spa hotel. Not bad for birdwatching too, with tree sparrows and nuthatches.
Restful. Nice park to escape the heat of the city and come to relax. Lots of bikes to hire and even a little train to take you around.

Not exactly perfect. I expected much as I love parks so deeply. Generally, it is nice - first, it is huge(!!) and so calm. We enjoyed a walk and had some rest on the grass... What we didn't like is that there are many construction works and some zones right on the boardline are fenced. It is not very convenient, and we were late for our boat just because we couldn't find the way through a line of the fence. There are way too many of them(( we couldn't find the beach, to spend some time on the river bank, maybe we were just unlucky, I don't know. You feel good inside, but the idea of the island is to see the river, isn't it? It's not prepared for that. There are several swimming pools and recreation zones, but we found them overpriced. Overall, a good experience with some minor minuses

The green island. I stayed in margheret island for a whole afternoon..you can breath a very clean area...you can have each kind of sport...yoga or simply relax your self or stay on grass with your friend and family...an oasis

Really lovely haven in a beautiful city. Loved spending the day on this island, we walked there from parilament and rented a gold caddy type car for half an hour to explore, its got a small zoo, lovely gardens and grounds and a dancing fountain which puts on a great show. Well worth a visit if your in Budapest!!
Lovely oasis in the centre of the Danube.. Lovely green space and park on an island in the centre of the Danube. We visited on a Sunday and it was very busy with tourists and locals alike.

A peaceful oasis. We went here by taxi and walked from one end to the other where we had a light lunch. There are bikes and multi people bikes and little golf buggies to hire so it is fine for those who can't walk far. There is supposed to be horse carriage rides too but we didn't see any on a weekday lunchtime. At the south end of the park is a pond with fountains where they also play music, a pleasant place to sit. We would have liked some better signage for restaurants as some seemed to be closed. We went to the one near the casino and fountains but the service was very slow. There is also a swimming baths here with I believe more than one pool. A lovely place to relax on a sunny day.We also could have visited the island when on a boat tour, (Legenda) is one of the best, gate 7, I think.Passengers can get off the boat on Margaret Island and then get the next boat back.The boat tour was a pleasant way of spending an hour or so and seeing the sights along the river. It had seating inside and out, complimentary drinks were brought roundand there was a commentary on the buildings we were passing. It was a very clean well run boat.

So much bigger than it looks on the map.. An area where the locals seem to flock to at the weekend. It's so much bigger than it looks on the map, with loads happening.
It's well laid out and with no cars, it's a pleasure to walk round.

beautiful and well kept!. Beautiful gardens, with suggestive view! Just in the middle of the Danube, this unusual island is very well kept, with walking and biking paths and always plenty if people doing open air sports!
Lovely, it deserves a nice morning at least

Recreational island - fountain is a beauty. A very well maintained n located Margaret island is just 12 min walk from the parliament. The musical fountain is a treat n very soothing... Can just sit by it n relax/read a book.... can walk the island or take the electronic shuttle on self drive... will not recommend the manual one.... It's too tiring,.. The rose garden is pretty too.... They have a small... There's a mini water park too that looked good.... Though we didn't go there as we were not prepared.... Overall I think one must go to the island with at least 3 hours on hand

Awesome during summer. Margaret Island is located on the north part of Budapest and it's accessible via a sort of path on the left in Margit Hid bridge. It's a very quiet and lovely island which is a sort of a park with fountains, statues and other amenities. It's really beautiful during the summer period because people go there to sunbathe or just to chill out.

Very peaceful place with an unexpected natives. It is a very nice island in the middle of Budapest. If you go there you will have an opportunity to visit rose and japanese gardens, sit near the 13th century's buildings and even see the monument made of Lego. Also our common friends - peacocks and deers are waiting for you.

I had no idea it existed!. Margaret Island is a small island located in the middle of the Danube between Buda and Pest. It’s very small (2.5km long and 0.5km wide) and is covered in trees, making it so different from the rest of the city, and absolutely beautiful. We took the boat from the Pest side of the river to the Island and spent about 2 hours there. We rented Segway-type bikes and explored the island for about an hour. We also hired bicycles and rode around the park for around half an hour, before we sadly had to leave to get the boat back. You can also rent little pedal cars for 4 or more people. The weather was brilliant (a sunny 27 degrees) and the place looked like it was full of locals who come here for picnics, to walk their dogs or to jog around the race track. There is a fee to use the bathrooms, and the lady was quite rude. I was so surprised to find such a lovely outdoor area in the middle of a big city, I’ll definitely be back again!

Nice excursion out of Central Budapest - Chock full of Local Residents getting away for pleasure. We went to Budapest in March, 2015 and went to this Island where a lot of locals go for their leisure. It is a nice place but honestly unless you are into walking in the woods, playing sports and being surrounded by lots of children I would suggest not visiting. The amount of time it took to get there and the "packed" buses that transport you on the island made the trip problematic to say the least.

Beautiful island in middle of beautiful city. Took a long weekend with my wife to Budapest and would warmly recommend the city. On our first morning we decided to acquaint ourselves to city by walking - 17 km :) Lot of fun and we especially liked Margaret Island. Great place to relax and just wonder around. Takes you out of the busy buzz of the streets running just nearby.

Unless you have children don't bother. We were very disappointed with this and I felt we had wasted precious time getting there. We walked to the island, although you can get off for an hour if you go on the boat. I would suggest unless you want to cycle or have a picnic, don't bother as there really isn't anything else there to see.

Pretty. This is worth a visit with plenty of walking and sight seeing to do accompanied with bars and eateries that are great value for money you get musical fountains dancing to music. If you are tired of walking you can get bikes, tandems, tuktuk's, golf buggies. The island is full of activities, sporting and recreational or just picnic and relax.

Fabulous little island. We thought to walk around this small island. It is 2.5 k long and 1/2 k wide. We didn't know what to expect and we're delighted! There is a dancing fountain near the bridge , which is absolutely charming. It goes for 15 mins every hour. Not sure about winter time though. There are all sorts of bikes and buggies for hire if you don't want to walk. There is a Japanese garden with Terrapins in the water feature. Lots of playgrounds, seats and beautiful trees, so shady if needed.

Many nice things, great nature break from the city. This is a great place to visit although I do not think it is as essential as some of the classics in the city. That is, if you only have 1-2 days then you can probably skip it, but if you're around for a bit longer then I definitely recommend checking it out.You can take bus #26 from the Pest end of Margaret Bridge (Margit hid) or just walk from either side. Ordinarily, you can also take tram #4/#6 from either side of the bridge, but in 2015 it is under construction for a considerable chunk of the year. Bus #26 runs across the island in case you're too tired to make it all the way and back on foot.Not too far into the island (from the south end, Margit bridge) is a nice fountain that sometimes also plays music. Farther in, on the west (Pest) side, you will find a small zoo with farm animals. Nearby toward the middle of the island is a big garden with lots of roses and other flowers (depending on the season, of course). Continuing on are some historical ruins and then a water tower. Toward the other end of the island (north) is a small construction with a rotunda called the Musical Well (Zenelo kut). This plays music on occasion. Just south of this area, not marked on the map, is a lovely little Japanese garden. It includes a small pond with a statue of a woman that often has live turtles sunbathing on it.The island is popular with runners, there are paths around the island and all over to accommodate that type of activity. It is also possible to rent bikes of all sorts to explore the surroundings in that way.

Beautiful place. Fisherman's bastion and Margaret Island are my two favorite places in Budapest. It's really nice when it's sunny outdoor. There are a lot of people here, but you can still find a place for yourself. Regardless of the crowd it' seems peacefully. Green in the park relaxing and you can take a rest at some bench and watch other people. There is also cute Japanese garden on the Island. It's totally different dimension. I recommend this island to everyone who likes nature, walking or biking.
A park on the Danube. Great park,a natural island on the river Danube,lots of things to do from walking to sunbathing on the river shores.

Tranquility in the mists of the city. My love for nature always trumps Architecture. I am a student of design, always learning and soaking in the beauty. yet my true nourishment is nature. My soul replenishes in the quiet of the moments, when you hear the birds chirping and the animals rustling in the brush hidden from view. The island is a sanctuary. I spend my day walking the island and back again. For a respite of the hustle and bustle of this great city, you will find it here. A must for those who would like a bit of quiet. It was a week day when I visited the park, and there were locals enjoying the day, as well as tourists sunbathing, jogging, lounging on the lawn, cuddling together.

A break from noise and wind!. We decided to have a walk there in the afternoon, getting to the island via Arpad bridge which had A LOT of traffic generating even more noise, and it was also very windy up there. As soon as we reached the island, both the noise and the wind disappeared, it was a wonderful transformation. Since it was a weekday there weren't many visitors. There are parks, wooded areas and open grassy bits, Japanese garden etc. There are some swimming pools but those are open in the summer only, it was a bit out of season, but still there were some outdoor bars open. We were walking, while others jogged or rode bicycles or quads, golf carts or similar, and some people were training martial arts, must be due to proximity of the Japanese garden... We finished our tour by leaving the island via Margit bridge, which has far less traffic than the other one, and is also closer to the city centre. It was time well spent, so visit if you have an hour to spare while in Budapest!

Peace and Quite in the CIty. Went in the Winter time to Budapest to avoid the hordes of tourists. The park was clean and quiet with little noise from the city, me and the Girlfriend had a nice walk around to end our holiday then we left to catch our flight home. Highly recommend for a peaceful break from the city with maybe a picnic. Obviously don't stay to long as you wont get to see all the amazing buildings etc in the city!
Very relaxing!. A very nice place to visit, especially during spring. You can sit back and relax on the grass and see the Danube river. Very friendly for bicycles!

Fantastic park. We visited in April on a warm day and it was perfect for a quiet stroll in the middle of an otherwise busy city. We walked across the bridge to get there and really enjoyed the tranquil surrounds, the mini zoo and open parklands. The running track is nicely finished and you can rent bikes or electric cars to explore - although it's small enough to cover on foot. I imagine it's even better in summer when more of the restaurants are open. But definitely worth a visit if the weather is nice! Next time, I'll bring a picnic.

Best Run. There is a hidden gem in the middle of the Danube, it is Margarit Island. You can take tram 2 to the end just past the Parliament building and walk halfway across the bridge until you get to the stairs that will go down to the island. There is about a 4 mile run on a single lane tartan track that goes around the entire island.There were workers fixing a small portion of it while we there, no big deal to miss 50 yards of track. It is a beautiful run around. We went early in the morning to avoid to many runners and it was a perfect run. The is a large park for picnickers in the center, an old chapel and the ruins of the convent Margarit lived in centuries ago. There are also two large pools and fountains for the sunbathers in the summer. It was closed for us, but then it is April.

Bring your swimming costume. We really enjoyed margaret Island, peaceful stroll through flower gardens and a Japanese garden. Lovely icecream. And my partner and son had a nice swim in the hotel spa.
