Avoid having a massage there though, I had a guy with long nails give me a foot massage and it was really not good

On the Decline. We had great expectations of spending a half day exploring this green space and then enjoying a drink or two before traipsing back across the bridge to the tram stop. We visited in the second week of April - it was at least 23 degrees C- but unfortunately nothing was open! The musical fountain that we had heard so much about was being cleaned and had no water in it, the lookout above the restaurant that claimed to be open every day of the year was closed as was the restaurant ! There was one small concession stand selling soft drinks and bread snacks. We circumnavigated the island on foot and then left! I was very disappointed to see a large wedge tail eagle in a small enclosure . Take the number 2 tram along the water front to the terminus just before the Margaret Bridge - single tickets €1. Validate on board.

loved it!. beautiful park with lakes and a mini zoo!have a capuccino at the beg seat near the zoo!the sweet old man that owns the cafe near the ducks is the best and very polite!!have a picknick at the grass and enjoy the sun1best day ever!

A green lung in the middle of the Danube. Just in the middle of Margaret Bridge, one road leads to a surprise: Margaret island- a vast, green lung in the middle of the Danube where anyone can enjoy themselves. You can rent bikes of all sorts to cycle your way through the ruins in the parks, the mini- zoo (there are pony rides for kids if interested and you can only feed the animals with food bought at any of the kiosks of the park), the open-air theatre and Spa (yes, there is also that!), or you can just go and visit the pools and waterslides when the weather permits it. Then again, it is very common for locals to make use of the island for training purposes, or to just have a stroll with friends and pets, or you might even see them having a picnic among important figures such as Lizst, Bártok and Kodály, whose busts can be found among the beautiful plants and trees of the island. Whatever your reason for visiting the island is, make sure you grab a nice cup of hot apple and cinnamon water if the weather is cold- or a hot ginger water if you like your beverage spicier and do not miss an opportunity to taste a Lángos- a local crumpet with cheese, sourcream and some garlicky sauce which will definitely satisfy your taste buds.
rent a bike!. i went to the margaret island with my girlfriend and we took a double bike for 1 hour, i think it was arroun 2400 HUF=8 euro and it was totally worth it. It is a very nice break!

peaceful break from the city. We had a lovely family afternoon, riding in a boneshaker group bike, eating ice cream, walking among lovely flowers and watching the fountains. A nice break from the city

A lovely excursion from the city. A very relaxing stroll through Margaret Island was a lovely counterpart to our recent city break in Budapest; a good choice for families as there are pedal powered vehicles for hire of all shapes and sizes! Spend a morning there - lots of paths, benches, trees and sights.

Peaceful. Margaret Island is a great place to stroller and just enjoy the views and the peace. There is some construction going on, but overall it is still very quiet and a great place to just stroll. You can walk over the bridge to the island or you can take a boat from the other side of the river.

An interesting island on the Danube. My family and I visited Margaret Island on a cold Easter Monday. We hired a family bicycle for an hour. We enjoyed our tour of the island, although we did find a number of dead ends. It feels a bit run down but that might be due to the time of year - I expect it gets pretty busy in the summer. Recommended.

Surprising Iseland. Fantastic place to spend time and face new surprises on the way: outdoor activities, sports, waterpark, animals, history, etc. Just go there if you want to spend relaxing time and enjoy to be outside!

Peace and quiet. This island in the middle of the Danube, right in the middle of Budapest, is a real oasis. The whole island is a park - almost no cars, a few buses, and a variety of bizarre pedal-driven vehicles to hire, if you want to do more than just walk. But there's no need - walking there is great. It's quiet, peaceful and relaxing.

Budapest's Central Park. A green island between Buda and Pest, popular getaway place for families and couples in the daytime, and party-seekers at night. Most of the island is maintained regularly, making it a great place to relax, do outdoor sports or just walk for a couple of hours. A running track embraces the island (~5km), the most popular one in the city.

Peace in the middle of the Danube. The island is in the middle of the Danube is an oasis of calm if you wish and can be great fun for children and adults where bike and electric scooters can be hired. Have a glass of mulled wine for 420 forints to warm you inside. Go to the Grand Hotel for dinner with music. Have been there many times in the summer and winter.

Getaway. The Margaret Island is very important for the citizens of Budapest as it's an easy accessible recreation area. The island has lots to offer, but most of it is open only during the summer period, like the pool, waterpark and the small zoo. There are some other sport establishments as well. It’s a long time since I’ve visited the place in the summer time, but I remember that it used to be a nice pic-nick destination for families. Now when I visited it during the winter time it gave a somewhat shabby and run-down feeling, but even in the wintertime people seem to enjoy the island. If for nothing else, at least for a run along the 5 km long rubber-coated track, which is at some places is in urgent need for reparation.

Does not match reviews . If you are a runner island could be great, otherwise spend you valuable Budapest vacation time elsewhere. The island is filled with decrepit Soviet Era facilities that are boarded up. It has a Japanese garden with non Japanese style plants and a Greek statue sitting in the water. Budapest has so much to offer, this isn't it

Beautiful park visited Oct. 2011. Had a great time walking over the bridge to the park. Great pizza at the cafe and very cold beer too. sat and watching the sun go down. Watched all the lights come on up at castle Hill. Just a really fun time. felt VERY safe being on foot.

A tranquility of calm!. I went here a few years ago! After the hustle and bustle of the city centre I jumped on a boat and went to Margaret Island. The boat went down the Danube and we all got about an hour walking around the island. It was very quiet even in the height of summer. A nice break! Coincidentally I met my wife a few years later and she is called Margaret!

Beautiful place for a walk. Peaceful place, had a really nice walk trough island ( visited there in March). Near old monastery was amazing tree, we had never seen so large one! Minizoo was nice surprise. I can imagine that in later spring there's really beautiful, with all those plantings etc.

Walkabout. Nice little island, though not that green during spring. Nice to bring some food and sit down.There is lots of joggers here so don't walk in the jogging path. I think it is best to travel here during summer. Much more that is open at that time.
it is nice to walk or to ride a bicycle there when the weather is warm. It is an interesting island, at the entrance of Budapest. One can walk or ride a bicycle there, in the middle of the Danube.

Island of tranquility. Margaret Island was for a long time a desert island in the middle of the city. A lot of interesting legend and secrets about Margaret and about her island. :)Nowdays every- day and time you can meet a lot of people - running, walking, doing different sports. It's a special meeting pont of the residents of the capital, particularly at summertime.

Interesting but lack of signals and information. It's a nice park for a stroll or a run, so much different from the rest of the city. In my opinion it's worth to rent a pedal car to see it properly, which I didn't do and regretted it miserably. There's also a bus that goes through the island (number 26). However, there were a lot of abandoned infrastructures, like cafes and so on, which might have been on the account of visiting during low season. Main attractions aren't properly signalled.

Fantastic on a Spring, Summer of Fall Day. Great park in the middle of the Danube River. Walk out there or take a bus that goes all the way to the furthest tip of the island. Great gardens, fountains and pools (at the Palatinus to swim in if you buy a ticket). Plenty of food vendors, and restaurants to enjoy. This may be an all day affair so plan accordingly. Enjoy!

Well worth it. A great place to have a stroll away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. We walked in via the Margaret bridge and spent about 2 hours on the island. There are some cafes to enjoy and if you like dogs there are plenty of them being walked here.

Amazing place for a run!. Great place to go for a run if you are into running. Other than that there isn't that much to do although would imagine it's better in the summer. The running track is great with lovely views of Budapest and easy on the legs. Would definitely reccomend to all runners out there!

Little to do. we went on the island and found it run down with everything closed. However there were pedal cars to rent which were really fun and makes it worthwhile! It worked out £4 for half an hour for the two of us!
Try the pedal cars!. Hired a pedal car to travel round the island - lots of laughs, though a bit hard on the legs. Stopped half way round for a cup of mulled wine - what's not to like?
Nothing spectacular. There is nothing that spectacular to do on this island, but the triple bridge leading to the island is worth seeing.

Odd place. We were here in the middle of winter so it may not be a fair critique as lots of things were closed, but it seemed a strange place rather lacking in atmosphere. There are some marginally interesting bits, a gigantic hotel that frankly seemed past its sell-by date, a marvellous water tower looking rather incongruous and a couple of old ruins but it wouldn't have mattered much if we hadn't gone. Oh, and there's a decent running track round the outside.

Unsure what to make of it really??. We walked onto the island from the far end after travelling there by Metro....... which is an experience in itself :-), and I was immediately struck by the beauty of the situation, the uniqueness, it was a bit deserted really being winter & there wasn't much open so this had an impact but,,,,, I could imagine that in the summer it would be proper buzzing with all-sorts of activities. There is runners everywhere (& a track at one end), there a pool, a hotel, and many other things on this island in the middle of the river Danube. Might be worth a look?!

Excellent Jogging Path. Calling fitness lovers, there is a jogging track measuring exactly 5k around the island that allows you to take in the views while going easy on your knees. Highly recommend and easy to find!

Best city running!. If you like to run, run the promenade to the Chain bridge. Crossing the river on the northern side you will be able to take the ramp down to the island. It literally has a tartan track running path around the perimeter of the island! After a full loop if you have more fuel in the tank, get back on the bridge and run castle hill on the far side. Be mindful of vehicle traffic, but have a wonderful run! Budapest is one of the most running friendly major cities I have ever encountered!

Nice place to run. The island is usually crowded with runners, even in winter. Reason enough for this, as the island offers a very nice and (for most parts) well kept track around the borders of the island. Conveniently accessible on foot and by tram.

Great park with lots to do. We visited last August with a group of friends and had an amazing picknick with food and drinks without being disturbed by anything. There is lots of space so you can feel isolated if you want to. There are great little cars to rent if you want to tour in the island and also there are great pool facilities for the summer, unfortunately we were not prepared for pool. Also seen many people jogging and exercising, even a wedding taking place nearby. It has it all!

People place. Walk there on a weekend. Couples, families with children, entertainers, food carts, fountains, trees, shady walks. Would've given another star if the vendors had more variety of beverages (only basic water and sugary "fruit" juices) and better ice cream. Minor detriment. It's a place to see the people of Budapest and to experience a city at play.

A very nice island park with quite an peaceful atmosphere. A fun little island to stroll about if the weather is nice. There were also some nice marked jogging&running paths along which was an added plus

So peaceful. We visited on our last day and spent some time wandering aimlessly around the island. Such a relaxing and peaceful place, in summer it looks like the lido would be amazing! The 'zoo' stretches the definition considerably but there's a few animals there to look at.

A very nice place to walk around and to see the Danbue. We walked around the island and the view is very nice. Quiet and peaceful and there is a ruin there. It is a nice place to see the River Danbue.

We rented the bikes and road around. The bikes made it far more interesting as most things were closed for winter. The gardens and park were nice and there was a mulled wine stand in the middle of the park.

budapest stay. This hotel, The Danibus, had some wonderful amenities! The thermal pools were relaxing and serene! As were the other aspects of the water areas (sauna, cold water pool). The 4-hand message was a pleasant experience. However, the room was fairly standard and a bit outdated. It had a smokey smell and when I complained to the front desk staff I was told that the hotel had been smoke-free for 5 years. However, the smoke was strong. Perhaps it wafted in from the balcony from someone else's balcony. Turning on the AC helped. Our shower door did not close and that meant the floor flooded! It flooded all the way out into the room carpet! Then that left a musty smell. The island was beautiful and it was away from the crowds.

Nice day trip. If you have some spare time, Margaret island is close and easy to get too. It's fairly peaceful and its free to get onto. Most people either just relax or hire a bike to ride around on. If you want you can use one of the ferries which leave in the centre of Bedapest and take it down to the Island for a day trip. There is not that much to do there but its just a nice peaceful day out.

Beautiful Park. The Park itself is very beautiful even in November when it is cold. However, the bike/cars were a bit much for us. I don't know if we just chose the wrong style, but found we were definitely not up to the task. However, the vendor was very fair and only charged us for the 15 minutes that it took for us to realize we couldn't handle this exercise.

A pleasant walk. Even though it is fairly deserted at this time of the year,this smallisland park in the middle of Danube offers a peaceful area for a pleasant walk especially on a non-rainy day.There are bikes available for one or two persons costing about 5 euro for half an hour that allows you to go around the island.A visit is worthwhile in my opinion.

Serene and tranquil island full of beauty.... We got off on Margaret Island from the Sightseeing Boar cruise, so we had about an hour to spend.The island is a grand park with jogging track, stadium, swimming pool facility. Its full of natural beauty and is very well maintained. We went in early December, so we could spot the beauty of fall as well.Most importantly, its serene and tranquil environment gives you a breather from the hustle bustle of sightseeing and touristy places.Much recommended: Do come here with snacks and a nice book to enjoy a full day picnic here.Tip for finding washrooms: Most outdoor ones were locked when we went. However, much to my relief some helpful tourists guided me to an indoor swimming pool where I found one.

Loved it here in the summer!. This was a great place to chill out, I forgot I was in a city! There were snacks, refreshments and places to sit which was really nice in the summer! As I was travelling, I enjoyed the relax time with an ice cream near the fountain in the middle which went to the music. Visited in July 2010, the review selection doesnt allow me to choose this time.

Lots of Wildlife. During the winter months many of the attractions on the island are closed, the musical fountain for example. The island is basically a big park with lots of different facilities for oudoor leisure (athletics stadium, 5 a side football courts etc) but there's lots of wildlife including red squirrels (some of them are the European black variant) but also lots of birds -robins, blue tits, great tits, nuthatches and all that in the space of 30 mins. Worth a stroll

Hidden Gem. I did not realise what a beautiful place this would be. There are many walking tracks, gardens, park areas, a dancing fountain and best of all peace. This was the one place in Budapest where no one was trying to beg for money or sell me something dodgy. A real gem and well worth a visit. I wish we had been more organised and brought a picnic lunch with us.

Quick visit, which we had longer!. The title says it all really. With lots of history to this quaint island would of liked to stay longer. Managed to access the southern end for a look around, and wasn't disappointed, read up about this place first, so much history.

Peaceful place in the heart of Budapest. I have visited quite a lot of times Budapest since I study in Hungary but for some reason I had never visited the island of Margaret. It is such a beautiful place and so peaceful! We visited it on a cloudy day but still the place is stunning. I highly recommend this as a must-see of the attractions of Budapest. It is just 10 to 15 minutes by walking from the Parliament. Don't miss it!!!

Yummmmm. Have never visited before really enjoyed the experience you could watch the process of the nougat being made and also sample their wines, something different to take in while in the Margaret River area.

Nice park, but..... Its just a big park. You'll see people playing, running and so on. During summer I think it would be better. But in November there's not much to see. The good thing though, if you are lucky, you may see squirrels!.

Love the fountain and the pedal cars. We had a couple of hours to spare before our transfer to the airport and going here was the best way to spend them! We walked from the chain bridge in about 25 mins. Turned up just in time for the on the hour display of the musical fountain.Initially thought the musical fountain was a bit odd but one song in I loved it! It seems to hypnotise both adults and children!We hired a pedal car for only 1400 HUF and had a great time pedalling up and down the island! A lot of fun for sure!

Lovely park. We hired bikes when on the island which I would definitely recommend doing. The park is very much cycle friendly and there are multiple vendors when you come off the bridge onto the island by the fountain. Prices are by the hour and very reasonable. The island is very peaceful with little sights dotted around. The mini farm and musical water fountain are well work seeing. Lovely colours in Autumn but I can imagine the park is much more impressive in summer as the Rose garden was none existent. Lovely park but nothing overly special, would recommend if you have a spare afternoon though and want to escape the hustle and bustle.

Great escape from the busy city. Great place for a nice long walk, to enjoy the nature and have a look at the fountain-spectacle! Very good place to escape from the busyness and trafic from the city centre.

An incredible surprise!. While on our last day in Budapest, we had a couple of free hours to spend and we headed to Margaret Island. Our book guide didn't say much about it, but after walking for 5 minutes we got to a big fountain. As we approached, music started playing and an amazing water and light show started! We enjoyed 4 different tunes and all of them had sinchronized water and light choreography. There is a show every hour and at 21.00 you can enjoy a ten tunes show! GREAT EXPERIENCE!

Nowhere like it. Margaret island is beautiful. Incredibly peaceful with so much to see and do. Musical fountain is a must see. Worth seeing it at night as well as they do a light show. Had an excellent, peaceful day. Only comment is that you have to pay for toilet use, so try not to drink too much :-)

Lovely, worth a visit . This is a pretty island just off one of the bridges to the North of the city. I recommend hiring one of the tiny electric cars (need a driving licence) as it is much bigger than it looks, and they are great fun to drive too. The Island has an fountain with an amazing water display timed to music for 15 minutes each hour during the day, and was very impressive - well worth videoing at least one song.

Very nice walk. We rented a richo and had a tour round the small islnd, it's been very nice and fun, nothing too speciL. Just nice park in the centre of the city. We were surprised by the big fountain that suddenly started a water dNcing with the classic music Nd we had to stand and just look nd dream for aome minutes. Lovely!

Peaceful haven in capital city. I love visiting parks in major cities, just to get some quiet time. Margaret Island is very unique in that it's in the middle of the Danube. I couldn't believe how peaceful it was. You can rent pedal cars or electric scooters to look around at very reasonable rates. Some beautiful ruins to see, although the old convent has been ruined with a load of nasty modern steps and bridges. For me though, the park was lacking something. I'd like to say it was because it was November, and I'm sure it's very different in summer (there is a water park on site).Also, there is a mini zoo. For me, the animals didn't have enough room, and the horses had no food or drink which upset me slightly. Worth a visit in summer I am sure, but for me, not my Budapest highlight.

Fun for children and peaceful for adults. Our bike tour stopped here. I was impressed by how much of island was a park full of quiet alcoves to relax, a zoo, bike/walking trails and great musical fountain. The music schedule is posted at fountain with times. All genres of music from classical to techno played (different times) to enjoy. Water is choreographed to music, even my teen son enjoyed watching. Some historical sites as well on island.

Spectacular musical fountain and peaceful park. Margaret Island is a tranquil refuge in the middle of the Danube near the centre of Budapest.
One of the main attractions here is the spectacular musical and light fountain. Here numerous jets of water are choreographed along to various musical tunes throughout the day and into the evening.

Beautiful park to while away an equally beautiful autumnal afternoon. Walked the length of the park - much bigger than we realised. There are loads of interesting areas to explore - on foot, bike or Rickshaw! Lovely mesmeric water features, and uplifting to see people of all ages just having old-fashioned fun. Kamilla is well situated for a coffee stop, but a little disappointing.

Nice park for an morning walk. The Margit island is a island on the Danube in Budapest, used as a park. The park is well-kept and clean. It has a running lane used by joggers all day long. The park is actually pretty big, and you might need an hour or so to go from one end to the other. It's a nice place to walk peacefully, it's open for dogs and it's perfect for relaxing in any hour of the day. It's never really crowded.

Beautiful place to spend the day. I arrived here via a cruise on the Danube. We got to spend a couple of hours. You could easily spend the whole day here. The greenery was very impressive and there are a lot of different areas. I rented a bike and pedaled around the whole island. You can also rent a golf cart if you don't fancy the effort. There is also a Japanese garden, a small zoo and a whole host of monuments and interesting things to see on the island so it is fun to explore. The fountain is also very beautiful and entertaining to watch. There is also a running track that circles the whole island (around 5km) that is very soft and easy on the knees to run on.

slow the pace in a green space. Once we figured out which bus to get us there, we liked the mostly traffic free park-like stroll along the river. As it was Sunday, there were a LOT of joggers, look out. The musical fountain at the south end was pretty cool.

Greenery and space. I love this island for its greenery and space. You can hire bicycles and cycle all over the small island. Walks along the river are also great. Lots of options for other sports as well.It is a green space well connected to the city. Good to spend a day here in the outdoors.

So much fun. Margret island is one of my highlights, we hired a little 3 wheeled bike on the island which was so much fun. Found a little zoo and a garden. Then there is the water fountain, it does little shows every now and then but a big show at 6 then 9We went back at the 9pm show and it was fantastic, the lights the music the show the fountain put on was brilliant would definitely recommend

A paradise of joggers and sports lovers. I jog / run very often and when I do, I go to Margaret island. It is also a center for other sport, mainly water sports. It has become extremely popular with runners, there is a track around the island where runners outnumber non-sportsmen/women therefore, I am sure most of them feel awkward as they are a not-so-welcomed by people living a healthy life.

Lots to see. Margaret Island is a great part of Budapest. There is an amazing musical fountain that plays four songs every hour on the hour and dances water jets in time with the music. The island is quite large and is lovely on a nice day to just walk around and enjoy the green.

Great place to chill. This is a great place to chill out for a few hours and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We got here as part of a river cruise which you can stop and get off here and get picked up at a later stage. We rented a bike (2 seater with canopy) to see the island. It’s a few miles around and easily done in a couple of hours but you could easily pass a half day or more here depending on what you want to do. It’s definitely worth a visit for something a little different than the usual sites around Budapest

Pleasant for a walk or picnic. In some ways it reminded me of Central Park - a green island of nature in the midst of the city. But it's not just a green park. You can find there several restaurants, a spa and hotel, the ruins of a medieval monastery and church and a peculiar fountain. The fountain is located at the southern end of the island and it plays popular music every round hour, "dancing" to the tune. The playlist included classical music, contemporary pop songs and some good old-fashioned rock n' roll. At 9 pm, the "concert" lasts about an hour.

Pleasant walk. Plenty to do (in summer). Easy to get to by foot and if you're worn out after walking around, the bus goes through the park.Lots to do for all ages here. The water tower was sadly closed even though it said open until end of October.One slight annoyance, there are several places renting out bikes, buggies, carts, motorised vehicles etc... These seem to have free run everywhere and were getting annoying on a fairly quiet autumn day. Hate to think how chaotic it is mid summer

Recreation in the city. Margaret Island is an oasis in the middle of Budapest. Even in autumn families, bikers, hikers and dog walkers come to enjoy the city nature along the pathways. In summer even more so when the recreational activities are open. The pathway on the Pest side is being repaired and will form a wonderful riverside walk. Rentals of 2-/3- and 4-wheelers are available even in autumn. Off-season the toilets are few, some portables and a better one close to the entrance.

Take a break getaway. In the heart of the busy city of Budapest is Margitsziget. Plan to take a break in this outdoor respite. Walk, jog or run in an idealic setting of nature. If you so choose you can rent a bike or a motorized golf cart and see the gardens the fountains which are choreographed to music. Enjoy local food or an espresso in the restaurant. Breathe in the beauty of nature while walking along the Danube. Easy access either by LRT, Metro or by boat. There is no charge for this relaxing journey.

Locals flock. This place is an idilic getaway within a city. Swimming pools and walks, a running track around the island(hard to spot) a small zoo with local birds etc. it's really a great place to go relax, walk and explore. It's always busy as the locals use this a lot too, which is always a good sign. Easy to get to by tram and plenty of places to eat and drink. If you visit Budapest you have to visit the island.

Worth the visit. A great little retreat. Easy to find. Little something for everyone, they even have a zoo. Little disappointed in the facilities but it is off season - the outside trail was blocked off, so you couldn't walk and see the Danube. Bike trails were not separated from the walking trails so pedestrians were constantly dodging vehicles. There was no visible and easy access area with picnic tables, only benches. I would like to have eaten at a table. All in all a wonderful and relaxing visit however. Beautiful trees and maintained park.

Arrived by Boat Departed by Bridge. As part of the Hop on Hop Off Bus ticket we arrived by boat and then wandered round the island finding our way back to the Margaret Bridge. Lovely park area and sports facilities and hardly any traffic except a few service vehicles. Bikes and other peddle powered vehicles available for hire. Some great statues and fountains.
A great place to stroll. Very interesting park. Great ruins and history. Even a children's zoo. Worth a few hours. An oasis in the middle of the Danube.

More than just a park. Wow the fountains were amazing and surrounded by autumnal coloured trees and sunshine where better! Park was much bigger than we thought and visited twice but still failed to see it all

Quiet Spot in Busy City. With two weeks in Budapest, we had plenty of time to explore, and we gave ourselves a full day to walk along the river to Margitsziget and explore this attraction. There is a bit of everything here, a spa, a water park, sports facilities, a hotel, a musical fountain, a ruined church and monastery. In other words it was not hard to spend the day. I was disappointed in the places to eat. There was only little sidewalk stalls with little variety. The hotel had a dining room, but it looked deserted. A good place to spend a relaxing day in Budapest.

Biggest surprise in Budapest!. After almost boiling walking around Budapest the previous day we decided/I was instructed a relaxing day in the park was in order - it was surprisingly good fun! There is a tram stop on the bridge, just beside the steps down to the island. There are quiet walkways, secluded sun traps, bikes for hire, beautiful gardens with the real highlight being the dancing fountains! Every hour the tunes strike up and the fountains dance, best viewed while dangling your legs in the water! After all this fun and excitement you can do a lot worse that head to Champs Bar for a beer and to chill out on their giant bean bags!
Lovely park . We were lucky with the weather as it's a lovely park to stroll around. We also hired an electric car for an hour to your around the island which was fun.

hidden gem. Everyone says about it being a lovely retreat, all peaceful in a giant park, but most people visit during the day.The island is beautiful during the day but at night around the fountain is spectacular, a free water/light display to music and most people miss it. A great place to sit and unwind at the end of the day.

The highlight of our trip. Margaret Island is an oasis of peace in the middle of a very busy city. We visited on a Friday morning after breakfast and spent about 2 hours there. There is no entrance fee and we walked the whole time but you can also rent bikes or small pedal cars. They have a japanese and a rose garden as well as mutiple lawns. We saw many locals working out and children playing football on the fields. They have a small zoo at the back with some lovely bantam chickens,ducks and storkes. They have bathroom facilities, a restaurant and stands to buy food from.

Better with a sedgeway . We visited in October and it was lovely to see autumn spring into life and the changes in the seasons.Hire a sedgeway for 1000 huk half an hour of 2000 huk for an hour and go all the way to the other side to see the zoo, convent and water tower.On the way back the gardens are lovely as well as the Franciscan church. Only thing to mention is the food is pretty rubbish at the cafés but drinks cheap enough!
Amazing place for work out. You get to walk, jog, cycle or just lay on the grass in a very nice and quiet atmosphere. Easy to find and free entrance. There are a few restaurants there too.

Peaceful oasis in the middle of Budapest. Margaret Island is a beautiful spot to go for a peaceful wander and provides great views across both sides of Budapest. The musical fountain is a delight, and is well worth sitting and watching for a while. We walked the length of the island before stopping to have a snack and a drink at the coffee lounge in the health spa. We then hired one of the electric novelty cars to drive through the park - it's a must do as it will bring out your inner child.

A quiet haven away from the crowds. This was a find for us, we were tired of sightseeing, the crowds, the noise. This island is a quiet trip out of doors that can be reached from Margaret's Bridge and there are buses that go out there.It is a recreational park, I am sure much more crowded in the summer as all the swimming pools and water areas were closed. The walk around the island is approximately 5K.We actually were on a ride on the Danube and there was a stop where you could get off and return on a later boat. You can tell many locals use it as there were many joggers, people having picnics, playing soccer, children's parties going on a nice walk around the island is refreshing and invigorating. There are some cafes, hotels around the island, a beautiful garden, some medieval ruins (as it was a religious center once) and even a sightseeing train if you're so inclined. We spent the afternoon enjoying the out of doors.

Peaceful - lovely place to run. The island which is very close to the Parliament building on Pest side or Batthyany Ter on Buda side is one of the favourite getaway spot for tourists and locals alike.We walked all the way from the Parliament to the island and loved the experience of crossing the margaret bridge and on to the island. We saw a lot of runners and cyclists on our way as well and loved the idea of it so much that I decided to take a run to the island myself the next day and totally enjoyed the experience.The island can also be reached by bus as well as the D13(?) bus boat which runs only on the weekends - for the latter though the passes aren't accepted and you would need to buy a ticket.The island provides good peaceful getaway from the city (not that Budapest itself is very chaotic or noisy in any which ways whatsoever).

A nice place for tourists & locals.. We visit the Strand, rent bikes and carts and walk along the paths several times on every visit to Budapest. The Strand has a wave pool and multiple mineral baths with fountains & bubbles. There is a small water slide that we tried a couple times but we stay mostly in the pools. We visit the Strand at least one time every trip. There are rental golf carts & bikes that make it easier to see more of the island. We always use the tram and get off half way across the bridge and then catch the bus down the island.

Disappointing in March. I took the tram from the Intercontinental hotel, a short. inexpensive journey, and arrived by the bridge which leads onto the island. I had asked if there were places to eat on the island and was told there were, but this was a no-go option. The weather was fine but I couldn't find anywhere decent to have lunch. It was more like a kiosk offering every now and again, with beers, ice-creams and hot dogs. There was a large fountain near the entrance which was enjoyed by those in pushchairs. It was all not what I expected. A colleague went for a run to and from the island and said it was good. The 'track' around the outside of the island was sprung and she said it felt strange, though I'm sure if a runner was used to it, it would be beneficial to regulars.

Tranquility and peace aplenty. We made our way to Margaret Island on bike. It was probably the best way to see the place. I kept remarking to my partner that it must be a great get away from the hustle and bustle of a capital city. We spent over 2 hours on the island. It was the highlight of our day spent going around Budapest on our bikes. Lovely gardens and walkways. Home to a host of outdoor baths. Could imagine myself visiting Margaret Island once a week if I lived within close proximity as it is a wonderful place for relaxation. Stopped for a hot dog and a beer at one of the shops on the island. Nice to rest at the fountain near the entrance before departing. Enjoyable experience.

A nice large park situated in the middle of the Danube. This well-kept park is used for a number of events - such as pop concerts. There are sports facilities, running track, fairground rides, follies and a spa hotel here too. There is an excellent open-air swimming complex (Palatinus Strand/Furdo) - this is good, with huge pools, a wave pool, nude sunbathing areas (M/F separate) and all very cheap. The place is run by the city/state and is quite officious - but persevere..A bus takes you right around the park or you can hire multi-used pedal bikes. Nice to get out of the city when the weather is good

Worth the visit. It is worthy of a visit but to be honest there's not a lot there. If you have children then the numerous swimming pools and the zoo would be quite a draw, but for a couple of 40 somethings we found it a little bland. The walk along the Danube was peaceful and pleasant enough and the gardens were very beautiful. The odd monument popped up which was interesting. A pleasant walk through lovely countryside.
Away from the City bustle. This seems to be the Budapest runners' circuit of choice. Some interesting and very old churches to see towards the Northern end. Calm and peaceful.

Best way to see it is to take the cruise included with the "Hop on Hop off" city tour.. I have written about this island in my review of the "Hop on, Hop off" city tour. For the life of me I cannot imagine why anyone can or could rate this attraction as anything less than very good to excellent. What was going on there that out of 898 reviews there are 40 reviews rated as below average? I usually read those reviews to find out just what they experienced that I somehow, in someway missed, but not this time. Maybe it rained that day and that was "terrible" for five reviewers or they fell on some uneven ground. I have no idea, but I think this a just a great place to see and visit if you are very young, a teen and right up to your nineties and beyond. I little piece of heaven on earth right in the center of one very beautiful city. Poor? No way!Terrible? Absolutely no way! And average if you rate NYC's Central Park as average.We used the biking coupon included with the "Hop on Hop off" city tour and the rest of the time just breathed the place in and looked at everything to see. I did not post any pictures, but see the pictures posted. Might not be an inviting place to go in the winter, but that does not change the fact that even in winter, this still a beautiful island.

Great way to spend quiet afternoon.. Catch the public BKK boat and get off at the island, turn right and head to the Japanese garden before walking back through lush greenery. See the locals havibg a picnic or playing football. Look for the beautiful St Michaels church and when tired of walking jump on the bus back to Margaret s bridge. A great relaxing way to spend a few hours away fro the hassle of the city.

Don't miss the island!. What a great place for a leisurely stroll in fresh air after the buzz of the city. Take a cruise on Danube, get off on Margaret island, rent a bike and check out romantic walkways, medieval ruins, a small zoo, musical fountain, etc...you won't be disappointed.Devote 2-3 hours to explore and enjoy the serenity on Margaret Island!

A litttle hidden gem. We stumbled on this using one of the hop off stops on the boat trip (giraffe hop on hop off bus tour) and after working out how to get through to the main part ended up spending most of the afternoon there - you can also get there by bus or walk as there is a bridge. You can hire a bike, motorised scooter, or a pedal car in various sizes or and electric buggy which we used. There are gardens, a small zoo, musical fountains,eating places and it is used by joggers as here is a track round the island. It is well maintained and friendly (Keep a few local coins for the toilets!)

Didn't stay long,but enjoyable . We visited here by chance due to a boat tour. It's very small with beautiful gardens and surroundings. There was a part we walked into where locals gave us very dirty looks but noone offered insight as to why, or if we should be in that part- there were opera singers but we wernt sure if this was an open event. Due to the looks we got we left straight away. To we rented a four person bike which I loved! We had a quick tour around the gardens and a drink before leaving. We were there around 1.5hours. Fun, but wouldn't put it at the top of my list
amazing green piece of land at the heart of the city. A great place to spend one day. Renting of a bicycle is a must. There you can also find electromobiles.

Perfect for relaxing. This island in the middle of the Danube is beautiful. You can hire bikes and ride around this lovely island. There are places to eat and drink, ruins, gardens, a small animal zoo and a beautiful water fountain which change colour and patterns to music. It is a very well kept and clean park and it is a lovely place to chill out on an a warm evening. We visited this park three times during a weeks stay in Budapest and loved it.

nice and peacefull. It was a perfect sunny 26c which made it tiring to walk around but there is plenty of benches to sit on. Unfortunately the Japanese garden was closed which looked the best free attraction. The running track around the perimeter is 5250m long and is quite bouncy where it is still intact. On the right hand side of the island is a free enclosure full of birds, deer and ponies great for the kids. Go in the evening to see the coloured water fountain display.

Peaceful and beautiful. Spent a couple of hours on this island on the Danube. There are no cars allowed and we got around on bicycles and electric car. The island has ruins, gardens, fountains and is very peaceful. Great place

perfect place for Sunday morning.. I small island in the middle of the Danube. Rent a bicycle for more fun. Perfect place for morning joking if you want to keep your form. Don't except many choice for food, just some snack. Get your own basket for picnic.

Nice big park. Recommended for those who have extra time to spend. Beautiful European park, clean, well kept with drinking fountain and squirrels running around. Did not visited the restaurants, brought snacks with us. The north of the island is less crowded.

Lovely and big island. At first we did not think it's so big and wanted to walk it through by foot but you need a couple of hour for that, or you can rent all available transport means at the entrance on the island: motorized or not bikes for 2, or 4 persons...or you can take the bus. Attractions on it include a wellness and spa center, open air theater, mini zoo, fountains, restaurants and many other things. Wish we could have spent more time on it, it's a great getaway!

Lovely getaway. A perfect place to go on a nice day with or without kids. Bikes for singles and for families powered by your legs or motorized. vehicles are not aloud on the island. A lovely musical fountain and kids playground. Nice to stroll and relax. Tram stops right on the entrance and there is also a bus entering into the island.

An Island in the Danube River. Margaret Island is a wonderful place to go for a walk or riding a bike, you can access from Margaret Bridge (Margit Híd).You can enjoy watching the boats on the river while doing a pic nic.Is a good option to go in the city.

budapest island. Suits all ages and tastes. Among the best is a great fountain for little ones to play at, bike rides to go on solo or with friends,a lovely train to take you on a tour round the island and much too much greenery to njoy youself taking a nap or a picnic with your mates. There are some snack bars to grab a pizza, an ice cream or a cold beer.

Had great time. A very large park, very nice to play with kids, rest or have launch. Very nice fountain at the entrance. Don't miss the family / couple bicycle cars - worth every forint (Hungarian money) :) look for the one that counts every ten minutes.

Lovely park. Lovely park, nice to watch the Hongary people take it easy when the sun hits the zenith. I have not spotted a place to cool down... the river is to dangerous to take a easy swim. The eateries around the park are just fine for a cheap pizza and cool beer. Nothing much though...
I recommend taking a bicycle.

Peaceful island in Budapest. If you're on for a long walk or just want to get a minute of rest switching off from Budapest's veins? Look no further - visit this little island on the Danube and jump to another universe looking at the architectural awesomeness of the buildings on the river.
Nice place to relax. Nice place to get away from the city but still very close. We walked one end to the other but wished we had hired bikes as they were cheap and plentiful. Well worth a visit.

Fontaine and Nature Time. Go there and enjoy your time while listening to music and fontaines dancing whilst it is sounded. Catch sunny day and allow yourself be a child renting a tri-cicle to ride across the island.

Budapest's Central Park. If you aren't too tired from walking in the city, a few more steps from a tram stop will put you in a green, relatively quiet oasis. Although in retrospect it was crowded, with bikes and golf-cart type vehicles in abundance, the island handles it well. The view of the Budapest skyline to the south is a photo op too. But of course, the beer gardens added to the whole experience.

Good afternoon out !. As part of a river boat trip we got dropped of at Margaret Island for the afternoon. It was a beautiful day therefore we could enjoy exploring all the island had to offer. Renting a bike is a must - I hadn't cycled in years and I had a great time cycling round the whole island. Also a great park for kids and animals to keep them entertained. Can get there by bus so no need to use the boat tour !

worth a visit. went on an AWFUL pirate themed boat trip, got off at Margaret Island and it was so worth it. can sit next to the river with a beautiful view of the parliament buildings etc. a few bars, rentable bikes and shows in the centre meant we ended up spending our whole day there. the history is really interesting as well.

Quiet in the middle of bustling Budapest. If you have the time, plan to spend half a day on Margaret Island. The best way to see the island is to rent a "family bicycle" and explore at your own place. There are plenty of things to see and the farther in you go, the less tourists you'll see. Afterwards, soak your feet in the fountain (don't worry about it being sanitary, you smell the chlorine).
good day out. cheap bike rental, including tandem bikes, lots to see including very entertaining musical fountain.
Fab. We have spent many days here during our stay and have not been disappointed! A fantastic place to relax, run and just enjoy the budapest summer!
Ideal place to be. If Budapest was my hometown this would be my ideal place.A magnificent park ,clean with sports and leisure facilities ,bicycles to rent the place to be on a warm day !!!

Beautiful island rich with history. A visit to Budapest will not be complete, in my opinion, without a visit here. We stay on the island in the spa hotel. However it is worth a day visit. You can rent a two person pedal bike or just walk or jog. There are some lovely ruins to climb around and remarkable history to learn. Of course the hot springs at the spa are wonderful. You can get a day pass for use of the pools or get a massage.

Escape from the city. The Margaret island is a peaceful place at the middle of the Duna.The access to the island is very easy (by tram or bus) and it is abundant with lawn-parks and ice cream stands.Highly recommended!

tranquil green oasis. While crossing the Charles bridge we entered onto the Margret Island! What a huge surprise. It was beautiful. To fully experience the Islands we rented a tandem bike and were able to ride around the whole island! Its about a mile long (give or take) There are bathing pools, fountains, athletic fields, flower gardens, out door theatres, a zoo (?we saw chickens and roosters) There is a running path around the perimeter of the island! If your looking to just stroll, stroll through this Island! When in Budapest....

Lovely island. Margaret Island is a must visit in Budapest. My partner and I hired a pedal car for an hour which was reasonably priced and lots of fun, and then walked round the rest of the island. It's very picturesque and there are lots of things to see and visit. The fountain display was brilliant, very impressive! Definitely give yourself time to walk around the whole island, as there are so many little corners you don't want to miss out on.

Great place to be in the fternoon, tranquil, and a surprise water fountain dance. We had decided to visit the island on our last afternoon for a bike ride and chill out. It was relaxed, tranquil, no major attractions, the odd ruin dated from C15th when Margaret was in the nunnery on the island. Around 5.00 we found ourselves at the water fountains, which then erupted into synchronised dance to three well known songs. The pictures painted in the water from the many fountains (100 plus) involved was exceptional and well worth being around. The synchronisation to the music was excellent, well worthy the trip alone.

Something a little different in the City. As we were travelling with children, Margaret island was recommended to us. We enjoyed riding round on the Bringohinto bikes (there was a small charge), however some of the island was closed for repairs. There was a very nice playground which my girls really enjoyed. It is definitely worth a visit

Beautiful fun island in the middle of Budapest. Beautiful island in the middle of Budapest. Easy to access by bus or ferry. We loved outdoor swimming at Platinus sands. Everything from wave pool, slides, children's pools to thermal baths. Also enjoyed the 4 person cycles to hire. Great restaurant at the theatre.

Beautiful chilled days. Margaret Island is a lovely chilled escape from the city but it's highlight was the fountain working in time with music. We could have watched it all day.We hired a pedal car for an hour at 10€, our kids loved it but we were a bit nervous of the lack of steering. We discovered the island water park Platinus, which a must if your there in summer with or without kids. We will certainly be back

Locals Fitness Island. This island is situated in the middle of the Danube, we enjoyed looking at it from the high spots, made for nice photos of Budapest, the Danube & middle island but for us the actual island did not have that much of a draw. It seems VERY popular for the locals as a place to run, jog, cycle, swim, etc. get away from the city and enjoy the beautiful serene gardens. As a tourist it depends on what you are looking to do when in Budapest and how much time you have to explore each of those places. There are so many more interesting places in Budapest however if you go be sure to inquire after the story of "Saint Margaret" it is very interesting.
Worth a walk around. Lovely little island that I accessed after a ferry ride down the Danube. A park setting that was a quiet break from the lovely city.

Perfect relaxation. This is a quiet island, where you can get lost, if you so wish. But it's also full of real life, which is what I always like - when an attractive place is not just an attractive place, but is also used for real-life activities. This is like that - it's full of runners on the running line; full of couples and groups sitting by the Danube, strictly observing some unwritten code of conduct, with each group leaving a decent space for all the other groups.It's lovely, calm, relaxing. You can feel life going on about here. It's a very nice place, with a very calming atmosphere. It's worth visiting anytime - perhaps especially after spending a day in the general rush of the city.

A pleasant walk. Although you can walk on to it from Margaret Bridge we travelled to Margaret Island by one of the "hop on hop off" river boats which are well worth taking.Where we got off the boat the island seemed a bit disappointing as all we could see were concrete walls and ugly fences and we were in danger of being trampled to death by all the fitness fanatics running round the shoreline.But we persevered and once we got beyond that the island turned out to be a very pleasant place to walk. There are lovely gardens there as well as a couple of hotels and a variety of sporting activities including swimming and cycling. There is an interesting water tower and a small pet zoo where children can take pony rides. There are cheap bars at the bridge end.

Great place, scam stables. The island itself is amazing. Unbelievable that this is in such a busy city. Sometimes you feel a bit like in 'Lost' because of the abandoned houses.The fountain is fun to watch, when it's hot you can put your feet in the water and enjoy the show.Watch out: there is an ice cream stable next to the fountain. Don't go there. Guy was mocking all the tourists (however, they are his source of income) and was trying to scam the guys in front of us and us as well. He clearly hated us and his job. When I said something about it, he started insulting me in Hungarian..

A great picnic spot. A very nice place to relax and enjoy with family, especially if you are travelling with kids. The park is beautiful and touristy. The musical fountains are relaxing and fun, while you dip in your feet in water and enjoy and ice cream or a cold drink.

Lovely place. Went by the free boat on our hop on hop off bus, went to the water park, not busy at all , we had a great time. Only one snack bar open but it was a Thursday. In the middle of a big city but so quiet here. Will visit again next time in Budapest.

wonderful place. Margaret Island was the perfect place to relax after two full days of visiting the city. We took the "Hop on - hop off" bus from Heroes Square to Erzsébet tér, and after that we walked for about 20 min to the island. There we rented an electric car and drove around the island. Unfortunately our time there was limited and we did not get the chance to visit attractions around the island.
Nice Green spot in the middle of the Danube. Nice park with a beautiful fountain great place to sit and relax. I strongly recommend to take the sailing on the Danube trip. really nice and worth it.

Oasis from the heat!. Visit Margaret Island via public transportation (boat is the most fun) and then take a leisurely stroll though the acres of trees, lawns, roadways and cafes. We ate at the central garden cafe and it was both relaxing and delicious. The high point of the afternoon (other than cooling off in the 100+ degree weather this summer in Budapest) was watching and listening to the dancing fountain that hourly "performs" with a variety of music. Rent pedal cars for easier access to the park and island.

A great escape. After days of broiling on the city streets, it was nice to have a reprieve on Margaret Island. We took the scenic #2 tram up the river and enjoyed the sights along the way. It's a decently far walk from the terminus over the bridge to the park (alternatively, you can take the 4 or 6 tram across the bridge or the 26 bus into the park). We walked and explored the sights inside the park and had lunch at the Water Tower. The climb to the top of the tower wasn't spectacular since much of the island is covered by trees. We walked the length of the island (south to north) and then rented a bringo to do another round trip. 30 minutes in one of those is sufficient; we saw most of the island twice since we had rented it for an hour. The Japanese Garden is under reconstruction (Aug. 2014), but you can still see the ruins of the Dominican Convent and a church. There are also lovely gardens and fields. We had brought a towel and books and stretched out in the grass to enjoy a lovely summer's day. Spend at least a half a day (easily can be a full day if you want to visit the pool) and relax the way the residents do (much better during weekdays).

Escape from the city. To get a new perspective of Budapest, Margaret island is a must. The island is quite large so you probably won't get to see it all but there are so many comfortable spots to relax and wander it is well worth a visit. At the entrance there is a beautiful water fountain music show and lots of paths to cycle along and commune with nature.

Just wonderful. Went here on a day it was raining and it didn't ruin the visit all. You can walk the whole island in 2 to 3 hours or you can rent either pedal or electric cars. So whatever your ability is you can see this lovely place. Nice and quiet with gardens, ruins and huge trees. There are also sports fields, a huge watermark, an open air stage and so much more. So glad we decided to go.

A gorgeous summer getaway.. Spending a day meandering over Margaret Island was a perfect way to relax after a hectic week!Laid out with exquisite flower beds located between shady walkways, with comfortable benches situated all over, there isn't a moment when you feel out of place, stressed or hurried. Affordable food is available across the island, leaving you no opportunity to go without. Make it all the way down the Island if you can - few people who get to the very end tip do anything but relax, making for a perfect place for a sit, a rest, to read a book or even to take a brief nap. Additionally, the rental Bicycles make the entire Island easily and quickly accessible.

A little piece of calm. We didn't get to see all of the island as it was 36 degrees and too hot to walk very far.What we saw was just beautiful,peaceful and serene from the musical fountains to the wonderful ice cream .make time for this one as it will be well worth it.

An oasis of calm. It's a fair way out if you're located in the centre and so be aware that it's not an insignificant walk and travel accordingly, but it's very pleasant. I'm not saying that Budapest is frantic but Margaret Island is nonetheless an oasis of calm and a great place to relax. All the locals came there of an evening, which we found really nice, and we were lucky in that there was clearly some event on which meant that the fountain was being used in a choreographed sequence with lights, different sprays and music that was a great spectacle. Certainly good to see.

Peace and quiet in the city. A great place to go and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.You can catch a service bus that runs the whole length of the island so you can get off where you want.There is a large range of sporting facilities,a long walking and jogging track,nice gardens to sit in or look round and several places where you can hire bikes from. My favourite bit is the musical fountains that put on a show to music for about 30 minutes every hour.A great place to sit and chill out.

My favourite place in Budapest. A nice remote area in the middle of the city, an island on river Danube. I love it because it is a small haven from the busy centre and there is always something new to discover. Very well developed, newly renovated area with beautiful parks.

Worth a visit if you have time. The island is like a recreational big park. There is nothing too special but it is worth going for a walk or maybe rent a bike. good for jogging too or maybe pay a visit to the aqua park!

Relaxing on Margaret Island. This is a great place to relax if you have time in Budapest. The Margaret Island is located in the midle of the Danube, between Margit and Árpád bridge. Carsl only could enter by permit only. The best way to there by foot, bicycle or public transportation, Traim number 4 and 6 stops at the island. or there is bus crossing the island number 26. The Island is a great park perfect for walking around, jogging or cycling. It has some ancient ruins, gardens and a sport faciliies. Ther is an open air theatre and the Palatinus strand - public bath and swimmingpool. Newly renovated musical fountain.

Great Place to Relax or Workout!. We walked around this island in one afternoon for about three hours, and it was a great relief to beat the heat and escape the bustle of the city. There are whimsical fountains here and the kids will be entertained by them for quite some time! rent Bikes? You bet...knock yourself out.Want to just laze by the river...no problem with that. If you have a week here, be sure to stop by this cute little island.
A wonderful island. A wonderful park-island where to have a peaceful walk. Definetely not to be missed in a sunny day!!!

Beautiful island. Nice place for jogging and go picnic with friends or family. We take electric car and drive around island. You can also choose bike for 4-6 drivers. It's very nice option to circle the island.

Lovely walks and bike rides. We walked the island around the padded running track as well as rented bikes. It was lovely and at one end you get a great view of the Parliament. Must do while in Budapest.
Beautiful. The musical fountain was lovely. Very tranquil. Great place to run if that's your thing there is a track around the island especially for you.
Nice Park to Relax. Nice park for walking, engaging in various other outdoor activities and simply enjoying the fresh air, the trees and the views of the Danube river.

A pleasant outdoor day for the entire family.. Margaret Island reminded us of Central Park in New York City. We spent an afternoon there on a sunny 75º day, but you can easily spend an entire day there. It is filled with large grassy areas, beautiful flower beds, a large water-fun park, a variety of transportation "vehicles" to roam the island with, and many places for young children to play. There are also some ancient ruins and a lot of eating places for fast food. We walked to the hotel at the far end of the island and had a light lunch at the outdoor patio (the restaurant was closed). If you are spending a week or two in Budapest, save this island for one day, especially if you have children who are getting 'bored' with travel.

Nature and history all in one. We spent a few hours walking around this park both to enjoy the beauty of the park and to see the historical landmarks on it. Both were worth our time. We had a lovely afternoon on a hot day in the shade. I would recommend renting a bike for a little fun (they have them for 1-4 people!).

Excellent place to chill. Arrived here from a Danube cruise (hop on hop off) then strolled around, there is an external track/road around the whole of the island for joggers, cyclists and roller bladers. Its a very relaxed place and has outdoor swimming pools, play areas for kids or benches just to sit and people watch or read a book. Places to buy snacks and drinks are dotted around the island also.
The singing fountain. Just to create the atmosphere: a warm summer evening after a rain, a park, wooden benches, music, changing colourful lights and the dancing water of the fountain. Amazing!
Go if you feel like visiting a park. Basically this is a wooded area where the locals go to run/walk. It was a nice visit but if you have limited time, rather spend you time doing something else.

Peaceful and fun!. This is a wonderful place if you want some peace and quiet! No cars!! I loved just walking around in the park, and watching the fountain play.
If you are tired of walking, rent a electric car or bikes.
Then there is the great Palatinus strand if you or the kids wants more fun!
Really worth a visit!

Must see for everyone in Budapest if you have enough time. As I grew up in Budapest, actually even close to the Margitsziget, I feel that it's part of my home and l'm always happy to visit again no matter for what occasion or with who. Recently I took a walk there with my 90-year-old grandmother on her birthday, we've seen the renewed fountain that plays music every hour (its music schedule is written next to the fountain), took a walk on the fresh air, met friends, seen many animals, although we didn't even visit the small zoo that is also on the island. It's really close to everything, to the city center, so maybe that's why I like it so much, as it's in the city but it's so different, always quiet, calm and peacful for me.I regret that last time when I was in Hungary but then as tourguide I couldn't go to the Margitsziget because we didn't have enough time, because I think that it worth to visit anytime of the year for any kind of trip: it's romantic for couples, it's fun with children and dogs or with other animals, you can rent there all kinds of vehicles, bike or electric car or you can ride a small train, you can go to the Danube bank and just take sunbath or go to the Palatinus beach or to the open air and closed sport-swimming pool, or take your running shoes and join the locals to a "szigetkör", to a round on the island (about 5 km) and you can find historical parts as well. You can spend there a whole day no metter on what sort of visit you are (or you can just travel through the island by public bus too), and you can even stay at the island on its hotels.The only problem I had there now was with public toilets that is actually a general problem in Hungary, that there isn't enough toilets and even if there is one, it's expensive. I really hope that this is a temporary problem and will change soon, because this is the only thing that spoiles the perfection of the island for me. But anyway: it's still a must see, I think. :)

A place for a calm walk, morning run, picnic... I visited that island in summer and I guess liking it depends what you are looking for - if you came to see big city and want a little bit of calm, this is the place. Also if you wan't a nice morning run or to take your loved one to picnic or to take afternoon walk but there's extreme heat - then that's the place. I stayed near by and that island was my first visit - and I loved it. I like nature more than a big city and it was a great walk - specially because the weather was very hot and sun was burning, but thanks to the trees it was cooler to walk there. And it's not just a walk, there's little bit of history (church ruins, memorial), Japanese garden, a tiny zoo, the fountain with light and musich shows (loved that one!), water tower and if you want to visit water park then that's there also. I think I was there about 2 or 3 hours and did not take food with me, but it looked like a great place to take a picnic. I think there was a place to eat also, but I don't know about that more. Oh, and if you don't want to go on foot, you can rent a bike - you can find it after the memorial, just before you go in to the park, I don't remember the prices, though.Overall, I think the island is a great place to just let the time stop for a while : )

Worth'it. Kudos to the Hungarian Public/Tourism Services who have/is developing this site keeping the resident as well as the tourist in mind. The island is around the bank of the Danube River and you would have access to the place by using the 4-6 tram that is going through the city. Love the fountain they have built and its nice to dip your legs on a hot summer day. A good selection of Restaurants with loads of other means to fill your thirst/hunger. They have recently added a running track for the residents.

Must do. We took a long walk along the bank of the Danube, past the impressive Parliament building and the heartbreaking Jewish war memorial on the banks. We continued on to Margaret Island and stood on the bridge at sunset looking back at where we had walked. This is the best view of the city - just As the sun sets and the lights come on. You can see all that I've mentioned plus the Chain Bridge and Fishermans Bastion. It looks like an elaborate film set, almost unbelievable.We went on to have a great evening on the island surrounded by the thousands of joggers that go there every night. We just watched, guiltily from the trendy bars and restaurants that seem to float there in the middle of the river.

Relaxing in the middle of Budapest. Escaping from the noisy city you will find a beautiful island of 3 km long. No cars permitted, so it's really a big quiet recreational park surrounded by the Danube. You can get there from Margaret bridge by tram 6,4 or bus . From Árpád bridge you can enter by car, there is a parking area next to the hotels. And by BKV ship, using normal bus ticket.http://www.bphajojarat.hu/ http://www.szeretlekmagyarorszag.hu/bkv-hajok-a-menetrend/I liked the summer evening fountain show with music in every half hour. It's lose to the Margaret bridge entrance.There is a swimming pool and further a huge open bath area. You can run around the island on special running pavement. It's so beautiful, you can enjoy the city view by running.The island really worth visiting even during winter season. Huge trees, big parks, near to the north, around the small Saint Margaret Chapel is a lovely place to relax. Children love the little domestic animals zoo in the middle of the island. You will get back to the city refreshed.

Horrible. We took a boat to this island. Wish we hadn't bothered. I guess it's a great place if you want to do some serious running and it is pretty so nice for a walk. The cafes were awful with no bathroom facilities. Had to use the free toilets at the swimming pool which were absolutely disgusting - dirty, with no toilet paper or hand towels and no locks on the doors. My husband tells me the gents were the same. Didn't see any fountains so, perhaps, we missed the best bit. There is so much to see when visiting Budapest - but not this!!!!
nice place. This is big island with a lot of sports activities and night life. It is easy to reach by local transport ot by walk

Lovely afternoon out. We went to Margaret Island with my mum and dad, both over 70. My dad not being able to walk very far I was concerned we might not be able to enjoy most of the island as there are no cars allowed. How wrong I was! We hired an electric car and drove around the island in the beautiful sunshine, stopped at a lovely cafe where they had freshly grilled sausages and Hunagrian fare before watching the music fountain. It couldn't have been better.

So nice I went twice. A pleasing and pleasant place to spend a few hours strolling, picnicking, sunbathing or sitting with your feet in the dancing fountain. An island of relative tranquility in the middle of the Danube, get to it by foot, bus or boat.

Very beautiful island to visit. Easy to access with a tram. The fountain with dancing water is worth seeing both in daylight and nightlight. It was the thing i enjoyed seeing most during the whole 10 days trip in town. We walked trough the island to Buda' s side and walked back that side of Donau to see the fountain in evening again. It was a programme for one day for us. You can see and photograph the Donau and the parliamenthouse from the bridge perfectly at nightlight also.

What a great place to spend some time.. We rented an apartment on the Pest side of Budapest near the river. We walked up to Arpad Hid then crossed over to Margaret Island. We loved the instant calm and nature! We walked down the running track looking toward Pest. We saw several exercise stations complete with instructions on how to use the equipment. There was a huge hotel/spa which we did not visit. We heard a peacock and thought we had lost our minds. Sure enough, we turned toward the sound and away from the track and found a peacock! There was a little zoo of sorts which is open April to October. We saw storks, little birds, roosters, ducks, ponies, and deer. According to the sign, there are pony rides for 500 HUF. The caretaker told us the three ponies are females and they love the treats one can buy at the concession stand. It was a fun and restful visit. We returned to the running track. We saw runners, walkers, and some people with those golf carts. The next thing we came across was some sort of ruins. I didn't find out until we got home that it was an old abbey which was abandoned and ruined during the Ottoman war. We climbed around there for a bit and then onward to finally an open plaza area with chairs, fountains with dancing waters, concession stands, and different vehicles for hire like a three wheel segway contraption. It was a lovely place. We recrossed the next Margaret bridge and returned to the Pest side. We probably spent 3 hours and enjoyed it all. For anyone visiting Budapest with kids or formore than a day or two, this is a great relaxing place to visit. We did notice that both the buses and the trolley stop in the middle of the Margaret bridge so it would be easy to get there.

Excellent place to spend some free time. It’s really nice place to go out for the walk. Every time of the day it’s good to do so. There is no cars or any other transportation (except one bus) so you won’t be disturbed. Many people chose this place to do jogging. It’s crowded but still nice to visit. Actually it’s a must to visit when you are in Budapest

A beautiful island. Margaret island is in the middle of the Danube. It has fantastic facilities including an outdoor swimming pool and an incredible professional running track that is as good as an athletics track. The 5k running route is flat and in the shade under the trees to a good extent. The views are also wonderful.

Great option for those who want nature and sport in the middle of an urban setting. Great option for those who want nature and sport in the middle of an urban setting. It has a running track and even a swimming pool. For those who just want to enjoy the view, go in the evening to watch the lights on the Danube River.

Go for a tranquil break from the hustle of Budapest. It was a lovely break from the pace and congestion of the city. Very nice forest setting and grassed areas. Big swimming pool complex also on Island. We took the easy way out and hired an electric car for an hour and viewed at leisurely pace .

Walk to Palatinus. Beautiful walk through the island to Palatinus Strand is surrounded by old trees and old ruins. There are spots where you can fill your bottle with fresh drinking water on a hot day.

Peaceful. Lovely fountain - so impressed! The island was a haven of peace, There were many joggers and space for lots of people to enjoy their weekends on the island as there was no traffic apart from a bus and segways! Really enjoyed our visit.

Lovely walk - Most amazing fountains!. The Island is a lovely place for a stroll with lots of space and flowers away from the busy city. You can hire little novelty vehicles to cycle about the place on and there is also a bit of history to soak up. The most impressive bit for me was this giant array of fountains that stopped all the guests. It runs on about a 30 minute cycle and is the best fountain I have ever seen (Lots of ooohs and aaahs from spectators!!).
Fountain great show . The fountain show was really entertaining. I was there at the 9 pm show but I decided to stay until 10 just because I liked it so much!

Garden to View,Enjoy, & Relax. This is more than an Island and a garden. A nice enclave for lovers.The walk around the island is exhilarating- Unpolluted island with clean ,fresh air, not many vehicles to disturb , the myriad of trees and flowers -all combine to make this island one of the best and most serene places in Budapest. Walk around as long as you like or get tired. There is a a public transport/ bus also along/ around the island . A trip on the bus gives you a quick view of the different facets of the island.

In all fairness.... In all fairness, I did not step onto the island but saw it from the boat on the Danube. In my opinion, there were numerous other places I wanted to see with the time I had. If I had a little longer, I would have taken the time to walk the island, which you can do from the tourist boat ride. There are other ways on, but there were too many other things to see.

great place to be outdoor, little bit croudy. Have been there many times, great getaway place in the middle of thr city. You can run around the island or have some beer. It is a dog and kid friendly island, recommended for all. If it is too hot you can go to the pool as well

Budapest heaven for runners and to be away from traffic. Half-way across the Margit Hid, you come to the entrance to Margaret Island. It's Budapest's Central Park, and it is a wonderful place to go for a walk, a jog, a picnic or just a spot go leave the city behind. Walk across the entrance bridge, and on your right is a set of steps to the jogging path - ~ 3.5 mile (~5.5 km) improved path that encircles the island. Along the way you will pass a nature sanctuary, clay and grass tennis courts, cafés, ruins of a convent, the Grand Hotel, a huge swimming complete , a track stadium and who knows what else. There are lots of joggers and walkers, and each of the 3 times I was there I felt completely safe.If you walk through the park, not around, there are fountains, gardens, the animal/ bird sanctuary, benches, the ruins of the convent, cafés and restaurants, etc. It's easy to get to, and a wonderful place for anyone wanting exercise or to just be out of doors for a while.

Don't miss the fountains. Went there on a weeknight and the place was packed.The island has beautiful views and lots of grand, old trees. The fountain show is worth watching and something kids would probably like.

Beautiful island!. It is a very nice place to relax and enjoy the fresh air and the sun.It has amazing big parks and a Japanese garden which is very cute.The most moving part of the island is the place where Margarita lived.If you don't know the history of the island it is worth reading it before visit the Margaret island.I could not understand why they named the island Margaret but then I read the history.Perfect place to visit.You can also rent a bike and explore the island.
