very relaxing. this is their "central park".very nice atmosphere, very green and relaxing. easy to get to with public transport.just stroll in the park or bring a picnic or freezbee..i recommend visiting if you have the time..

Very peaceful. After reading some of the reviews on here about the island I decided to give it a miss... However, I was near and had a couple of hours to kill. So I thought why not. It was a surprise! Yes, I never visited in january or during a rain storm, but I enjoyed the island. Very peacful and tranquil not much going on. That was the charm. A beer and goulash in champs bar! Very nice. If you have the time. Take a stroll and enjoy the little gem in the middle of the city.

Fabulous music water fountains. Walking across Margaret Bridge, we had no idea that we could get access to the island. We were then amazed to find a beautiful water fountain show. All lit up in red and white lights, we stood and enjoyed some 6 pieces of music with the fountains all choreographed in time to the music. There was a mix of classical and pop classics. The shows run between May and October.

Nice place to take a walk on a warm day. As we visited most of the Budapest attractions, on the last day we found ourselves just walking around the city. We passed the Parliament and went to the Margaret Island. In my opinion it is not an attraction stricte for tourist, but it's a nice place to walk after a dinner. Many people run and ride bicycles there or simply take a nap in a park, I guess it is a nice place for a family with small children. Allegedly there are some restaurants, although we didn't eat there. The one thing we liked especially was a fountain concert.

Lovely spot on sunny day. Here you can spend quite a bit of time on a sunny day.You can choose to sit/lay down and relax on a bench or on the grass. Or you can choose to be active going for a swim, kayaking, rowing or playing tennis. Or you simply may want to walk or cycle around the island. During that on island on the Donau river between Buda and Pest really makes it a special experience: you feel in the centre of a metropolis and on the country side at the same time. Highly recommendable.You can vary time with weather and availability.

Nice place to wander around. This is a great park (actually a fairly sizeable island) to wander around in, there's a fountain with water displays that you can sit and watch, wide-open green areas, paths among the trees, the odd historic ruin, a perfect place to relax and unwind after too much touristing in the rest of the city.

excellent place. the area is calm, charming and you can see it by segway which is a lovely experienceit is full of green areas where you can resti spend an hour there with my husband which i find enough for tourist, but it is easily to spend a 4 hours
Nature Seekers. A park and island in the middle of the Budapest, surrounded by the Danube. Do you need more convincing?
Fantastic city park. Great park to walk or run around. Fantastic views of the river and some of the outstanding architecture of the city. Recommended.

that's the place to see locals. The whole island is a park with a swimming pool in the middle. Actually it is more of a rec. center.You'll see all kinds of people on the Margaret Island: joggers, tourists, couples, dog owners, children.When you come there you loose track of time. First you sit on a bench and look at the Danube river flowing by, then you take a walk around the island and realize how big it is. After that the sun goes down and you get this magical light for taking the pictures.Also we found this playground and had a lot of fun there.

Impressive!. This is the most impressive place in Budapest. Between two sides of the city ( Buda & Pest) you can walk, run or sit in the middle of the green park and watch the amazing environment..You can listen to the birds singing and breath a peaceful atmosphere..Definitely love it!

Wilderness in the City. As part of the Hop-On/Off bus tour you get a free boat ride to the Island where they drop you off and pick you up 2 hours later. With the package you also get an hours free bike hire which we used and it was great. The Island is about 2.5km long and about 500m wide, doesn't sound that big but there is so much stuff on this little Island. There are a few hotels there, sports facilities, running track, old monasteries, a mini zoo and amazing wildlife. The hour on the bike flew by and we covered most of the island stopping of at many of the beauty spots, the best was a pond right in the middle of the island where there were terrapins, fish, frogs and ducks all living together. After the hour bike ride we had a little wonder and stopped off at one of the many food stall selling various things, but we had the Langos with sour cream and it was great. If you have a couple of hours to explore this tiny island then do, it's refreshing tranquil after spending days in the city at the busy tourist attractions. I imagine it is even nicer in the summer, although probably a lot busier.

Nice Park, prob best in summer. Our family visited this park today. We had fun riding the family style bike around the park and were glad to do so because we didn't realize just how long the island was! It's nice and green and the old ruins were super neat...but the playgrounds were just ok and there wasn't much food (thankfully we had brought a picnic) and the fountains weren't filled/on so there wasn't TONS to do. There was a waterpolo match going on, which is unique and fun!

Get lost in nature without leaving the city. Trees, flowers, birds and water. All you need to relax and enjoy a sunny day without the stress of the city. I've spent a whole afternoon there. It was refreshing. If you are with friends, don't forget your Frisbee or your volley ball. Great for a picnic too.

Tranquil respite from city sightseeing. Although this is very much a scenic attraction in itself, we spent a beautiful spring half day ambling about the island. The gardens, parks and recreational activities are ample for all age groups looking for time out in a beautiful green space very close to town. The snack food was clean and reasonably priced, and there are lots of bins which may be why the place was very clean. The only thing on my wish list would have been some directional signage on the island itself so we could find out way back to the boat without having to use Google Maps.

Picnic oasis. Every summer we jump on our bicycles with our picnic basket and go to Margitsziget! There is everything from gardens to wide open spaces for football/volleyball, horse-driven carriages & other fun for the kids, swimming pool and athletics track as well as places to eat & drink. It's the perfect oasis for a laid-back afternoon in the summer sun and/or cool shade of trees. No visit to the city is complete without a stroll on the Island.

Lovely little oasis in the city. We caught the boat over to Margaret Island and spent a couple of hours in the gardens, a lovely little oasis away from the noise of the city. We hired a cycle car for two (not sure what the proper name is!) and had a hilarious time cycling round the gardens and covered more distance than we would have on foot. We then walked back over the bridge into the city.

Just kick back and relax.. I think this will always be my favourite place in Budapest. If you have spent the day running around visiting the sights, it is the perfect place to stop, take a deep breath and just unwind.From the newly refurbished fountain, the various eating places, the cycle hire, and the small park at the north end, it is the perfect place to kill a couple of hours or more. In the summertime especially, just go and sit with a good book, or people watch, or sit by the river and watch the boats pass by. If you want a little activity, there is a water park, and a running track which runs all the way around the Island.But honestly ? Just go there and chill out !
A relax from the city.. Great. Hire a bike which is cheap and spend an hour or two looking round the sights. There is more going on here than you'd think

Lovely afternoon spent relaxing. We had a nice afternoon walking around in the Margaret Island, and while the weather wasn't particularly nice, we still quite enjoyed it.During warmer months you can rent out these so called "bringohintos" (Bicycle carriages) and paddle with them everywhere on the island, great fun usually.

Great for Families, A Bore if You Do Not. Margaret Island is the Central Park - and then some - for the people of Budapest. It is very large, can be beautiful, has a lot of things to do -- if you are with kids. If you are going because your tour book said to do so, think again. Unlike Central Park, or Hyde Park or St. James Park or the grounds of the Villa Borghese, there is no architectural significance to the island,no charm. it is an excellent outdoor recreation and entertainment venue for families. Those facilities look pretty good - and the Transylvanian pastries, sort of a round, cone shaped zeppole you eat i strips - probably made the visit worthwhile. That and finding out my wife had to pay for the toilet, I did not -- and in the style of the city, the toilets were immaculate (they cost around eighty cents) and a kind local told me I did not have to wait on line to pay.
Very peaceful. Perfect for the family, just take a mice walk and enjoy the outdoors. There are restaurants all around and sometimes there are various street performers. Very safe, very nice.
Beautiful. Beautiful for many reasons... for family walks, cycle rental, jogging, little zoo, outdoor swimming pool .... a nice place to go to escape the city traffic. Excellent for family

Nice park and amazing open air opera. A very nice park to walk in, with lots of groomed gardens as well as more wild-nature areas. You can rent a bike to get around the island, but it's worthy of a walk!There are a couple cafés and outdoor food and beverage carts as well as hotels and hostels with restaurants and pubs.I particularly enjoyed the amazing open air opera Madame Butterfly at the scene below the water tower. Amazing acoustic, great performance, excellent seating - food and beverage service in the pause and ushers to guide you to your seat. Definitely an amazing opera experience.Jogging/running tracks around the entire island, right by the water.
Quiet park. Get the number 4 or 6 tram to the tramstop on the Margaret bridge. We had a pleasant walk round the park and also hired a tricycle made for two which was great fun.

Not sure what I expected!. Margaret Island was really like an overgrown park. Lots of lovely trees and gardens, water features and walkways. Very popular with joggers and cyclists.I wouldn't put the Island as a must do on a Budapest visit.

Take your time and enjoy the peace. This is a beautiful park for a leisurely stroll. While there isn't much to do here, you can certainly spend some time here away from the activity of the city. We rented a tandem bike for an hour, which a fun way to get around the park. A bit pricey for what you get, but it's fun.The ruins are interesting to read about as you stand on centuries old stone remnants, though not all that picturesque. The re-built church is a beautiful landmark, though we couldn't go in that day, there is a haunting energy around this building, and all its history. Well worth the escape for a few hours of calm, peace and quiet in the park.
Just watch the river flow. This is one of my favorite city parks in the world. The park is large, the ways it is used are various, and the ambience is lovely.

not as picturesque as had been led to believe. To be fair I do think that going in January may not have been the best time of year to see the island, there were road works at the entrance and the buildings that we passed had graffiti all over them, some of the benches were broken or missing altogether. I think we were so disheartened by this point that we didn't go right into the island as we certainly didn't see any landmarks or anything worth looking at.maybe if you visit in the summer you will have a very different experience ?

Beautiful area for walking and sightseeing. Margaret Island is a beautiful large public park well worth a visit. There are many benches, fountains, swimming pools, tram transportation, bikes to rent, and great walking trails.

Relaxing site with a calm atmosphere. When visiting the Margaret Island do not expect any breath-taking moments. It is a park where the people of Budapest go to run around the island on the running track (app. 6 kms, 4 miles), visit the swimming pool or meet up with friends have a few friendly beers or a bottle of wine while looking at the river Danube.The best time to go is during the summer while it's better not to stay alone during the night, mostly for solo women travelers.I would recommend to visit the island after a busy night's party, a busy morning or afternoon or with friends in the evening.

Not What We Expected. We felt that some parts of the park were sort of tacky where the vendors set up, and not well maintained. We were there on a sunny day in November, and it was delightful to people watch around the huge fountain. At the same time ,although it was peaceful to stroll, we did not find the topography that interesting. Perhaps we are just used to parks with more of a design to them. But if one needs a quiet place to relaxthis is probably it.

It must be great during Summer. I was there in November so I was able to enjoy a very quiet walk through the park and admire the autumn colors. I can only imagine how colorful and lively it must be during summer. That's probably the best time to go.

Long live Margaret!. When you enter the island ,a peacfull and calm atmosphere is wrapping you immediatly. You can stroll peacfully not caring about cars and traffic lights.The island was a big "siesta" after running all over Budapest trieng to catch as much as you can. The musical fountain was terrific!

Lovely place to relax after a walking day. We went to Margaret Island after our first walking day on Budapest - actually it was our last stop before returning to the hotel. The musical fountain was great, and it also has a beautiful park with colorful flowers. We could relax and get some rest, and we could get some really tasty snacks on the island. Highly recommended for all the family.

Pleasant experience. Unfortunatelly, I have visited Budapest during wintertime, so I haven't seen the entire beauty of the island. Nevertheless, the view is incredible and I really felt relaxed and happy in that natural frame. It is a lovely place to be.

Very pleasant. Supposed to be one of 1001 gardens to see before you die - don't go for that, but it is a pleasant park to walk around. Lots of locals use the running track that surrounds the island and it was busy as a bank holiday when we went. An easy 5 mile walk up and down and more if around or zig zagLovely old trees which were good to see as autumn, dancing fountain and other interesting buildings Water tower didn't seem open (bank holiday?)Planting was all removed for winter so more colour In summer I guess unless they replant for winter too

unusual. What an interesting history to this small island ,They have so many things in this little area, swimming pools etc and apart from public transport and bicycles there are no other motorised vehicles allowed in this area.

Really enjoyful!. Absolutely worth a visit, even though at times a bit overcrowded. Easily accessible with public transport and with plenty recreational and sport activities for young and old. There is sort of a jogging/biking lane around the island, the rest is full of parks with some sporting facilities scattered around the whole area. There are different playgrounds for children, plenty of stands offering drinks/snacks, quite some possibilities of renting a bike or golf cart to ride among the island (better plan for an hour or more). And of course I should mention the magnificent fountain just upon entering the island, it is a spectacle on its own, but it is a real delight at dusk with music...

Central park of Budapest!!!!!!. It's a very beautiful island in Danube river, easily accessible by tram line 6 or bus..... It is quiet and few cars are allowed in there,so you can enjoy a walk or a pic nic in a beautiful landscape .....

A wonderful park not to be missed. A two mile walk through a great park with many interesting species of trees. The ruins along the path added interest. We had a nice little lunch from a roadside vendor. Sausage and potatoes - they were great. The fountain at the entrance of the park is not to be missed. We sat for a half hour mesmerized by the display of dancing water.

Lovely place to walk. It is a lovely place to have a walk around. We took wraps down from a local humas bar and sat looking at the river. There are lots of benches and it is just a nice walk. We also managed to see the fountain 'dancing' to the music when we arrived. It would be a great place to go for a run.

Margaret Island / Margit Sziget Budapest. Peace and tranquility in a bustling city! Electric vehicles only, apart from the bus services. This is an oasis in the middle of Budapest, full of greenery. An ideal place to enjoy a leisurely stroll, even in Winter. A fountain runs to a programme, synchronised to classical music. A ruined abbey is another of the attractions and there is a spa hotel on the island. For film buffs, the houseboat scenes from The Netherlands in Steven Spielbergs' Munich where filmed close to here.

a piece of peace in a city. It is long so hubby & I caught a bus to one end and walked from there, it is a beautiful park with wonderful tree's.There are 2 hotels on the island, one of which is a health spa, but I did not check it out. The rose garden surprised me as still in flower. many ruins and a cute church to see, good for a afternoon delight.
Not in Budapest!. Two minutes walk from Margaret Bridge (Margit hid) but you would think you were NOT in a capital city! Enjoy the walk(s) and the peace and quiet.

Get away from the hustle and bustle. Margaret Island sits in the Danube river like a Green, lozenge shaped Oasis of relative tranquility. The island is accessed by numerous trams and buses that cross Margaret Bridge at an odd angle. The whole Island is designed with relaxation and stress relief in mind, dotted with greenery. sports facilities and wildlife everywhere and is an ideal spot to spend a lazy Sunday afternoon.

Great for Kids and Kids at heart. Wandered across the Danube without realizing what little gem we were heading to. The electric vehicles first caught our attention as we walked down the street, but the fountain came into view, playing classical music whilst the water fountain played to the tune. Unfortunately we only caught the last 3 / 4 minutes, so we found a seat, sat in the warm sunshine and waited till the next performance in 50 minutes.(On the hour). The map showed a ruins and Zoo further down the road, so the kids in us got the better and we hired an electric vehicle. Great fun driving down the roads at safe speeds. Were able to stop at leisure and see what we wished.A good mornings activity. If you wish to be a kid at heart - give it a go.

Great for kids, families, and anyone who owns a bicycle. Have been several times, over several trips to Budapest. You can rent family size bikes, which kids absolutely love. There's an outdoor pool on the island (far side when approaching from Margit Bridge), although that was closed this time due to the flooding, and a "real" swimming pool complex on the same side, slightly before that.It's entrance is shared between vehicular traffic (road) and a paved area. The bridge has not long been refurbished, and leads you down to a huge expanse (and I mean huge), with park, musical water feature, restaurants, takeaway food shops, the road runs both ways on one side, and all around the island there is a running track (an athletics stadium is sited at the entrance to the island) It's popular with cyclists, runners, families (there's a play area not much further past the stadium), and on a warm day, anyone who just wants to sit, relax, read or spend some time with friends.Hugely popular with tourists and locals alike.We loved it, and go every time we visit, always more than onceYou can also grab a hop on hop off water boat here (those tickets are normally free when buying the hop on hop off bus tickets around the city centre. You could spend half a day here, then head off to the numerous other sites along the danube if this was the case.

Fabulous fountain!. Went for an evening wander and discovered the amazing fountain show. Beautiful fountain performs in time with music is as good as any fireworks. If you see it in the evening, the colours are spectacular, have a look on YouTube for the videos! I think the best performances are at 18h and 21h and it runs from May to Oct 31st.

Great Place to spend a day. The island is a great way to spend a day while in Budapest. Spend the strolling looking at the ruins and the small zoo grab a bench and watch the Danube flow bye.Throw down a blanket and enjoy a picnic lunch and nice glass of wine and just people watch all in all one of the nicest spots in all the cityLoved by visitors and locals alike

Running Paradise. While in Budapest I did a lot of running around the city as I was training for a marathon. Margaret Island is wonderful! It has a paved running track all the way around the island. Fabulous. And beautiful.

A walk in the park!. Sunday, the sun is shining and there is a park to visit. Talking a walk around this large park there were so many locals out doing exactly the same (and heaps of joggers too). You can spend as little or as much, walk along the river, hire a bike, an electric car thing or just use your own two feet. You need to try the pastry horn with cinnamon as a snack too - yum!

Lovely spot. A peaceful haven in the middle of the river Danube. Lots of lovely walks on a sunny day and the musical fountains are captivating.We called in there after taking the Hop on Hop Off boat trip so our time was a bit limited. If you are into running there is a great running track (with built in shock absorbing surface and distance markings)

in heart of Budapest. The Margaret island is a beautiful place in heart of Budapest. You can walk or run around the island, or rent something, or visit the mini zoo. This is a good program for the whole family, and for friends.

A peaceful break from the bustle of Budapest. In the middle of the Danube, this island is home to some great gardens and natural spaces. If you are feeling energetic, you can run round the island on the purpose built track, but for the rest of us, then a stroll is more than adequate to appreciate what is there.

Excellent place. If you plan a trip to Budapest, this is the place you have to visit.There are two bridges across Danube on the edges of the island, so you can go there on foot, but I recommend that you take a boat ride. The island is beautiful. You can enjoy walking, and then you can rest in beautiful gardens or enjoy watching the musical fountains.

Stumbled upon this Hidden treasure. I had taken a boat ride on the Danube and saw this Island, The boat stopped at the island and I decided to get off and explore.What a cool place, I hadnt heard of it but saw the castle ruins on the island. We met some locals there who told us about this water fountain synchonized to Music. It was really nice. Defiantly a surprise and thanks to those anonymous Locals who told us about it.There is also a petting zoo, Pony rides and a flower garden on the island
Very good on a hot day. Margaret island is a green place in de middle of the Donau. Good for jogging, walking, skating.Rather new are the rosegarden and the musical fountains, nice!!!

A Must Visit Attraction In Budapest !!. The Margaret island is in the middle of danube river .In fact its the main city park in Budapest.The are a big fountain in the island with light and music effects .You can rent a bicycle or a bicycle car to see the island .There are a tourist bus also and electric car you can rent .The island is very beautiful and there were many visitors and local people in saturday.Its A Must Visit Attraction In Budapest !!

Just take a rest in Budapest here. You can get a bus do this island in Budapest so it is not so hard to go there. You can see beautiful flower gardens, fountain, etc. Margaret Island is a peaceful place in big town, so I surely recommend it.

Good place for a run. My wife and I targeted Margaret Island for morning run and found it tho be a very pleasant break from the rest of the city. Even better, it has a rubberised running track that follows the shoreline around most of the island.
Margaret island. Beautiful places with fountains and music, a japanese garden. Bicycle location. this is a place to be if you want fresh air

Picturesque island with lots to do / explore. Margaret Island is where our hotel was so we had plenty of time to explore. There is lots to do and see including gardens, fountains, a mini zoo, an ampitheatre, ruins, and a running track. Besides all this there is a lot of open space and lawns to just lie out in the sun. You can hire all manner of bikes/pedaloes to get around the island. It's definitely worth a visit and is easily accessible on the number 26 bus which goes right through the middle of the island.
green island. margaret's island is a place to go and relax...take a book and lie down to read it.or go there and run in the trees...surounded by water
Nice Island Park. Cafes, food stalls, fountain shows, hire bikes, and other activities making it a nice place to spend an afternoon.

A wonderful surprise.. We went to Margaret Island as an afterthought. The boat trip was included with our Hop on Hop off bus ticket. Go to the fountain. There are lots of different jets. Some circle. Others go really high. So we are sitting there people watching and suddenly music starts to play (Time to Say Goodbye), and the fountain keeps time. I still get emotional thinking about it. You could easily spend a few hours here. There are roadside stands for stuff to eat. You can rent a variety of bikes.

Peace and Quiet. Margaret Island is a large vibrant and popular city park situated in the middle of the River Danube just a 20 minute walk from the Parliament building. Facilities in the park include medieval ruins, flower gardens, a small zoo, dancing fountain (with music on the hour) swimming pool, restaurants, cafés, running tracks, pleasant riverside walks, and acres of grass all criss-crossed by numerous paths. It made a pleasant break from the heat of the city during our visit to Budapest. To get around it's possible to hire both adult and children's cycles, pedal powered carts, electric golf buggies, take the land train, or simply stroll. The island can be accessed on foot from either Margit bridge or Arpad bridge, with both having numerous bus and tram routes across them. Or if you prefer you can catch bus 26 from Nyugati Palyaudvar (central station), which runs through the centre of island connecting both bridges. Admission to to island is free.

Very Nice place to Run. I took a boat tour on Danube. Got off and ran around the jogging path. It is about 5k around the island. Flat and shady course and a lot of runners to motivate you. The grounds are great and a few cafes to enjoy. Walk, stroll or rent a bike.

Just beautiful. This island is wonderful. We were on a river trip and stopped off at the island for two hours. There is so much to see and do - easy walking around the island with two beautiful hotels. One of the highlights was sitting and watching the water fountain display played with classical music.A must for anyone visiting Budapest.

Tranquil and green. Beautiful parkland and gardens a stone's throw form the city bustle. The Island is accessible from a bridge over the Danube and a brilliant place to visit on a hot day. We did so on a day when the temperature rose over 41 degrees as there is an amazing swimming pool complex known as Platinus Strand with all manner of hot and cold pools.

Visited the pools in record heat!. We visited the Margaret Island pools in the hottest day since 1931. Needless to say it was packed with hot Hungarians. What fun! We hit the wave pool and everyone was just having so much fun we joined in. I was a little concerned about bacteria and my husband refused to enter, but my grown children loved it. No ear aches or problems post experience. Later we sat in a 3-4 foot pool with cool water showering down on us. A great way to spend time in miserably hot weather! The changing rooms were busy but clean. There was staff around, and there are private rooms to change in. We didn't bother with a locker, just had my husband watch our stuff while we "swam". The park is cleaner than most American parks and I commend the Hungarian people for not throwing trash around.

Great outdoor. I was there because I was curious about the place. Since there are many reviews about it. But I put too much expectation. The place is great for an escape from the city. If you want to work out this is also a nice place to go for a jog/walk.

Dancing Fountains. Margaret Island is a big park - I like parks normally but I don't think I was in the mood for a park the day I visited. We had intended to visit the outdoor pool but changed our minds when we got there as the pool has a lot of slides etc that we did not think we would avail ourselves of so (for us) it would not be worth the entrance fee. On our way out the music started up at the fountain and it was lovely to sit and watch the water rise and fall and twist in time to Verdi's Four Seasons, Simon & Garfunkel's Cecilia and also the Slaves Chorus from Nabucco. It was very entertaining and I had never seen anything like this before.

Really peaceful, worth a visit. It was a beautiful sunny day when we visited Margaret Island. The scenery was fantastic. It's a nice place to go and chill out for a few hours and get away from the city.

Nice and quiet. I went to Margaret Island in the morning and I have to say it has a pleasurable view and nice atmosphere. There are quite a few attractions for kids, such as small mini-cars, tourist trains and bicycles. If I were to live in Budapest, I think I'd visit it at least once a week just to take a quiet walk in the morning. It feels refreshing.

Pleasant, quiet park on an island on the Danube. I visited it in the morning with my brother. It is a beautiful, nice and quiet place to start the day. I think it is a great place to visit for people of any age.

Pretty and pleasant. Nice for a little walk...we were getting a boat from here to join us to the hop on hop off servic, and had a short time here - one of the local attractions it seems as plenty of locals there too...

Good in the Danube. Do disembark on your river cruise on this beautiful little island or walk over one of the Margaret Bridge to the South or the Árpád Bridge to the north of the island. Its beutiful parkland, flowerbeds and dancing fountains make it a popular destination for tourists and relaxing locals alike. The monastic ruins give some insight to its past as an important religious snctuary.

Really fun place!. Cool, fun place. The watershow is amazing!!! There is a fun and cheap waterpark there with slides and pools. There is good food on the island and it i a calm place. You can rent bicicles and electric card wich might be fun. I love the island :)
Very large Island. Worth seeing. Some nice ruins there and a musical fountain. Lot's of walking though so bring your walking shoes.

A Haven. This is a mainly no car haven for tourists and locals where everyone is either on foot or cycling. It's an island in the middle of the Danube and is easily accessible from either side. There is a symbolic statue at the far end of Buda meeting Pest. There are all sorts of outdoor sports going on, and the lido is magnificent. it looks Soviet era, and has loudspeakers which are intimidating and very brutal architecture. The assortment of pools is amazing, and you can see that locals go there to be seen. There are fountained pools, children's pools and serious swimming pools (with or without fountains) and refreshments stands at the side. There are also places to sunbathe...never mid the indoor spas, this is a must visit!

A Respite. A lovely respite in the centre of this big city. Nice to simply wander around. Sit and enjoy the gorgeous fountain while cooling your burnt out feet in the water. Worth a walk. Can hire a bike or electric car if you want but it is only 2.5 K in length so walking is very doable.

Wonderful recreation facilities for runners, swimmers, families. Margaret Island is in the middle of the Danube. It can be reached via a bridge. Once on there you can get a break from touristy Budapest and hang out with the locals - either by enjoying a 5km run once around the island (the have a special runners' track all around the island) or by joining local Budapest families in the open air lido with slides, water features and fun all around.

Very nice island. We stayed in one of the hotels on the island, so had time to explore. It's a lovely place to just stroll around or jog if you are energetic. There are a couple of restaurants and some street food stalls at the city end of the island. There is a modern fountain with a water and music show in the evenings again at the city end of the island. You can get a local bus from one end to the other or there are various bike type vehicles to rent.We tried to get a water taxi off the island but found that they only run at weekends.There is a small zoo and some beautiful gardens.Overall a lovely place to explore, you have no idea that you are in the middle of a city.

Spend a day :) what a beautiful Island. theres fountains dancing to music,trees,food, statues, buggies you can pedal, or electric buggies :) wear good shoes as you will walk ,this is the only place you will pay for the toilets

A huge park in the middle of Danube. We did not plan to go there as first but we bought tickets for the play Oliver Twist which was performed there for just a few days in an open air theatre. The play was good although we do not understand Hungarian. There were a lot of people jogging, cycling and picnicking. It is good for spending half a day walking around.

Green. When you are annoyed already by all the noise, dirt, crammed streets and all-over-concrete (what is natural in a capital) you can find peace and relaxation on the Island - as all the Budapestians are doing it!

brilliant for the all family. It's just an amazing place in the middle of the Danube . You wouldn't even know you are in Budapest it's so quiet and calm ! My 11 years old daughter loved it !we went to the park with the slides ,wave pool and loads and loads of swimming pools !!!!!! It was just wonderful . we brought a picnic with us and spent the all day there (8 hours) .

Lovely day at the Margaret Island pool complex. We spent a very hot Sunday afternoon on Margaret Island enjoying the pools and baths. The pools, which include a rockin' wave pool and medicinal baths, are priced much more affordably than the private baths in Budapest (like the Gellert) and are just as much fun. It's a very family atmosphere and you can lay out in the grass or have a snack at the cafe. They just added a water slide complex that was a blast. One tip - the lockers are free, use them to store your valuables. While were there a local woman gathered the police to announce her pocketbook, cellphone, etc had been stolen from her blanket while she had been swimming. They were not very sympathetic but seemed to try to do their best to help her, while the other locals on nearby blankets were openly scoffing at her. Entertaining but instructive, this was the only crime we came close to our entire stay in Budapest (which is a very safe city) and did seem self-inflicted.One thing I'm sorry we missed by three days was a water polo match at the pool located a bit further down the island. Hungary was playing Montenegro and we heard it was very exciting - check the schedule before you go to see worldclass water polo.

Fantastic. You can get the 4-6 tram up to Margaret bridge, walk up to the bridge or catch a bus. Once there, you can hire, bikes, scooters, bike cars and pedal cars but we chose to walk round. The park is very pretty and peaceful and there are plenty stalls with food/ drink/ ice cream. There are toilets available but you have to pay for them (This seemed to be the case everywhere in Budapest).The park sits on a island in the middle of the Danube and is about a mile and a quarter long and maybe quarter of a mile wide. There is a jogging track around the island, a cycle track and a scenic path you can walk round. As you walk into the park, there is a fountain which is gives light and water shows tro music throughout the day and evening. Fantastic to view.

A Gem! (just a few sharp edges). The Margaret Island is a must see during any longer stay in Budapest. It is typical of Budapest and Hungary as a whole for its inconsistencies. That is to say one can't completely be satisfied. It is very easily accessible, and is worth walking over the newly restored Margaret Bridge, the view of the city makes for terrific photos. I'm writing this review after last nights visit with family and friends. The freshly restored giant fountain at the southern entrance is amazing, and the water and the lights (best after dark) and the occasional music make is mesmerizing. If you are with kids, as I am most of the time, then you will note that the playgrounds are in various states of repair, from new to broken down. The statues and flower beds likewise. You'll also find a few homeless people here and there sadly. Be careful of the travelling vendors, I would avoid them and even the snack bars (because of the prices). There are three places to swim on the island, the Palatinus (avoid it, big and crowded in the summer), the Hajos Alfred swimming pool (more for serious swimming, but it does have a children's area) and the Spa in the hotel at the north end (hotel spa). I would suggest going to the Hajos A. swimming pool, though it does lack the slides and stuff at the Palatinus. What I haven't done (but should) is join the many fit people jogging around the island on the jogging path... There are various other small attractions, being a history buff I would definitely say visit the ruins of the medieval Dominican nunnery, where Saint Margaret (whom the island and bridge are named after) lived. So go. What continues to bother me is Hungarian inconsistency, the failure to keep everything looking prim and proper and in good working order, we still have this attitude here of it's "good enough / it'll do", and I look forward to a time when the emphasis will be on making everything perfect.

Oasis. The island was a great relaxing time .We walked there and you can rent bikes or funny golf looking cars.We decided to walk the whole way and saw gardens, old ruins and lots of everyday life in Budapest.There are outdoor pools to swim in and a favirite spot for runners.Lots of food vendors to buy food from.

Excellent steam baths. We spent 4 or 5 hours here on one of the hot days last week. The steam baths are really nice, the warmer one was best left until the day cooled down a bit. A nice vibe, areas of grass to sit on, and loungers too. There's a wave machine nearer the back and space to play games etc. Worth visiting for a day, cost was 8 Euros.

Beautiful venue for everyone.. The 4-6 tram dropped us on the Margaret bridge and we walked down and into the park. There are many varieties of transport to hire, bikes, scooters, bike cars and pedal cars. Flowerbeds dress the park and there is food and toilets available. Toilets cost money which a big minus for Hungary and the rest of Europe. You don't pay to pee in Australia and the US.The park sits on a island in the middle of the Danube and there is a sandy beach where bathers sunbake and dunk in the Danube. A jogging track around the island is in use and a cycle track very popular with riders. A Feature of the park is the marvelous fountain which is programmed for a water symphony. It pleases the kids as well as adults and there are seats to enjoy the performance. Very tranquil and highly recommended.

Interesting and pretty. My friend and I rented one of the bicycle cars to go around the island and I found that to be the perfect adjunct. With her peddling like Lance Armstrong, we got around the whole island in just under an hour including several stops. Worth seeing are the monastic ruins on the Pest side of the island, the beautiful water tour in the centre, and the Japanese pond at the northerly point. Would highly recommend,

Don't miss this one!. I think that my travel companions and I had walked about 7 miles, all over Budapest, and it was just becoming dusky out. Margaret Island was on my "to do" list so my son (adult) and I decided to rally and continue running our pedometers and hoof it to Margaret Island. What a treasure the island is! As we entered the island the first thing we came upon was the "dancing" fountain which was also lit up and the musical number, of all things, was a pretty obscure Rolling Stones tune.....what could be better.....Mick, lights, dancing water! We stayed by the fountain awhile and then continued trekking on the island past several beautiful garden beds and then heard an altogether different genre of music wafting through the gorgeous summer night air of Budapest....it was the symphony. There was an outdoor theater where if you wanted to pay for a ticket you would be seated in the interior. For those not inclined to purchase a ticket the island has plenty of lawn chairs set up outside the arena and a Jumbo-tron so that you can actually watch the symphony on the big screen. I believe there are free shuttles that will ferry you around the island, but I'm not sure. We saw tons of shuttles but preferred to walk. This truly is a DO NOT MISS place to visit when in Budapest! Great people watching venue also!

A Must Visit. Beautiful, expansive park with a soft running track along the Danube. Filled with bicycles and pedestrians, this city gem is a great way to waste away a day outside. Includes food options, plenty of escape-worthy green area, some ruins and if your feet need a break, simply take the bus back.

Have a rest at this park at the end of a warm day. To cool down I used this park after cycling a whole day in the city nearly every day. What makes this parc atractive? The flower borders, the people, the fountain with music, the water tower, the ruins, the running path we cycled on, the hidden nice corners? All of this, I think. Great meeting place also for all Europe's inhabitants. Loved to have my feet at the border of the fountain to cool my whole body!Some parts of this parc need some update, but you should visit the parc!
Romantic. Romantic, beautiful, relaxing. What more can u ask? Go just before nightfall for a perfect day's ending.

Escape from Margaret Island. I'm sure its normally a lovely place, BUT when we were there June 2013 most of it was shut for renovations, the gardens were sad and underplanted, full of mosquitos and poorly marked paths. We started down one feeling hopeful, but then half an hour later were questioned by park officials as to how we came to be there and were told " The Borders Are Closed" rather unsettling, but we figure we were on a closed path, but they had not blocked off the one entrance to that path that we found. There are a lot of abandoned facilities on the island which made it feel that much shadier. The big Fountain at the entrance was turned off and shut as well. Better give ol' Marg some time to recover and check before you go. it was so dissappointing.

Handles a crowd. A great park set up to handle the big crowds of Budapest. We strolled across the Margaret bridge from the Pest side on a beautiful Sunday afternoon with a huge crowd of people out enjoying a day in the park. Lots to do, we rented a bike, a pedal car, and jut walked the paths. Even with the large crowds the park was enjoyable.

Relaxing and refreshing. Easy access by tram 4-6 to this lovely green island in the middle of the Danube. Lots of paths take you around the island and lots of fun in hiring different way of transport being bikes/golf carts/of toy cars. Loved the Japanese garden and the water fountain is a must see

I'm not Impressed. In my opinion, there's no reason to give up any time site seeing in Budapest to check out Margaret island. It is a beautiful place, but the beauty does not compare to the grandeur and splendor of the city. Consider spending your time checking out the Parliament or the Castles instead. If you do decide to take the trip to the island, make sure you pack a snack and BYOB because the prices are seriously INFLATED once you step on the boat to get to the island. Also, I didn't see any bathrooms at all. So, make sure you're prepared!

Don't miss Margaret Island!. Only about 1 mile long, it may take you all day to visit! After getting off the Hop On Hop Off boat, we started down the right side of the island. In addition to a wonderfully shaded area to escape the 95 degree weather, we saw a unique little zoo with storks, deer, rabbits, and ponies (all of which were different than in the US) and many were open so you could actually get quite close to the animals. There were some beautiful gardens, great green spaces, and just a lovely place to take a stroll. At the northern tip of the island, there was a small, but exquisite little garden with ponds and lily pads. Coming back along the left side, there is a rubber running path. Since my husband's feel were bothering him, it was an ideal way to walk the last mile! Along that side, there is a swimming complex that can hold 22,000 people. We didn't think to bring our suits, but if we had, we'd have had an even more relaxing day!

Allow lots of time to chill!. We went by boat on a hot day, tried and failed to see all the sights and got v tired from walking! Allow half a day if you are eating and maybe consider hiring a buggy/bike. The musical fountains are great, and the park itself is lovely and lush.

Disappointing. We visited Margret Island for a romantic walk, and found it very disappointing. The "kissing tower" was closed, the gardens were roped off, workmen everywhere, and there were lots of mosquitos. Maybe when everything is open, and there are no renovations occurring, it would be a nice place to go.

Oasis in middle of the Danube. Don't miss this place! Still after the huge flood this was a beautiful island, where you can eat,drink,relax etc. in park like surroundings. Couple of tips, it's few km walk from city centre(Pest side) or Castle Hill(Buda side). So we took a nice river cruise, that stopped in the island. Then few hours over there and then hop in back to ship. And when you are in Margaret Island, hire a bike(normal,tandem etc) or a golf car, so that you can easily see the whole island

Very nice stroll. I went during winter, you get to have the park almost entirely to yourself. Beautiful place to take pictures and to be by yourself with the Danube, right in the middle of Budapest.If you're not used to walking, though, be aware that it's a 3km walk from one bridge to the other.Also, the passageway from the Margit bridge is not the nicest. I could only tell for looks, but I wouldn't like to cross it at night.

Hire bikes and have fun.. We spent a couple of hours exploring this tranquil and relaxed island on a 6 seater bike. It has a distinctly holiday feel with Hungarians and tourists alike picnicking, exercising or wandering in the gardens. A perfect, chilled afternoon after a night spent in the ruin bars!

Great place for leisure. A beautiful peaceful island. The best place to take a stroll and free your mind from worries or what not. It was nice too see people/families walk and jog around. We went there quite late so we didn't get to see the whole island, it was like a huge park! Make sure you have enough time to fully experience what Margaret Island can offer you!

Don't miss it. Margaret island is a must when you visit Budapest. We were there in November. There are lots to see and do including the outdoor adventure centre and the waterpark. Allot was closed when we visited but we wanted to see Saint Margaret if Hungary' grave, in the old Dominican convent. For us there was only one way to see this island and that on the pedal cars you can rent as you enter the island from the bridge. There are little cars that look like beetles but these are the most expensive. In the same are there are blue peddle cars with red roofs that are easier to cycle and cheaper. For myself and my partner it was less than €5 , 1300 HUF, For an hour. This was enough time to go around the entire island see everything including some parks ponds and a little outdoor cafe. Cycling is a great way to see the Buda Sid elf the city from the island. The bike also have roofs that keep out the rain. Some even have lights for the evenings. You need to leave identification such as a passport with the company to take the bike. We only had a credit card but the woman was very accommodating and allowed us to take the bikes. We had one of the best hours we had in Budapest, full of laughs. There are some great photographs to take if that's what your into. You can get 2 or 4 sweater bikes and each can take 2 small children on the front. Trust me you won't regret this fun day out. If your planing a day out at the park you have to pay for the public toilets, which are immaculately clean. It's 50 censor less and I think the ticket allows you to use them all day.

Green Space. Like Central Park in the middle of the Danube. Wonderful Spas, public and private. Medieval ruins, lovely gardens and walking paths. Family entertainment, bike rentals local color. Don't miss it

Beautiful retreat in the middle of the hustle and bustle. An oasis in the middle of the Danube - situated just off the 4/6 tram line, Margaret Island is the place to be on a sunny afternoon in Budapest. It air is fresher, the people are happier, and the kids have places to run away and expend all their wildness. There is something for everyone here: 5k+ rubber running path around the perimeter, parks, pools, picnic areas, sunbathing spots, ruins of a church, musical fountain (which ATM is out of commission), bars, restaruants, cotton candy, bike and other rentals, and lots more. It is a mini retreat still in the city. I totally recommend going (as I myself go every weekend for a run or some sun!)

Beautiful Island in the Danube. Beautiful island in the middle of the Danube. No motorized vehicles allowed. Terrific place to rent a bike, go for a run, stroll around or even swim at the old Olympic training facility.
Definitely worth a visit.

Tranquil Oasis. A lovely peaceful area just away from the main city streets with only a few buses and delivery vehicles passing by. Great for a bike ride or a more leisurely walk, or if you feel really energetic there is a jogging track around it too! The Japanese garden gives a very relaxing feeling. have been told it can be VERY busy on a summer's afternoon. The small zoo park and birds will amuse you too.
lovley place to visit. good views and beautiful features !! there was not alot of activites but is nice to go to and just relax

Fun way to spend a sunny day!. Margaret Island is a welcome break from the city especially on a sunny day. We rented a bicylcle that seats 4 with 4 wheels and went around the whole island. The kids also played in the play ground which is quite big while we soaked up the sun. There are pools for swimming for money but we did not have the time to take a swim but they looked quite nice. All in all it is a nice park like Retero in Madrid but smaller.

Lovely for an escape from the city. Margaret Island offered a break from the the traditional sightseeing and walking in the busy city during my trip in May 2013. There are lots of different types of transport to rent - some very fun and adventurous such as the option I chose - a little blue car for two people with pedals like a bike. Great fun, although it could have done with a couple of gears! We rented the bike/car for 2 hours and felt like that was enough time as the weather wasn't so great but on a sunny day I'm sure you could spend many hours out in the parks and seeing the sights on the island. Lovely escape if you have the time during your trip.

An oasis in the middle of the Danube. Margaret Island is a fantastic place. We got the Metro and after crossing the bridge we had a short walk to the northern tip of the island at which point we strolled along the river Danube. Imagine Hyde Park in London being in the middle of the river Thames and you get the picture. This is a huge island in the middle of the Danube which is all about relaxation and enjoyment. There are parks, a zoo, hotels and bars / restaurants. We loved it and it gave a huge sense of escapism away from the busy city of Budapest. The southern point of the island is busier as this is the most common entrance, but I would recommend starting at the norther point as it is quieter.

An island park. We took the boat and got off at the island. There are sporting amenities here and lots of open spaces, and food outlets. We visited on a bank holiday and think the rest of Budapest decided to go as well. There was a great atmosphere with fairs and entertainment. Otherwise if you visit when there is no bank holiday still go for a walk and some peace away from the crowds.
Beautiful island. Excellent place to be for families with children and friends. Easy accessible, quiet but lots of things to do (rent a bike and visit the whole island). We really enjoyed our visit!

Time to Relax and Refresh. It's all about walking and enjoying nature, sunbathing, gazing at the Danube, leisure strolling or a b risk jog, looking at animals at the small zoo, cycling on a surrey, people watching and maybe enjoying a beer or ice cream. No cars allowed on this little island on the banks of the Danube
very peaceful place. If you are visiting Budapest, spend a little time at the Margaret island: get a bike or an electric car a take a trip across the island.

Great place to go for a walk!. If you are trying to get your 10k steps for the day. The entire route around the island will help you get the 10k steps you need and many recommend. There is also the workout section where you can use a gym or join some exercise classes they have in the morning. There is also a Yoga class if you are into that. I did a Russian Kettlebell class there one time and that was pretty neat. I got walking/running here with my SO. There are others running around also but I like it because it is setup exactly to get 10k steps. There are also some ice cream and pastries in the inner workings of the islands all around. There are also various exercise outdoor machines and warm up places before you go for your run, jog, walk. Also is a dedicated runing walkway which is padded. It's a single lane so I mostly let the runners have a go at it while I enjoy it when I'm walking but I pass to the right for the fast ones! Overall a great park and place to just get away from the city. Concerts are played here often also.

rent a bike. We rented bikes for two hours and saw the whole island. It's a beautiful green island full of nice things to do. The Japanese garden is very simple, but it has a pond with tortoises. Try the "langos" a kind of fried pancake with sour cream and cheese.

IT IS THE IDEAL PLACE TO RELAX. Bycicles for two or for four persons, a small train, or walking ,whatever you choose, is nice to go around the Island that is not very big,enjoy the flowers,the trees and don't miss the Chapaness Garden with the waterfall.

Crowded, run-down, and boring. So, I actually live near Margitsziget and decided to check it out when I had a free Saturday with pleasant weather. It wasn't a very pleasant experience. One, there is not a lot to do there and a lot of the buildings are run-down looking or closed. There are literal historical ruins on the island, which is fine, but there are also "modern ruins" that are just eyesores--buildings that have been abandoned and covered in graffiti. But the worst problem was how crowded it was. Maybe the day I went there was an anomaly, but the crowd seemed incredible to me. I felt like I was back in the States at Six Flags or something like that, with young couples and families running every which way. It was the very opposite of relaxing. And forget coming here to do something you normally do in parks, like play frisbee or something. You'd never find that much unoccupied green space. You'll be lucky if you find a place for your picnic blanket.

Pleasant but not spectacular. Margaret Island is a pretty parkland setting. There is nothing spectacular about it but it provides a pleasant few hours of strolling and just enjoying nature. There is access to it by boat or by just walking over the bridge.
Nice small island in the middle of the Danube. If you are a runner, you'll find this small island in the middle of Danube especially attaractive. Besides, it is also a very nice and green place.

hire a bike and cycle. a nice island in the heart of budapest, would recommend hire a bike and cycle there. there are a few things to do for both the parents and kids; water park, zoo and health spare.

It is but do not expect too much!. It is good to go there and spend some time. I would say that 2-3 hours are good... you can rent some electrical vehicles which are for 4 people and I think the price was 4500 HUF or you can have some bicycle vehicles again for 4 people. You will be able to find some plases to eat and drink but there are only few.In reality what this "island" offers is some nature and a good place to walk.

Green space and quiet. I find that Budapest is very noisy so we walked from the inter continental hotel, to Margaret island in April. Day was over 20 degrees so was very warm and sunny. Walked for about 30 min to get there, walked to the very end and you will be in Japanese gardens which were nice to see. Trees were interesting and Lillie's in pond very nice to view. You can walk or run around the entire island. If you like to walk, it is a nice place to get away from crowds.

Discover the island with a family-cycle. There are different vehicles you can rent on Margaret island. One of them is the so-called 'Bringó hintó', which is a pedal driven vehicle for 4 or 6 people. Last year there were small electric cars to be rented, too. Or you can go for a ride on the micro-bus. There's a little zoo, a look-out tower, a swimming-pool, an open-air pool, several sports facilities, a fountain, a running track going around the island, a ruin, two hotels, a play-ground for children and last but not least a lot of huge trees.

A haven in the midst of Budapest. I could say over and over that your trip would not be complete unless you visited so and so...Everyone has different tastes ..However 'Your trip would not be complete without an hour or two wondering Margarest Island..'It is an easy walk to the Margaret bridge and then descend the steps ono this haven of peace and tranquility..It is a great place to take a picnic..but there are coffee places and a restaurant or two..but by choice is a picnic hamper ..and whatever drink is your choice..
Scruffy and unappealing. The title says it all really. Littered, dirty with clapped out scruffy buildings........what an eyesore.
Oases in a buzzzing city. great atmosphere, lots of space and nature in the middlle of the big Danube river located in the big city: Budapest. Concerts, sportsfacilities, picnic, etc....

RIVER ISLAND THAT DANUBE TOUCHING. BUDAPEST: MARGIT SIGETRIVER ISLAND THAT DANUBE TOUCHINGBy Zoran SlavicIt is an incredible feeling current relaxation when you are in the green Margit Siget. In the middle of the Danube. Transfer from the incredible climax of Budapest, whereas if for a minute do not stop wailing siren ambulance and the police, are embedded in the overall noise of the big city, is fast and elegant. Buses, taxis, bike. Even the walks! Therefore, the shock of pleasure and beauty is so stunning and relaxing. So: Margitsziget (Margaret Island) is a huge island between the two bridges: Margit-híd and Arpad-hid. Seemingly, it is nailed to the Hungarian capital, a few hundred meters away; this is an island where the city rests his soul. Halfway between Buda and Pest, Hungary largest island in the Danube, originally known as Rabbits Island, now popular as Margaret Siget centuries represented, first, religious rarity, then resort and spa, and today is all that and more tourist attraction, of course. This river island, in the urban environment, an unusual feature of this city. Margit siget has given Budapest, the Hungarian capital, another dimension to the city that has long takes up an important place in a great range of world capitals. Related to Budapest, in recent times, with Margaret and Arpad Hido, this island has been inhabited since Roman times when it was in the Middle Ages monks visited due to its isolation from everyday life, but also kings, due to the hunting. It is called by the name of daughter of Hungarian King Bela (Adalbert) III, Margaret, who is the became a nun in the 13th century. In the 19th century, the island became a place available the ordinary people of this city. Suitable for couples. For Margit Siget I first heard it in the late sixties, the radio transmission water polo match our team against Hungary, taking place in one of his famous pools. Maybe that is the one that bears the name of Alfred Lajos, Olympic winner in the 100 and 120 m from 1896. Year. Having learned about the fact that this place is in the middle of the Danube real small archipelago of island's eighteen, I could not decide what to admire more: the nature that created them, or entrepreneurial, persistent and pedantic Hungarians throughout the centuries and decades of adapting these islands new purpose. The one purpose, which has always been in collusion with what the man from the city, returns themselves, their bodies and their souls. Thermal pools, walking trails, tennis courts, fishing, beaches, open theater, interesting bike trail, two large and representative hotel (old'' Grand Hotel'' Siget Margit, with marble bathrooms and rooms of incredible dimensions, and "Thermal Hotel") only part of the content that this Danube island has to offer the residents of Budapest and numerous tourists. Including the inescapable and cute Japanese. The Chinese, however, are not here today, foreign tourists! Many of them live in Budapest. Of the neighboring islands, which are bound in the chain of recreation, entertainment and leisure, first mention Old Budim Island, Óbudai Sighet, which is the biggest rival Margit Sighet, mostly because of the fame that has seen in recent years: it has become known as '' Pepsi'' island. The name is derived from a weekly pop-music festival, which brings together the most famous pop groups in the world and over 300,000 visitors. Is not bad and remember the names of some other islands Danube between Pest and Buda, such as Haros, NEP, Molnar, Palotai, Szentendre, and Chapel. If nothing else, at least be surprised how many are refined and regulated by your drawing our previous in this area. Is not bad and remember the names of some other islands Danube between Pest and Buda, such as Haros, NEP, Molnar, Palotai, Szentendre, and Chapel. If nothing else, at least be surprised how many are refined and regulated by your drawing our previous in this area. In Budapest, Hungary, which have multiple destinations for enjoyment.

A peaceful retreat in the middle of the river. I didn't know what to expect from Margaret Island but it was worth taking a trip there on a sunny day. As part of our boat cruise we were able to take the boat there, take around for a few hours and then be guided back along the Danube at dusk. This is mainly a park but there are a couple of hotels with spa treatments if that's what you're looking for. The musical fountain comes alive every hour and there's a lovely garden to explore. Not many places to eat and drink so you may want to bring a small picnic with you. This is an island, mainly for young lovers to escape the city and indulge in romance! - this is also a working park, there are schools and houses but it is not densely populated. if you have spent too much time walking along Budapest's busy streets, then this is a welcome retreat for a few hours.

Largest park - easy access. Spend a less than two hours walking from end to end incl a coffee break, or spend the entire day in this set of green lungs in the middle of the Danube. Tons of things to do. Another cheap thing to do in Budapest. In Pest, take tram 2 north until the last stop. From here, walk onto the bridge and furtheron to the island. Walk to the other end, and return by bridge to either Buda or Pest and commute back.

hire a bike and enjoy the ride. Not a huge amount to see on this island in winter but we hired the 4 seater bike for a half hour spin which took us round the island, kept us warm from peddalling and filed us with laughter. Was worth the visit for that if nothing else. Imagine its a pretty place to visit and walk along the Danube in Spring/Summer

Walk in the park. I know it was Winter (December 2012) and I am sure there is alot more going on in the warmer months but this was just a walk in the park on a cold winters day. There was a small animal farm with a few animals but apart from that and alot of statutes that was it
Nothing to do here in winter. I'm sure this is a great place during spring and summer, however i dont think its worth spending your time visiting it in winter..

Good for strolling. This place is really far from what could be called an "attraction", you can walk around the island to get some fresh air, and mainly that's it. There's a small zoo and a "running circle" around the island if you want to do sports, and on summers there are a few clubs where you can go to have fun, but there are more interesting places in Budapest where you can spend your time.

Nice, but no cafe open during winter. We walked around Margaret Island and enjoyed the vegetation but we couldn't find one open place to drink a coffee. That was a bummer. In addition seem the building pretty rotten and are ugly.

Cold and windy, not much to see. We made a stop during our city tour here, and walked around for an hour. We didn't see anything interesting and the only good thing with the island was the gluhwein we bought from the small kiosk in the middle of the island. Probably very nice with nicer weather, but on wintertime I wouldn't bother.

Don't bother in Winter!. We had a 4 night stay in Budapest in January and our original plan was to take a day trip to Vienna. We changed our mind last minute and as such had a more relaxing day in Budapest, which involved a walk along Margaret Island.First mistake - we decided to catch the Metro to the furthest end of the island away from the centre, and then walk back to the city. Had to get off in not the nicest area and do a long, cold, boring walk over a featureless bridge. Once we got onto the island we could see the running track, which is an excellent facility, and it was well used. We walked the full length of the island and all we really saw were run down buildings and graffiti, it didn't look very well cared for at all.I'm guessing in summer it's much more appealing, and once we got to the city-end it got busier and there were cycles for hire etc which could be fun, but in winter the only redeeming feature was the gentleman selling yummy hot wine from a small stand which was sorely needed! If you're here in winter and you absolutely have to see it, then just make sure you aren't sacrificing any better sights.

Great park setting in the middle of Budapest!. My family and I bike and walk at Margit Island as often as we can, and we just LOVE IT! There are amazing parks for children of all ages on the island, and the bike trails are perfect for families with small children, as well as people of all ages. Beautiful scenery, lovely gardens, good restaurants on the island.....great, great place to visit while in Budapest!
Tranquil park in the middle of Budapest. This is a lovely place to go for a walk or bike ride (you can hire bikes) on a nice day or if you are feeling romantic there are also horse drawn carriages.

A bit overrated, yet nice. The island is nice for killing time or taking it easy. It is definitely yhe place to go for locals, especially with small children. However, as tourists, I did not find it as a place worth visiting. Budapest has other attarctions to offer
Great solution. Margaret island lies on Danube between Margit and Arpad bridge. No traffic allowed. Paradise for nature lovers.

Loads to see and do. Although it was new years eve when we walked around this island you can see that in summer the place would be buzzing as there is so much to do on the island. Sports and outdoor activities in abun dance. There is a cushioned running track (single lane) that joggers use all year round that goes right around the island and it was busy even when we went. There is a hot spring and a very grand hotel and spa reswort on the island too.One thing.... mind the dog poo!

Dancing, eating, jogging, walking, laying on the sun.... Margaret Island is a green island in the middle of the vibrant city. In the winter or autumn I always go there for a walk if I wish to clean my mind and stay away from the crowd.At summer and spring is nice to have a party at Cha-cha-cha or Holdudvar, daytime laying on the sun or pursuing a sport with friends. There are other activities for example you can roll with funny bicycle or find hidden places to make love.:-) Different programs also are available during summertime, like watching a drama at the open-air theater or taking part in the hemp festival.

Margaret Island. Its a wonderful island in the middle of the city, with lots of trees, animals, with a small but very nice zoo. There are a lot of local people jogging, running, doing any kind of sports. Its full of life, energy. It has also some good playgrounds for kids.

A must in Budapest. Especially during summer Margitsziget is one of the best places to be in budapest. You can find here from bar's\pubs or restaurants to spa's\ hotels and a lot of facilties for lovers of outdoors activities such cycling.

Lovely island especially in Autumn!. This was a wonderful island, you can get to from 'Y' Bridge. We also had a boat tour round it. There is a running track around the outside or you can take a stroll away around 1 hour or so. In Autumn it looks fantastic as the yellow/orange leaves have fallen!
Don't bother in November.. Went in early nov. Nothing was open. Trees were pretty and nice to escape the city,but don't expect to do anything besides take a stroll or run the great running path.
Nice for walks. Lovely place to go for a walk. You can also rent bikes if you wanted and there is a running track on the outside.

Beautiful place to walk.. This is a very peaceful oasis in a very busy and vibrant city. There is an olympic sized swimming pool where the residents of Budapest take time out during their very hot summers to cool off. Many outdoor cafes to sit and enjoy a glass of excellent Hungarian wine as you watch the world go by.

Shall we walk, run or ride?. Margaret Island translated from the Hungarian Margit Sziget offers not just the opportunity to have a leisurely stroll and take in the fountain with musical co-ordination but also has a running track made of the sort of stuff you get in childrens playgrounds to take the strain of running....never seen that before, certainly not in a park. There were dozens of people using this facility. I have to admit walking on it was very good for the feet after walking around the island for most of the afternoon. Even though it was late September some flowers were still in bloom and the scent of these was a real feast for the nose. It was glorious sunshine too.As we were stopping nearby we decided to come back and try out the car bikes built for two, thinking this would be a quicker way of getting around. Wrong! It was a very good exercise for the legs and we are glad we only had it for half an hour or we might not have been able to walk away from it. Our legs ached! But we felt better for it and had a good laugh along the way.
Great place for a stroll. What a wonderful place to take a stroll ,have a lunch and enjoy the out of doors...be sure to use you hop-on Hop-off ticket for a boat ride to the Island ..Enjoy !

Go for a walk.. Many locals like to escape the city and come to Margaret Island to walk, run, or ride their bikes. Children can rent little peddle cars and drive like little angels or maniacs depending on their parenting. There are places to get ice cream and snacks. There is a beautiful fountain that is set to music, stay around a while, the song and water pattern will change. Well done. They have a rubberized jogging lane, swimming pool with high dive (check the schedule). There are many beautiful trees to look up to and admire. No shortage of smokers or cigarette butts. No need to pay for a guided tour, just get a good guide book to tell you what to see.

Nice park to relax in. The park is really a get away place in the middle of the busy city of Budapest. Lots of space for the children to run around and playgrounds to keep them busy. Be careful where you decide to eat as there are only a few places and some of them seem to use the advantage of being few to serve something they call food.
Hire electric car. The electric car. Massive fun for 4300 HUF/hour (c.15 Euros). We went here as part of the hop on-hop off cruise deal and also enjoyed the petting zoo and tranquility.

island - playground of the Budapest. Margaret island (Margitsziget) called the playground of the city, this island, it is forbidden for cars, has everything you need to enjoy a day of relaxation. Here we have a sports stadium, numerous tennis courts, swimming pools outdoor, open-air theater, a rose garden and a Japanese garden, the remains of the early Middle Ages, two hotels with thermal water and shelter for the beer.Complete relaxation you can experience the Margit island, walking many parks, watching the fishermen or just sitting by the fountain, listening to quiet melodies of Liszt.

Hot day in Budapest. Visited in July, it was very hot and we wanted to make the most of the weather. Visited Margaret Island with my Husband and we had an enjoyable day. The queue was not too long after we go off the bus. We entered and went to the little window on the right hand side to get a safety deposit box for our valuables, watches and rings etc. if we had thought further ahead we should have left these in the hotel safe. It was a little odd to be given an old wooden draw to but our belongings in but the system seemed to work and gave us peace of mind. We walked through the complex of pools to try and find a nice spot with a bit of shade, it was 37 degrees so very hot! We found a spot and got some loungers off the piles that were dotted around, some people were just sitting on their towels on the grass etc but the loungers were only about £2 for the day so we thought they were worth it. Staff come round throughout the day and take the money for the loungers and give you a ticket, if you have already paid earlier, you just show your tickets when they come round. We enjoyed the size of the pools and range, this is not a spa but more like hydro pools with jets and water fountains and pools of differing temperatures, our favourite bits were the very small whirpool in the middle of the jacuzzi pool which is activated every half and hour or so, it is very fast and fun. Also the wave pool where the waves come on once an hour for about 15-20 mins. It would be better if the wave pool was more often. People had balls and toys in the pools, there was enough space without upsetting other people.We had cocktails from the bar which were delicious and reasonably priced - would recommend.The actual complex here is quite old, the toilets need a bit of a makeover and the changing rooms are not very well lit etc but we knew this in advance, we were glad of somwhere private to change after a day in the sun and this suited us fine. I would recommend this day out to anyone in Budapest at this time of year it is fun but based on other reviews take your own food in, we had some crisps to keep us going and take some flip flops if you have them.

Lovely place for a walk or cycle. It is accessed by a bridge with the same name. This is a lovely park on an island in the middle of the Danube. It's a great place to spend a couple of hours cycling, walking or having a picnic. There are several places to rent bikes on the island. You can stop for a coffee, watch the runners ... great on a hot day.

A Nature Oasis in a beautiful city. Take hiking shows and access the Island from wither end. Situated in the middle of the Danube it offers a canopy of majestic sycamore trees, an urban zoo, a senic tour, a monastery, massive pool complex in summer, monuments, fountains, and spectacular views of the City. Urban parks are common but this ranks as one of the best I have ever seen. There are "small trains" to help you get around and bike ways bit it is Not accessible by cars. ( without a permit). For the runners in the ctoud there is a massive rubber track that goes around the circumfrance of the island.
Nature for a walk.... Near to the river, place for a walk....There is a bus going there, a tram too...Nice experience, in the weather is sunny, as in my 2nd trip there!

Chill out. A great place to chill out, gym and relax!!!! Peacefull place, full of green and quiet.A nice place to spent 2 hours especially after a tiring walk to the sightseeings! We rent a bike-car for 6 people - really exhausted and after 20 minutes we rent a car vehicle and we it was really good and relaxing.we had a quick lunch in on of the canteens eating traditional sausages and fresh fries potatoes!!! (yami yami)
Great place to relax. We found the island lovely and relaxing. We took an electrical car so it was fun too. If you want to escape a few hours from the city , go there.

a stroll around is a must do thing. strolled around here more than once on every visit to budapest and this year a few days after i ran the marathon i had to join the several hundred locals and ran around it on the soft path , oh i would do every day if lived here  but if just strolling slowly wonderful as you slowly admire the views of buda and pest as you pass , all the boats going on their business , in the park there is the impressive water fountain timed with music , a small zoo , plent things to look at inc sports places , it free to go in and accessible via margaret bridge

Fun place to chill. We spent a few hours here; it's easy to walk to and we rented "land pedalos" (those four-people bikes) for a reasonable price, which was a great way to explore. There's not a huge amount to do, but it was very pleasant, we just cycled around, saw the fountain and flower areas and some ruins, also saw red squirrels (exciting to a Brit used to grey ones), and stopped to eat at one of the stalls (basic food but good fried potatoes and sandwiches). I'd recommend fitting a visit here in if possible, though it's nothing hugely unique to Budapest so not an essential.
