PS Don't forget 150Ft for the toilets (very well kept and clean, though I still don't understand why you're given a receipt for going...)

Lovely place for a cycle or walk. This is a lovely park on an island in the middle of the Danube. It's a great place to spend a couple of hours either cycling, walking or having a picnic. There are several places to rent bikes on the island. You can stop for a coffee,watch the runners...great on a hot day.

Very poor ordinary park. Walked across on our last day expecting to have a full day here. Very disappointing ! Felt very run down if it wasn't the fact that there were lots of conkers would not have got 2 stars!!! Would only recommend if you wanted a break from the city and you did not mind resting in a non spectacular space!
You cannot miss that. Save a day to go to this incredible island in the middle of the Danube. Rent a bike or go for a walk, get a coffee and enjoy the nicest gardens of the city

Going to one place in Budapest? Go here.. I lived in Budapest for a year, and Margaret Island was by far my favourite place in the city.It is a giant part on an island, and includes the ruins of two monasteries, a zen garden, a bandstand, a few cafes, ice cream stands, and acres of park land where you can sit an enjoy the sun.My absolute favourite place to sit (and one of my top places in the world for a picnic) was in the ruins of the old monastery. There's a small tree, with a bench beneath it, and you can sit in the shade and watch the world go by. So peaceful.I also like sitting beneath the tree in the zen garden (I think it's a cherry tree, gorgeous blossom anyway), beside the waterfall, watching the terrapins in the water.The musical fountain makes me smile.There are many places to buy langos (a Hungarian snack, deep dried dough covered in sour cream and cheese), frankfurters and potato wedges. You can also rent pedal cars and golf buggy's to drive around the island.

very tired. The japanese garden was pretty but nothing special. Eerily also went to the hotel margitziget . It was empty and did not have grand elegance expected of such a grand hotel. Not worth getting off the boat to view. We were the only ones who got off and now we know why !

pleasant but a bit 'tired'. took tram to southern end of island & walked to northern tip. Pleasant to be away from the traffic noise with the sun shining through the trees - there are some huge ones dotted about. Alot of the lawns, flower beds, etc are poorly tended. The tower at the cafe part way along, appeared almost derelict & there was some loud retro music blaring out. We felt we had walked into a time warp!! Overall an ok way to spend a couple of hours but don't expect a well-manicured garden.

A nice place to walk and jog. It is in the middlle of the Danube River. It is quiet and nicely landscaped with lots of trees and seasonal flowers. There is a hotel there. With tree-lined walkways to jog or walk and enjoy the river at the same time. Do bring mosquito repellent. I was eaten alive.

What a lovely relaxing place. Catch tram no 2 to the end of the line and walk across the bridge to the island. What a beautiful relaxing place. We walked the length of the island and had coffee at the Kamilla Coffee House. Lovely gardens and plenty seating areas. You can get the bus back or walk. Bikes for hire too.

Lots to see. Loved the musical fountain. Quite a large island with lots to see and do We saw a fountain which was in time to music. Two baths, one which the local Hungarian swim team use to practice. A bird sanctuary and plenty more. Stayed a full day here and used it to have a picnic.

A place to court girls, pet dogs and soak up sunshine. Arguably the best place for recreation and jaunts. You can also board ships of the Budapest Transport Company and do a Danube cruise with a modest 1.8 EUR ticket (you pay it once aboard).

A nice way to spend a couple of hours.. We went via public transport and (slowly) made our way from the South to the North of the island - its about a couple of KM and is very pretty. Didn't go at night but it looks like it would be fun. Plenty of different transport to hire and things to do, at cost, but its nice to just walk around and chill out.
PLEASANT WALK AROUND!. Nice to get away from the traffic noise and walk around the island! Quite a walk though and toilet facilities are not too obvious!
hire a tandem. peaceful and interesting, lots of garden areas, musical fountain, worth exploring for an hour or two, no traffic

A brilliant get away. What a surprise this island was. We were not ready for the size of it. We did hire a bike, which I was glad we did, just to get to get to the other end and back again. There is a lot to see, kids and adults alike. If it hadnt been so hot I would have loved to have tried out the running track around the island it was soft and spongy perfect for my tired legs.The musical fountain was lovely but not well looked after could do with some TLC. There are some animals for the kids to look at, a lovely garden for adults, and a swimming pool to cool down in. Plenty of food and drink available. An excellent place to chill out and get away from the hussel of the main town

Very nice afternoon. It's a place very nice to spend the afternoon walking, or running.At the beginning of the island there is a fountain, which "dances" with the music, quite nice classical music.It has as well a beergarten, where the food is not expensive at all, the cocktails were good and the cheapest I have ever had in my life (800HUF for a mojito, 2.80 euro for a mojito), and walking inside of the island there is a small zoo where the animals can be seen very close, mainly birds, but there are horses as well and some other animals.Is one of the memories that we will have always in mind.

A lovely quiet retreat in a bustling city. Margitsziget is a lovely oasis of calm and green, completely separate from the busy city all around. It is easy to reach by tram or bus and it surprises because of its size. You could walk around it and see the zoo with its storks and horses, the ruined convent and the wonderful flower displays. Or you could hire a bike or an electric buggy if you are feeling tired. Or, you can catch the bus which goes the length of the island. Like everywhere else in Budapest, access is so easy and the results are often surprising. Well worth a half day.

Fab!!. Loved Margaret Island! Very cool little pub/rest when you first come onto the island off tram 4 or 6. Its on the left side and down the stairs. cheap beer and great view. Also really loved renting a pedal car and taking it around the island with our two year old. The one company had pedal cars with carseat things in the front which was perfect! A must do in Budapest!

Lovely place to visit. A lovely place to visit, an island in the middle of the Danube, huge island...locals go running around it, lots to do here too; swimming, relaxing, football....dont forget to watch the fountain as you enter Margaret Island, it works to music which is really cool...well worth visiting.

Worth a visit. There are not many open spaces in Budapest so the island is a welcome area to breathe a bit of clean air. Good soft surfaced jogging track right around the perimeter. Attractive gardens including Japanese garden with turtles in a pond with waterfall. Couple of snack bars to keep you going when it is hot as it was when we visited. Electric cars a good laugh and easiest way of seeing the island. We felt it was worth a half-day. Public toilets (150 HUF fee) absolutely spotless and a real pleasure after some of the dreadful places we have been forced to use in the UK.

Great place for rest. Margaret Island is a very nice place to have a rest or walk around. I saw a lot of people taking picnics or just laying on the grass. There are paddle cars and bikes for rent - I recommend renting them instead of one of the electric carts at the entrance of the park. We rented one electric cart, but it was quite difficult to drive, because the steering wheel was totally unballanced and our cart was moving on zigzag. When I told the guy that the carts need serious repair and maintenace he reacted quite rudely. For one hour you have to pay about 15 EUR, and when the time finish and you are in the middle of the park, have to push the cart back to the same place where rented it. Margaret island and park are must to visit place - just bring some food and drinks with you.

Oasis of calm in Budapest. Margaret Island is accessed via the bridge and consists of acres of open space, park land, sporting facilities and the Palatinus baths. Really green, peaceful and beautiful in the summer, you can hire funny cycle cars to get about in, or just do it on foot and enjoy the experience of it all. Take a picnic.
Nice island for a walk. Nice little island to walk or rest a little bit. You can rent a bike here but you need to bring a lot of cash cause the warranty for the bike has te be payed in cash.

Margaret Island. We travelled by 'Hop on Hop off Boat' on Saturday 8 Sept to Margaret Island, the round walk took us one and a half hours. We were met by a guide who gave us a map and advised us to turn left at the top of the stairs from the boat, he also stated that the round trip would be 2.2 kilometres. We were concerned that we would never get to the end of our walk. There were many runners and cyclists coming towards us, also many hire vehicles. After our half way walk we then found limited places of interest, two large sports centres that had been closed some years ago. A Zoo and playground for the children. Derelict tennis courts, Swimming pools which only one appeared to be open to the general public, the other swimming facilities we believe belonged to the Hotels. There were ruins of Dominican Convent and Church and St Michael Chapel. We found a Cafe half way round on our journey and a Restaurant upon our return to the boat jetty. The boat trip was excellent, plenty of English and German tourist information, but if you are not keen on walking, Margaret Island is not for you.

A quiet retreat in the city centre. Beautiful walk. Very hot the day we were there. Loads of places to sit down and enjoy views and people watch. Loads of places to eat and drink at top of island and bottom of island.
So so. Not a great deal to do here but it is out of the hustle and bustle if you want a relaxing break. Worth a visit if you've got a couple of hours to spare
Amazing!. Absolutely stunning especially at night! It certainly ideal to cross from the pest to the buda side.
nice place to visit. I liked this recreation island,,,bike riding, large pools to swim,quiet, great for walking or biking, pinic, food, park like setting in the middle of budepest

Peace and tranquility. What a lovely, tranquil place for a walk in the shade or along the banks of the Danube. Lovely fountains, flowers and footpaths. Opportunity to cycle or walk. The pool at the end does not spoilthe atmosphere with unnecessarty noise. Well worth the visit,

Afternoon chill at Margaret Island. I recommend everyone, who gets tired of an all-day-night sightseeing in Budapest. This kind of Park (island) is in the central of the city, you can approach by with tram 4 or 6. You can do some sports here or just relax. Moreover you can rent a "birngohinto", it's kind of bike droven by 4 people. (it's a great fun :) )

Nice place to relax. nice place to relax for a few hours, rented a bike for a short while and sat by the fountain. a little out of the way if walking from castle hill but not so much if you;re at the parliament building

A must if you are a runner. I'm visiting Budapest at least three times a year, and this August I decided to have a go and run like back home, every second day. First day was a run to the Citadell from area 7. People were watching me as if I'd fall from the moon. The climb up to the Citadell is full of different paths, with lots of garbage and smells...so, clearly, the next thing to visit was this island. Tram stops at the bridge to the island ( I think the tram number is 6 ), went there around six am and when I got off the tram, I knew I was at the right place for a runner to be in Budapest. Lots of joggers, runners, bikers. The path around the island is exactly 5 km long and paved with runner friendly material, which your legs will love. No smells, some garbage, lots of green trees, lovely views... So, if you are a runner, this is to place to be when one is in Budapest. The access from most hotels along the Danube is great, so just put it to must do list, again, if you are a runner or a jogger. Otherwise, nothing special.

Relaxing and green. What a relaxing place! You enter via a bridge on the river Danube and immediately you feel the difference. The bridge is bristling with heavy traffic while the island is vehicles-free (except public transport) and full of trees. We rented a four-wheel bicycle (with very uncomfortable seats) and we crisscrossed the whole island, up to its northernmost point.A great place to visit for a picnic or just to stroll around, like so many people do. It is so large that you'll definitely find a quiet corner to relax. Fantastic!

A good day out. A fun day out instead of sightseeing round Budapest this is a relaxing place to visit there are bicycles to rent,electric buggy's or buggies you peddle for 2 or 4 people then there is a little road train to take you round the Island.There is a fountain who's water dances to music a few cafes to eat and drink a swimming pool area which looked very full when we passed it.plenty grassy areas to picnic.A small zoo or take a quite walk round the island.We took a ride on the train but be warned it was very bumpy but enjoyable.We then took a walk round to see other sights. it's a typical park full of people trying to have a relaxing time.

Nice Place to Relax. The island was easy to reach via one of the bridges near the Parliament building. Lots of paths, nature, I heard there were baths on the island, but I didn't go. It was a lovely place to hang out and relax after a busy morning of siteseeing, but if you are on a tight schedule like I was, you could probably stand to skip it.

Full of surprises. We went here on the national holiday expecting shelter from the burning sun and a bit of peace and quiet. The island was humming with people, you can hire little carts and bicycles. Old ruins, a soft running track around the entire island and on this day also a free open air concert with stalls, food and drink made this a very exciting trip.

7 days on Margaret Island. Spent 7 days at the Grand Hotel on Margaret Island and it was absolutely fantastic! So much to see and do and the locals were very helpful and polite. Scenery was fantastic! Spa resorts are well worth visiting and going for a night cruise on the Danube is a must! Going back next year
Lovely place to chill.. Hired a peddle bike here, took some sandwiches and watched the world go by. Absolutely beautiful flower beds!

Nice for a walk, but not unmissable. Nice for a wander - the prices quoted for attractions on the Island in the Lonely Planet Guide were incorrect so watch out for this! The water tower was about 4 times the price.Lots of shade, beautiful gardens and fountains and a few cafes splattered about. If you have the time and want a nice walk it's great, but it's nothing you'll miss if you don't go. Plus if you're walking to get there, the roads which reach the island are both very busy so not the most relaxing. I think there are buses you can get onto the island too. Lots of bikes and electric cars to rent for added fun.

Just an Island. The place is not overly exciting. It's crowded (at least in the summer), and does not offer much for tourists to do. Could be a nice place for a quick lunch, but the restaurants don't offer anything special or unique.

Stay healthy!. If you need some exercise, this is the right place for you! I jogged on one of the evenings, and it was weekday. The place was crowded with local and foreigners alike, exercise and simply having fun! LOVED IT!

Nice place for rest in Budapest. Great gardens full of lilies, nice swimming pool to have fun during the summer and bikes to rent. Hooray! There are also old architecture structures from the Ottoman times and places to have tea or coffee.

Disappointed. We booked for 2 hours between ferries. We walked all 2 hours mainly around the jogging track shoreline. Tranquil yes, except for the Buda side where the track is fenced off for miles from several swimming pools. Highlight was the fountain. Disappointment - literally no birds or birdsong

Ride by viewing. The Danube River cruise tour included on the brochure "a view of Margaret Island." That was true. There was an announcement on the loud speaker about the island as the boat swung around and headed back toward the city. If you want to see the island, you'll have to go there. My average rating is just from my perspective aboard the ride-by boat.

A bit like a theme park .... We did visit on St Stephen's Day so maybe that's why the island was packed with families and children. It made it very busy and very theme park-like, so we just walked from one end to the other as quickly as we could. We walked from south to north - if you do the same, it is worth taking the bright over the Buda side at the top of the island and going to Obuda (old Buda) and the Fo Ter which was absolutely lovely!

Chill out. We went there and stayed a couple of hours which was sufficient as the island is small and compact. It is easy to walk around and appears to be a haven for the healthy and body-conscious with 5 swimming pools catering for over 1500, sports centres and summer camps for children. A nice place to wander and relax for a couple of hours.

Margitsziget - oasis in Budapest. A green isle in Danube where you get a hiding-place when it gets really hot in the summers. You can take walks around the island, get close to the Danube. You can take swims in the pools and sunbath. The whole isle is like a park, very beautiful with Japanese Garden, Rose Garden and and animals like deer and storks. Only 5 km to Budapest, when you long for city-life. Bus 26 will take you to the city. A place where you can stay when you want both sun-and-city-vaccation. Two hotels you can choose between.

Relaxation anyone?. We went there for two hours only, just to relax from the city and its noise ... the gardens are beautiful ... although the dancing fountain is small, old and weary, but it does its job.We walked on the running track, which circles the island ...There is a small zoo ... a waterpark and a stadium for concerts..we totally loved our relaxation time there and will go there again.Totally recommended for people with children.

Margaret Island/Margitsziget. This is one of the most beautiful places in Europe and when visiting Budapest it is a must see. It is an island on the Danube river between Buda and Pest and a place to relax and enjoy.
Peaceful Spot. We drove on the island but most people walk or bike.A welcome break from the hustle and bustle. Excellent if you have children and need a change of pace.

A city runner's dream. There is a running track all the way around the island. Running from a lot of the hotels beside the Chain Bridge, round the island and back is 10km. Beautiful views, you run along the Danube, through shaded park lands - brilliant!

have a walk. had a walk through the whole island, an area to relax, sleep, or play, a piece of nature in the middle of the city..we did not visit the swiming pool area, but went onto the Water tower with nice view over the city
Very cool spot. Very interesting place in Budapest. Wonderful to relax or to make some sports like jogging. During the night there's some bars/clubs to go out.
small island worth a visit. Had a lovely afternoon here, Hired a bike for 1 hour to get around. Ideal place for city dwellers to relax
Lovely Island. Like a very large park. They do seem to like loud music through the public tannoy system by their swimming pools etc. At one end is a pick up point for the Hop on Hop off boat/bus.

Nice to relax!. I enjoyed to spend one hour there with the guide from 'Legenda' cruises (quay 7), near Elizabeth bridge!
The guide was attentive and very sweet... the tour guide was included in the price and after one hour, the next boat picks you up.
Great relax place. Lots of place to relax, do sports and meet people. I wish we had such an island in Cracow. I recommend to rent a bike.

Lovely place to spend a summer's day. Went to St Margaret's Island expecting to spend an hour there as we had no plans to visit either of the swimming pools but was there for much longer. Some interesting ruins, musical fountains, gardens, play areas and unexpected statues made the visit very interesting. You can hire cycles, children's cars, electric golf carts or cycle rickshaws for up to 6 people to get round the island but it's a very pleasant and easy walk the whole way round it.

Peace and tranquility. If you visit Budapest you must visit Margaret Island. It is a tranquil island with plenty of places to rest, take in the views and get away from the bustle of the city. No 2 tram is the best way to get there from the Pest side.

Lovely picnic spot. We spent a very happy Sunday afternoon here recently. Lovely walk around the perimeter of the island (shock-absorbing jogging route also). Lots of open parkland spaces filled with people of all age-groups enjoying a picnic, lying in the sun, playing ball sports etc. Plenty of cafés and ice-cream carts too. All-in-all, a pleasant afternoon for free!

i expected it better. the fountain was nothing compared to the "fontana magica" of barcelona and the island is smaller than what i tought. renting a bike is very cheap ad very nice.the best thing are the pools!!

take a suit. We walked out to see what it was about. Neat paths to run and some interesting foundations of old monasteries. Kids were climbing in them; totally different from the preservation of Roman ruins-where we had just come from.There were several baths and we were sad we had not brought our suits to participate. I think it would have been more fun. Note that the fountain at the entrance is cued to music. Pretty cool.

park. nice park, lot of joggers, beautiful flowers in flowerbeds and pathways to walk.
I recommend Margaret Island to active rest ;)

A great get-away,. My wife and I spent a day on Margaret Island. We wanted to escape the crowds and this was the perfect place. We rode there on our tandem bike and spent the day just cruising and relaxing in this quiet place.

Place to relax, or go with kids. If you're sick of the crowd and want to relax or take the kids for a nice walk, go to the Margaret Island. There is a small ZOO here (free admission!) and loans, where you can have a picnic.

A great park!. ThHere is lots to see and do on the island park, from swimming or spending time in the spa on the island, just strolling through the flower gardens, sun bathing on the shores of the Danube, and of course dining at one of the restaurants, or food vendors located at various points on the island.

Loved it!. I went there and loved it. The place is so full of live, and full of flowers and coulours. For those who enjoy parks, I highly recommend it. It's gorgeous! And there is a pool, some restaurants and cafés, a beautiful hotel and termal waters. It really is an amazing spot to chill out and having a good time.

You should walk over the island. My honest evaluation is, that if you want to see a lot of locals and want to see, what they are doing, go there. Fantastic island, where you can go to spa, or small zoo(?) or just be or just jog. Personally for me it was disappoint, that I did not realize, that you can actually run there and if I ever go back to the city, I will take my running shoes with me and jog that island around. :)

A good short visit. I went for a walk (boy, did I walk when I was in Budapest) and decided to go and visit Margaret Island because, quite frankly, I like islands. I caught one of the little tour bus type things which drives around the island - a welcome chance for me to sit down for a bit. I then finished my tour by sitting by the musical fountain (which is rather impressive) eating an ice-cream and dipping my feet in the cool water.

Spent hours here. If you have children take them on the island it is great place to spend the day water park very busy Take time to stroll through the park. A bit scruffy and needs money spending on it but it's very good
relaxing place. walk from the Parliament building over the bridge to Margaret Island Sunday Aug 7 we where herethe Island is buzzing loads of people Hire a two pedal car ride round the Island Enjoy
Margaret Island. Great place to ride bikes. Beautiful parks, live music, great jogging paths and spectacular gardens. A very short distance from Buda

Unexpected fun!. My fiance and I went to Margaret Island because we had an afternoon free. We were really surprised at how much fun we ended up having here. We rented a four wheel bike for one hour. It was just enough time to bike around the whole island and see the landmarks there (the map was on the bike). We picked up some corn on the cob and spicy French fries and raced back to bring our bike back on time. I recommend bringing water, cash, and ID (to rent the bike) with you on your visit. There is an ATM and toilets in the swimming pool building.

Spent a few hours.... It was so hot the day we went there. It felt good to sit at the huge water fountain and listen to The Blue Danube Waltz while the waters were dancing, and enjoy the spary coming off them. Nice playground area near-by. Bike rentals, ice cream everything is available. We arrived via the 4-6 tram, but opted to walk back to Pest over the Margit Bridge. Got some amazing photos of the Paliament from there. They a really nice job renewing the bridge. I was hoever saddened to see that the vandels had already broken the cross off some of the crowns located at the entrance to the Sziget.

A big island with lots to do.. We went to the island to specifically rent the four wheeled bikes. In the heat, it was quite a workout, and 30 minutes was plenty for us. I noticed the people who rented at the same time as us, returned in 30 minutes as well. There are two very large pool facilities on this island, as well as a sports facility, two hotels, lots of green space and lots of places to find refreshments. You could spend a whole day, for sure.

Relaxation with great views. One of the ways to visit the island is by a joint tour bus/boat trip. There are tennis and swimming facilites as well as hiring a bike or taking a trip on a mini train, superb.

Green, green, green. I always admire big green parks that give you the opportunity to do different things, from sports to picnik. We rent a car-bicycle which was very funny! Don't forget to sit and listen the music fountain as you enter the island!

lovely place to spend the day. we walked to the Island and then walked all the way round it. A most beautiful place for some peace and quiet. We particularly enjoyed the Japanese garden, would have liked to visit the swimming pools which looked amazing but just didn't have enough time
Great walking or biking park. Lots of attractions, small zoo, large public pool, many fountains, outdoor theater, statues, monastery ruin, bus route, boat access, well used, visit if you have time

Runners haven. If you're staying in any of the river front hotels this is a great location for joggers. My favorite run was to cross from Pest to buda on the Chain Bridge, run the riverfront to the bridge to Margaret Island then run for awhile on the island then finish crossing the bridge. I believe the island has a running path for its entire circumference
took a trikke there. Got a rental 'trikke' and went through the park. Looked like there was a lot of great stuff for the locals but not sure what a tourist would want to do there.
An oasis of calm. The quiet, space, quality and size of the gardens, attractions like the musical fountain all make this a unique destination.

A Relaxing Island. I stayed in this island when I visited Budapest. The island is very relaxing. If you intend to relax with your travel in Budapest, then stay in the Margaret island. It has all the facilities that you need for relaxation - spa, thermal baths, sauna, swimming pool, etc. Try to check out the shows in the open theater because they are quite interesting. :)

OPEN AIR THEATRE. BEWARE when booking any show on Margaret Island as the theatre is in the open air and should the weather be bad the show will be cancelled and you will lose your ticket entrance monies as they do not give refunds.It may be in the small print but in Hungarian.

Beautiful park. One of the best parks I've ever been.Between Buda and Pest there is Margaret Island,an extremely beautiful park full of green and nice gardens.There are some cafes to rest or you can just sit on one of the many benches.There is also some kind of water park with many big swimming pools(you have to pay to get in). You can rent different kind of bikes or you can walk through it (around 1.4 km). Absolutely a must see.

Beautiful - rent a little car for a whole tour. The island is a couple miles long. If you walked all day already like we did, you might want to rent a little car or bikes to explore. No cars are allowed on the island, but you can take #26 bus there. The car was a little golf cart, we rented for $20 for one hour and was able to see everything on the island.

The dirty lung of Budapest. I have always liked Margitsziget, but last time I was there it looked like the city dump. A local father with his son was having a pic-nic and the boy started throwing bottles in the river. The father didn't really care.Too bad that this place is starting to look like a waste dump. Avoid until the mentality changes among the locals who go there.

Lovely place. Went on the boat which was very pleasant. Had a trip on a runabout train which took us all round the island. Lots of sports for young people and play areas for children. Beautiful gardens and had soup and coffee in the Grill Terrace. Excellent.
Very nice. We rented bikes and rode around Margaret Island. It was fairly clean. You can spend anywhere between an hour to a whole day on Margaret Island, just depending on what you want to do.

Worth A Visit. Margeret Island is a peaceful haven which is worth a visit when in Budapest. I took the tourist train at the entrance one afternoon before walking around. Some of the garden areas were very nicely tended and a peaceful place to sit.

Peaceful. Another tranquil area of the city which just lets you escape and explore. Variety of different things to look at and take part in if you like, alternately lots of natural attractions and picturesque gardens to take in. Again, probably best to access via tourist bus, it can be quite some walk in the heat (as we discovered) and crossing the road bridge to directly access the island is dangerous at times, although there is a crossing further up!

Margaret Island is worth a trip. We spent four days in Budapest with one afternoon and early evening at Margaret Island. It is a great spot to walk and we enjoyed being a part of the local scene. We ate langos at an outdoor take away cafe and people watched. On the Danube we watched what appeared to be a kayak class for kids. There were lots of runners on the island. We took a Hop On Hop Off boat to Margaret Island then we strolled back to our hotel. It was a wonderful afternoon.

Nice Island Park. Take a few hours here, walk around, hire a "golf cart" or a peddle bike. There's lots to see and do, the statues and water fountain, the pools, or you can hang around and do nothing. If you are a runner, try out the running track. It's the recycled material that is springy, so nice to run on.
Nice park. This park is big and calm. A lot of people do a footing in the evening, young people drinks some beers, couples have a lovely time. It's opened all the night!

Visit the island and spend a few hours there.. The island is in the heart of the city. There are many activities for all ages. It is well kept with gorgeous parks, a small zoo, running path, playgrounds for kids and adults (!) also, lakes, etc. Must spend a few hours there. Enjoy!

An ideal place for a picnic!. Worth a visit. Spent a few hours wandering about Margaret's Island. You can get there by bus, boat or tram.There are all the usual tourist gimmicks available to rent....bicycles, tandems, pedal cars, electric cars etc. Should you wish there are also horse drawn carriages and a little tour bus. I chose to walk and explore myself.The musical fountain is unexpected and worth a look, there are gardens, old ruins, animals etc. to keep all ages entertained. Snacks and refreshments (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic) are available.The island could do with a bit of a facelift...fountain could be cleaned up, benches repainted.My advice, bring a picnic and spend few hours enjoying the sights on the island :)
Chill out zone. Lovely area to relax and escape the tourist traps, very clean and green. We ate out in a lovely eatery but I'm afraid I can't remember the name!
God for running. If you're into jogging, Margaret island has a running track around its perimeter, which is about 5 km !

Paradise in the middle of the Danube. I walked acroos the bridge over the Danube which has a spur on to the Island. Of course some of the buildings were built during the communist period and it shows--but it is a wonderful park with lots to do and see--if you are unable to walk too far hire an electric car , stop and have an ice cold beer and something to eat--fancy the Olympic size pool? there is so much to see and do

Tranquil afternoon walk. Get away from the hustle and bustle of the city with a walk in this lovely little island. When I was there early July, the temperature was at a record high; over 40C, so this made a very pleasant escape from the heat. The shade of the trees and surrounding river provide an ideal atmosphere. As you stroll along, there are many points of interest, so that this is not just a walk in the park, so to speak.Take your time and walk the entire length, then use the excellent bus service which runs along the spine, to get back to the start, or come off the island at either end to take the main lines.

Unbelivable tranquility. It was one of the most beautiful places that we have visited in Budapest. It is peaceful,well kept,colourful and beautiful. If you want a relaxing stop during the day- a visit and a picnic are recommended.
good fun. A good place to picnic and stroll around. We hired a covered bike which was really good fun and cheap. Well worth spending an afternoon on the island
Good place to spend a hot day. We spent a whole day swimming and enjoying the park at Margaret Island. Fun place to visit.

Thermal Spring in the Island. One of the only island in the World in the middle of the Capital.
Lovely English Garden all the way . Pleasent walking bridge to bridge.
Peaceful and well worth a visit. We went here to visit Palatinus Baths, they are lovely but make sure you go there when the sun is shining. Rent a bike to see the island in all its beauty.

Glad to find other runners. Went here for a morning run on Saturday. The (paved soft track) route around the island was getting good use. The route is just over 5km so a nice distance for a walk or run. With lots of trees, grass, playgrounds, etc a great place for a (family) picnic.

A peaceful haven in the middle of Budapest. This is a great place to go at the weekend to relax and get a feel for what the locals do with their free time. In summer it's buzzing with people running, doing yoga, playing football and going to open air concerts. Often with a bottle of wine !

Nice Little Island Getaway. If you're tired of walking amongst the buildings of Budapest, or want to go a jog away from most of the traffic, get yourself to MI and wander around, have an ice cream, see the gardens on the Eastern end, and generally relax. A good place for kids, you can rent 'family' bikes (big square things the parents drive and the kids relax). Not a whole lot to see; don't go thinking there are monuments or a bunch of Belle Epoch building behind every hedge.....MI is for relaxing, maybe a bottle of wine and a picnic.

Nice, but may not be worth the time. Margaret Island is well relaxing and nice to visit, but it did not leave any impression on me. It was full of locals playing rugby and doing yoga. I had read about the Japanese Gardens and musical Bodor Well and was excited to visit these parts of the island. However, the Japanese Garden was very small and unimpressive. The Bodor Well was okay, but it only plays music on the hour apparently. We didn't know this so were not able to enjoy the music. If you're on a short visit to Budapest, you should spend your time elsewhere.
Nice. Nice for a walk! And especially the fontana with the music and dancing waters!
Lovely respite. Nice garden in city centre. Went by Hop on Boat, cold beer, good food.
Spend a day there. Nice park, plenty of space,bring a picknik basket with you and enjoy.

Musical fountain!. It is so nice to sit in the sun on Margitsziget and listen to the musical fountain and get a bit sprayed by it. And the Japanese garden is nice too, and the pools are full of fat frogs and turtles. Its a place to go when you've got not much money left and you can take sandwiches & just chill out. There are 2 swimming complexs there too (not free). Only thing I wish is that there were more toilets on the island and that the ones there are were free.

A green oasis. We decided to go here on a lark and it was actually very relaxing. We just walked around and watched people running by. Had a bite to eat at the cafe. A nice peaceful area to chill out.

Awesome Spot to Run!. We ran the 3.5 mile loop around the island. It was a great intro to the city and the padded track was a welcome relief from running on pavement. The tram goes right there, too (#s 4 and 6).

This place needs a facelift badly. Margaret Island could be beautiful but it's been clearly neglected and suffers from overuse. I think they should close it down for a couple of years to allow it to regenerate and to clean it up and improve on all its facilities which are clearly decrepit and unkempt.

Recreation on Margaret Island. We went on the Island from the hop on ferry and stay a while on the island. Lots of joggers, there is a fountain on music, several swimming pools, people laying down on the grass, two hotels, restaurants. Nice to spend a lazy afternoon.
Summer Time!. Don't miss it during the summer for the great open bars, people watching and if you like running the cushioned track!

Margitsziget. Great park for wandering around and meeting all kinds of people. Lively in the evening with music and restaurant. They put out a number of screens so people could enjoy the International football completions. Great fun.

be prepared. There is a lot to see if you are prepared-a map. On disembarked from the hop on/off ferry there is a map there, but try and get one before. Hire a bike/car or take the minitrain ride to get acquainted.

Margaret Island. We didn't have time to actually stop at the island, but circled it on our boat tour. It is a quiet oasis in a busy city with trees, well-used walk/running paths, and other amusements.
Good one day trip. Exelent to spend a hot summer day on, bicycle rents or golf car rents possible.

Oasis in the City. Come here for the green space. Visit the fountain on a hot day listening as it plays classic music in time to the water spraying into the sky. Dip your feet, rent a bike, eat at one of the restaurants, or play Frisbee in the meadow. The petting zoo will amuse children.

Idylic Island. Went for a morning run here every day before the crowds appeared. A great place for a family day out or a picnic or evening meal or drink. Also has magor sports complex here for sports enthusiasts.

Beautiful little island. Beautiful little island with hotels, tennis courts, pools, etc on it. They said not car traffic on it but we saw a lot of cars. It is one of the stops on the hop on/hop off bus. You can rent a golf cart to be around the island.
A relief from business. It was fun to walk the Island and see the people, the abandoned convent.

A miniature fitness island!. A must do if the weather is pleasant - this island is full of small surprises on every corner...ampitheaters, running tracks, a thermal water park, the Nike sports complex, wonderful beer gardens, beautiful city views, and a general "park-like" atmosphere....perfect for a day trip or stay at either of the hotels on the island. You will welcome this lovely reprieve from the busyness of the city.

Have a relaxing time in Budapest. When you have been walking up and down all the street in Budapest it is nice and relaxing to use a bit of time on Margaret Island. Very big park surrounded by the river

Dutiful daughter's legacy to the Hungarians. Loved the story behind this island, the king's daughter that laid her life for her people when the country was expelled of its oppressors. Spent a hot summer's day splashing in its musical fountain to cool my swollen feet, drank from it spring fountain, just so peaceful here.

A mixed bag. Margaret Island is well placed for a walk - not, I imagne at night - and like all places where the fun element is uppermost, it can be either tacky or amusing ( depending on mood and company) The bicycle/carts are fun and the tower is interesting, but its great charm is the circular walk (avoiding joggers) and the interior, where one can escape the noise of traffic. A small and ancient church owuld be fascinating to visit, but we always found it locked.

Rent a bike and see the island. Beautiful, peaceful park in the middle of the Danube river. We rented bikes to tour the entire island which has beautiful gardens, ancient ruins, a water park, zoo and hotel with thermal baths. Very relaxing day in a lovely park.

HUGE !!!!. What a stunning place to visit - we walking from the Pest side enjoyed a free show of incredible fountain & music & walked on more. departed by going to Buda side & walking on to castle. Some nice bars etc on Island and you can also hire small electric four seater cars which are brilliant fun !!! Budapest is now one my favourite places to visit. !

Lovely Park Land. We walked to Margaret Island. It is a lovely place with a walkway and running path. Plenty of people sunbathing and enjoying the good weather. Plenty to discover. If you have a family, there was a rather large outdoor pool area which looked brilliant fun for children. There is also a small animal enclosure where refreshments are available.

An escape from the city. An easy ride on the tram, if you get a chance bring your picnic lunch from the Farmers Market eat lunch on the grass overlooking the Danube then explore the island ruins. There is a few places to buy pizza and traditional foods as well as snacks and drinks. Rent a peddle bike if you are tired of walking but a bus can take you to the end of the island and back again. Use can use the public restroom in the swimming complex. Before you go look up information about the water park there as well.
Family picnic place. The island is itself is a big park... not much interesting sites to see after a long walk there. Nicer to walk along the shores of Pest than to walk around Margaret Island
loved this peaceful island. We really enjoyed the walk round the island, you can hire pedalos and theres a great running track, tennis courts and swimming.

Beautiful place to walk.. First off, there is no subway or tram stop here. They stop on either side of the bridge and you have to walk halfway over. It's a gorgeous place to walk and run, I visited it loads of times on my trip, to walk around and take in the scenery and also to go to the water park. A trip to Budapest is incomplete without visiting here. The musical fountain alone is worth the trek over the bridge. Wear comfy shoes.
Lovely. Went there really just to get back to our Hotel but wish we had had more time there very tranquil after the busy city, great for a walk at sunset.
jogging in city. nice to make some run circle around the island. The running line is lighted at night.

A very big park situated on a Danube island. You can get there by Margaret Bridge or by Arpad Bridge, the place is full of people jogging, riding bikes and playing different sports. There are some festivals that are held during summer here also.

Not as good as I was expecting. I stopped off here from a boat cruise not knowing what to expect and it turned out to be somewhat disappointing. I have to say I like parks, Central Park in New York being my favourite, as an escape from the noise of the city, but whereas Central Park has so much of interest, this seemed to have little.I can understand why it is so popular with the locals with lots of greenery and a running track which appears to go right around the island, but for me there was little else. Having got off the boat, there were no signs but I did eventually find the location of the island's transport being a stop for the road train, cycles, and electric vehicles. Unfortunately I could not make use of the electric car since a car licence was required and I had not brought mine. I thought I would therefore use the road train and when one did arrive I boarded and was told that it would not leave until they had another five passengers travelling. After waiting what seemed like five minutes or so and with no one else showing any sign of interest in boarding, I decided to set off on foot. I walked alongside the road until I saw the water tower. This seemed an interesting climb and once inside, I saw a sign indicating I should pay at the kiosk but with not a soul about I climbed to the top to look at the far from impressive views. On my return to the bottom, two men had by now appeared, but since they showed no interest in me, I walked out. I stopped at a small entertainment arena but with not much to be seen, continued walking until I had then reached the other end of the island. I decided at this point that I really would prefer to make much better use of my time elsewhere and then walked alongside the running track by the river until I reached the boarding point for the boat which was thankfully about to arrive, two hours after I had reached the island.I came here midweek when it was really quiet, perhaps there is a better atmosphere when there are more people around.

Great Views of City. We took the boat trip that came with the open top bus, and got off at Margaret Island, and the views of the city are worth it. Plus the walk back in to the city is again over the bridge with great views.

oasis of peace. This is the place where the locals go to relax a little. there is a large pool complex on the island, as well as some fitness equipment. There are also two hotels on the island and a small zoo which you may enter for free. You can rent a bicycle to ride the whole island. You can get to the island by bus No. 26 or 234 or you can walk 400 m from the last stop of the tram No. 2 (having its route along the river Danube).At this large park we met some funny birds and a couple of squirrels :-)

Lovely tranquil place. Margaret Island is Budapest's lung and is a truely lovely place to go. The whole island is a tree filled park, though with the Palatinus Strand outdoor bathing complex, a luxury hotel with cafes, food stands, an Olympic swimming pool, various ruins, views of the Danube, playgrounds, a Japanesy Garden, rose(ish) garden and a whole array of pedal and electric cars and bikes for hire you could easily spend all day here.We had burgers at the open air cafe opposite Palatinus Stand - 750HUF (£2). They were enormous!!

One of the best spots in Budapest. Very nice isle that I recommend you experience with a small car you can lent at the entrance. It's cheap and really nice to drive around freely on the island, seeing a lot of amazing stuff there is to be seen and meeting a lot of friendly people, both local and tourists. Island is very beautiful and you might wanna visit the spa there!
family. huge place, wonderful for families, its full of activities and definitely worth a visit

island of dreams. If the surfeit of cultural delights is in danger of swamping you and you feel you're suffering sensory overload, head for the laid back pleasures of Margaret Island. Hop on the number 2 tram and head for the largest island in the Danube and chill out in one of its many shaded open spaces. If you're feeling energetic, there's a perimeter jogging track that's immensely popular or head for the riverbank to marvel at the progress made by pleasure cruisers against an intimidating current

A lovely day out!. As it was a lovely day, we started by popping down to the school sports tournament at the stadium. It was very entertaining, although we were somewhat alarmed by a fat man covered in red rashes who kept running past us to the first aid tent. Rachel and I decided to stop off at the bar (Who has a bar at a school sports day?) for a few light beers. It took awhile to get served as there was a gang of British lads downing shots and making suggestive comments about the female stewards. Instead Rachel suggested we hire out one of the whimsical cycle-cart type things and we took a lovely trip round the island. On several occasions we nearly had collisions with the youths from the bar who seemed to be having some sort of off-road race in electric buggies. The ice-cream bar was lovely although Rachel dropped her pistachio cornet due to being startled by someone shouting 'toggy'. And I had to jump off the wall of the penguin enclosure to avoid being hit by an out-of-control golf cart. It amused us greatly to see the driver later on explaining the incident to the owner of the carts. We tried again to get a light beer at the bar but still no success (the barkeep seemed a bit worse for wear, and he just kept repeating 'plinky plinky plinky' for some reason). We finally decided to call it a day when someone in the bar threw a whole bucket of water over a poor, understandably distressed transvestite. All in all - it was a hoot!

Bike ride makes this a great family outing. Margaret Island is nice, and if you are going with kids you can rent a coach-bike for the whole family (even if you are 5-6 in your family) and pedal around. Great fun for everyone.

An Island Park in the Danube. Margaret Island, in the Danube river between the Buda and Pest sides of Budapest, is a lovely green space in the middle of the city, accessible from the Margaret Bridge. The island is a huge park, containing historical ruins, a hotel, a swimming pool complex, tennis courts, jogging trails, outdoor theater, a petting zoo, Japanese garden, observational water tower, as well as several cafes and food kiosks. There is definitely something for every member of the family. With minimal traffic, and facilities such as several WC stops, Margaret Island is great place to take kids, either as a tourist or a city-dweller. It's accessible by the Margaret Bridge which can be reached on foot, or on the 4/6 Tram which runs along the Budapest Ring Street.

I've seen better parks!. Oke it's nice to know that also Budapest has a green oasis in the middle of the city or in this case in the middle of the Danube. You can get their by walking over a bridge. The park...well it is a park, what can i say more? It's very calm, you barely hear the noise from the city. We rent a sort kind of skelter because the park is about 2 km long and the walk to the park made us tired, so we didn't want to walk in the park, so the skelter was a good alternative. We found a few nice places in the park like the ruins or the mini zoo (with peacocks...). But too be honest - i was expecting more. Maybe i've been spoiled by visiting the beautiful el retiro park in Madrid (well THAT is a park) - but i think it's a good way to avoid the smell and noise from the city. But i would skip it if you are staying for a short time in Budapest.

not sure why we went there. told it was a green oasis in the middle of the city. well, i suppose it is, but its not stunning, mostly just a wild parland with football pitches and green spaces. a few formal flower beds at the entrance
Alright. A flat park. Quite full of people.. Does not compare to parks in my home country, New Zealand. Although nice to have a picnic here after seeing concrete for 7 days straight.

Inner city peace!. Having read some -ve reviews, I think to find this lovely place, in the middle of the a busy city, between Buda & Pest is just lovely. We visited May 17th 2012, a lovely sunny day & the park was being planted with a workforce of gardeners completing a very grand job. It was peaceful to walk around & sit watching the boats cruise up the river.Back up the steps we were on the bridge waiting for tram no 6 to take us back into the city within 5 minutes.It's a lovely place to go & free. Lovely views across the river to monuments. Loved this little gem.

A haven of tranquility!. We spent the whole morning strolling around the beautiful Margaret Island. It is a little gem in the middle of the Danube! A haven of peace and tranquility, away from the hustle and bustle of the more 'touristy' areas. Don't miss the Japanese water gardens (home to the noisiest frogs you've ever seen!!!)
Emerald in the heart of the city. Fun to take a walk, bike, run here, a real green oasis in the heart of Budapest. You will love it.

Nice place from May till Sept.. One of my favourite place from May till end of September. Nice to go there for swimming in Hajos Alfred Uszoda, or check in to the Palatinus Strand... walking a lot or playing with the dogs. In case you like sports this is the place where you can enjoy it. Take the tram 4 or 6 or walk across the Margit or Arpad Bridge.

It's a park.... Well, nothing too special here that is worth a visit...I am sure that in your origin countries, you have parks as well... We went there on a Saturday and it was full with locals and tourists- getting a tan, walking and eating ice cream, jogging... What you would expect from a park. :) There are far more interesting things to do in Budapest and I would recommend City Park- It will offer you more possibilities for entertainment...
nice for a walk. nice for a walk but if you want to see all the island rent some kind of transportation (available there)

Tranquillity in the middle of the city. A beautiful place to spent a few hours. You can walk around the island, or take a small train, golf buggy or double bikes (we did this and had great fun). If you have children the swimming pool looks amazing but the zoo was disappointing.

flat experience. This was highly recommended by our hostel. We were somewhat disappointed. Would probably be more interesting when the foliage was more bloomed. Had no idea what to look for so missed what I'm seeing in pictures online now that I'm back home again. Would have been nice to have signs showing what was available. It was obviously the "off season" because a number of things weren't open. Did walk down the steps to lay in the sun along the river. Took a short but enjoyable nap. This place may have more appeal to those who live in Budapest and/or have grown up with this park.

An enjoyable space. but avoid it like the plague on a weekend or public holiday as it gets terribly crowded. Take your driving licence if you want to hire a golf buggy to do a tour. there's a good bar in the middle and also a food outlet. It would have been easy to while away a few hours if it hadn't been a public holiday.

A paradise to relax. Such a great place to walk , relax so close and yet so far to Budapest..... We rent 2 bikes for 2 hours (8 Euros!!! both) and had the time of our lives!!!! You feel like like small children.... And the place is full of colourful flowers...... Great just great.....

Place to rest. OK, those two ruins, one church and small lakes woth frogs and ducks are not worth of visit. But the whole atmosphere "relax, turn off your mind, just enjoy weekend" is immersing. Its more used by local people than tourists, but if you need calm place... you´ll find it here.

A beautiful island.. This is a perfect place for a 2-3 hour romantic stroll.The island is all green, with a dense forest, numkerous flowers and almost zero traffic.There's a tiny zoo on the island, where you can see some deers (and pet them, if you're lucky).A word of caution - the benches on the island are always kept clean, which means that they are constantly being painted in white. Sometimes, there is no "wet paint" sign, so be sure to check before you sit, as my jeans got a nice "souvenir" from the island. :)

If you have some time and want to walk, its great. We went and strolled around the island and found it very pleasent indeed. Great people watching and the park is very well kept up as far as Eastern \European parks go. Had a lovely stoll and would recommend it to anyone who has some time to kill and hankers a walk.

beautiful. I visited the island on my first night spent on Budapest! I is very beautiful, everything green , big alees for people to walk or for bikers, there are also some caffes and chairs to sit and admire everything around. In my opinion for the touristi it is not very interesting , I think it is more useful for Budapest inhabitants to spent a moment of relax in this area , outside all the trafic and the buildings.But if you have time during you visit it would be nice to take a walk.

Perfect for relaxation. If you want to take a break from your sightseeing fever, come to this small island and have a stroll along its alleys and paths. Spring is probably the best time to visit the island because the nature is in full bloom.
Great & green. This is a much better bet than the City Park. Lots to do and see an island on the Danube that is a green oasis!

All in one place. Margaret Island is a place for everyone. Lot you can see, beautyful park where you can have picnic for examples or do some sport.. 2 nice Hotel there where you can enjoy wellness.There is a small zoo, idal for kid's. Nightime there is few clubs, nice atmosphere. Worth to visit any time in a day!
Margit Island. An oasis of calm amid the stressful surroundings of Budapest. Stroll among the trees, look at the Danube, take it altogether easy – and watch how Hungarians do it too.

Tips on a 1 hour tour. I took the Legenda cruise that docks on the north side of the island, and spent one hour on the island with my wife and 2 preschoolers. Since time was short, and the island is 2 1/2 km long and 1/2 wide, we had a lot of ground to cover. There's a place to rent bikes right by the Legenda boat dock (close to the Japanese Gardens). I rented a 2 person bike that holds two small kids in the front for something like 2900 HUF for one hour. First stop, the watertower, which is under going renovations (no going to the top, so a bust). Next stop, Dominican church ruins for a quick 5 minute photoshoot. Next stop, a small zoo with some ducks and peacocks on the east side of the island (5 min photos). Next stop, Franciscan church ruins (5 min photos). Now drive north past the waterpark to the Japanese Gardens (a bit sparse in April), a quick stop at the Bodor Well, and then drop off the bike where we got it. Took 45 minutes, got on the next boat to return to the docks. Margaret Island is definitely not a place that a tourist needs to visit, but if you plan it right it's worth the hour, and my quads got a good workout too. If you're a jogger, looks like a great place for a run as they made a track lane with rubber around the island (probably 4 mile run). Clean bathroom by the Japanese Garden, but it costs 150 HUF.

A bit of a non-event. I heard some rave reviews about the Island so popped to it in the morning during a stay in Budapest and I just think it's a non-event. I don't really understand the necessity or desire to visit this during your stay. It's essentially a lake that is a rather large park. Lots of runners, dog walkers etc... Nothing exceptional...Considering the many other high quality things Budapest has to offer, I'd personally give this a miss.

Nice but not at all what I expected. It is a nice park, but it need more guidance. No indications, the monuments aren't that clean or well preserved. There are some bikes or electrical cars rentals,but not one sign to indicate where to go. Must improve on that to gain the tourism market.

Fantastic. As someone who used to live in New York and loves Central Park, I consider Margit Island the greatest inter-city park I've been to. It has more of a woodsy, naturalistic feel, and is loaded with amenities: great swimming pools, health clubs, tennis courts, track and field facilities, great spa hotel, petting zoo, bike rental, and bike paths. It's marvelous. It's more rustic than other parks, and has a very relaxed feel. Only negative is that there s really no high quality food options on the park, except at the spa hotel at the north end. But burgers, hot dogs and ice cream are perfectly fine for a day at the park.

Attracts lots of joggers. We visited this site on a really beautiful spring day. It was very sunny and there were lots of joggers out on the circuit. Bikes and buggies to hire. Some of the restaurants are closed out of season. 2 hotels at the opposite end to the bridge apparently which we did not find!
Convenient.. One of the best place for a relaxing day. In the middle of the city, but far from noises.
A great big park. Awesome to see that there were no cars, only the small bicycles. It was sunny when we where there, so we enjoyed a lot our stroll to the park.

Should be lovely in Spring and very pleasant in Summer. In winter, even in a sunny day looks a bit sad since most trees have no leafs and flowers are hard to find.It would have been nice to find a place where we could drink something, it was a bit disappointing.
The place to exercise in Budapest. Great place to jog alongside the Danube. Hire a tricycle from the very friendly cafe owners.
Lovely for a walk. A great place to escape the city and go for a walk or ride a bike. Plenty of people around when the sun is out. Lots to do in the warmer months too - pools, outdoor theatre etc.

loads of fun pools on the island in the Danube. I went there when I was a little girl and it all memories and decided to go back. Packed and alot of peolpe during the hot summer month and alot of pool to try out for everyone.of all ages. You need to spend all day there and it an enjoyable family day out. It had shops to buy pool gears and foods. It bit pricey at 3000HUF nearly £8.50 to get in but worth it. Easy reach and it had a shuttle bus on the island that take you to one end of the island to another. My little boy love it so much

Enjoy the musical water fountain and take a trike ride around the park. Great way to spend a few hours in a park in Budapest. The highlight is the musical water fountain. Amazing. We took a trike ride around the park and enjoyed both the views and exercise.

I love with Margaret Island. Margaret Island was a wonderful place to relax. There is a bus that goes along the island so that you can see the different attractions it has to offer. There is a small city pool, the signing fountain, a formal garden, ruins, a water park, a bird sanctuary, and even a formal Japanese garden. Along the paths there are places to buy snacks and ice cream. There are running paths along the sides of the park and free wifi at the outdoor cafe at the end of the Island closer to Buda.
Very nice walk. Lovely family bicycles, interesting ruins, statues, animals
Margaret Island. Nice place to take a walk or go for a run on the 5K track. Not much interested me.

Interesting but not outstanding. Despite some warnings about wandering on Margaret island we found it safe - but evidence of drunks. The island was once attrctive but is now just a park with is not very interesting. The large fountain that shoots up water in time to music is interesting and probably the highlight.

Nice island walking. Tranquil, with a lot of squirrels and woodpeckers in the middle of Danube.Budapestians go there for stretching or dog walking.There is even a tartan for running.It must be wonderful in spring and summer
Too bad. In winter you can not find anything on the island. Not a restaurant, a cafe. Is wilderness.
Very nice park. Alot of shade and very clean as well. We rented a bike here and it was a fun ride.
A great getaway. Pastoral in the heart of the city and danube. Historic spa. Relaxing parks.
A little peice of heaven in the city. Great place to take do a bike ride through - lots of trees, land, people and food. A little break from the city of Budapest right in the middle of the Danube.
Perfect get away in Budapest when town is too warm and crowded. Don´t miss the SPA at Margret Island and the Danubius hotel with its fine rooms and service!

A Nice Place for A Stroll. The island itself is not particularly remarkable for anything other than the gigantic party that occurs annually and the somewhat dilapidated services. It is, however, a pleasant enough spot for a stroll if you weary of the city bustle.

Peaceful place.. Quiet and beautiful place.
Great place to exercise and enjoy the outdoors.
Far from the city center.

Peaceful haven in a busy city.. The island is probably beautiful in the summer, but we were there in December so it was a little bleak. However, we hired pushbikes for an hour and cycled around the island. There are hotels on the island that looked very nice. There is a bandstand-type building that started playing music as we approached!, along with a duck pond with ducks, fish and turtles swimming aroung. There is a small castle in the centre of the island along with the ruins of a church/nunnery dedicated to St Margaret. This island can be reached by bridge from either end; buses run along the main road on the island from either end. Well worth a visit.
Margitsziget is worth a visit!. We had a wonderfull stay at Margitzieget. We rented bikes and took a round trip at the island, a nice experience.
Tranquill. Quiet area to get away from the tourist crowds and recharge for awhile.

Nice, beautiful, island.. After you hop off the trams in the middle of the bridge, you should definitely take one of those electric cars or bicycles, you have to bring the cars back to their place in half an hour or so, perhaps the bcyles should be preferred, for the island is quite long, three or four kilometers, and the church ruins which the ottomans demolished are almost at the other end, in summertime it can be hot and tiresome to walk the island, I visited it on beginning of june, mosquitoes were like clouds, not an adequate restaurant in the whole island, surprising and disappointing to me. There is a public pool, and a large hotel. Place, park definitely needs a better attention I believe.
Hire a bike..... This was a stop off point on a riverboat trip,the island is a lot bigger than it looks there's a Zoo,gardens, cafe so plenty to do,you can hire a bike for two to get round.

Magnificent Margaret Island. It may be a distance from the centre of Budapest but it was well worth the 30 minute walk. In the capital city yes, but so quiet and peaceful with enough atrractions for all ages. Particularly impressed by the display of winter flowers which brightened up a dull afternoon. Also, and very imortant, the toilets (100 forints) were very clean

Beautiful restful island. A great place to spend a nice afternoon to lay down and get some sun. Bring some friends, a Frisbee, and a soccer ball to pass around. Beautiful gardens. If you want a place to relax and separate yourself from the city look nor further. Easy to get to on the 4 and 6 line.
Run the Island. Great little running path around the Island. Saw more people running their than everywhere else I ran combined. Seems to be the place to run in central Budapest!!
relaxing place. I think during summer time will be great but in november the only thing worthing is the ride with the two sitted bicycles

The long walk. My dear wife who shares the same name was always going to have a walk round the island... we walked from the hotel up round the island and back down the other side past the parliament and back to the hotel again!!! she slept that night!!!

Island adventure amidst big city. Take the time to stroll out or through the island. It is so rare that in the middle of a capital city there is a piece of paradise like this. If you have more time, grab a bathing suit and take advantage of the all day Wednesday special the the Thermal Hotel.
Beautiful little island. This is a beautiful place for a walk, a picnic, or tanning in summer. A truly green island with a beautiful enviroment.
Beautiful placwe to walk. There is loads to do on the island and it is beautiful
Beautiful. Lovely place to spend an afternoon/early evening. Have drinks in the bar with the outdoor area with lots of paper lanterns hanging up.
dont miss the bikes. nice gartdens and beaches. enjoy a relaxing 2 hours tour with the bikes
Nice place. Nice location for a half day tour, not too far from the city center. Go and have fun with kids. Good shadows and lot of sitting place.
Nice. We went on a lovely sunny day in October but nothing there except a few food stalls. nice and peaceful tho..
paradise. a paradise in earth. What everyone want for his town
Runner's paradise. Great place to do a 5 k run in the morning. Great views
Spa and relaxing. Took a tour of the park on twin pedal bikes which was fun and then had excellent lunch at Grand Hotel. and spent afternoon in the spa of the Thermal Hotel.

Good trip on a sunny late October day. Walked to the island and six of us hired three double seat cycles. Really enjoyed it even though there are quite a few attractions closed down or shut for the season. Enjoyed the musical fountain and the whole experience was great fun.
calm. The most exciting on this island is the `bringo`. It is a special bicycle, which we rented and we could make a tour on the island by ourselves.
Quiet retreat. Lovely place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and a free animal park too.

Beautiful Park. I visited this park as part of a Hop-On-Hop-Off bus?boat tour. It is much much larger than I had anticipated seeing. New Yorker's would compare it to Central Park. Big, beautiful, with all kinds of things going on.A tip: Rent one of the electric cars when you visit. Unless you want to walk for miles and spend 3 to 4 hours, you will not be able to explore the Island without one.

A Rolls Royce Visit!. My husband and I went to Margaret Island for a quick visit to check it out-but its a large island. At the entrance to the park, a man was renting golf carts decorated as little mini Rolls Royces. It was hilarious, fun, silly and quite effective for visiting the sites! There was no way we would have been able to see the whole island without our little rented golf cart. It was HILARIOUS because our first "cart" ran out of power and my husband had to push it back to the rental site. It was also hilarious because people in the park were looking at us as though we were crazy in this silly "car." We had so much fun and laughed out loud. It was 2900 forints for 1/2 an hour. We LOVED it!! I highly recommend a visit with a cart!

musical fountains. Spent 2 peaceful and happy hours on a sunny Sunday in Oct watching locals walk their dogs and play badminton. Stumbled across a wonderful fountain which was playing to classical music, just gorgeous. Lots of people had hired bikes or pedal-cars, but we just walked, so only got about half way up the island. Very pleasant, and you can stop for coffee or hot wine at the little stalls.
Not suitable in cold October. Walked around the island for 1-2 hours but it was cold and windy and most places closed for the season it seemed. Maybe nicer in the summertime.

Day trip within a holiday. We walked from Budapest city across bridge and onto Margaret Island, which is situated in the Danube river. Whole island is walkable with very pleasant gardens including a playground, picnic areas, small animal enclosure with a pony ride for children and the biggest attraction for my grand-daughter then aged 4 was the fountain which "dances" to classical music. We enjoyed a full day on the island and would definitely visit again if we return to Budapest.

Island with three time periods. Margaret Island has the most interesting history. I spent three hours there on my 'solo' day of sightseeing. It was walking distance from Ramada Plaza. The first thing I saw was the Centenary Monument, created in 1972 to commemorate the 100-year-anniversary of the joining of Buda and Pest. Nearby is a large fountain with background music. Then there are the soccer fields, gardens, pools, petting zoo, lakes, jogging paths. The187ft high octagonal shaped water tower built in 1911 has a gorgeous Art Nouveau tower,and is a UNESCO monument. Travel north and you'll find the ancient ruins of a 13th century convent of Dominican nuns, once home to the daughter of King Bela IV, herself a nun, for whom the island was named. Wander amid the ruins and marvel at the intact foundation areas, tiny rooms and surrounding areas. St. Margaret was buried there in 1271 and flowers are still left on her headstone. The chapel of the medieval monastery has the oldest tower bell in Hungary, cast in the fifteenth century, destroyed in WWII then rebuilt from most of the same bricks. In the Middle Ages, the island was home to a number of religious cloisters, but by the beginning of the 1800s, this 1 mile island was embraced by the royal family, who turned it into an ornate garden. Several food areas or pack your own and relax on the expansive lawns. You could easily spend six hours there if you had the time.

A breath of fresh air. Budapest can be a bit dusty and polluted at street level, so if you're in the city for a few days it is definitely worth paying a visit to Margaret Island, which is like a green oasis in the middle of the Danube. You can hire bikes very cheaply, lie on the grass watching the musical fountain, eat ice cream and generally chill out. There isn't much to see here, but it's a nice change from the bustle of the city.

Spa on Margaret fantastic. I went to the Spa on Margaret Island called Danubius Margitsziget it was fantastic.They have several thermal pools even a very called pool, jacuzzi and a swimming pool. Spa very clean & peaceful.I also booked myself for the salt cave. It was an awsome treatment really relaxing they put me ona deck chair covered in blunkets. They play relaxing music, while you breath the dead sea salts. I liked also the lighting red, greem, mellow nice I wished I hade one at home.It is cheaper to use the spa during the week and one gets a discount if booking the salt cave. Also I liked the roof terrace with deck chairs where one has nice views ot the park on Margaret Island.After I went and cycled around the island which was great, beautiful park and fountain nice views of the river relaxing.I got into Margaret Island by taking n bus 133 to Arpaud Hid and then n 26 bus really easy as the other side of the bridge is shut..Budapest over all is very good for cyclist.No fees to the Island but to the spa yes.

Take the Danube boat tour to Margaret Island. One of the side trips we took when in Budapest was on a Danube River boat. You get a nice, unobstructed view of certain attractions that would otherwise be difficult to see. Another positive aspect was that the trip takes you out to the Margaret Island, which is in the middle of the Danube. The boat will take you from the streetside docks, over to the island and drop you off. They then give you a Boarding Pass to pick up another boat heading back to the streetside docks later. The island has various different attraction to see, or you can just enjoy the walking path which takes you around the whole island. For those that are hungry or thirsty, there are multiple establishments blending into the surroundings that offera wide range of confections. A very relaxing and enjoyable respite from the Day-to-Day "Tourist Traps"

Our favourite place in Budapest. Margaret Island is a beautiful, peaceful oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of Budapest.We take the Number 4 tram onto the bridge across the Danube and steps lead you from the bridge onto the island. There is a football pitch, olympic pool and a waterpark our children have loved over the years. The water park has a number of slides, many pools and one with a wave machine along with many bars and food outlets.There is also a running/jogging track that circles the island.The island has beautiful gardens including a stunning fountain which features a music programme and synchronised jets which shoot high into the sky and is visible above the treeline from the city.Located at the north end of the island are spa hotels. Last year we spent a couple of nights at the Danubius Hotel and thoroughly enjoyed the peace and quiet having spent some days in a city hotel.There are opportunities to hire various types of transport to take you around the island. There are also a number of food/drink and ice cream around the island

walk, run or just wander. It is a beautiful park, you can wander there for hours.There is a rubber run track that circles the island, so you can walk or run there. It is about 5 kilometers to circle the island.Pretty views of the town, many trees and lawns, good contact with nature.

40 years later I still go back there with joy. This time, with my family. It was so nice to see how the place remians the same I enjoyed 40 years ago, and it produced the same effect on the new generation. A most wonderful locations where to spend a full day while in Budapest

Water park in Budapest??. Spent a lazy afternoon here after seeing the sights of Budapest for 2 days with our teenage sons. We rented a 4 seater bike cart from Bringohinto bike rental, explored the island for a while and had lunch. Then our boys hit the water park (yes, we went to Budapest and the kids went to a waterpark.. Ever traveled with teens sightseeing for a week or more? Then you'll understand.) while we sat in an outdoor cafe enjoying drinks, reading, and people watching. A good way to spend an afternoon and gear up for the next leg of our vacation.

A big park. A paradise for runners, outdoors, sunbathers, pool bathers and bikers. Nice to go there with kids. You can stop there by boat sightseeing tours but I haven't discovered the pier. Recommend a bike or electrical bike tandem to explore the place> price to 3000 HUF peer 30 mins.

Large park between Buda & Pest. No big Wow factor here but the island is a nice large park between both sides of the city. We were here at Easter Week when the beautiful weather finally brought rain at the end. They do have the Franciscan Church ruins & Dominican Convent ruins. If the weather is nice you should enjoy renting a bike or electric vehicle to ride around in. This is more a summer time place.

Beautiful place. Went there with hop on-hop off boat. We spent there 2 hours. It is very nice and I think it worths a visit. It makes you relax and you enjoy the nature. We rent a bike to make the whole tour of the island, but we finally realized that it is a better idea to rent an electric car (same money for 4 person and you don't get tired if you are untrained like us...)Anyway it is a very pleasant place.
A good relaxing place. A good place to walk and rest after a day of lot work. Many gardens to seat and eat an ice cream
