disappointed. Not much to do on margaret island for tourists. It was disappointing, almost nobody was there. It looked a bit old.Almost no place to have a drink.

Relaxing, ideal in the summer. Normally you can get to Margitsziget by tram no 4 or 6 which both stop on Margaret bridge. At the moment Margaret bridge is being renovated, so you probably have to take a bus from the other end of the island. The bridge will be ready by spring I think.I was there in the summer, and it was really relaxing to walk in the shade, in the woods by the river. Very romantic. You can just read a good book on a bench or watch the world and boats go by.There is an open-air swimming pool / spa (Strand) as well, so you can easily spend an entire day with children there.

Beautiful Park. We went here when it was about 5.30pm. Its so safe and is the hub of Budapest's sporting fascilities.It has a runing track and football stadium but the massive park and fountains are just so pretty. Our feet were tired so we walked half way across the island but it was very beautiful.You can hire buggys and pedalo bike type things and we really thought it beautiful and well worth a wander around.Be warned at the moment Margaret Bridge is under construction so there is a lot of traffic both from people pn foot and bikes as you have to use the small foot paths.:)
Went here yesterday and hired an electric.... Went here yesterday and hired an electric car (a converted golf buggy) for an hour, lots of fun and a mice way to spend an hour

fun family day. we went w/4 adults & 2 kids (3&7). had so much fun. we rented this "bike thing" - kind of like a cannopied open car, pedal powered by 4 people. kids sat in front on shelf like, but strapped in - SO WELL WORTH IT. LOTS OF LAUGHS. there's a playground on the island & pool (which was closed then). fun day
A haven of peace. The ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and main tourist attractions. A tranquil oasis in the middle of the Danube.

Look at the Ruins, stroll, and have some ice cream!. This is a great place to relax and get "out" of Budapest for an afternoon, although if it is warm, a lot of people will have the same idea. It can be quite a walk from some parts of the city, so check transit map carefully. Make sure you walk to the South end of the island. This is a great place to people watch and relax, but you can also rent a bike to see the rest of the island. As a historian, I particularly liked looking through the ruins of the island.

A wonderful facility in summer. What a great idea, on a baking hot day in Budapest, what better to do than take off to an island in the middle of the Danube and spend the day at the beach (almost!) We could have spent all day at the baths here on the island, plenty of grass to spread out your towel as you decided when to tkae another dip in the lovely clean pools. Varying in temperature from very warm to beautifully cold and refreshing. this was a great place to spend a couple of hours while on the island. The staff in the changing rooms were brisk to say the least, but i suppose that is a very minor complaint!The little Japanese garden on the island is lovely as is the main park.

Could have spent a 1/2 day here. An island in the Danube! How novel an idea! This beautiful park is worth spending a nice walk through. I regret I only took one picture on the island. We started our walk on the bridge on the south end of the island and walked all the way to the bridge on the north. It's quite large! On the island you can rent bikes, or bike type cars that 4 people can ride on and help pedal. There is a stadium, swimming pools, fountains, open air theater, a track, a zoo, restaurants, hotel, ruins of a covent (Saint Magaret was who the island was named for), large tower, and more. It was filled with large shade trees, open spaces perfect for playing a game of Frisbee, and gardens. Since it is between Buda and Pest in the river, you don't even hear the city sounds as you enjoy the peacefulness of the island. We are so glad we took a walk on this island, a neat part of Budapest that isn't as touristy.

A must during Summer. During Summer the Island of Margaret is crowded of visitors, people doing sports. It's huge island and comparing to many other european cities it is hard to find such a big green space, right in the middle of the city, where you cannot hear the city noise at all!It's between Buda and Pest and contrdicts both sides in the sense that there are very few buildings to see (so don't bother to look for one, just enjoy the parks).Nevertheless it is big enough to have a Hotel, 3 clubs, e or 4 more pubs, one football stadium and a big complex of swimming-pools/thermal baths (these ones concerning the pic posted from one advisor). And believe me, from outside you can only see green, so imagine the size of this park. Summer is the right time to go there!

Should have kept walking south.... We visited the North side of the island and found it very neglected, many buildings going through refurbishing, muddy paths, lack of flowers. For what we read later in guide-books, the best part is in the South of the island, near the water tower! There is a bus that crosses the island all along. Should have taken it to get to the nice area, and will do the next time! It seems there is an hotel, ancient ruins, swimming pools and baths.
Ancient History. I just wanted to share this photo with everyone, as i see Hungary does not get accreddited as much as other European countries. Let me know what you think!
